column1: arrange the sushi in a row .

column1: cut the meat at a slant .

column1: slice the fish horizontally .

column1: slice the fish horizontally .

column1: add soaked raisins and fried onion on top of the rice .
column2: add in some soaked raisins to the pot on top of the rice . add some fried onions on top .

column1: layer rice on top of the vegetables .
column2: use a spoon to scoop up some rice . lay the rice on top of the vegetables in the bowl .

column1: layer rice on top of the vegetables .
column2: now we want to add a layer of rice on top of our dish . just take the rice out with a spoon and set it on top of the veggies . make a nice thin layer .

column1: layer rice on top of the vegetables .
column2: use a spoon to scoop up the rice . put the rice on top of the vegetables in the pot . spread the rice evenly across the top .

column1: add mint coriander turmeric chili powder masala salt and tomatoes to the bowl .
column2: take the contents in a glass mixing bowl . add some cut pieces of mint in to the bowl . add some turmeric powder and chili powder in to the bowl . add some masala powder and salt in to the bowl . add some tomatoes in to the bowl and mix .

column1: add mint coriander turmeric chili powder masala salt and tomatoes to the bowl .
column2: add mint to the bowl . pour in coriander , turmeric and chili powder . add 1 1/2 teaspoons of masala . add some salt . pour in tomatoes and use a spoon to mix everything together .

column1: add mint coriander turmeric chili powder masala salt and tomatoes to the bowl .
column2: take coriander and add it to a bowl . then chop mint up with a knife very coarsely . gradually add salt . cut tomatoes with a knife into small pieces . mix all together in the bowl and enjoy .

column1: place the vegetable mixture into the pot .
column2: put a medium sized saucepan on the stove and turn on the stove . with your mixture in a bowl , carefully spoon it into the warmed up saucepan . mix it up with a large wooden spoon .

column1: place the vegetable mixture into the pot .
column2: hold the vegetable mixture bowl over the pot . use a spatula to scoop the mixture out into the pan carefully and slowly .

column1: place the vegetable mixture into the pot .
column2: use a spoon to scoop the vegetable mixture into the pot . stir the vegetables into the bowl as it cooks .

column1: mix the potatoes and onions in .
column2: take the salad into a large glass bowl . cut the potatoes into big cubes . add the cut potatoes into the bowl . add the fried onions into the bowl . mix all the ingredients together .

column1: mix the potatoes and onions in .
column2: pour in the potatoes into the bowl . add 1 tablespoon of chopped onions in the bowl . continue to stir with the spoon .

column1: mix the potatoes and onions in .
column2: put the potatoes in the bowl . put the onions in the bowl . mix the ingredients together with a spoon .

column1: add oil ginger and garlic to a pot .
column2: add oil to the pot . add ginger to the pot using a spoon .

column1: add oil ginger and garlic to a pot .
column2: add 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil to the pot . add sliced ginger to the pot . put in some sliced garlic .

column1: add oil ginger and garlic to a pot .
column2: use a spoon to scoop 2 spoons of oil in the pot . add ginger and garlic to the pot .

column1: mix fried onions with the rice .
column2: take the rice into the glass bowl . take the fried onions in a small bowl . pour the fried onions into the large bowl with rice . mix the rice and the fried onions together .

column1: mix fried onions with the rice .
column2: add in a small amount of dried onions . mix together with a spoon .

column1: mix fried onions with the rice .
column2: add some fried onions into the bowl . use a spoon to mix together the fried onions with the rice .

column1: add the vegetables yogurt cream and cheese to the bowl .
column2: pour the vegetables into a large bowl . use a spoon to scoop in some yogurt . add some fresh cream . pour in the cheese .

column1: add the vegetables yogurt cream and cheese to the bowl .
column2: put the vegetables in a large bowl . add the yogurt to the bowl . add the fresh cream to the bowl . add the cheese to the bowl .

column1: add the vegetables yogurt cream and cheese to the bowl .
column2: use a spoon and scoop the vegetables into the bowl . add the yogurt cream and cheese to the bowl with the spoon .

column1: add flour corn meal sugar salt and baking soda to bowl and mix .
column2: in one bowl pour in flour , corn meal , sugar , salt and baking soda . mix everything in the bowl together .

column1: add flour corn meal sugar salt and baking soda to bowl and mix .
column2: add flour , corn meal , salt , sugar and baking soda to a large mixing bowl . mix the ingredients together well .

column1: add flour corn meal sugar salt and baking soda to bowl and mix .
column2: take a large bowl and add a cup of flour . add a cup of corn meal in to the bowl . add little salt and sugar in to the bowl . add little baking soda in to the bowl . mix everything in the bowl with a spoon .

column1: add milk and one egg whisk together .
column2: put milk into bowl and crack one egg into bowl . use w whisk to mix the milk and egg into the flour . once mixed and smooth set the bowl off to the side .

column1: add milk and one egg whisk together .
column2: pour milk into the bowl . crack an egg on the side of the bowl and carefully crack it into the mixture . use a whisk to stir that all together into an even batter .

column1: add milk and one egg whisk together .
column2: add milk and one egg . stir together until it is smooth .

column1: cut hotdogs into thirds and place in the flour .
column2: cut hot dogs into thirds . place hot dogs into bowl of flour .

column1: cut hotdogs into thirds and place in the flour .
column2: using a sharp knife , cut each hotdog into three even pieces . put the hotdog pieces into the flour bowl . use the flour to coat the hotdog pieces by moving them around in the flour .

column1: cut hotdogs into thirds and place in the flour .
column2: put some flour into a large bowl . use a knife to make 2 cuts on each hotdog , making 3 pieces . put the cut hot dog pieces into the bowl of flour .

column1: put hotdog pieces in batter and coat them .
column2: place hot dogs in batter 2 to 3 at a time . cover them with batter using a spoon to make sure they get completely covered . fish them out and place them in heated fry pan . repeat steps for the rest of the hot dogs .

column1: put hotdog pieces in batter and coat them .
column2: roll hotdog pieces in some flour until the hotdog looks white . put the hotdog pieces into the bowl with the batter . use a spoon and cover the hotdog all of the way up with the batter . make sure that you ca n't see any of the hotdog , only the batter .

column1: put hotdog pieces in batter and coat them .
column2: take the batter in a bowl . cut the hot dogs in to small pieces . add the hot dogs in to the batter bowl . take a spoon . coat the hot dogs with the batter .

column1: fry the corn dogs .
column2: use a fork to scoop under the hot dog one at a time . slowly lower into the oil . they turn themselves . keep oil at set temperature . only leave in a about 3 minutes .

column1: fry the corn dogs .
column2: take the pot on a stove . heat the oil in the pot . take the corn dogs dipped in batter in a bowl . add the corn dogs in to the hot oil . fry the corn dogs .

column1: fry the corn dogs .
column2: using a fork , take the corn dogs out of the mixture , and place inside pan with the oil . corn dogs will turn themselves once they are done , or until they are golden brown . use a thermometer to measure the heat of the oil , so it is not too hot . adjust burner to a higher or lower temperature if needed .

column1: remove the corn dogs and put them onto a paper towel .
column2: cook the corn dogs in the pan . take the corn dogs from the pan . take the paper towel on a plate . place the corn dogs on to the paper plate . repeat the same with all of the corn dogs .

column1: remove the corn dogs and put them onto a paper towel .
column2: lay a piece paper towel on a plate . carefully take out the corn dogs from the pan using tongs . put the corn dogs on the napkin .

column1: remove the corn dogs and put them onto a paper towel .
column2: place 2 - 3 sheets of paper towel on top of a plate . get a metal cooking tong . with the tong , take out one corn dog out of the oil and move it up and down on top of the pan so that the extra oil fall back into pan . do the same with the rest of the corn dogs .

column1: lightly mash the kidney beans and dal and cook .
column2: in order to make it creamy you need to mash the kidney beans and dal a little bit . using a masher , press down the mixture in your pot , but do n't over do it . cook for around five more minutes .

column1: lightly mash the kidney beans and dal and cook .
column2: using a potato masher , smash up the kidney beans and dal . after 1 - 2 minutes of smashing , put the burner on to a low - medium setting . let this cook for about 5 minutes .

column1: lightly mash the kidney beans and dal and cook .
column2: use a potato masher to mash the dal until creamy . use a spoon to stir the dal . let it cook on low to medium heat for five minutes .

column1: pour the spiced ghee over the dal .
column2: move the pan of spiced ghee over the dal bowl . use the spatula to scoop the ghee into the dal bowl .

column1: pour the spiced ghee over the dal .
column2: remove the pan from the stove . carefully pour it into the bowl with the dal . use a spoon to get it all in there if you need to . place pan back on stove or into the sink .

column1: pour the spiced ghee over the dal .
column2: take a pan and heat the pan . add little butter and melt the butter in the pan . add the spices to the butter . off the stove and take the pan away . add the spiced ghee in to the bowl of dal .

column1: place the dal in a pressure cooker with four cups of water .
column2: cook them on medium high . add water .

column1: place the dal in a pressure cooker with four cups of water .
column2: put the dal in the pressure cooker with a spoon . add 4 cups of water to the pressure cooker .

column1: place the dal in a pressure cooker with four cups of water .
column2: put the dal into the pressure cooker . pour 4 cups of water in the pressure cooker so that it cooks with the dal .

column1: heat the ghee in a small saucepan .
column2: put a small saucepan on the stove and turn the heat up halfway . put the ghee in the pan and let it melt .

column1: heat the ghee in a small saucepan .
column2: put a small saucepan onto the stove . turn on the burner to medium high heat . slowly pour the ghee into the pan , using a spoon to scrape all of it out into the pan .

column1: heat the ghee in a small saucepan .
column2: turn the dial on the stove to medium high . place the saucepan on the burner . once the pan is hot , pour the ghee onto the pan using a spoon to get it out of the bowl .

column1: uncover the pot and stir .
column2: carefully open the pot when it unlocks . do n't try to force the pot open before it unlocks . stir the sauce with a large spoon .

column1: uncover the pot and stir .
column2: take the lid off the pot . use a stirring spoon to mix the ingredients in the pot .

column1: uncover the pot and stir .
column2: remove the top and place aside . slowly stir and scrape the sides of the pot until everything is soft and tender .

column1: garnish with shredded ginger .
column2: cook the dal in a pot . transfer the dal in to a bowl . take an inch piece of ginger . grate the ginger in to small pieces . add the shredded ginger on top of dal .

column1: garnish with shredded ginger .
column2: use a knife to remove the skin off some ginger . grate the ginger using a grate . add a pinch of the grated ginger to the top of the dal .

column1: garnish with shredded ginger .
column2: add soup to bowl . shred ginger . garnish soup with ginger .

column1: add cumin seeds .
column2: pour cumin seeds into the frying pan . mix the seeds around the pan .

column1: add cumin seeds .
column2: in the bowl of your mixture put in some cumin seeds . then mix all together with a spoon .

column1: add cumin seeds .
column2: pour cumin seeds into the pan with the oil . be careful of oil splattering .

column1: add cream garam masala and amchoor powder .
column2: next , add the cream that we measured out in the beginning . use your spoon to scrape all of the cream from the measuring container . then , add the mango powder that we measured out at the beginning . after that , add the garam masala powder that we measured out at the beginning . double check that you have completely emptied the containers for these three ingredients into the pot before we start to stir . we have to make sure we are using the right amounts , so do n't leave any behind .

column1: add cream garam masala and amchoor powder .
column2: pour in the cream . add the amchoor powder and garam masala into the pot .

column1: add cream garam masala and amchoor powder .
column2: prepare a bowl . put in eggs . add cream . put in mango powder . throw in garam masala .

column1: cover the pot and cook .
column2: cover the pot with a lid that fits snugly . turn the knob of the stove to medium and let it cook .

column1: cover the pot and cook .
column2: put a lid onto the cooker . wait for the cooker to start to steam . turn the heat down to medium . cook for 25 minutes .

column1: cover the pot and cook .
column2: add the lid to the pressure cooker . make sure the pressure cooker is locked .

column1: add the asafetida and red chilies .
column2: hold the spices over the pan . drop the spices in carefully .

column1: add the asafetida and red chilies .
column2: put the amount of oil we measured into the pan . turn the stove on to medium high heat ( that 's the middle notch on the dial ) and allow the oil to heat for about 3 minutes . drop a few very small pieces of asafetida into the oil . if the oil makes a hissing sound , it is hot enough . add the asafetida to the pan slowly , so that you do n't cause oil to splash and burn you . next , carefully drop the red chilies into the oil .

column1: add the asafetida and red chilies .
column2: add asafetida into the pan . put a few red chilies to the pot . use a spoon to stir the mixture around the pan .

column1: add the salt turmeric ginger and green chili .
column2: as your pot simmers get ready to add the spices . one at a time add the green chili , ginger , turmeric and salt to the pot .

column1: add the salt turmeric ginger and green chili .
column2: hold the ingredients over the pot . carefully shake the salt turmeric ginger and green chili into the pot .

column1: add the salt turmeric ginger and green chili .
column2: pour in some green chili in the pot . add ginger . add turmeric . pour in some salt .

column1: mix milk and vinegar together .
column2: put milk in a liquid measuring cup . add vinegar to measuring cup . then stir milk and vinegar together .

column1: mix milk and vinegar together .
column2: add one tablespoon of vinegar to the one cup of milk . stir the vinegar into the milk . pour the vinegar and milk mixture into the pan .

column1: mix milk and vinegar together .
column2: measure out one tables spoon of vinegar . add vinegar to one cup of milk . mix the vinegar into the milk .

column1: add flour paprika garlic powder black pepper and salt to a bag and mix together .
column2: put a plastic bag in a pot so that the plastic bag is open at the top . pour flour from your measuring cup into the plastic bag . use a small spoon to put paprika into the plastic bag . use a small spoon to put garlic powder into the plastic bag . sprinkle pepper and a small spoonful of salt into the plastic bag , and then use a large spoon to mix all of the ingredients in the bag together .

column1: add flour paprika garlic powder black pepper and salt to a bag and mix together .
column2: put a plastic bag in a large mixing bowl . put flour , paprika , garlic powder , salt and black pepper into the flour . use a large spoon to mix the spices into the flour .

column1: add flour paprika garlic powder black pepper and salt to a bag and mix together .
column2: open a plastic bag and put it in an empty bowl . add flour to bag . add 1 tsp . paprika , garlic powder , salt to bag . shake in black pepper according to your taste . mix the ingredients in the bag with a spoon until they are well combined .

column1: dip the chicken in the milk and the flour mixture .
column2: take your togs and slowly dip the chicken into the milk mixture . do n't splash the chicken around to much , or the raw chicken could contaminate your area . just slowly dip it in the milk and flour mixture and then set it in your other mixing bowl with the bag . now grab the next piece of chicken and do the same thing .

column1: dip the chicken in the milk and the flour mixture .
column2: use tongs to pick up the chicken . hold the chicken with the tongs and dip it into the milk . turn the chicken over in the milk getting milk all over . pick the chicken back up with the tongs and put it in the bag with flour mix .

column1: dip the chicken in the milk and the flour mixture .
column2: using tongs place one piece of chicken into the milk . cover the chicken in the milk , moving it around until it is fully coated . using the tongs place the chicken into the flour mixture .

column1: cover the chicken with paper towel and let sit .
column2: take a paper towel and place it over the chicken . let the chicken sit for 30 to 45 minutes . take off the paper towel and see how the paste looks .

column1: cover the chicken with paper towel and let sit .
column2: cover chicken with paper towel . set aside for 30 - 45 minutes . check the chicken to see if the flour coating has fully formed .

column1: cover the chicken with paper towel and let sit .
column2: lay a paper towel flat over the container of chicken to cover it . let the chicken sit there .

column1: fry the chicken in oil .
column2: coat chicken in eggs and breading mix . heat oil in a pan on stove until bubbles start to rise . carefully add chicken to oil with tongs . flip chicken periodically , cook for - minutes .

column1: fry the chicken in oil .
column2: once the oil in the pan is hot , slowly place each piece of chicken in . wait a few minutes then turn over once it 's brown . do the same for the other side . once both sides are cooked , remove from the oil .

column1: fry the chicken in oil .
column2: using your tongs , put the chicken into the very hot cooking oil . cook the chicken for 20 to 25 minutes . use your fork to flip the chicken sometimes . poke the chicken the check if it is ready . move the chicken onto a plate when finished .

column1: mash a bowl of chickpeas using a fork .
column2: hold the bowl of chickpeas firmly in the palm of one hand . hold your fork in the other hand . place a finger or two on the foot of the fork , just below the slots . use this finger to control the fork as you firmly press it into the chickpeas . repeat this until the chickpeas are mashed into a rough paste .

column1: mash a bowl of chickpeas using a fork .
column2: take 15 to 20 chana into a bowl . mash the chanas or chickpeas with the help of a fork . we can use a smasher to smash the chana peas . we will bet a nice aroma if we mash some chanas to our gravy .

column1: mash a bowl of chickpeas using a fork .
column2: take a fork and smash the chickpeas . squish it down together with the fork .

column1: pour oil onto a hot pan .
column2: take your oil . pour the oil into a hot pan on the stove .

column1: pour oil onto a hot pan .
column2: pour some oil into a hot pan . move the pan around to make sure the pan is coated .

column1: pour oil onto a hot pan .
column2: heat pan on stove top . carefully pour oil into pan . move pan around so oil covers pan .

column1: add garam masala cloves cinnamon sticks bay leaf and cardamom to the pan .
column2: once the pan is hot , add garam masala to pan . then add cloves , cinnamon sticks and cardamom to pan . after they cook a little bit , add the bay leaf to the pan .

column1: add garam masala cloves cinnamon sticks bay leaf and cardamom to the pan .
column2: add garam and masala to the pan . add cloves and cinnamon sticks to the pan . add bay leaves to the pan . add cardamom to the pan .

column1: add garam masala cloves cinnamon sticks bay leaf and cardamom to the pan .
column2: once the pan is hot go ahead and grab your ingredients . you can slowly add your ingredients , but wait to add the bay leaf . make sure to be careful it is very hot ! wait until you can smell your cinnamon cooking and add your bay leaf carefully .

column1: add garlic ginger paste to the pan and stir .
column2: mix in the garlic paste . you can also add whole peppercorns now . keep mixing everything .

column1: add garlic ginger paste to the pan and stir .
column2: add the ginger paste into the pan . add the garlic paste into the pan . stir both the paste until it is cooked . stir its raw smell vanishes .

column1: add garlic ginger paste to the pan and stir .
column2: use your wooden spoon to scrape the garlic ginger paste off the plate . carefully scrape it into the hot pan . stir with wooden spoon until mixed in well .

column1: add grated onion to the pan and stir .
column2: put the grated onions into the pan . stir the onions until they change to a golden brown color , which should be about 2 minutes .

column1: add grated onion to the pan and stir .
column2: using your hands , add the grated onion onto the garlic and ginger . using your spoon , mix all of the ingredients together .

column1: add grated onion to the pan and stir .
column2: put the small pieces of grated onion into the pan . stir with a spoon or spatula and spread it out evenly in the pan . cook it for about two minutes and the onions should start turning a little bit brown .

column1: add turmeric to the pan and stir .
column2: add onions to the hot pan on the stove . next add turmeric to the pan . stir the ingredients together for a few minutes .

column1: add turmeric to the pan and stir .
column2: add the turmeric you measured out to the pan . use a wooden spoon to stir the pan . cook for two minutes .

column1: add the mashed chick peas and the whole chick peas to the pan and stir .
column2: slowly add your mashed chick peas into the mixture . once added in , you will also add whole chick peas to the pan . you 'll then want to stir all the chick peas into the pan . then you can let the gravy cook for at least 15 minutes .

column1: add the mashed chick peas and the whole chick peas to the pan and stir .
column2: add the mashed chick peas into the pan . add the whole chana in to the pan . mix together using a spatula . wait until they are nicely cooked .

column1: add the mashed chick peas and the whole chick peas to the pan and stir .
column2: add mashed up chick peas to pan and stir with wooden spoon . add whole , unmashed chick peas to pan and stir with wooden spoon . keep stirring with spoon for 15 minutes . you can also use the microwave to cook this .

column1: garnish with cilantro leaves and stir .
column2: gather a knife and cilantro . slice the cilantro into small pieces . add the cilantro into the pot . stir the pot for a few minutes . after 5 minutes of stirring , you are done .

column1: garnish with cilantro leaves and stir .
column2: sprinkle cilantro on top . stir .

column1: garnish with cilantro leaves and stir .
column2: pour in the cilantro . stir in and mix the cilantro with the rest .

column1: mix occasionally and cover and allow the chanas to cook .
column2: take a plastic tipped spatula and use it to stir the food every ten minutes . use the spatula to press down lightly on the chanas .

column1: mix occasionally and cover and allow the chanas to cook .
column2: mix the chana in the bowl . stir it occasionally . press some of the chana so that the masala can be blended easily . cove with the lid to cook properly .

column1: mix occasionally and cover and allow the chanas to cook .
column2: mix the chanas with a spatula . press the chanas down to the pan with the spatula . mix the chanas again with the spatula .

column1: add in the water that had been set aside little at a time .
column2: add a little bit of the water you had boiled earlier to the pot that you have on the stove . you want to add the water slowly , so that it will be slowly cooked into the chana on the stove . after you add the water , put the lid back on the pot on the stove and let it continue to cook .

column1: add in the water that had been set aside little at a time .
column2: add some water into the pan . stir the water into the pan . continue adding small amounts of water and stirring waiting until the water has been cooked in before adding more .

column1: add in the water that had been set aside little at a time .
column2: take a pot and place it on stove . cook the ingredients in the pot . take the water in a bowl that is set aside . add the water in to the cooking pot little at a time . mix the water with the other contents in the pot .

column1: separate the water and the chanas do not discard the water .
column2: place the chanas in a bowl . save the water for later .

column1: separate the water and the chanas do not discard the water .
column2: use a strainer to remove the chana ( chickpeas ) from the liquid . do not throw away the liquid .

column1: separate the water and the chanas do not discard the water .
column2: use a strainer spoon to scoop out the chana . lightly shake the spoon so that any remaining liquid drains out . pour the chana into an empty bowl . save the liquid that the chana cooked in for later .

column1: add in the chana masala chaat masala red chili powder dry mango powder and anardana powder .
column2: gather together all the dry spices . sprinkle the chana masala powder , the red chili powder , the chaat masala powder , dry mango powder , and anardana powder into the cooking pot . stir everything together with a heatproof spatula . anardana powder is made out of pomegranates .

column1: add in the chana masala chaat masala red chili powder dry mango powder and anardana powder .
column2: now we want to add in our dry spices . first pour in some chana masala powder and a little bit if chaat masala . then we will put in some red chili powder and some dry mango powder . last we will put in anardana powder and being mixing them all with our spatula .

column1: add in the chana masala chaat masala red chili powder dry mango powder and anardana powder .
column2: add the chana masala into the pan . add the chaat masala into the pan . add the red chili powder into it . add dry mango powder and the anardana powder into it . add all the masalas and mix together .

column1: add in the chanas / chole and mix again .
column2: stir the pan with a spatula . add chanas / chole mix into the pan . with the spatula mix the ingredients together .

column1: add in the chanas / chole and mix again .
column2: add the chole to the pot that has sauce in it . get a large cooking spoon . mix in slowly and thoroughly the chole into the pot with the sauce . then pour in the boiled water to the mix of sauce and chole together .. .

column1: add in the chanas / chole and mix again .
column2: add the chanas / chole to the contents of the hot pan . using a spatula stir and mix all ingredients together .

column1: close pressure cooker and allow it to whistle twice and then lower heat to cook for another 20 min .
column2: close the lid of the pressure cooker . wait for the cooker to whistle at you twice . turn the heat down lower and let it cook for 20 minutes .

column1: close pressure cooker and allow it to whistle twice and then lower heat to cook for another 20 min .
column2: close the pressure cooker and make sure it is sealed and not venting . allow it to cook on low heat for 20 minutes .

column1: close pressure cooker and allow it to whistle twice and then lower heat to cook for another 20 min .
column2: close the lid of the pressure cooker . cook it for about 2 whistles . now lower the heat of the stove . cook for another 20 minutes . now open the lid of the pressure cooker .

column1: cook till the tomatoes separate from the oil .
column2: the object is to cook the tomatoes until they separate from the oil . the tomatoes should be cooked on medium high heat . they must be watched carefully and stirred frequently so they do n't burn or splatter .

column1: cook till the tomatoes separate from the oil .
column2: add tomatoes to pan . use medium high heat . stir often . use caution as tomatoes may splatter . cook until oil separates from tomatoes .

column1: cook till the tomatoes separate from the oil .
column2: continue to stir the mixture . keep cooking until the tomatoes and the oil move apart .

column1: soak the chanas in water and then transfer it into the pressure cooker .
column2: you will have been soaking the chanas in water . now , make sure the pressure cooker is on high heat on the stove with the top off . carefully add the chanas to the pressure cooker . be sure to also add the water the chanas has been soaking in . do this carefully and use a spatula if needed .

column1: soak the chanas in water and then transfer it into the pressure cooker .
column2: add the chanas to the water in the pot . pour everything in the pressure cooker .

column1: soak the chanas in water and then transfer it into the pressure cooker .
column2: turn your pressure cooker to high heat . add the water that the chanas soaked in to the pressure cooker . add the chanas to the pressure cooker .

column1: add in cinnamon stick bay leaf black cardamom teabags and salt .
column2: take a pot with water and chick peas in a pot . add a bay leaf and black cardamom in to the pot . add 2 teabags in to the pot . add some salt in to the pot . mix everything in the pot .

column1: add in cinnamon stick bay leaf black cardamom teabags and salt .
column2: this step is simple because you do n't need a knife . put a stick of cinnamon , one bay leaf , one cardamom pod , two teabags directly into the pot . add the amount of salt that the recipe needs .

column1: add in cinnamon stick bay leaf black cardamom teabags and salt .
column2: get a pot with water . add a cinnamon stick . add a bay leaf . add black cardamon . add salt .

column1: once hot add in the asafoetida and right after that add in the crushed tomatoes .
column2: heat up a pan on high . add in crushed tomatoes . mix well .

column1: once hot add in the asafoetida and right after that add in the crushed tomatoes .
column2: take your tomatoes and carefully poor them into the pan . now mix it around with your spatula or spoon . careful the pan is hot .

column1: once hot add in the asafoetida and right after that add in the crushed tomatoes .
column2: add the asafoetida to your oil in a large pot . now quickly add in the tomatoes to your pot . mix it all together using a large spatula .

column1: once done allow the pressure to go down and then open .
column2: now , once the dish is finished cooking , the pot will still be hot . the pressure of the pressure cooker needs to go all the way down before you can open it . wait until all the pressure has gone down . get a pot holder and carefully twist the top loose . once the top is loose , gently lift the lid of the pressure cooker .

column1: once done allow the pressure to go down and then open .
column2: one you see the pressure go down , you can open up the pan . now that the pressure is gone , we will remove the tea bags . just use a spoon and set them to the side .

column1: once done allow the pressure to go down and then open .
column2: take a spoon and press them against the pan . take them out of the pan and into a bowl .

column1: in a pan heat oil on medium heat .
column2: put a deep pan onto the stove . add your oil to the pan . turn the burner on to a medium setting . allow 2 - 3 minutes for the oil to warm up .

column1: in a pan heat oil on medium heat .
column2: take a pan on the stove . take about two tablespoons of oil . add some oil in to the pan . turn on the stove to medium heat . heat the oil in the pan .

column1: in a pan heat oil on medium heat .
column2: put a pan on the stove on medium . then take a small cup of oil . pour the small cup of oil into the pan wait until the oil is hot .

column1: cut the pork into slices .
column2: place pork on the cutting board . grip the pork with one hand to steady it . cut thick slices with the other hand until the entire piece is done .

column1: cut the pork into slices .
column2: get out a cutting board and place the pork on top . hold the pork still with one hand before you begin to cut . using a sharp knife , cut into slices as wide as your thumb , cutting from the top , down into the meat . be very careful to watch your other hand so you do n't cut your fingers .

column1: cut the pork into slices .
column2: take a cutting board and a knife . take the pork on the cutting board . cut the pork in to thick slices . repeat the same till the entire pork was cut . take all the slices on the board .

column1: cover the pork in plastic wrap and pound .
column2: take your slab of pork and cover it in plastic wrap . this will decrease the mess when you pound the meat with your meat mallet . carefully , but strongly pound the meat with the mallet until the meat is flat . now remove the plastic wrap and dispose of it .

column1: cover the pork in plastic wrap and pound .
column2: cover the pork with plastic to protect the area . pound the pork with the hammer . remove the plastic .

column1: cover the pork in plastic wrap and pound .
column2: the port needs to be flattened . to avoid making a mess place the pork on a cutting board . then place a piece of plastic over the pork . now hit the fork with a meat tenderizer ( which is a hammer for food ) . use a medium amount of force when hitting the meat .

column1: sprinkle salt and pepper on top of the meat .
column2: use the herb grinder to grind pepper onto the meat . use a separate salt grinder to grind sea salt onto the meat . mash the pepper and salt in to the meat with your clean , gloved hand .

column1: sprinkle salt and pepper on top of the meat .
column2: sprinkle pepper on the meat . sprinkle salt on the meat . pat down the meat .

column1: sprinkle salt and pepper on top of the meat .
column2: grind pepper onto the meat , do this by twisting the pepper shaker for about 5 seconds . sprinkle some salt onto the meat as well either by shaking the salt shaker or twisting it if its the larger type of salt grains . wear a plastic cooking glove and push the salt and pepper into the meat with a flat hand for a few seconds . this helps the meat absorb these ingredients while it cooks .

column1: melt butter in the pan .
column2: scoop butter into the pan with a knife . the butter will melt as it gets hot .

column1: melt butter in the pan .
column2: put pan on stove and turn on the heat . add butter to the hot pan and melt the butter .

column1: melt butter in the pan .
column2: find a pan . turn on the heat to low . find the butter . put a small amount of butter in the pan . watch the butter melt .

column1: mix eggs milk salt and pepper together .
column2: slowly pour in the milk salt and pepper . use a fork to mix it around moving it back and forth fast but carefully not to spill it and splash .

column1: mix eggs milk salt and pepper together .
column2: take a medium sized bowl . break open some eggs and add it in to the bowl . beat the eggs properly with the spoon . add some salt it in to the bowl . add little pepper powder in to the bowl .

column1: mix eggs milk salt and pepper together .
column2: pour 2 tablespoons of milk to the bowl . stir the milk in with a fork . add a little salt . add a little pepper .

column1: dip the pork in the egg mixture and the bread crumbs .
column2: use tongs to pick up the meat . place the meat in the egg mix and move it around with the tongs . pick the meat up and let it drip all the liquid off . put the meat in the breadcrumb mix and cover it with breadcrumbs .

column1: dip the pork in the egg mixture and the bread crumbs .
column2: take your pork chops with your tongs . dip them into the egg mixture . with your tongs turn them over to make sure they are covered . with your tongs take them out and dip them into the bread mixture . take your tongs and flip your pork chops .

column1: dip the pork in the egg mixture and the bread crumbs .
column2: dip the pork into the liquid using tongs until covered . lift the pork up with the tongs and let the excess liquid drain off . move pork to the bread crumbs and coat both sides of pork .

column1: fry the pork in the pan .
column2: carefully put the pork in the pan with tongs . the meat will bubble and sizzle as it is cooking be careful for splatter .

column1: fry the pork in the pan .
column2: melt plenty of butter in a frying pan on top of the stove . once the butter is hot , add the pork to the pan . fry until the bread crumbs on the top start to look a little wet , then turn the meat to the other side . fry both sides until they are golden brown .

column1: fry the pork in the pan .
column2: pour some oil into a pan and let it heat up . drop in the pork slowly into the pan . top it off with some butter and let it get hot . when the bread crumbs look see through turn over the pork .

column1: heat butter in a pan and cook bacon in it .
column2: take your butter , and add it into your hot pan . this will make the butter start to melt instantly , just mix it around in the pan with your spatula . now gently place your bacon strips into the pan and let them begin to cook . continue cooking them until they have that perfect sizzling golden color .

column1: heat butter in a pan and cook bacon in it .
column2: heat up the butter in the pan it will bubble up . slowly pour the bacon into the pan . use a spatula to mix it around .

column1: heat butter in a pan and cook bacon in it .
column2: switch on the stove . heat the butter till it melts . put some butter into it . add bacon into the pan . cook until the bacon is done .

column1: add chili flakes .
column2: add a sprinkle of chili flake to the pan . stir to incorporate .

column1: add chili flakes .
column2: find the chili flakes . the chili flakes are dry . pinch your fingers together and pick up a small amount in between your fingers . without touching the pan , sprinkle the flakes over the dish . stir the dry chili flakes into the dish .

column1: add chili flakes .
column2: if you enjoy a little bit of spice and heat in your food , we can now add some chili flakes . take the dried chili flakes and slowly sprinkle a pinch of them into the pan and mix them in . remember , the chili flakes are optional and up to what you like .

column1: pour in vodka .
column2: pour vodka into the pan . make sure the pan is nice and hot so that the alcohol will cook out .

column1: pour in vodka .
column2: open the bottle of vodka ( kids , have a parent do this part ) . carefully pour enough vodka so that it is bubbling ans sizzling in the pan .

column1: pour in vodka .
column2: take the cap off the bottle of vodka . pour in a little of the vodka . careful : steam will come up from the pan .

column1: add tomato puree to the pan .
column2: add 3 - 4 tablespoons of tomato puree in the pan . stir .

column1: add tomato puree to the pan .
column2: add 3 or 4 tablespoons of tomato puree to the pan . stir the tomato puree and mix it in with the rest of the pan .

column1: add tomato puree to the pan .
column2: find the can of tomato puree . use a can opener to open the can of tomato puree . use a spatula to get the tomato puree out of the can . stir in the tomato puree . continue stirring until even .

column1: pour in heavy cream .
column2: cook the ingredients in a pan . then add the heavy cream to the ingredients in the pan . mix the cream with the ingredients .

column1: pour in heavy cream .
column2: take your measure amount of heavy cream and pour it into the pan . mix the cream in with the rest of the sauce using a wooden spoon or spatula . then you want to heat the pan until tiny bubbles form in the sauce . this is called a simmer .

column1: pour in heavy cream .
column2: hold the cup with the cream over the pan . slowly pour the heavy cream into the pan being careful not to splash it .

column1: grate some parmesan cheese and chop some parsley .
column2: find a cheese grater . by rubbing the cheese against the grater , grind up about 1 cup of parmesan cheese . take a full handful of parsley and rip off the leafy tops to separate it from the stems . roll the parsley up into a ball and cut it up with a knife .

column1: grate some parmesan cheese and chop some parsley .
column2: hold the grater against the board . rub the parmesan cheese over the openings of the grater to shave it into pieces . cut some parsley into small pieces .

column1: grate some parmesan cheese and chop some parsley .
column2: take your cheese grater and make your cheese block into small pieces of cheese . take a handful of parsley . rip the top off . carefully cut the parsley up .

column1: add boiled pasta cheese and parsley to the pan .
column2: add the boiled pasta to the pan . mix in the pasta into the pan . add the cheese to the pan . put the parsley on top of the cheese .

column1: add boiled pasta cheese and parsley to the pan .
column2: add the noodles into the pan . add the cheese and parsley into the pan . stir the pan .

column1: add boiled pasta cheese and parsley to the pan .
column2: take the strained pasta and put it into the sauce in the skillet and mix it around with a spoon so that the pasta is covered in sauce . sprinkle some parmesan cheese and some parsley into the skillet .

column1: boil a large pot of water and cook macaroni in the water .
column2: fill a large pot with water . place the pot on the stove on high heat . when water bubbles , add the macaroni . turn off the stove and remove the pot when the macaroni is soft .

column1: boil a large pot of water and cook macaroni in the water .
column2: fill large pot almost to the top with water . turn on the burner on the stove to high heat .. . when water is boiling , add some sprinkles of salt . add the macaroni and cook for 10 mins . stir with a spoon every 2 minutes . remove the pot of macaroni and drain it into a bowl that has a lot of holes in it . this is called a colander . cut off the stove .

column1: boil a large pot of water and cook macaroni in the water .
column2: put water in a large pot and put it on the stove . turn it on ( have an adult help if you need them to ) and let the water boil - when it starts bubbling it 's perfect ! put a little salt in the water and add the macaroni noodles . it 's cooked when it 's turning soft . take the pot ( have an adult help if it 's too heavy ) and pour it into a colander ( a big bowl with holes in ) to get rid of the water .

column1: pour macaroni on the baking dish and add butter and salt to macaroni .
column2: use a spoon to help take the macaroni out of strainer and into a baking pan . add 1 to 2 tablespoons of butter and a little bit of salt .

column1: pour macaroni on the baking dish and add butter and salt to macaroni .
column2: pour the macaroni from the strainer to the backing dish . while the pasta is still warm add one to two tablespoons of butter and a little salt to season . mix well .

column1: pour macaroni on the baking dish and add butter and salt to macaroni .
column2: drain the macaroni noodles . pour macaroni into baking dish next . then add 1 to 2 tablespoons of butter to the pan . then add some salt to pan . mix ingredients together .

column1: add evaporated milk water and cheese .
column2: open the can of evaporated milk and pour into the pot . fill the can with water and add the water to the pot . add 10 oz . of velveeta type cheese to the pot . turn the heat on medium . use a spoon to break up the cheese and stir every now and then as cheese melts .

column1: add evaporated milk water and cheese .
column2: put the pot on the stove . do n't turn on the heat yet . slowly pour the can of evaporated milk in the pot . fill the empty evaporated milk can with water and slowly pour the water in the pot . add 10 ounces of velveeta type of cheese . turn the heat on the stove to medium and stir the mixture in the pot . break the cheese into pieces with your spoon so the cheese will melt faster . be careful not to touch the hot pot , stove , or mixture in the pot . use a long spoon to stir the cheese mixture .

column1: add evaporated milk water and cheese .
column2: take a large pot on a stove . take a small can of evaporated milk . add the evaporated milk in to the pot . take a big block of cheese and add it to the evaporated milk . mix the cheese till it melts away .

column1: add shredded cheese .
column2: after the cheese is melted and blended , pour in two cups of shredded colby jack cheese . use your wooden spoon to carefully stir .

column1: add shredded cheese .
column2: take the bowl of colby jack shredded cheese . use a spoon to slowly pour 2 cups of the cheese into the pot .

column1: add shredded cheese .
column2: add the cheese to pot . then add 2 cups of colby jack cheese . mix until melted .

column1: mix in an egg sauce and beer .
column2: carefully crack one egg over top of the macaroni . be sure not to get any of the eggshell in your macaroni . discard egg shell . with a spoon , mix egg and all of macaroni together . pour cheese sauce over top macaroni , and mix in evenly . water can be added if you would like a creamier sauce .

column1: mix in an egg sauce and beer .
column2: cool the macaroni . add one egg , making sure you do n't get any broken egg shell in the macaroni , that can be a crunchy and weird surprise . mix the egg gently in the macaroni until it is fully mixed . the next step is to carefully pour in the cheese sauce . make sure to use oven mitts or pot holders when handling the pot of cheese sauce . it may still be hot . mix the cheese sauce all the way through the macaroni . add water if you want a creamier sauce . just add little amounts at a time , maybe a tablespoon or so until you get the creaminess you want .

column1: mix in an egg sauce and beer .
column2: let the noodles cool . blend in an egg and add the cheese sauce . mix well . if you need to add in a little more water .

column1: cover the top of macaroni with cheese .
column2: stir the macaroni with a big spoon . put 2 cups of shredded cheese on top of the macaroni .

column1: cover the top of macaroni with cheese .
column2: pick up the measuring cup containing the cheese . using the fork to help , pour the cheese over the macaroni , moving the cup back and forth so the cheese does n't fall in just one place but covers the whole casserole . use the fork to take out any cheese sticking to the sides of the cup .

column1: cover the top of macaroni with cheese .
column2: once you are done mixing the macaroni sprinkle the rest of your shredded cheese over the top of the entire dish . try and sprinkle it evenly so it 's equally cheesy all over .

column1: bake the dish in the oven .
column2: turn on the oven , so the dial is set to 350 . wait for the oven to beep that it 's ready . place your tray in the oven and wait for 15- 20 minutes . 3 . place your pan in the oven and wait 30 minutes . now you can turn off the oven and remove the pan .

column1: bake the dish in the oven .
column2: set the oven 's bake dial to 350 . smooth the macaroni and cheese topping so that it 's level . cover the pan completely with a sheet of foil . when the oven beeps , put the pan into the oven . after at least 15 mins , remove the pan if the cheese topping is bubbling .

column1: bake the dish in the oven .
column2: cover the pan with foil . preheat the oven to 350 degrees and make sure the oven dings before putting the pan in . once the oven is preheated and reaches temperature place the pan inside the oven . cook the pan for 15 to 20 minutes . after 15 minutes check the pan . if the sauce is bubbling then it is ready . the sauce should be thick and creamy . the cheese should be just melted . turn off the oven afterward .

column1: cut tofu into square pieces .
column2: use a knife to carefully cut the tofu into square pieces . try to keep all of the pieces the same size .

column1: cut tofu into square pieces .
column2: take a big block of tofu . take a cutting board and a knife . cut the big block of tofu in to two halves . cut the each half in to long rectangle blocks . cut each rectangle block in to an inch shaped blocks .

column1: cut tofu into square pieces .
column2: place tofu on a cutting board so that one of the two largest sides is facing up . using a knife , cut the tofu in half . flip the tofu over , so that one of the two second largest sides is facing up . using a knife , cut the tofu in half again . flip the tofu over , so that one of the two largest sides is facing up , and make three cuts , equally spaced apart .

column1: put cornstarch in a small bowl and mix with water .
column2: get a small bowel . get corn starch . put one tablespoon corn starch in small bowl . add 3 tablespoon water to small bowl with corn starch in it . gently stir mixture together .

column1: put cornstarch in a small bowl and mix with water .
column2: add a tablespoon of corn starch in a bowl . add three tablespoons of water .

column1: put cornstarch in a small bowl and mix with water .
column2: get a small bowl . get a table spoon . get a cup of water . put one table spoon of cornstarch in small bowl . add three table spoons of water to cornstarch and stir .

column1: empty a sachet of mapo tofu paste into a bowl .
column2: take a small bowl with paste . take a packet of mapo tofu . open the packet of mapo tofu . add the mapo tofu in to the bowl . empty the full packet of mapo tofu in to the bowl .

column1: empty a sachet of mapo tofu paste into a bowl .
column2: get a packet of mapo tofu paste , usually available at asian supermarkets . use a pair of scissors to cut open the packet on one side . squeeze the contents of the packet into a small bowl .

column1: empty a sachet of mapo tofu paste into a bowl .
column2: take your paste package . from top to bottom squeeze the package into a bowl .

column1: stir fry ground pork and the paste .
column2: heat up the wok and put some oil . wait a few seconds for the oil to heat up . put the ground pork in the wok . move the pork around the work with a wooden spoon for two minutes . add the paste from a bowl into the wok by pushing the paste out of the bowl with the wooden spoon . stir the paste into the cooked pork with the wooden spoon .

column1: stir fry ground pork and the paste .
column2: heat up the wok and fry up the ground pork in the cooking oil till it is no longer pink . ( medium heat ) . add the mapo tofu paste and stir fry for about two minutes .

column1: stir fry ground pork and the paste .
column2: place wok on the stove and heat . add oil inside of the wok . add ground pork in heated oil , stir and cook until no longer pink . add the mapo tofu paste to the wok and cook for about 2 minutes .

column1: add water tofu cubes sprinkle and salt and cover .
column2: add 1 cup of water to the pan . next add tofu pieces . stir tofu into sauce . next sprinkle with salt . cover and cook for 5 minutes .

column1: add water tofu cubes sprinkle and salt and cover .
column2: add one cup of water into a pan , then ad the cubes of tofu to the pan as well . sprinkle 1/2 teaspoon of salt over the tofu . cover the pan with a large lid and let it all cook about 5 to 6 minutes .

column1: add water tofu cubes sprinkle and salt and cover .
column2: pour one cup of water into a pan on medium heat on burner . gently pour tofu cubes into the water . sprinkle 1/2 teaspoon of salt into the hot water . cover the pan with a lid . cook in the pan for 5 minutes .

column1: add cornstarch and stir gently .
column2: get the cornstarch and place it in a small bowl . slowly pour the cornstarch into the pan . use a wooden spoon or a spatula and gently stir the mixture .

column1: add cornstarch and stir gently .
column2: pour cornstarch mixture evenly in pan . stir gently .

column1: add cornstarch and stir gently .
column2: remove the lid from the pan . add cornstarch into the pan . gently stir with a wooden spoon . the dish is now ready to serve .

column1: soak and rinse the short ribs .
column2: take a medium sized bowl . add some water in to the bowl . place the ribs in the water . soak the ribs in the water . place them in water for one hour to remove the blood .

column1: soak and rinse the short ribs .
column2: soak the short ribs in water for one hour . soaking the ribs in water with drain out the blood . after and hour , the water will appear red . take the ribs out of the water . rinse the ribs in a clean bowl of water and separate any bones with your hands .

column1: soak and rinse the short ribs .
column2: use tongs and place the short ribs into water . soak the ribs for 1 hour . after 1 hour remove the ribs from the water . rinse the ribs in fresh water .

column1: peel and grind an onion and add mix with the marinade .
column2: peel an onion . grind the onion with a food chopper . add the onions in with the marinade . mix it well .

column1: peel and grind an onion and add mix with the marinade .
column2: use a knife to cut the ends of the onion . peel the skin off the outside of the onion . put the onion into a mixer and grind it up . add the onion to the ingredient and use a whisk to mix them together .

column1: peel and grind an onion and add mix with the marinade .
column2: peel the skin off the onion . grind up the onion in the machine . put the blended mix in the marinade .

column1: cut the ribs into pieces .
column2: remove the ribs from the pan . using a knife , cut the ribs into small pieces .

column1: cut the ribs into pieces .
column2: use tongs to take out the ribs and put them one a plate . hold the ribs with the tongs and take scissors to cut them up into pieces .

column1: cut the ribs into pieces .
column2: use the tongs to remove the ribs from the pan . use a knife to carefully cut the ribs into smaller pieces .

column1: mix soy sauce sugar ground pepper sesame oil .
column2: hold the soy sauce sugar ground pepper and sesame oil bowls over the big bowl . carefully pour them into the big bowl . use a whisk to stir everything together .

column1: mix soy sauce sugar ground pepper sesame oil .
column2: add 1/3 cup of soy sauce . pour in 1/3 cup of sugar . add 1 teaspoon of ground pepper . add 3 tablespoons of sesame oil . use a whisk to mix everything together .

column1: mix soy sauce sugar ground pepper sesame oil .
column2: put soy sauce in a bowl . put sugar in a bowl . put ground pepper in a bowl . put sesame oil in a bowl . mix ingredients together with a whisk .

column1: cook the short ribs .
column2: set the rib on the frying pan . cook on low heat for 5 minutes . use a spatula to turn over the ribs . cook the other side for 4 minutes .

column1: cook the short ribs .
column2: on a heated pan put your ribs in it and cook on low heat for 5 minutes . then flip over the ribs in the pan and cook on low heat still for 5 minutes . take out the cooked ribs and put in the remaining ribs and cook them same .

column1: cook the short ribs .
column2: heat up a large frying pan on low heat . with a pair of tongs , take the marinated short ribs and lay about three to four in the pan side by side . they should not overlap . cook the ribs for about 5 minutes and then flip them over and cook for about 4 more minutes . when the ribs are fully cooked , use tongs and take each piece out and place on a plate to rest . repeat the cooking process for the ribs for any that are left .

column1: marinate the ribs .
column2: put gloves on your hands . put the short ribs in the bowl to marinate . use your hands to rub the marinade into the ribs .

column1: marinate the ribs .
column2: grab the ribs with your hands with gloves on . put the meat in the sauce . squish everything together to marinate or cover with sauce .

column1: marinate the ribs .
column2: mix your marinade using a spoon in a large enough bowl to fit all the ribs . place the short ribs inside the marinade bowl . you can wear gloves so you can massage the ribs with the marinade making sure each piece is thoroughly covered in the marinade .

column1: cover the bowl with saran wrap .
column2: cover the bowl of ribs with saran wrap . let the bowl sit for 3 hours to marinate .

column1: cover the bowl with saran wrap .
column2: tear off a piece of plastic wrap . cover the bowl with the wrap to cover the top .

column1: cover the bowl with saran wrap .
column2: place the meat in the liquid inside the glass bowl . pull a strip of clear plastic wrap a couple of feet long . cut the plastic wrap , using the serrated edge of the box . place the plastic over the bowl opening . smooth the extra wrap onto the outside of the bowl .

column1: put the dish in the oven .
column2: make sure the oven is set to the right temperature . put on oven mitts . open the oven door . carefully place the baking sheet in the oven without touching the inside of the oven . close the oven door .

column1: put the dish in the oven .
column2: put the dish on a cookie sheet . place the cookie sheet in the oven . leave in the oven for 15 - 18 minutes at 350 degrees . remove sheet from oven .

column1: put the dish in the oven .
column2: put the dishes on a baking sheet or cookie sheet . carefully place the sheet in the oven without touching the edges of the oven which are very hot .

column1: mix butter pressed garlic chives salt pepper and cooking sherry .
column2: make sure to wash your hands first as you will be using your fingers and you do n't want to spread any germs . you will be using softened butter , garlic , chives , salt , white pepper , and a garlic press . white pepper is stronger than black pepper , so measure this out carefully . white pepper will not show up as much either . use a fork to mesh up the butter in the medium size bowl before adding any additional ingredients , until it is mushy . place the softened butter in the bowl , and mash the three garlic cloves in your garlic press , one clove at a time . you will place a clove of garlic that has been peeled in the press , squeeze , and then using your fork , scrap off the garlic paste that oozes out of the device . you are really getting the juice out of the clove , which is different than if you chopped it . mix in the chives , about one to one and a half tablespoons of chopped chives . add a small amount of salt . using your fork , continue to mix and press all the ingredients until smooth and well mixed . next , you will need to slowly add cooking sherry , an inexpensive sherry from the grocery store is sufficient to give a good flavor . start with a small amount , about 1 tablespoon , and only add if more sherry s need . this will be used for the twelve mussels , but could be used on top of chicken , fish , and steak to make a tasty dish and marry the flavors .

column1: mix butter pressed garlic chives salt pepper and cooking sherry .
column2: now we want to take our fork and mix up the dish . now take your garlic press and smash 2 - 3 cloves of garlic so that the juice goes into the bowl . throw all of the skins to the sides as we do not need them . now put a tablespoon or so of chives into the bowl and add a little salt . white pepper also goes well . now take your cooking sherry and slowly add it in .

column1: mix butter pressed garlic chives salt pepper and cooking sherry .
column2: take a mixing bowl add some butter in to the bowl . add pressed garlic in to the bowl . add cut pieces of chives in to the bowl . add little salt and pepper in to the bowl . add cooking sherry in to the bowl and mix everything .

column1: spread butter on top of escargot .
column2: scoop the butter out of the pan with a fork . spread the butter out on top of the escargot . pre - heat the over to 350 degrees .

column1: spread butter on top of escargot .
column2: take the rest of the butter and place on top of each escargot . the oven should already be preheated to 350 degrees .

column1: spread butter on top of escargot .
column2: use a fork and scoop up some butter . use the fork to spread butter over the escargot .

column1: pat escargot dry and place on mat .
column2: clean the escargot with water . pat the escargot . dry the escargot and place on mat .

column1: pat escargot dry and place on mat .
column2: use a strainer in the sink and rinse the escargot . after rinsing six of them place them on a dry paper towel and pat them dry .

column1: pat escargot dry and place on mat .
column2: now we want to take the escargot and place them onto the mat . you will want about 6 per person at the dinner . just gently place them onto your mat so they can dry from washing .

column1: put butter mix into baking dish .
column2: use your fork to put a little dollop the size of a quarter . carefully add the mixture using your fork and finger to the bottom of each one of the container . make sure it goes all the way to the bottom .

column1: put butter mix into baking dish .
column2: use a fork and your fingers to put some of the butter into the pan . make sure you put butter into each hole in the pan .

column1: put butter mix into baking dish .
column2: spoon small amounts of butter mixture into each cavity of a stoneware dish . sooth to form a bed for the escargot .

column1: rinse off escargot under cool water .
column2: use a can opener to open the can of escargot . place a strainer the sink and pour the can of escargot into the strainer . rinse the escargot under cool water .

column1: rinse off escargot under cool water .
column2: get a colander or a bowl . dump the escargot into the colander or bowl . run water over the escargot . swish around the escargot and make sure they are clean . check for any bits that you might want to pull off .

column1: rinse off escargot under cool water .
column2: put the escargot in a strainer in the sink . rinse everything in the sink .

column1: put escargot onto each drop of butter .
column2: you will be using two escargot dishes . these have a handle on each side , with a rim so that the butter will stay inside the pan . there is a center hole , and five other holes . you will have a scoop of butter ( mix ) in each of the holes in the pan , and the escargot ready in a dish . using your fingers , put an escargot in each of the holes on top of the butter . the nice thing about these dishes is that there is room when the butter melts , to cover the escargot . you should have twelve holes with butter , and twelve escargots , or snails for those of you wondering exactly what type of animal is an escargot .

column1: put escargot onto each drop of butter .
column2: we ' ve put the drops of butter into little tiny individual molds . set one escargot onto each single butter mold spot .

column1: put escargot onto each drop of butter .
column2: using a spoon put escargot onto each drop of butter . making sure they are on right use your hand and press them into the butter .

column1: add water juniper berries and the bay leaf to the pot .
column2: add half a cup of water to the pot . add the juniper berries and the bay leaf with a spoon . mix with a spoon .

column1: add water juniper berries and the bay leaf to the pot .
column2: add 1/4 to 1/2 cup more water to the pan . add a small handful of juniper berries to the pan . sprinkle a pinch of salt into the pan . set a bay leaf on top of the ingredients and then use a wooden spoon to mix it all up gently . turn the stove down on low and put the lid on the pan .

column1: add water juniper berries and the bay leaf to the pot .
column2: add a half cup of water to the pot . add the juniper berries to the pot . take a pinch of salt and put it in the pot . take one bay leave and put it in the pot . take a wooden spoon and stir the ingredients in the pot .

column1: add olive oil and onions to the pot .
column2: put a pan on the stove over medium to high heat . coat the bottom of the pan with a thin layer of olive oil . once the pan is hot carefully put the onions in . stir the onions with wooden cooking spoon so they will not stick to the pan and will cook evenly .

column1: add olive oil and onions to the pot .
column2: turn the heat of the stove to medium . pour some olive oil in the pot . add onions to the pot .

column1: add olive oil and onions to the pot .
column2: with a pot on the stove , turn on the stove to medium to high heat . add olive oil to the pot and let it heat up . add the onion to the pot and mix with a spoon to coat in the oil .

column1: add the apple and garlic to the pot .
column2: take a pan on the stove . cut the apple in to small pieces . cut the garlic i to small pieces . add the garlic in to the pan . add the apple in to the pan .

column1: add the apple and garlic to the pot .
column2: hold the apple over the pot . scoop the apple in with a spatula . scoop the garlic in the pot with a spatula .

column1: add the apple and garlic to the pot .
column2: add the chopped apple into the frying pan . pour in the minced garlic . use a spoon to stir everything together as it cooks .

column1: cook the bratwursts on the skillet .
column2: take a skillet on the stove . add some butter on the skillet . place the bratwursts on the skillets . cook on one side and flip to the other side . cook on the other side of the bratwursts .

column1: cook the bratwursts on the skillet .
column2: add butter to a skillet until it is melted . using tongs , add the bratwurst to the skillet . leave them on one side until it is brown . flip the bratwurst with the tongs , and brown the other side . make sure the bratwurst is not pink on the inside .

column1: cook the bratwursts on the skillet .
column2: fill a large pot with water , add brats to water , turn on stove and allow water to boil . allow the bratwurst to boil for 3 minutes . carefully remove the pot , discard the water and set the bratwursts aside on a paper towel . carefully place a skillet on the stove and turn the stove to a medium - high heat . allow the pan to heat up for a minute , then carefully add the bratwursts to the pan . allow the bratwursts to begin to sizzle in the pan for 2 minutes . you will notice some liquid escaping from the bratwursts . carefully use tongs and flip the bratwursts so the opposite side can cook . you will notice brown marks as you flip them . allow the bratwursts to sizzle for another 3 minutes .

column1: add the sauerkraut to the pot .
column2: put a pot on the stove . turn the stove on . pour a jar of sauerkraut into the pot . turn the stove up . stir sauerkraut with a wooden spoon .

column1: add the sauerkraut to the pot .
column2: add sauerkraut to the pot . use a spoon to stir the sauerkraut in with the onions .

column1: add the sauerkraut to the pot .
column2: cook the onions until they are starting to soften up a little . add the jar of sauerkraut to the pot and mix it until it 's all thoroughly combined !

column1: add butter and olive oil to a skillet .
column2: place butter on the skillet . spread the butter around the skillet evenly . add some olive oil to the skillet .

column1: add butter and olive oil to a skillet .
column2: use a spoon and scoop butter onto the skillet . pour oil on the butter .

column1: add butter and olive oil to a skillet .
column2: put the skillet on medium to high heat . put butter and a little bit of oil into the skillet . tilt the skillet back and forth to coat the bottom .

column1: peel the apple and chop it into pieces .
column2: peel the apple with a knife cutting the skin off . cut up the apple into pieces that are small .

column1: peel the apple and chop it into pieces .
column2: use a knife to cut an apple into two sections . take one half and peel the apple peel off with a knife . chop the rest of the apple into small pieces .

column1: peel the apple and chop it into pieces .
column2: with a knife cut the apple in half . with a knife take off the skin of the apple . with a knife cut the apple into small dice size pieces .

column1: boil the bratwursts in water .
column2: put some cold water into a pot and place of a heated stove top . put the bratwursts into the pot of water . bring the water to a boil .

column1: boil the bratwursts in water .
column2: fill a medium saucepan halfway with cold water . put the pan on the stove . turn the stove on to high heat . the dial for the burner should be at the notch farthest to the right for high heat . do n't wait for the water to boil . as soon as you have turned the stove on , carefully drop your bratwursts into the pot . by boiling them first , we can be sure that the middle is cooked all the way , so we wo n't have to cut them open or guess when we cook them in a frying pan later . once the bratwursts have boiled long enough , use tongs to carefully take them out of the pan . place the bratwursts in a colander so that the excess water drains away .

column1: boil the bratwursts in water .
column2: place the sauce pan on the stove . add water into the sauce pan . add the bratwursts into the water . put it inside until it boils .

column1: cut the pita bread into cubes .
column2: put a piece of pita bread onto a cutting board . with a sharp knife , cut the pita into 4 strips . turn the pita one quarter turn and cut it into 4 strips again . you should wind up with cubes of pita bread .

column1: cut the pita bread into cubes .
column2: cut the pita bread into 4 equal slices . next cut the slices into 4 equal size pieces making them into cubes .

column1: cut the pita bread into cubes .
column2: now we want to take our knife and cut the pita bread into small square . take the knife and cut along in one direction of the bread . now turn the bread and cut the opposite direction across the bread .

column1: toss the salad .
column2: add all vegetables to large bowl . add flatbread to bowl . use two large spoons . mix salad . make sure the bottom cucumbers and tomatoes are mixed from the bottom .

column1: toss the salad .
column2: use to forks to toss the salad . be sure to mix all parts of the salad so everything gets tossed all over .

column1: toss the salad .
column2: with two spoons mix the salad together . make sure everything is mixed together .

column1: add olive oil lemon juice garlic salt and pepper to a small bowl and mix .
column2: measure out 2 teaspoons of olive garden and 2 teaspoons of lemon juice and pour them into small bowl . get some garlic salt seasoning and peeper and add to the small bowl of olive oil and lemon juice . mix the ingredients in the small bowl well .

column1: add olive oil lemon juice garlic salt and pepper to a small bowl and mix .
column2: slowly pour in olive oil lemon juice garlic . use a small spoon to add in salt and pepper . with everything with the spoon .

column1: add olive oil lemon juice garlic salt and pepper to a small bowl and mix .
column2: take a small bowl and add 2 tablespoons of olive oil in to the bowl . add 2 tablespoons of lemon juice in to the bowl . add some garlic salt in to the bowl . add some pepper powder in to the bowl . mix everything properly with a spoon .

column1: add cucumbers tomatoes iceberg lettuce green bell pepper parsley spring onions mint leaves and spring onion whites to a bowl .
column2: using a spoon put 3/4 cup cucumber cubes and 3/4 cup of tomato cubes into bowl once the seeds are removed . next tear 3/4 cup of lettuce with your hands and add to bowl . then add 1/2 cup capsicum cubes and 1/4 chopped parsley to the bowl . also add 1/4 of finely chopped spring onion greens , 1/4 cup mint leaves . also add a 1/4 cup of spring onion whites to the bowl .

column1: add cucumbers tomatoes iceberg lettuce green bell pepper parsley spring onions mint leaves and spring onion whites to a bowl .
column2: get all of the vegetables that you prepared and make sure they are handy . everything is ready except the lettuce which you will just tear into pieces when you add the ingredients . in a large bowl , add each of the vegetables in this order : . add the cucumbers , then the tomatoes , the iceberg lettuce , the bell peppers , the parsley , the lettuce , the bell peppers , the parsley , the spring onion greens , chopped mint leaves and sliced spring onion greens .

column1: add cucumbers tomatoes iceberg lettuce green bell pepper parsley spring onions mint leaves and spring onion whites to a bowl .
column2: cut the cucumber and tomato in to cube size pieces . add the cucumber and tomato in to the bowl . add pieces of iceberg lettuce and cut pieces of bell peppers in to the bowl . add cut pieces of parsley and spring onions in to the bowl . finally add cut pieces of mint leaves in to the bowl and mix them .

column1: add the dressing and bread pieces the salad .
column2: pour the dressing into the salad bowl . then put the pieces of bread to the top of the salad .

column1: add the dressing and bread pieces the salad .
column2: have mixed salad in a glass bowl . put in sliced onions ( small amount . pour in small amt of dressing . add bread pieces . stir with spoon .

column1: add the dressing and bread pieces the salad .
column2: if you have made dressing or have your favorite dressing in a bottle whichever had it to the top of your salad mix in a bowl . then break up pieces of bread , or you can use croutons , or pita bread to the top of you salad mix in bowl . stir your salad mix - lightly .

column1: brush olive oil on both sides of a piece of pita bread and place onto a hot pan .
column2: take a brush and brush olive oil on both sides of a slice of pita bread . place the bread on the pan with your hands .

column1: brush olive oil on both sides of a piece of pita bread and place onto a hot pan .
column2: put the pita bread on a cutting board . brush olive oil on both sides of the pita bread . next place pita on a hot pan and cook until crisp .

column1: brush olive oil on both sides of a piece of pita bread and place onto a hot pan .
column2: get a pastry brush and dip it in some olive oil . lightly brush olive oil on both sides of a piece of pita bread . put the bread on a heated frying pan and fry until a little crisp and golden brown in color .

column1: add some steamed rice and stir everything together .
column2: use a spoon to scoop some rice . put the rice into the pan . use a wooden spoon to stir everything together .

column1: add some steamed rice and stir everything together .
column2: add 1 1/2 cups of steamed rice . use the stirring spoon to mix the rice together with the rest of the pan .

column1: add some steamed rice and stir everything together .
column2: put the cooked rice into the pan . use a wooden spoon to stir the rice into the meat mixture .

column1: melt some meat loaf in a pan and stir to cook them well .
column2: cook the meat in the pan while stirring with a wooden spoon . stir while the meat cooks and wait until the meat is now brown .

column1: melt some meat loaf in a pan and stir to cook them well .
column2: take a pan on the stove . heat the pan . place the meat loaf on the pan . melt the meat loaf . mix the melted meat loaf with the spatula .

column1: melt some meat loaf in a pan and stir to cook them well .
column2: put some meat into a pan . cook the ground beef stirring with a wooden spoon . continue cooking until it turns brown .

column1: add 1 chopped onion and green bell pepper .
column2: hold the vegetable plate over the pan . drop in the cut up pieces of onion and green bell pepper .

column1: add 1 chopped onion and green bell pepper .
column2: chop one medium onion and one medium bell pepper into bite - sized pieces . put them into the pan with the meat , while it is still cooking .

column1: add 1 chopped onion and green bell pepper .
column2: add 1 chopped onion into the pan with the meat . put in 1 chopped green bell pepper . use a stirring spoon to mix the pan together evenly .

column1: add a cup of salsa and one can of black beans .
column2: add a cup of salsa to the pan . add black beans to the pan .

column1: add a cup of salsa and one can of black beans .
column2: add 1 cup of salsa to the pan . add 1 can of black beans . use the stirring spoon to mix into the pan .

column1: add a cup of salsa and one can of black beans .
column2: take ground beef and add it to a skillet . then add salsa . apply heat . stir with a wooden spoon . mix until all is cooked and serve .

column1: add the moreno to a piece of taco and spread some cheese and roll it up .
column2: take a taco on a plate . add some moreno on to the taco . spread some cheese on the moreno . roll the taco from one side . fold the sides and roll it to the other side .

column1: add the moreno to a piece of taco and spread some cheese and roll it up .
column2: use a spoon to add the mixture to the middle of the tortilla . add cheese to the top of the mixture . fold the end of the burrito over the meat and cheese . fold up the sides . finish rolling the burrito .

column1: add the moreno to a piece of taco and spread some cheese and roll it up .
column2: use a spoon to scoop up the meat . put the meat on the middle of the burrito . sprinkle cheese on the meat . fold the shell over and roll it up .

column1: add mixed seasoning of black pepper garlic powder salt oregano cumin and chili powder .
column2: add a mix of seasoning the bowl . the mixture should include black pepper and garlic powder . also include salt , oregano and cumin . finally put in 2 tablespoons of chili powder . mix together in the pan .

column1: add mixed seasoning of black pepper garlic powder salt oregano cumin and chili powder .
column2: add mixed seasoning to the pan . using a wooden spoon mix the mixture together .

column1: add mixed seasoning of black pepper garlic powder salt oregano cumin and chili powder .
column2: make sure your mixture is cooking in a frying pan on the stove . with all your spices on one plate , including 3 tablespoons of chili powder , dump it into the frying pan .

column1: tie a lobster tail with string and place in a pot of boiling water .
column2: tie the lobster tail together at each end with two pieces of string . cut the loose ends of the string off using a knife . place the tail into a pot of boiling water .

column1: tie a lobster tail with string and place in a pot of boiling water .
column2: take a large pot on a stove . add water in to the pot . boil the water in the pot . take the lobster and tie a thread to the tail . place the lobster in the boiling water .

column1: tie a lobster tail with string and place in a pot of boiling water .
column2: use a string to tie the lobster tail . trim the extra string with your knife . gently place the lobster inside the boiling water . use your tongs to gently move the lobster pieces to make sure they 're covered by the water .

column1: place the lobster into a bowl of ice water .
column2: put water and ice cubes in a large bowl . take cook lobster out of pot . put cook lobster into the bowl of ice and water . doing this will stop the lobster from over cooking .

column1: place the lobster into a bowl of ice water .
