column1: drain the extra water from the beef .
column2: wait until the meat looks brown . move the meat to one side of the pot with a wooden spoon . drain the liquid from the beef .

column1: drain the extra water from the beef .
column2: as the beef cooks , use the spoon to break up larger chunks . turn off the heat once the beef turns brown . move all the beef to one side . dump out the grease .

column1: drain the extra water from the beef .
column2: take beef and put in pan . add heat and cook until brown . stir with wooden spoon . when cooked , drain the water from the beef . then put back in the pan .

column1: add chicken salt coriander leaves and garam masala powder and mix well .
column2: put boned chicken in the tomato sauce in the pan . add salt and mix well . add in coriander leaves and garam powder , mixing well again . cook for 20 minutes or until gravy consistency . add hot water if needed .

column1: cover the pan .
column2: place the lid on the pan . reduce the heat to medium .

column1: cover the pan .
column2: you will want to cook the food around 20 minutes on medium heat . make sure you cover the pan with the lid .

column1: cover the pan .
column2: take a pan on the stove . cook the chicken on the pan . mix the cooking ingredients in the pan . take the lid of the pan . cover the pan with the lid and cook the chicken .

column1: garnish with chopped coriander .

column1: garnish with chopped coriander .
column2: sprinkle the chopped coriander over the dish . the color and texture serves to make the dish look better .

column1: garnish with chopped coriander .
column2: take small amount of chopped coriander and pick it up with your hands . it should be about a tablespoon . release it over the dish .

column1: add ginger paste and garlic paste .
column2: use a spoon to pick up the ginger and garlic paste . put the ginger and garlic paste into the hot pan . use a spoon to mix the paste in the pan .

column1: add ginger paste and garlic paste .

column1: add tomato puree and salt and mix .
column2: add a bowl of tomato puree to pan . stir and add little bit of salt and pepper and then stir again .

column1: add tomato puree and salt and mix .
column2: pick up the bowl of tomato puree and pour carefully into the pan . stir everything in the pan with a spoon . use your measuring spoon and measure the correct amount of salt . sprinkle the salt into the pan . stir the contents of the pan with the spoon again .

column1: add tomato puree and salt and mix .
column2: carefully and slowly pour in the tomato puree . add in the salt . use a spatula to mix everything .

column1: add grated onion and cook until the onion turns brown .
column2: squeeze the onion bits until the water comes out . pour a little bit of oil in the pan . put the onions in the pan and start to cook the onions . move the onions around with the spatula until it starts to turn brown .

column1: add grated onion and cook until the onion turns brown .
column2: drain all the extra water out of the onions . add the onions to the cooking pan . continue to cook the onions until they turn brown .

column1: add grated onion and cook until the onion turns brown .
column2: pick up the bowl of onions and squeeze out the water . add the onions to the black pan . take the wooden spoon and stir the onions . let the onions turn brown then add other ingredients as directed .

column1: add turmeric powder red chili powder cumin powder coriander powder water and salt and mix .
column2: put in turmeric powder . then use a spoon and put in some red chili powder . then add some cumin and coriander powder . add a little water to prevent burning . mix the spices together on the frying pan for about 1 minute .

column1: add turmeric powder red chili powder cumin powder coriander powder water and salt and mix .
column2: add a teaspoon of turmeric powder and chili powder in to the pan . add a teaspoon of cumin powder and coriander powder in to the pan . add little water in to the pan . add some salt in to the pan . mix everything in the pan with a spoon .

column1: add turmeric powder red chili powder cumin powder coriander powder water and salt and mix .
column2: add a small quantity of turmeric powder . add a small quantity of red chili powder . add a small quantity of cumin powder . add some quantity of coriander powder . add water and salt into the pan and mix all the masalas together .

column1: heat oil in a pan and add cinnamon green cardamom and cloves .
column2: pour a bit of oil in the pan . turn up the heat on the stove . pour in the cinnamon green cardamom and cloves .

column1: heat oil in a pan and add cinnamon green cardamom and cloves .
column2: use a nonstick pan . pour a small amount of oil into the pan , enough to lightly cover the bottom of the pan . break up a small piece of cinnamon and place it in the pan . add a pinch of green cardamom and cloves to pan as well .

column1: heat oil in a pan and add cinnamon green cardamom and cloves .
column2: pour some oil into a nonstick pan , tip the pan to make oil cover the bottom . turn on the stove to heat up the pan . add some cinnamon , green cardamom and cloves to the oil in the pan .

column1: in pan take 1 pound ground beef add 1 finely chopped onions 2 cloves finely minced garlic cook 5 mins .
column2: lets take our one pound of ground beef and add one chopped onion to the meat . now we will take 2 cloves of garlic and add it in with the meat . for 5 minutes we will stir our pan and let the meat brown . remember , we wo n't need to drain any of the grease and oil off at the end of the cooking .

column1: in pan take 1 pound ground beef add 1 finely chopped onions 2 cloves finely minced garlic cook 5 mins .
column2: place 1 pound of ground beef into a frying pan . add 1 whole onion that has been chopped up . put in two cloves of garlic that has been cut up . mix the ingredient together while they cook . cook for about 5 minutes until the beef is brown .

column1: in pan take 1 pound ground beef add 1 finely chopped onions 2 cloves finely minced garlic cook 5 mins .
column2: to the ground beef , add one onion that has been chopped into very small pieces . also add two cloves of garlic that have been chopped very small as well . fry the mixture until the meat is completely brown . stir while frying to make sure all the meat gets cooked . there is no need to drain unless there is a lot of fat coming from the meat .

column1: add 1 cup of water and 6 ounce of canned tomato paste blend it well and season it with salt .
column2: pour one cup of water over the meat that is in the frying pan . take a six ounce can of tomato paste and add it to the other ingredients in the frying pan . using a large spoon , mix the water and tomato with the other ingredients . after all the ingredients are mixed well , sprinkle 1/2 teaspoon of salt on top .

column1: add 1 cup of water and 6 ounce of canned tomato paste blend it well and season it with salt .
column2: take a cooking pan on the stove . add 1 cup of water in to the pan . add 6 ounces of canned tomato paste in to the pan . mix it well with a spatula . add some salt in to the pan and mix well .

column1: add 1 cup of water and 6 ounce of canned tomato paste blend it well and season it with salt .
column2: now we want to add in one cup of water . once the water is in , we will add 6 oz of tomato paste to the pan . now stir the dish with a spoon until it is blended good . now we can add about half a teaspoon of salt on top of the dish to season it .

column1: steam frankfurters for 4 minutes in same steamer place the hot dog buns and steam for a couple of minutes .
column2: now , turn off the stove , move the pan off of the hot burner and let it cool somewhere . put your steamer pan on the burner instead . make sure your steamer pan is holding the water measured out in the beginning . then , turn on the heat again , and put the lid on the steamer pan . when the water begins to boil , put the hot dogs in the steamer basket . put the lid back on , and let the steam for about 4 minutes . remember to set your timer . after the hot dogs have steamed for 4 minutes , remove the lid , and add the hot dog buns right on top of the hot dogs . carefully put the lid back on the pan while the buns steam .

column1: steam frankfurters for 4 minutes in same steamer place the hot dog buns and steam for a couple of minutes .
column2: put water in the bottom part of the steamer . place the steamer on the stove top and turn the heat on high . put the hotdogs in the top part of the steamer , let steam for about 4 minutes . place the buns on top of the hotdogs , and put the lid back on the steamer . let the buns steam for about 1 minute .

column1: steam frankfurters for 4 minutes in same steamer place the hot dog buns and steam for a couple of minutes .
column2: place steamer on stove . turn on high heat . add frankfurters for 4 minutes . open lid . place hot dog buns on top and let steam for a couple minutes .

column1: add 1 tbls prepared yellow mustard 1 tbls worcestershire sauce 2 tsp brown sugar mix simmer 5 minutes .
column2: add your mustard with a teaspoon into the pot . pour your worcestershire sauce into the pan . with your hands grab your brown sugar mix and add it to the pan . with your wooden spoon mix the mixture together .

column1: add 1 tbls prepared yellow mustard 1 tbls worcestershire sauce 2 tsp brown sugar mix simmer 5 minutes .
column2: put in 1 tablespoon of yellow mustard to the mix . add 1 tablespoon of worcestershire sauce . put in 2 teaspoons of brown sugar . use the stirring spoon to mix everything together . let simmer for 5 minutes .

column1: add 1 tbls prepared yellow mustard 1 tbls worcestershire sauce 2 tsp brown sugar mix simmer 5 minutes .
column2: to the meat mix in the pan , add 1 tb of plain yellow mustard , and 1 tb worcestershire sauce . mix well into the other ingredients . continue to simmer . add 2 tsp brown sugar and mix well . simmer for about 5 more minutes .

column1: place frankfurter in middle of bun cover sausage with chili prepared earlier top with mustard sauce garnish with chopped onions .
column2: place a steamed hotdog bun on a cutting board . put one hotdog wiener on the steamed bun . use a wooden spoon to top the hotdog with chili . put some mustard and raw chopped onion on top of the chili .

column1: place frankfurter in middle of bun cover sausage with chili prepared earlier top with mustard sauce garnish with chopped onions .
column2: put the frankfurter inside a bun . put chili inside a bowl , pour mustard into chili and stir . put chili inside the bowl on top of frankfurter with a spoon . put mustard on top of the chili . sprinkle raw onions on top of the mustard .

column1: place frankfurter in middle of bun cover sausage with chili prepared earlier top with mustard sauce garnish with chopped onions .
column2: place the hotdog ( also called the frankfurter ) in the middle of the hot dog bun . use a wooden spoon to put some chili on the hot dog . add some mustard . add some chopped onions .

column1: now add 2 tbls of chili powder 1 tbls of cumin powder and cook for 3 minutes .
column2: measure 2 tablespoons of chili powder with a measuring spoon . add that to the meat . mix it together with a spoon .

column1: now add 2 tbls of chili powder 1 tbls of cumin powder and cook for 3 minutes .
column2: sprinkle 2 tablespoons of chili powder over the meat . sprinkle 1 tablespoon of cumin powder over the meat . mix the spices in until they are evenly spread over the meat . let the meat and spices cook on low heat for about 3 more minutes .

column1: now add 2 tbls of chili powder 1 tbls of cumin powder and cook for 3 minutes .
column2: sprinkle two tablespoons of chili powder on the meat that is in the pan . sprinkle one tablespoon of cumin powder on the meat that is in the pan . using a spoon , stir all of the ingredients together . mix the ingredients well and let them cook for three minutes .

column1: add rice to the pot of water .
column2: bring the water in the pot to a boil . scoop the rice into a pot of boiling water . stir the rice as it cooks for 4 to 5 minutes .

column1: add rice to the pot of water .

column1: add rice to the pot of water .

column1: add seeds salt oil to a pot of water .

column1: add seeds salt oil to a pot of water .

column1: add seeds salt oil to a pot of water .
column2: put a large pot of water on the stove top . add cumin seeds , salt and oil to the pot of water .

column1: add oil and seasoning to a pot .
column2: add oil to the pan using a spoon . add seasoning to the pan .

column1: add oil and seasoning to a pot .
column2: add oil into the pot . spread the oil around so the bottom of the pot is covered in oil . add the seasoning to the pot .

column1: add oil and seasoning to a pot .
column2: take a pan on the stove . add some oil in to the pan . heat the oil in the pan . add seasoning ingredients in to the pan . mix the ingredients in the pan .

column1: fry onions in the pot .

column1: fry onions in the pot .

column1: fry onions in the pot .

column1: pour the rice into the pot with the vegetables and stir .
column2: gently add the rice to the pot of vegetables . use a spoon to mix the rice and vegetables . let it cook for about 5 minutes .

column1: pour the rice into the pot with the vegetables and stir .
column2: gently add the rice into the vegetables . gently mix everything together . wait 5 minutes .

column1: pour the rice into the pot with the vegetables and stir .
column2: pour the plate into the pot . use a stirring spoon to mix everything together evenly .

column1: top the rice and vegetables with some nuts .
column2: add some nuts to the vegetable and rice mixture . spread the nuts around the top of the mix .

column1: top the rice and vegetables with some nuts .
column2: cook rice by adding to boiling water . then drain . add vegetables to the rice . then mix all together . finally serve .

column1: top the rice and vegetables with some nuts .
column2: sprinkle some nuts into the pan . it is now ready to serve .

column1: add vegetables and salt to the onions and stir .

column1: add vegetables and salt to the onions and stir .
column2: add carrots to the bowl and stir in with a stirring spoon . pour in some salt and continue to stir as it cooks .

column1: add vegetables and salt to the onions and stir .
column2: add the vegetable all at once . stir together and mix everything . add salt and mix for another minute and stir . add onions and stir until they are clear .

column1: cover the pot with a lid .
column2: add a little bit of water to the pot . place the lid on the pot .

column1: cover the pot with a lid .
column2: get a lid that fits nicely on the pan . cover the pan with the lid .

column1: cover the pot with a lid .
column2: cover the pot with a lid . let the ingredients simmer .

column1: place the strained rice on a plate .
column2: use a strainer to scoop out the rice . pour the rice out on a new plate .

column1: place the strained rice on a plate .
column2: strain the rice . after draining the water , pour the rice onto a plate .

column1: place the strained rice on a plate .
column2: after cooking and straining the rice pour the rice onto a plate . spread the rice evenly over the plate .

column1: add paneer chilies mint and seasoning to the vegetables and stir .
column2: add paneer chilies mint into the pan . add seasoning to the pan . add vegetables to the pan . using a spoon stir the mixture together .

column1: add paneer chilies mint and seasoning to the vegetables and stir .

column1: add paneer chilies mint and seasoning to the vegetables and stir .

column1: pour saffron and water into the pot .
column2: cook the dish in the pot . take a small bowl . add some water in the bowl . add some saffron in to the water and soak . pour the saffron and water in to the dish .

column1: pour saffron and water into the pot .
column2: pour the saffron into the pot . add water to the pot . with a spoon stir it all together .

column1: serve in a bowl with sauce on the side .
column2: place in a bowl . very healthy to eat . have the sauces on the side and add as much as you want .

column1: serve in a bowl with sauce on the side .
column2: scoop everything into a bowl with a scoop . serve the dish with some sauce in a separate bowl next to it .

column1: cut the wing at the two joints .
column2: you will need an adult 's help with this because you will be working with a sharp knife . place a wing on your cooking surface and look where the wing bends . it will remind you of your shoulder . the joint should be larger than where the other side of the wing bends . cut between the joint ( the big , round , bone looking object ) and the rest of the wing . there should not be any bones to cut through . when you have cut the joint , move down to the thinner side of the wing . this part will remind you of an elbow . cut through where it bends . always know where your fingers are when you 're using a knife . make sure you have an adult with you and watching you . always wash your hands after you touch raw chicken .

column1: cut the wing at the two joints .
column2: get a chef 's knife ( to help with cutting of chicken wings ) . spread the first wing so that the thicker end is to your right . slice through the skin at the top of the thick end ( above the large joint ) . spread the wing open and carefully cut through the joint ( do n't cut through bone ) . cut through the small joint at the other end ( the narrow wing ' tip ' ) .

column1: cut the wing at the two joints .
column2: with a sharp knife ( be careful ! ) cut through the skin between the wing and thigh . until you can see the joint . when you can see the joint , cut between the bones . to cut off the wing tip , place the knife , sharp side down , on top of the wing . first cut through the skin . give the top ( dull side ) of the knife blade a little whack with the palm of your free hand .

column1: mix salt seasoning pepper and baking powder in a bowl .
column2: take a small bowl . add some salt in to the bowl . add seasoning pepper powder in to the bowl . add baking powder in to the bowl . mix everything properly .

column1: mix salt seasoning pepper and baking powder in a bowl .
column2: put 2 tablespoons of salt mix in the bowl . then put 2 tablespoons of pepper in the bowl . finally , add 2 tablespoons of baking powder in . then take your mixing tool and mix it together well .

column1: mix salt seasoning pepper and baking powder in a bowl .
column2: add seasoned salt and pepper to the bowl . also add baking powder ( to help crisp the wings ) . mix thoroughly with a whisk .

column1: coat the wings in the seasoning mix .
column2: cover the wings with the seasoning mix inside your bowl . use your hands to make sure the seasoning is all over the wings .

column1: coat the wings in the seasoning mix .
column2: rub the wing with the seasoning mixture . get it all covered .

column1: coat the wings in the seasoning mix .
column2: sprinkle half of the seasoning mix over the chicken wings . using your hands , mix and rub the seasoning over the wings . sprinkle the rest of the seasoning over the chicken . use your hands to finish mixing the seasoning mix over every bit of the wings .

column1: cook the wings in the oven .
column2: put the wings on a baking sheet . put the baking sheet in the oven on the rack . turn the oven on and leave the wings in the oven for 25 minutes .

column1: cook the wings in the oven .
column2: take your pan of chicken wings and slide them into the oven . do this very carefully so you do not burn your hand on the hot oven . now set a timer and for 25 minutes so the chicken can bake evenly .

column1: cook the wings in the oven .
column2: line the wings up on the cooking rack so they are spaced about a finger apart . line them in rows . put the wings in the oven carefully .

column1: flip the wings .
column2: use tongs to flip each wing over . put pan back in the over after all wings have been flipped .

column1: flip the wings .
column2: flip every wing with a pair of tongs . if the wings stick a little bit , shake them side to side with the tongs until they come loose .

column1: flip the wings .
column2: grab tongs . carefully use them to turn the wings over on the baking sheet .

column1: cook the wings in the oven .
column2: use oven mitts or a towel to grab the pan and rack . place the wings back in the oven .

column1: cook the wings in the oven .
column2: put on your oven mitts . place the wings back into the oven for an extra 20 to 25 minutes .

column1: cook the wings in the oven .
column2: put the wings into the oven . let cook for twenty more minutes .

column1: mix hot sauce and melted butter together .
column2: put butter in a bowl of measuring cup , ( not metal ! ) place in microwave for a few seconds to melt . add 1/2 cup hot sauce to the melted butter .

column1: mix hot sauce and melted butter together .
column2: melt some butter in a measuring cup . get the hot sauce . measure half a cup of hot sauce . add the hot sauce into the measuring up with the butter . get a big bowl .

column1: mix hot sauce and melted butter together .
column2: stir hot sauce . add in melted butter . mix together .

column1: coat the wings in sauce .
column2: wings are already cooked and on a cookie sheet on the counter . get a big bowl and put it on the counter . if you like sauce on wings , pick the one you want and put in a cup . pour the sauce in the big bowl and count 12 wings , put into the bowl and shake the bowl around to have sauce on all the wings . if you do not want sauce on some wings , keep them on the cookie sheet .

column1: coat the wings in sauce .
column2: pour your sauce into a nice big bowl . place almost all of the chicken wings into the sauce bowl ( just in case some of the people who will be eating want wings with no sauce ) . shake the bowl around to mix the sauce with the wings .

column1: coat the wings in sauce .
column2: put sauce into bowl . add chicken to the sauce . toss the chicken in the bowl until all the chicken is coated .

column1: crack the eggs into the bowl .
column2: find a bowl . take an egg and hit the egg on the side of the bowl softly or on the table . take the same egg and use your fingers to open the shell . drop the egg and yoke out of the egg . continue to do this 7 times .

column1: crack the eggs into the bowl .
column2: carefully crack your eggs and release the yolk and egg whites into the bowl . crack 7 eggs into your bowl , and it is best to use a flat surface to crack the eggs , rather than the edge of the bowl . this will decrease the chances of getting egg shell into your bowl .

column1: crack the eggs into the bowl .
column2: get a medium sized bowl . get 7 eggs . crack the eggs on a flat surface to reduce chance of egg shells in the mix . crack one egg at a time and put it into the bowl . put all the cracked eggs into the same bowl .

column1: add milk creme and butter .
column2: in the bowl of eggs , pour your milk . pour your measured cream next . lastly add the cubes of butter .

column1: add milk creme and butter .
column2: add milk and double cream to the eggs in the bowl . then add a small amount of butter .

column1: add milk creme and butter .
column2: slowly pour in the cup of milk so it does n't spill . scoop in a few pieces of butter .

column1: add salt and pepper and whisk .
column2: add small amount of pepper . add a pinch of salt . stir just a bit using a fork or whisk , not too much because it will put air in the mix .

column1: add salt and pepper and whisk .
column2: all we need to season it is a small pinch of salt and another small pinch of pepper . just drop the salt and pepper into your mixing bowl and grab a fork or whisk . take the fork and mix the pepper and salt into your mixture .

column1: add salt and pepper and whisk .
column2: add the salt and the pepper . stir the ingredients quickly with a fork until they 're blended .

column1: place the bowl over a pot of water .
column2: get ready a pot of light simmering water . take the bowl and place it over the pot of simmering water .

column1: place the bowl over a pot of water .
column2: wait for your pot of water to simmer very lightly or gently with very few bubbles . now place the bowl of your mixture gently over the simmering water .

column1: place the bowl over a pot of water .
column2: add some water to a pot , just about 1 inch of water from the bottom of the pot . heat some water until it just starts to boil and adjust the heat so the water never boils very much , just a little bit . place your egg mixture in a glass bowl that can be heated . the bowl should rest on the rim of the pot over the lightly boiling water so it can be heated from below . it is important to use a glass bowl that can be heated like a pyrex bowl .

column1: stir the eggs .
column2: get a spatula . gently stir the eggs without splashing them .

column1: stir the eggs .
column2: add eggs to a bowl . place bowl of eggs over a hot pot with water in it . cook low and slow . stir with a plastic spoon . it should take 15 minutes to cook .

column1: stir the eggs .
column2: add 2 cups of water to a large pot . find a glass bowl that can be heated ( like a pyrex bowl ) . place the bowl over the boiling water in the pot so that the sides of the bowl is resting on the top rim of the pot . add your egg mixture to the glass bowl and stir gently as you boil the water in the bottom of the pot . this will take about 15 minutes and some lumps will form in the egg mixture which is ok . the egg mixture gets thicker as it cooks .

column1: melt the butter in a pan .
column2: put butter into pan . let butter sizzle and melt . boil butter .

column1: melt the butter in a pan .
column2: put the butter in the pot . when the butter starts to sizzle it is losing the water in it . this is when the butter melts .

column1: melt the butter in a pan .
column2: take a small pan on the stove . heat the pan on the stove . take some butter in a bowl . add the butter in to the hot pan . melt the butter in the pan .

column1: slice the salmon into small pieces .
column2: hold the salmon carefully . slowly slice the salmon into into small bits .

column1: slice the salmon into small pieces .
column2: cut the salmon into small pieces with a knife . be very careful , ask an adult for help .

column1: slice the salmon into small pieces .
column2: place the salmon onto a cutting board . slice it down the side a few times until its into small pieces .

column1: add the salmon to the eggs .
column2: you are first going to want to add your cut smoked salmon in with your eggs . just take the salmon and drop it into your scrambled egg mixture . now just mix the salmon and eggs together using a rubber spatula .

column1: add the salmon to the eggs .
column2: add the smoked salmon to the eggs with your clean hands . stir the salmon into the eggs until the salmon is nicely , evenly incorporated with the eggs .

column1: add the salmon to the eggs .
column2: add the smoked salmon to the scrambled eggs , and stir everything gently . add the mixture to the toasted piece of bread .

column1: place the eggs on the toast .
column2: mix it . now take it and put in onto the toast .

column1: place the eggs on the toast .

column1: place the eggs on the toast .
column2: crack eggs and put into bowl . add a little bit of milk , butter and seasoning . stir until there are no chunks . pour eggs into pan on medium heat . stir to avoid burning eggs . dump scrambled eggs into a bowl and spoon onto bread or plate as needed .

column1: top the eggs with the salmon butter and vinegar .
column2: take a bread slice on a plate . add cooked eggs on top of bread . add small pieces of salmon on to the eggs . add some butter on to the eggs . add little vinegar on to the eggs .

column1: top the eggs with the salmon butter and vinegar .
column2: add salmon butter to the top of the eggs . put a few drops of sherry vinegar on top .

column1: top the eggs with the salmon butter and vinegar .
column2: put the eggs on top of the toasted bread . next add the salmon pieces to the top of the eggs . next add butter . then sprinkle the vinegar to the top .

column1: break three eggs and add a little cream .
column2: break 3 eggs . put the insides of the eggs into a bowl . be careful not to get any shell in the bowl . and 1/3 cup of cream into the bowl .

column1: break three eggs and add a little cream .
column2: break three eggs into a bowl . add one - third cup of cream to the bowl .

column1: break three eggs and add a little cream .
column2: to start , we need to break our 3 eggs into the bowl . just use the edge of the bowl to crack them and let them fall into the bowl . make sure not to get any shell inside the bowl . now we can add 1/3 cup creme to the eggs .

column1: mix the cream and eggs .
column2: put your eggs and cream into a small bowl . using a fork , quickly stir the egg and cream mixture . continue mixing until the egg yolks can no longer be seen .

column1: mix the cream and eggs .
column2: put a pan on the stove and heat it up . use a fork to mix the cream and egg mixture .

column1: mix the cream and eggs .
column2: now while the pan is heating up , we can take a fork and mix up our cream and egg . just spin the fork around in a circular motion to start mixing it . keep going until the yolk of the egg is all mixed in and there are no streaks left .

column1: spread some parmesan cheese and stir the egg mixture .
column2: grate parmesan cheese into the pan with a cheese grater . using a wooden spoon scrape the bottom of pan to mix in the cheese and cook the eggs . turn off the heat .

column1: spread some parmesan cheese and stir the egg mixture .
column2: using a grater , grate parmesan cheese in the pan . use a spatula to mix up the eggs .

column1: spread some parmesan cheese and stir the egg mixture .
column2: grate some parmesan cheese into the pan . use a spatula to stir the cheese into the egg mixture . turn off the heat on the stove .

column1: put a pan on medium to high heat .
column2: put pan on the stove . put the dial to medium or high heat .

column1: put a pan on medium to high heat .
column2: get a non - stick skillet . put the skillet on the stove and turn the knob up to medium high .

column1: put a pan on medium to high heat .
column2: put a non stick pan on the oven . turn on the heat to medium to high .

column1: pour the egg mixture to the pan and shake the pan .
column2: after you have added butter to the pan and it 's melted good , add the mixed eggs into the pan . gently shake the pan back and forth a little bit , but do n't stir it . wait about 20 seconds until you see small bubbles .

column1: pour the egg mixture to the pan and shake the pan .
column2: take a pan and place it on the stove . melt some butter in the pan . take the egg mixture in a bowl . add the egg mixture in to the pan . shake the pan to evenly spread the egg .

column1: pour the egg mixture to the pan and shake the pan .
column2: have a pan ready and heated . dump the bowl of egg mixture into the pan . scoot the pan back and forth by the pan handle . wait 20 seconds to stir the eggs .

column1: heat the butter and some sea salt flakes in the pan .

column1: heat the butter and some sea salt flakes in the pan .
column2: put the butter in the pan . pinch some sea salt and sprinkle it in the pan .

column2: grab pan from cupboard and place on burner . turn burner on low . cut butter into a small cube and place in bottom of pan . grab small bowl of sea salt flakes . take two pinches of sea salt flakes and put it on butter in pan .

column1: stir in the milk and add vanilla extract .
column2: take flour and add to bowl . then add milk . stir with a whisk . add in vanilla extract . keep stirring until there are no lumps to make your pancake mixture .

column1: stir in the milk and add vanilla extract .
column2: use a whisk to stir the bowl . add milk to the bowl and continue whisking . add a drop or two of vanilla extract . continue to whisk the bowl .

column1: stir in the milk and add vanilla extract .
column2: as you whisk the flour , gently mix in your milk as you continue to stir . you may notice a bit of clumps , but continue to gently mix until it 's mostly smooth . add a drop or two of vanilla extract , and use your whisk to mix the vanilla in completely .

column1: spread butter on the grill pan .
column2: drop a piece of a stick of butter on the pan . use a spatula to spread the butter all over the pan .

column1: spread butter on the grill pan .
column2: put a slice of butter on the pan . spread the butter around the entire pan .

column1: spread butter on the grill pan .
column2: put a piece of butter on the pan . spread the butter around on the pan .

column1: spread butter and maple syrup on the pancakes .
column2: use a knife and scoop up some butter . spread the butter on the pancakes with the knife . pour maple syrup on the pancakes .

column1: spread butter and maple syrup on the pancakes .
column2: using a butter knife spread some softened butter over the tops of your pancakes . finally , top your pancakes with some maple syrup . do n't put too much syrup or your pancakes will become soggy . grab a fork and enjoy your breakfast .

column1: spread butter and maple syrup on the pancakes .
column2: use a knife to spread butter on top of each of the pancakes . take a bottle of maple syrup and spread it across the top of the pancakes .

column1: beat two eggs into the milk and whisk in a cup of melted butter .
column2: crack two eggs into the cup of milk . mix it all together with a whisk . pour in the melted butter . mix everything more with the whisk .

column1: beat two eggs into the milk and whisk in a cup of melted butter .
column2: pour milk into a measuring cup . crack two eggs and drop them into the cup . stir milk with a whisk . melt butter in microwave , let butter sit a few minutes . pour butter into the cup and whisk .

column1: beat two eggs into the milk and whisk in a cup of melted butter .
column2: crack two eggs over top of the milk , letting the eggs fall into the glass . then set aside or throw away the eggshells . use a whisk to stir it very well for a few seconds . pour some melted butter that 's sat out a minute ( so it is n't too hot ) into the milk . use the whisk to stir everything together again .

column1: combine flour salt baking powder and sugar in a bowl .
column2: get a clean mixing bowl . put the pre - measured flour , salt , baking powder and sugar in that bowl . get a whisk . mix the ingredients in the bowl with the whisk .

column1: combine flour salt baking powder and sugar in a bowl .
column2: set aside a bowl . pour in the flour salt baking powder and sugar . mix everything together with the whisk .

column1: combine flour salt baking powder and sugar in a bowl .
column2: pour flour into a large bowl . add salt , baking powder and sugar to the flour . slowly mix with a metal whisk .

column1: pour batter on the pan .
column2: take an electric griddle . heat the griddle . spread the oil on the griddle . pour the batter on the griddle . spread the batter to a pan cake .

column1: pour batter on the pan .
column2: add 1/3 cup of batter to the pan . add the batter for as many pancakes as will fit on the sheet .

column1: pour batter on the pan .
column2: grab the batter with a cup . pour it onto the pan in a small circle .

column1: remove the onion rings from the pan and onto a paper towel .
column2: take an onion and cut into slices . dip the onions in batter . add oil to a skillet . add heat then dip the onions into the skillet . fry until light brown then remove and serve .

column1: remove the onion rings from the pan and onto a paper towel .
column2: now we want to take our onions out of the pan and set them on a paper towel . the towel will help soak up some grease . the tongs will help you keep your fingers away from the hot grease in the pan .

column1: remove the onion rings from the pan and onto a paper towel .
column2: take out the onion rings from the pan with tongs . place the onion rings on a paper towel .

column1: dip the onion rings into the batter .
column2: take the batter in a bowl . take some onion rings . add the onion rings in to the batter . dip the onion rings in the batter . coat the onion with the batter .

column1: dip the onion rings into the batter .
column2: turn the heat up to 375 degrees . use tongs to dip the onion rings in the batter . be sure to cover all sides of the onion rings in batter .

column1: dip the onion rings into the batter .
column2: get a pair of tongs . life one onion ring with the tongs and dip it in the batter . make sure the ring is completely covered with batter .

column1: place the onion rings into pan of hot oil .
column2: take an onion and cut into thin slices with a knife . then coat with batter . add oil into a pan and heat . then drop the rings into the pan . fry until light brown and repeat until all are cooked .

column1: place the onion rings into pan of hot oil .
column2: use tongs to pick up the onion rings . place the onion rings into a pan of hot oil . cook for a few minutes until golden brown . use tongs to place the finished onion rings onto a plate covered by paper towels .

column1: place the onion rings into pan of hot oil .
column2: use tongs to grab the onion rings . put the onion rings in the pan of oil slowly .

column1: chop an onion into thick slices and separate into rings .
column2: take an onion on the cutting board . remove the peel of the onion . cut the onion in to thin circles . take the onion circle in to hand . separate the rings from the onion circle .

column1: chop an onion into thick slices and separate into rings .
column2: get an onion , get a plastic knife or ask an adult to help you , and a plate . peel the outside paper skin off of your onion . ask and adult to cut your onion into circles or you carefully cut with a plastic knife . separate your onion layers until each onion piece forms only one circle . " put each onion circle or ring " " on a plate . " " . "

column1: chop an onion into thick slices and separate into rings .
column2: using a knife , chop up an onion into thick pieces . separate the pieces with your hands into rings .

column1: add flour buttermilk baking powder onion powder oil salt pepper sriracha and garlic powder into a bowl and mix .
column2: poor the buttermilk into a bowel . add ingredients to the bowel with a pinch of salt . add hot sauce of any type . mix everything together using a whisk to make sure there are no clumps .

column1: add flour buttermilk baking powder onion powder oil salt pepper sriracha and garlic powder into a bowl and mix .
column2: pour in buttermilk to the flour in the bowl . add some baking powder and onion powder . add a pinch of salt and some black pepper . pour in a bit of sriracha and garlic powder . use your whisk to mix everything together for 1 minute until it has no lumps .

column1: then dice them up .
column2: place peppers on cutting board . cut the peppers into small pieces .

column1: then dice them up .
column2: hold the peppers carefully . cut them into lines or strips . now turn the knife or board and cut the other way to make tiny squares .

column1: then dice them up .
column2: place the peppers onto a cutting board . carefully cut the pepper into thin strips . then cut the strips of pepper into little cubes .

column1: keep it in the oven at 400 degrees for 30 mins .
column2: keep it in the oven . set the oven to 400 degrees on the knob . wait 30 minutes .

column1: keep it in the oven at 400 degrees for 30 mins .
column2: put the food dish into oven that should be preheated at 400 degrees . leave it in stove and set timer for 30 minutes . after the 30 minutes are done take out you food dish .

column1: keep it in the oven at 400 degrees for 30 mins .
column2: put the pan in the oven at 400 degrees for 30 o 40 minutes . bake until the edges start to brown up .

column1: take 2 peppers and 1 green bell pepper take out the seeds and cut it into half .
column2: put the green bell peppers on a cutting board . use a knife to cut the peppers in half . remove the seeds and the white ribbed part . line a baking sheet with tin foil and rub the tin foil with oil . put the peppers on the oiled pan cut side down .

column1: take 2 peppers and 1 green bell pepper take out the seeds and cut it into half .
column2: slice two peppers and 1 green bell pepper in half and remove the ribs and seeds from each one . cover a baking sheet with foil . pour a tablespoon of oil onto the baking sheet and with your hand spread the oil evenly over the foil . place the peppers cut side down on the baking sheet .

column1: take 2 peppers and 1 green bell pepper take out the seeds and cut it into half .
column2: use a knife to slice a green bell pepper in half . take the seeds out of the pepper . put oil on the aluminum on the pan . set the 2 bell papers upside down on the sheet .

column1: grease the pan and place them upside down at 400 degrees for 30 minutes in the oven .
column2: cover a baking sheet with aluminum foil . after you have cut the peppers in half place them cut - side down on the aluminum foil . preheat the oven to 400 degree fahrenheit . use oven mitts to carefully place the peppers in the oven . cook the peppers for 30 minutes in the oven .

column1: grease the pan and place them upside down at 400 degrees for 30 minutes in the oven .
column2: place aluminum foil on the baking tray . take some bell peppers . place them upside down in the baking tray . set the oven to 400 degrees . bake them for 30 minutes in the oven .

column1: grease the pan and place them upside down at 400 degrees for 30 minutes in the oven .
column2: you 're going to roast the peppers at 400 degrees . place the peppers in your sheet pan that you ' ve covered with foil first . now roast them for about half an hour .

column1: serve the burrito with sour cream .
column2: set the burrito on a plate . put sour cream on the side of the burrito on the plate .

column1: serve the burrito with sour cream .
column2: after place burrito on plates to serve to eat . place at least a spoon full of sour cream on the side .

column1: serve the burrito with sour cream .
column2: cut out the burrito one slice at a time with a knife . take a spatula and take out the burrito . place the burrito on a plate .

column1: you can easily peel the skin and get roasted pepper .
column2: peel the skin off the edge of the pepper . set the remaining roasted pepper on the tray .

column1: you can easily peel the skin and get roasted pepper .
column2: after the peppers were cooked in stove and cooled off . peel off the skin to the peppers using your hands .

column1: you can easily peel the skin and get roasted pepper .
column2: grab the skin of the roasted pepper . peel the skin off of the peppers .

column1: add the roasted pepper .
column2: add the refried beans from the can and stir . add 3/4s of the roasted peppers , reserving the rest to put on top of the dish . mix the beans and peppers well with the other ingredients , using a spoon . take the pan off the heat . add seasonings .

column1: add the roasted pepper .
column2: add most of the roasted pepper into the pan . use stirring spoon to mix the ingredients . take the pan off the heat .

column1: add the roasted pepper .
column2: now we are going to scrape in 3/4 of our roasted pepper . save 1/4 of them for our topping later on .

column1: take tortilla and fill the baked mix into it and add shredded cheese and roll it .
column2: put stuffing on your tortilla , about two big spoonfuls . add cheese on top . the roll up the burrito .

column1: take tortilla and fill the baked mix into it and add shredded cheese and roll it .
column2: lay burrito on a flat surface . take a spoon and scoop 2 cups of the mix . add the mix on top of the tortilla . add shredded cheese . roll it up .

column1: take tortilla and fill the baked mix into it and add shredded cheese and roll it .
column2: set the tortilla on the table . use a spoon to scoop the filling from the pot . put the filling in the middle of the tortilla . add cheese to the top of the filling . fold the edges of the burrito and roll it up .

column1: take out and turn the oven to boil and keep it for 3 - 5 mins .
column2: turn the oven on broil . put the pan of food in the oven . let the food cook for 3 - 5 minutes .

column1: take out and turn the oven to boil and keep it for 3 - 5 mins .
column2: put on oven mitts and put the pan in the oven . set the oven dial to broil . keep the pan in the oven for 3 - 5 minutes .

column1: take out and turn the oven to boil and keep it for 3 - 5 mins .
column2: take the baking tray out of the oven . turn the oven in to broil . place the tray in the oven and bake for 3 - 5 minutes . open the door of the oven . now take the tray out of the oven .

column1: put the leftover filling on top and some sauce and some more cheese .
column2: use a spoon to put the leftover filling on top of the burritos and then spread it out . use a spoon to sprinkle homemade or jarred salsa all over the top . sprinkle roasted peppers and shredded cheese on the top . make sure there are enough toppings to look colorful like a mexican christmas tree . put the dish into the oven that should still be heated to 400 degrees .

column1: put the leftover filling on top and some sauce and some more cheese .
column2: spread the leftover filling over the burritos in the dish . get out your salsa , either homemade or store bought . using a spoon , spread salsa over the top of the burritos in the dish . get your cheese out of the refrigerator , open package . spread cheese over the top of your enchiladas in the dish .

column1: when it is done take out and cover them up and let them steam in its heat for 15 mins .
column2: take the pan of peppers out of the oven . cover the peppers with a pan and let them steam for about 10 to 15 minutes . this will loosen up the skin .

column1: when it is done take out and cover them up and let them steam in its heat for 15 mins .
column2: cut bell pepper in half and cook in oven in a aluminum covering the bottom of pan . when the skin appears roasted , skin will look wrinkled and bubbly . take out of oven when they are bubbly , with an oven mitt . set pan inside a larger pan . cover so the bell pepper will become soft and able to peel easily .

column1: when it is done take out and cover them up and let them steam in its heat for 15 mins .
column2: put oven mitts on . open the oven to carefully take out peppers . set peppers on the tables . over up the peppers . let steam in its heat for 15 minutes .

column1: grease the pan and place all the rolls in it .
column2: grease a glass pan with cooking spray . place the burritos into the greased pan side by side .

column1: grease the pan and place all the rolls in it .
column2: spray grease onto the bottom of the pan . roll up the burritos . place the burritos onto the pan .

column1: grease the pan and place all the rolls in it .
column2: now we want to grease our pan . once the pan is completely greased , just set as many burritos as you can into the pan .

column1: add 1 can of kidney beans and 1 can of refried beans and mix it well .
column2: pour in 1 can of kidney beans into the mix . add 1 can of refried beans . use the spatula to mix the pan together as it cooks .

column1: add 1 can of kidney beans and 1 can of refried beans and mix it well .
column2: open 1 can of kidney beans with the can opener . open 1 can of refried beans with the can opener . dump both cans in the pot .

column1: add 1 can of kidney beans and 1 can of refried beans and mix it well .
column2: open one can of kidney beans with a can opener . pour the kidney beans into a colander to drain the liquid . pour drained kidney beans to the mixture . open one can of refried beans with a can opener . use a spoon to add refried beans to mixture .

column1: add seasoning at last chili powder cumin powder salt and pepper powder and mix it well .
column2: from the container add some chili powder to the contents of the pan . then add some cumin to the pan . next add some salt and pepper . using a wooden spoon mix it up .

column1: add seasoning at last chili powder cumin powder salt and pepper powder and mix it well .
column2: with your mixture still cooking on the stove in a large sauce pan , mix in some chili powder . about 1 teaspoon . next , add in some cumin powder . about 1/2 teaspoon . add salt and pepper to taste and mix the mixture with a wooden spoon so that the spices are spread around evenly . note , if you like spicy food you can add a little bit of hot sauce too .

column1: add seasoning at last chili powder cumin powder salt and pepper powder and mix it well .
column2: cook the contents in the pan . add little chili powder in to the pan . add little cumin powder in to the pan . add salt and pepper powder in to the pan . mix the contents of the pan .

column1: take a pan and put some ground beef and add some chopped onions and garlic .
column2: put some ground beef in the pan . chop up the beef with a spatula and let it get brown . add in the cut up onions and garlic .

column1: take a pan and put some ground beef and add some chopped onions and garlic .
column2: put ground beef into a pan and start breaking it up with your spatula . add the chopped onions and garlic to the pan . mix it well and cook all together .

column1: take a pan and put some ground beef and add some chopped onions and garlic .
column2: crushed the ground meat on the hot pan . brown up the meat ( you can use beans instead ) . add a lot of onions . put in a lot of garlic . mix them up well .

column1: cook the pasta .
column2: put a large pot half full of water on the stove . turn the heat on under the pot and wait for the water to boil hard . pour the past into the boiling water .

column1: cook the pasta .
column2: in a large pot pour 16 cups of water . add salt to taste . let water boil until you see rolling bubbles . pour pasta into the boiling water and stir . let pasta boil for 20 minutes or until the pasta is tender .

column1: cook the pasta .
column2: take your pasta and slowly put it in your boiling water . be careful and do it slow because it will be hot .

column1: chop the pancetta .
column2: cut 1/4 lb of pancetta ( italian bacon ) into little pieces . 2 tbsp butter . warm frying pan to medium heat . add butter to warm frying pan .

column1: chop the pancetta .
column2: take a 1/4 pound of pancetta . cut the pancetta into small pieces . put pan on stove . add 2 tablespoons of butter to pan . melt butter and add pancetta .

column1: chop the pancetta .
column2: take your lancets and put it on a cutting board . go straight across the pancetta and cut it into small pieces . cut them into cubes . butter pan .

column1: add butter and oil to a pan .
column2: heat up the pan . add some butter to the pan . pour oil onto the same pan .

column1: add butter and oil to a pan .
column2: put the 2 tablespoons of butter and place in your heated pan . add the olive oil to the butter .

column1: add butter and oil to a pan .
column2: add 2 tablespoons of butter to a pan . the measurements for a tablespoon are on the butter package . add 2 tablespoons of olive oil to the pan so that it keeps the butter from burning .

column1: add the pancetta to the pan .
column2: chop up the pancetta into small cubes . with your pan hot , add in the cubes of pancetta carefully . then lower the heat just a little .

column1: add the pancetta to the pan .
column2: when the pan is hot , add the pancetta to the pan . then lower the heat a little bit .

column1: chop the onion .
column2: pancetta is cooking in pan . get a medium onion . peel onion . cut off ends of onion . cut onions into small pieces .

column1: chop the onion .
column2: peel off skin . cut the onion into small pieces . do n't worry about the size .

column1: chop the onion .
column2: while pancetta cooks . take a medium onion . peel onion . cut off ends . chop the onion into small pieces .

column1: chop the parsley .
column2: slide cut up onions to side of cutting board . grab fresh parsley . pull leaves from stem . put parsley on cutting board . chop the parsley until it is finely chopped .

column1: chop the parsley .
column2: add the parsley to the cutting board . chop up the parsley into small pieces .

column1: chop the parsley .
column2: we are going to break the parsley . to break the parsley , grab a large knife . using the knife , press the sharp end down against the parsley over and over . you want to break it into little pieces . once it is broken , we can move on .

column1: add the onions to the pan .
column2: in a pan cook pancetta . peel an onion . chop up an onion into small pieces . add onion to the pan with the pancetta . stir the onion and pancetta as they cook .

column1: add the onions to the pan .
column2: take the onion on a chopping board . cut the onions in to small pieces . take the onions with hand . keep the onions in to the pan . mix them good .

column1: add the onions to the pan .
column2: pick up the chopped onions . carry the chopped onions to the pan .

column1: pour in the vodka and tomato sauce .
column2: pour the small bowl of vodka into the hot sauce pan . start stirring the pan with a wooden cooking spoon . while stirring with one hand pour the tomato sauce into the pan with your free hand . keep stirring with the wooden spoon .

column1: pour in the vodka and tomato sauce .
column2: pour the vodka into the hot pan so it sizzles . stir the vodka around . next add the tomato sauce to the pan . mix the tomato sauce with the vodka .

column1: pour in the vodka and tomato sauce .
column2: pour the vodka in to the mixture . we can hear the sound when we pour it . add the fresh tomato sauce into the mixture . stir all together with the help of a spatula .

column1: drain the pasta .
column2: place the strainer into your sink , with a pan underneath it . grab your pan of pasta and take it over to the sink . slowly pour the contents of the pan in your hand into the strainer . you want to keep about a cup of the reserved pasta water aside .

column1: drain the pasta .
column2: put the drainer in the sink . once the pot with pasta is cool enough , grab it by the handles . pour the pasta and water into the drainer in the sink . pick up the drainer and shake it a little bit so more water comes out . now you are left with just pasta and all the water is gone .

column1: drain the pasta .
column2: place your strainer in the sink over a larger pot . pick up your pan carefully and carry it to the strainer . be careful because the water is very hot . lean the pan just enough to pour it slowly into the pot in the sink . lift the strainer off the pot , and keep the water below .

column1: add cream to the sauce .
column2: add what your mom has for cream . could be half and half . add cream , whatever kind your mom has in the frig .

column1: add cream to the sauce .
column2: take the cream from the refrigerator . pour the amount of cream that the recipe says you need into a measuring cup . get a spoon that is ok to use in a hot pan . slowly pour the cream from the cup into the hot sauce gently stirring the sauce while you are pouring it . once you have poured all the cream into the pan , put the cup down and keep cooking the sauce for as long as the recipe says .

column1: add cream to the sauce .
column2: the tomatoes are in the sauce pan . pour the cream into the tomatoes .

column1: add the parsley to the sauce .
column2: wash the herbs nicely . cut the cleaned herbs in to small pieces . add the beautiful cut herbs into the sauce . stir the sauce at the last .

column1: add the parsley to the sauce .
column2: the pan on the stove is warm . the sauce is warm in the pan . take the chopped parsley from cutting board . add the parsley to the sauce . mix the parsley into the sauce with a spoon .

column1: add the parsley to the sauce .
column2: add the chopped parsley into the sauce . stir in the parsley with the sauce , mixing well .

column1: add red pepper to the sauce .
column2: add a little bit of red pepper to the pan mixture . this is so the mix will be spicy . once you add a little red pepper , mix everything in the pan well .

column1: add red pepper to the sauce .
column2: with pan on stove with gravy . add red pepper to gravy for spice . stir the gravy . grab the cooked pasta in the strainer . add pasta to pan with gravy .

column1: add red pepper to the sauce .
column2: put in red pepper . stir it up . toss pasta . add to sauce . serve .

column1: add pasta to the sauce and stir .
column2: take the pasta and pour it into the sauce . stir the pasta into the sauce very well .

column1: add pasta to the sauce and stir .
column2: pick up your freshly strained bowl of pasta . pour the pasta out of the bowl and into the pan of sauce . please be careful , the pan of sauce is hot . stir the pasta into the sauce until it is all together .

column1: add pasta to the sauce and stir .
column2: take the strainer with the pasta and pour the pasta into the sauce . stir the pasta into sauce while it is in the pan . let the pasta and sauce simmer for a few minutes .

column1: add cheese on top .
column2: add a little bit of romano cheese on top of the pasta . you can add more cheese to your liking , if you want .

column1: add cheese on top .
column2: take the bowl to which cheese is to be added . take romaine cheese . sprinkle cheese on top of contents of bowl . mix the contents . wash the hands .

column1: add cheese on top .
column2: put pasta in bowl . add romano cheese . get out a fork . taste the pasta . if needed add more romano cheese on top .

column1: sprinkle oil on the dosa .
column2: sprinkle oil on the dosa in the hot pan . continue cooking .

column1: sprinkle oil on the dosa .
column2: put pan on stove and preheat . put dosa in pan , then drizzle some oil onto the dosa .

column1: sprinkle oil on the dosa .
column2: take a spoon and put it in a bowl of oil . take the oil and sprinkle it around the dosa .

column1: place the filling on the center of the dosa .
column2: place 2 tablespoons of filling right on the center of the dosa . place a cover over the dosa . ( do your best to find a cover that is not too big and not too small ) .

column1: place the filling on the center of the dosa .
column2: pick up a spoon . use the spoon to pick up a little bit of the mushy green and yellow stuff . put the spoonful onto the circle of bread in the pan . add more until there is about a baseball sized piece of the green and yellow stuff . put the lid on the pan .

column1: place the filling on the center of the dosa .
column2: use a spoon and scoop up some filling . put some spoonfuls of the filling in the middle of the dosa circle .

column1: fold the sides of the dosa over .
column2: take a spatula and fold the right side of the dosa over so it meets the middle . then fold the left side over so it meets the middle .

column1: fold the sides of the dosa over .
column2: use a spatula to fold one side of the dosa . use a spatula to fold the other side of the dosa . use a spatula to press down to seal the dosa .

column1: fold the sides of the dosa over .
column2: using the thin part of a spatula slide it under the dosa . lift the dosa and fold the sides into the middle of the circle .

column1: separate the batter into smaller portions .
column2: use a large spoon or ladle to take some batter out of the pot and put it into a smaller bowl . add just as much batter as you will need .

column1: separate the batter into smaller portions .
column2: take your ladle and take out as much batter as we will need for our doses . you want to put the batter in a smaller container after you have separated it from the larger pan .

column1: separate the batter into smaller portions .
column2: move batter to smaller bow . add .

column1: mix salt with the batter .
column2: take about one spoon full of salt and pour it into the pot . now take your ladle and pour the batter in with the salt , and start mixing it well !

column1: mix salt with the batter .
column2: fill a tea spoon with salt . put it into the batter . add a little more batter . mix everything together .

column1: spread the batter in the pan .
column2: get a nonstick frying pan hot . pour out a ladle full of batter into the pan . using the ladle , spread the batter around the bottom of the pan until it is coated .

column1: spread the batter in the pan .
column2: all you need to do is take a spoonful of the batter and put it into the middle of the pan . now using the same spoon , just spread the batter out all along your pan in a circular motion , until it is the size you want it to be .

column1: spread the batter in the pan .
column2: take a pan and place it on the stove . heat the pan on the stove . take the batter in a bowl . take a spoon and pour some batter in to the pan . spread the batter on to the pan .

column1: add pepper and dressing to the salad and toss .
column2: grind some black pepper onto the lettuce in the bowl . place a couple spoons of dressing on the lettuce . be sure to add the dressing just before serving , so the lettuce does n't wilt . stir the dressing to coat the lettuce .

column1: add pepper and dressing to the salad and toss .
column2: add pepper to the salad . add dressing to the salad . using tongs mix the salad .

column1: add pepper and dressing to the salad and toss .
column2: use your pepper grinder to grind about 10 twists of pepper onto the salad . add your dressing to the salad as you are about to serve it by using a spoon full of dressing . mix the salad with the dressing with tongs as to coat the lettuce with dressing evenly .

column1: cut up the tomatoes and add them to the salad .
column2: use a knife to carefully cut the cherry tomatoes across the middle . toss the tomatoes into the bowl .

column1: cut up the tomatoes and add them to the salad .
column2: get a knife . cut the tomatoes . add them to the salad .

column1: cut up the tomatoes and add them to the salad .
column2: on a large cutting board set a large handful of cherry tomatoes . using your non - dominate hand , hold all the tomatoes down with your hand flat . next , take a serrated knife and slice the tomatoes in half by cutting horizontally underneath your hand . if you do n't feel comfortable doing this step , it 's okay to leave them whole too . once tomatoes are cut , add them into the bow of lettuce .

column1: chop up the basil and add them to the salad .
column2: chop up the basil carefully with a knife . add the basil to the salad with your hands .

column1: chop up the basil and add them to the salad .
column2: use a knife to cut up the sweet basil leaves . toss the basil into the salad .

column1: chop up the basil and add them to the salad .
column2: put some basil leaves on a cutting board . use a sharp knife to cut the basil leaves and add to the salad bowl .

column1: add butter pepper salt and garlic to the pan .
column2: add some butter into the pan . add some salt and pepper . put in some garlic flakes into the pan . stir the pan and mix everything around .

column1: add butter pepper salt and garlic to the pan .
column2: add butter to the pan . sprinkle salt and pepper in the pan . add garlic to the pan .

column1: add butter pepper salt and garlic to the pan .
column2: add bread cubes , butter , salt , pepper and garlic to the hot pan . shake the pan to mix .

column1: squeeze lemon juice into the dressing and mix .
column2: use a knife to carefully slice the lemon . squeeze the lemon juice into the dressing . use a whisk to mix the ingredients of the dressing bowl together .

column1: squeeze lemon juice into the dressing and mix .
column2: take a lemon on a cutting board and cut it in to two halves . squeeze half a lemon juice . take the salad dressing in a bowl . add the lemon juice in to the bowl . mix the salad dressing and the lemon juice .

column1: squeeze lemon juice into the dressing and mix .
column2: squeeze a lemon over the dressing to get the juice . mix up the mixture with a spoon .

column1: sprinkle cheese and pepper on top .
column2: sprinkle the remaining grated cheese so that it is spread out nicely on top of the salad . using a pepper mill , grate some freshly ground black pepper on top of the salad as well , according to how you want it to taste .

column1: sprinkle cheese and pepper on top .
column2: sprinkle the cheese on top of the salad . grind some pepper over the top of the salad .

column1: sprinkle cheese and pepper on top .
column2: use your hands to grab some cheese . sprinkle some cheese on top . sprinkle pepper on top the same way .

column1: rip the lettuce into pieces and add to the bowl .
column2: with your hands tear the lettuce into shreds . put the lettuce into the bowl .

column1: rip the lettuce into pieces and add to the bowl .
column2: tear the lettuce leaves apart by pulling apart and twisting away from the stem . you want your pieces to be small enough to eat as a single bite . add your bite sized pieces to the bowl .

column1: rip the lettuce into pieces and add to the bowl .
column2: take the lettuce . take a medium sized bowl . remove the bottom of the lettuce . rip the lettuce in to pieces . add the pieces of lettuce in to the bowl .

column1: crush the garlic mash with salt and chop .
column2: use the edge of the knife to crush the garlic . use the knife to carefully crush the garlic . add some salt to the garlic .

column1: crush the garlic mash with salt and chop .
column2: place peeled garlic cloves onto the surface of the cutting board . add a heavy pinch of salt ( about a teaspoon ) over top of the garlic . use the flat side of your knife to smash the garlic . mash it until it 's broken up . use the sharp end of your knife to roll the knife back and forth on the garlic until it is chopped into tiny pieces .

column1: crush the garlic mash with salt and chop .
column2: put garlic on a cutting board . use the side of the knife blade to slightly crush the garlic . sprinkle salt on garlic and mash the garlic . then use the knife to chop the garlic into little pieces .

column1: add lemon juice and cheese to the dressing and mix .
column2: squeeze a lemon into the bowl . shave some cheese with a grater . add the cheese and mix with a whisk .

column1: add lemon juice and cheese to the dressing and mix .
column2: use a knife to carefully slice the lemon . squeeze the lemon juice into the bowl . add the cheese to the bowl . use a spoon to stir the dressing together in the bowl .

column1: add lemon juice and cheese to the dressing and mix .
column2: use a sharp knife to carefully cut a small lemon in half . hold one half of the lemon over the bowl and gently squeeze the juice into your dressing mixture . do not force all of the juice out of the lemon half , because you do n't want to use so much juice that the lemon flavor overpowers the dressing . rest a cheese grater against the table , and drag a large wedge of parmesan cheese downwards against the grates . when the wedge of cheese become small , slow down - you want to be very careful that you do not scrape your hand across the grates . when you have enough cheese to fill a 1-cup measuring cup , put the cheese into the dressing mixture . use a whisk to blend the cheese into the dressing mixture .

column1: add dollops of dressing croutons and peppers on top .
column2: on a plate , place your lettuce . take the small bowl of salad dressing and add a couple small spoonfuls of the dressing over the salad . note : too much dressing can make the salad watery . now , take your already prepared croutons and bell peppers and put a small handful around the top of the salad . lastly , sprinkle the top with parmesan cheese .

column1: add dollops of dressing croutons and peppers on top .
column2: use a spoon to add some scoops of dressing around the salad . add croutons over the top of the salad . put some peppers on top .

column1: add dollops of dressing croutons and peppers on top .
column2: add small spoonfuls of dressing onto the salad . add croutons to the salad . add peppers on top of the salad .

column1: add mayonnaise garlic and pepper to a bowl .
column2: use a knife to chop up some garlic . add mayonnaise , black pepper to the bowl . add the garlic to the bowl .

column1: add mayonnaise garlic and pepper to a bowl .
column2: get a small bowl and tablespoon . put the mayonnaise in the bowl . add the chopped garlic to the bowl and add a little bit of pepper ( just 1 or 2 shakes from the pepper shaker ) .

column1: add mayonnaise garlic and pepper to a bowl .
column2: use a spoon to put some mayonnaise into a bowl . add some chopped up garlic . add some ground pepper to the bowl .

column1: cut up the bread into chunks and add to a pan .
column2: cut up pieces of bread into chucks with a knife . add the pieces of bread to a pan .

column1: cut up the bread into chunks and add to a pan .
column2: take a knife and cut the bread into big squares . put the bread pieces in the pan .

column1: cut up the bread into chunks and add to a pan .
column2: take the bread on a cutting board . cut the bread in to thick slices . now take each slice in to small pieces . take a pan on the stove , add the bread in to the pan .

column1: cut up the bell peppers .
column2: use a knife to cut up the bell peppers . slice the peppers into small sections .

column1: cut up the bell peppers .
column2: put the red and yellow peppers on a cutting board . use a sharp knife to cut the peppers into small pieces .

column1: cut up the bell peppers .
column2: take bell peppers and put on cutting board . use a sharp knife and cut into pieces . be sure to slice into bite size pieces . while cutting , saute chicken in a skillet . then mix all together and add lettuce .

column1: add the peppers to the pan .
column2: add peppers into the pan . mix the peppers in the pan with the other ingredients .

column1: add the peppers to the pan .
column2: take a cutting board and a knife . take some bell peppers . cut the peppers in to small pieces . add the peppers in to the pan . mix the peppers by shaking the pan .

column1: add the peppers to the pan .
column2: put the chopped peppers in the pan with the other ingredients . shake the pan to combine the ingredients , being careful not to spill anything out of the pan . cook it until the flavors absorb , but not so long that the peppers lose their crunch .

column1: add chick peas to a food processor .

column1: add chick peas to a food processor .

column1: add chick peas to a food processor .

column1: squeeze the garlic paste into the food processor .

column1: squeeze the garlic paste into the food processor .
column2: put chickpeas in the food processor . put the cooked garlic into the food processor . you might have to squeeze it .

column1: squeeze the garlic paste into the food processor .

column1: add salt pepper and oil to a food processor .

column1: add salt pepper and oil to a food processor .

column1: blend the ingredients in the food processor .
column2: place the ingredients in a blender . make sure the lid is tightly closed . if there is a blender speed choice , use low to start . turn on the blender . continue blending until no large pieces of your ingredients are left .

column1: blend the ingredients in the food processor .
column2: add all the ingredients to the food processor . lock the lid on top . mix it on high until smooth . add more oil if it needs to be more smooth .

column1: blend the ingredients in the food processor .
column2: take a blender with a lid . add the ingredients in to the food processor . close the lid of the food processor . turn the food processor on . blend the ingredients in to a smooth paste .

column1: take all the shredded vegetables in a bowl add 4 tsp salt and mix well .
column2: we now can take our shredded vegetables and place them into our large bowl . we then need to add in 4 teaspoons of salt to our bowl . using your hands , just go ahead and start mixing the veggies and salt all together . make sure it is mixed well !

column1: take all the shredded vegetables in a bowl add 4 tsp salt and mix well .
column2: shred the vegetables in a food processor . place all the vegetables in a large bowl . add about 4 teaspoons of salt . the salt will help get the juices out of the vegetables . mix the salt in with your hands until it is well - mixed . you want enough water to come out of the vegetables , that you will have liquid to cover the vegetables when they are put in the jar .

column1: take all the shredded vegetables in a bowl add 4 tsp salt and mix well .

column1: shred the onions radish and the carrot .

column1: shred the onions radish and the carrot .

column1: shred the onions radish and the carrot .

column1: cut the cabbage in small pieces and shred it using the shredder .
column2: put the head of cabbage on a cutting board . use a sharp knife to cut the cabbage in half . remove some of the outer leaves of the cabbage . use a knife to remove the core ( hard part ) of the cabbage . cut in half again and place in the food processor to shred .

column1: cut the cabbage in small pieces and shred it using the shredder .
column2: cut the cabbage in half with the knife . cut out the core and the outside pieces . cut the cabbage into small pieces with a knife then shred it using the shredder .

column1: cut the cabbage in small pieces and shred it using the shredder .

column1: fill the jar with the vegetables and cover the jar .

column1: fill the jar with the vegetables and cover the jar .
column2: use your hands to take the vegetables and transfer them into a jar . pack the vegetables into the jar . put the lid on the jar and cover it .

column1: fill the jar with the vegetables and cover the jar .

column1: preheat the fry pan and heat a quarter cup of oil .
column2: turn heat on half way , under your pan . add 1/4 a cup of either peanut oil or canola oil to heated pan . heat pan for a couple of minutes until the oil shimmers . test the oil using a strip of potato ; if the oil sizzles and bubbles around the potato when placed in it is ready . add 3 cups of shredded potatoes to pan .

column1: preheat the fry pan and heat a quarter cup of oil .
column2: place your pan on top of your stove and turn the dial to medium to sit for 2 minutes . add 1/4 cup of oil to the bottom of your pan so it can get hot .

column1: preheat the fry pan and heat a quarter cup of oil .

column1: add 3 cups shredded potatoes in fry pan season with salt and pepper and cook on medium heat 5 - 6 minutes .
column2: take a fry pan and add some oil in to the pan . shred the potatoes and rinse and dry them on a paper towel . add 3 cups of shredded potatoes in to the pan . add salt and pepper about a teaspoon each . cook on a medium hit for 5 - 6 minutes .

column1: add 3 cups shredded potatoes in fry pan season with salt and pepper and cook on medium heat 5 - 6 minutes .
column2: take shredded potatoes and place them under the water and rinse them off . pat the potatoes with a paper towel to get them dry . put oil into the pan . put the potatoes into the pan . using a spatula press the potatoes down until they are flat .

column1: add 3 cups shredded potatoes in fry pan season with salt and pepper and cook on medium heat 5 - 6 minutes .
column2: add three cups of shredded potatoes once you have washed and dried the potatoes . be sure they potatoes are dry to prevent the oil from spattering . season the potatoes with salt and pepper . do not use too much . you can always add more seasoning but once it is in you can not take it out . cook the potatoes on medium heat ( make sure the dial on your stove is at medium ) for 5 to 6 minutes .

column1: cook the potatoes until golden brown on both sides .
column2: turn the heat down to low and cook for another 5 minutes until brown on bottom . use a metal spatula to flip the potatoes over . once flipped use a spatula to press the potatoes into a pancake shape . cook another ten minutes . take the potatoes out of pan and put on paper towels . taste and season if needed .

column1: cook the potatoes until golden brown on both sides .
column2: take a pan on the stove . cut the potatoes using a grater . add the potatoes in to the pan and cook on one side till golden brown . turn the potatoes on to the other side . cook the other side of potatoes till they are golden brown .

column1: cook the potatoes until golden brown on both sides .
column2: turn the heat to the low setting , then cook the potatoes until they are golden . use a spatula to flip small pieces of the potatoes over , then cook for 5 more minutes .

column1: take 6 pieces of thinly sliced sirloin .
column2: make sure you have thinly sliced sirloin steak . six pieces of sirloin will be needed .

column1: put the sliced sirloins in to a zip lock cover .

column1: remove the air and lock the cover .

column1: remove the air and lock the cover .

column1: remove the air and lock the cover .

column1: massage the mixture properly to marinate the meat .

column1: open the cover and reseal it and put it into the fridge .

column1: open the cover and reseal it and put it into the fridge .
column2: put into the ziplock bag . seal the ziplock bag . put the ziplock bag into the fridge . keep the ziplock bag of marinating meat into the fridge until it is time to grill . take it out of the fridge when it is time to grill .

column1: open the cover and reseal it and put it into the fridge .

column1: spread oil on a pan and heat till smoky spread the marinated meat and cook both the sides flipping it .

column2: first spread oil all across you hot pan . make sure the oil is spread across the entire pan . now wait for the oil to start smoking under the high heat . once it begins to smoke , slowly place your meat onto the pan . because the meat is so thin , it will take no more than a couple minutes to cook . you will know to flip it , when you are able to easily lift the meat up off the pan without it sticking .

column1: remove the cooked meat and set it aside and chop it into small pieces .

column1: remove the cooked meat and set it aside and chop it into small pieces .

column1: wrap it along with other vegetables to make tacos .

column1: once all the wraps are rolled heat 2 cups of peanut oil high in a pan about 350 degrees .

column1: mix 3 tsps of corn starch with water .

column1: mix 3 tsps of corn starch with water .

column1: now add the rolls into the hot oil and cook for 6- 8minutes until they are light golden brown .

column1: put the mixture on edge roll and fold it tucking in edges and at the end spread corn starch mixture .

column1: put the mixture on edge roll and fold it tucking in edges and at the end spread corn starch mixture .

column1: microwave the mixture on high for 1 - 2 minutes just until slightly soft but crisp .
