column1: 1 lbs large peeled and cooked frozen shrimps    soak in cold water for 15 - 20 minutes or until they are defrosted .
column2: use 1 lb of large peeled cooked frozen shrimp from the store . soak the shrimp in cold water until they are not frozen . about 15 or 20 minutes .

column1: 1 lbs large peeled and cooked frozen shrimps    soak in cold water for 15 - 20 minutes or until they are defrosted .
column2: now for the filling , we are going to use 1 lbs . of jumbo shrimp . this shrimp is precooked , so we will just soak them in cold water . this will defrost the shrimp out for us .

column1: 1 lbs large peeled and cooked frozen shrimps    soak in cold water for 15 - 20 minutes or until they are defrosted .

column1: add 1 tsp ground coriander 1 tsp five spice powder 1    grated lime rind    tsp himalayan pink salt and mix .

column1: add 1 tsp ground coriander 1 tsp five spice powder 1    grated lime rind    tsp himalayan pink salt and mix .

column1: add 1 tsp ground coriander 1 tsp five spice powder 1    grated lime rind    tsp himalayan pink salt and mix .

column1: cut off the tails and chop the shrimps into rough pieces about    inch thick and set them aside .
column2: use a knife to cut the tail of the shrimp . then cut the rest of the shrimp . the pieces should be about 1/4 of an inch thick . set the shrimp aside .

column1: take rinsed and dried green onions cut off an inch in start and root bases chop into 1/4 inch pieces .
column2: wash off the green onions and then dry them . bunch the green onions together on a cutting board . using a knife cut an inch off of the top of the onions to remove any bad ends and to even out the length of the onions . now cut off the roots at the bottom of the green onions . cut up the onions into small pieces about 1/4 of an inch .

column1: take rinsed and dried green onions cut off an inch in start and root bases chop into 1/4 inch pieces .
column2: now we are going to take an inch off the top of the greens with our knife . now take the knife and remove the roots as well . once this is done , take your knife and cut the stem into about 1/4 inch pieces . keep your fingers clear of the path of the knife .

column1: take rinsed and dried green onions cut off an inch in start and root bases chop into 1/4 inch pieces .
column2: get out your cutting board . get your sharp knife . wash your onion with water . put your onion onto the cutting board . cut your onion .

column1: mix flour pepper garlic powder salt and paprika in a bowl .
column2: take a small bowl of flour and add salt and pepper to it . add some garlic powder to the flour . add some onion powder to the flour . last , add some paprika to the flour . stir it around with a spoon to completely combine .

column1: mix flour pepper garlic powder salt and paprika in a bowl .
column2: mix the flour in a bowl with salt and pepper . pour in some garlic and onion powder . add paprika and mix .

column1: mix flour pepper garlic powder salt and paprika in a bowl .
column2: take a small mixing bowl . add some flour in to the bowl . add some pepper powder in to the bowl . add some paprika and garlic powder in to the bowl . add little salt in to the bowl and mix .

column1: fry the chicken wings in deep oil .
column2: grab the chicken one piece at a time . carefully lower each chicken piece into the oil slowly . cook the chicken in the oil until golden brown .

column1: fry the chicken wings in deep oil .
column2: place the chicken in the pan carefully as the oil is very hot . cook the chicken in the pan for around 12 minutes for smaller pieces and 15 minutes for larger pieces . turn the chick every few minutes . turn the heat off . drain the chicken on a plate that has been covered with a napkin .

column1: fry the chicken wings in deep oil .
column2: take a pan on the stove . add some oil in to the pan . heat the oil in the pan . add the chicken wings in the oil . fry the chicken in hot oil .

column1: coat the chicken wings with both mixture .
column2: put the chicken into the egg wash . completely coat the chicken with egg wash . put the chicken into the flour , shaking off the extra flour . then repeat the process .

column1: coat the chicken wings with both mixture .
column2: completely coat chicken in egg wash . roll chicken in flour . roll chicken again in flour . coat the chicken again in egg wash . roll chicken again in flour .

column1: coat the chicken wings with both mixture .
column2: take a chicken wing from a bowl . dip it into a wet mixture . then put it into corn meal . roll it around until completely coated . repeat until all chicken is coated .

column1: drain the chicken wings with paper towel and serve .
column2: place several paper towels on a plate . use tongs to remove the chicken from the fryer . place the chicken on the paper towels so the extra oil can be absorbed .

column1: drain the chicken wings with paper towel and serve .
column2: take out your chicken wings with a knife . place your chicken wings onto a paper towel .

column1: drain the chicken wings with paper towel and serve .
column2: take a pot on the stove . add some oil in to the pot and heat the oil . fry the chicken in the oil . take a bowl and place some paper towels in the bowl . now remove the chicken from the pot and drain them on the paper towel .

column1: beat an egg and mix with some milk .
column2: crack the egg . place the egg into the bowl . add milk to the bowl . with a fork mix the egg and milk together .

column1: beat an egg and mix with some milk .
column2: tap an egg to crack and open it into the bowl . take a fork and mix the egg up . pour in a bit of milk and mix everything .

column1: beat an egg and mix with some milk .
column2: take a small bowl and crack an egg into it . pour a little milk on top of the egg in the bowl . use a fork to mix the egg and milk together until the yolk and white are combined .

column1: cook bacon in a pan until crispy .
column2: place your frying pan on the stove top . grab your sharp knife and chop up your bacon into cubes . turn on the heat under your frying pan , and put your bacon into the bacon . watch bacon closely , and heat until crispy . once bacon is crispy , turn off the heat and place cooked bacon on a paper towel to absorb the oil .

column1: cook bacon in a pan until crispy .
column2: take a pan on a stove . cut the bacon in to cube shaped pieces . add the bacon in to the pan . mix with the spatula . cook the bacon till it is crispy .

column1: cook bacon in a pan until crispy .
column2: put the squares of bacon into your pan . stir the bacon and make sure each side gets cooked . when the bacon is crispy , it 's finished .

column1: put 2 tsp of olive oil add cut bread dices and fry .
column2: add 2 tablespoons of olive oil to hot pan . then add cut up pieces of bread . fry the bread in the oil .

column1: put 2 tsp of olive oil add cut bread dices and fry .
column2: add two tablespoons of olive oil to hot pan with the bacon fat . add cubed pieces of bread to pan . fry bread until golden brown .

column1: put 2 tsp of olive oil add cut bread dices and fry .
column2: take a pan on a stove . add 2 tsp of olive oil in to the frying pan . cut the bread slices in to the cube shaped pieces . take the bread in a bowl . add the bread in to the frying pan .

column1: tear fresh lettuce leaves and add them with seasoned kale leaves .
column2: take a clean big glass bowl . take cut pieces of lettuce leaves in to the bowl . take fresh kale leaves . tear the kale leaves in to small pieces with hand . add the kale leaves in to the bowl .

column1: tear fresh lettuce leaves and add them with seasoned kale leaves .
column2: tear the lettuce leaves in pieces . the pieces should be small enough to fit in your mouth . and big enough you can pick them up with a fork . put the pieces in the bowl with the kale .

column1: tear fresh lettuce leaves and add them with seasoned kale leaves .
column2: take the lettuce with your hands . tear it with your hands .

column1: add roasted bread crumbs crispy bacon slices of parmesan cheese    shaved    to seasoned greens and pour dressing blend on top .
column2: in bowl of greens add the roasted bread crumbs by tipping pan into bowl . sprinkle on crispy bacon . take a cheese slicer or vegetable peeler and shave off slices of parmesan onto the salad . pour on wanted amount of salad dressing .

column1: add roasted bread crumbs crispy bacon slices of parmesan cheese    shaved    to seasoned greens and pour dressing blend on top .
column2: place kale and greens in large salad bowl . add roasted bread crumbs . sprinkle on top crispy bacon slices . using a cheese slicer , slowly shave thin slices of parmesan cheese . pour dressing blend on top .

column1: add roasted bread crumbs crispy bacon slices of parmesan cheese    shaved    to seasoned greens and pour dressing blend on top .
column2: add bread crumbs , cooked bacon , pieces of parmesan cheese . pour dressing on top .

column1: tear raw kale leaves in bite size pieces add lemon juice and salt and massage thoroughly keep it aside .
column2: tear the raw kale into small pieces that can be easily eaten and place in bowl . cut the lemon in half with a knife . squeeze the lemon so that the juice will spray on the kale pieces . turn the salt shaker and add salt to the kale leaves . rub the lemon and salt into the kale leaves so that they are coated with the lemon juice . put away from you while you do something else .

column1: tear raw kale leaves in bite size pieces add lemon juice and salt and massage thoroughly keep it aside .
column2: tear kale into bite size pieces . add lemon juice from a whole lemon . next add salt to kale . use your hands to mix the kale , lemon , and salt together .

column1: tear raw kale leaves in bite size pieces add lemon juice and salt and massage thoroughly keep it aside .
column2: rip apart dark green lettuce into small pieces . add lemon juice and salt . mix with hands .

column1: mix 1 cup of whole egg mayonnaise dijon mustard paste half a lemon juice 2 anchovies    finely chopped .
column2: add 1 cup of whole egg mayonnaise to the bowl . next add 1 teaspoon of dijon mustard . then add a 1/2 of lemon . finally , add garlic and 2 anchovies cut up very small . mix all ingredients together .

column1: mix 1 cup of whole egg mayonnaise dijon mustard paste half a lemon juice 2 anchovies    finely chopped .
column2: put 1 measuring cup of mayonnaise and 1 tablespoon of dijon mustard into a bowl . cut one lemon in half and squeeze 1 half into the bowl . cut up 2 anchovies and put into the bowl ( you can skip this step if you do not like anchovies ) . cut up 1 clove of garlic into very small pieces . mix everything that is in the bowl .

column1: mix 1 cup of whole egg mayonnaise dijon mustard paste half a lemon juice 2 anchovies    finely chopped .
column2: scoop one cup of mayonnaise and dijon mustard paste into a bowl . squeeze half a lemon into the same bowl . use a knife to chop two anchovies into small pieces .

column1: 1 clove of garlic finely chopped 2 tsp of grated parmesan cheese and freshly ground black pepper .
column2: pull apart a bulb of garlic separating it into cloves . cut one of the cloves up into very tiny pieces and add to dressing . using a cheese grater , rub the parmesan cheese up and down the grater . when you have 2 teaspoons of cheese grated , add it to the dressing . twist the pepper grinder to sprinkle a little pepper into the dressing and mix with a whisk .

column1: 1 clove of garlic finely chopped 2 tsp of grated parmesan cheese and freshly ground black pepper .
column2: add 1 clove of garlic to the bowl . then add grated parmesan cheese . next add some fresh ground black pepper . mix it together . add some water to get the consistency you want .

column1: 1 clove of garlic finely chopped 2 tsp of grated parmesan cheese and freshly ground black pepper .
column2: place on counter : chef 's knife , medium size bowl , medium jar , small grater , whisk . with the chef 's knife and 1 clove of garlic , chop the garlic into small bits . carefully scrape the bits of garlic onto the knife and drop them into bowl . over the bowl , rub a block of parmesan cheese on the grater to make 2 spoonfuls . turn a black pepper grinder a few turns over the bowl .

column1: pour the blend into a jar .
column2: pour the mixture into a jar . the jar will make it easier to serve .

column1: pour the blend into a jar .
column2: find a jar with a spout for pouring the dressing . carefully pour the dressing from the bowl into the jar .

column1: pour the blend into a jar .
column2: hold up the bowl with your hands . slowly and carefully pour the blend from the bowl into a jar .

column1: dice the short cut bacon .
column2: dice the short cut bacon . be sure to use a knife .

column1: dice the short cut bacon .
column2: cut the short cut bacon into small cubes . you can first cut it into strips . then you can cut them to small cubes by cutting the strips .

column1: dice the short cut bacon .
column2: with a sharp knife , cut the bacon into 1/2 inch strips . turn the strips sideways on your cutting board and cut them in 1/2 inch strips again , making very small squares .

column1: cut the bread loaves into half remove the crust and dice .
column2: cut the loaf of bread in half with a knife . using a knife cut the hard crust off of the bread . cut the bread into small squares .

column1: cut the bread loaves into half remove the crust and dice .
column2: we are going to first prepare the croutons - start by cutting the loaf in half . day old bread is best . cut off the crust , because we want to use the soft bread and not the hard crust . add bacon squares in the pan . the cut up bread will suck up the bacon oil while cooking .

column1: cut the bread loaves into half remove the crust and dice .
column2: use a bread or serrated knife to cut the bread into half width wise using a sawing motion . cut the outer edge or crust off of all sides , top and bottom , until just the fluffy bread is left . cut into cubes using a sawing motion .

column1: add beef cubes to the pot .
column2: hold the bowl of beef over the pot . pour the beef cubes into the pot .

column1: add beef cubes to the pot .
column2: put two pounds of beef chuck cubes into the hot pot . use a wooden spoon to stir the beef .

column1: add beef cubes to the pot .
column2: cut the 2 pounds of beef into 1 inch cubes . toss the cut beef into the bowl with the noodles . mix them together with a stirring spoon .

column1: melt butter in a pot .
column2: take a pot on the stove . heat the pot . add some butter in to the pot . heat the butter in the pot . melt the butter in the pot .

column1: melt butter in a pot .
column2: place a piece of butter in the pot . let the butter sit until it becomes liquid .

column1: melt butter in a pot .
column2: add 2 tablespoons of butter to the pan . melt the butter and spread it around the pan .

column1: add paprika to the pot and stir .
column2: measure 2 teaspoons of hungarian paprika and sprinkle it into the pan with the other ingredients . turn the stove down on low . let it cook for about an hour , and occasionally stir it with a wooden spoon . while it cooks , add another cup of water or beef stock if you need to , to keep everything moist .

column1: add paprika to the pot and stir .
column2: take a pot on the stove . add the ingredients in to the pot . cook the ingredients . add a table spoon of paprika in to the pot . mix it with other ingredients of the pot .

column1: add paprika to the pot and stir .
column2: add 2 tablespoons of paprika to the pot . adjust the heat to low . use a mixing spoon to stir for 1 hour . add 1 cup of water and continue stirring the bowl .

column1: cook onion in the pot .
column2: put onion in the hot pot . cook the onions in the pot .

column1: cook onion in the pot .
column2: heat up a large pot on the stove with a couple tablespoons of oil inside . take the thinly sliced onions and put them in the pan once the pan is hot . cook the onions until they are soft and a little bit see through . this will take about 5 - 8 minutes .

column1: cook onion in the pot .
column2: add 2 thinly sliced onion into the pot . cook for 5 to 8 minutes .

column1: add salt and pepper to the pot .
column2: grab some salt and pepper with your fingers . sprinkle it into the pot .

column1: add salt and pepper to the pot .
column2: take meat and cut into small pieces with a knife . add to pot . then add salt and pepper . stir with wooden spoon . cook until completely heated .

column1: add salt and pepper to the pot .
column2: add salt into the pot . put some pepper in . use a stirring spoon to mix it together in the pan . cook for 1 more hour .

column1: pour water into the pan .
column2: pour in 1 cup of water to the pan . use stirring spoon to mix the ingredients while it cooks .

column1: pour water into the pan .
column2: hold the water cup over the pan . carefully pour the water in the pan without splashing .

column1: pour water into the pan .
column2: pour one cup of beef stock to your mixture in the pot . use your wooden spoon to mix it . you can also add one cup of water instead of the beef stock .

column1: mix together flour baking powder baking soda salt and sugar .
column2: add correct amounts of flour , baking soda , salt , and sugar to a bowl . using a whisk or spatula , stir the ingredients together until they are mixed .

column1: mix together flour baking powder baking soda salt and sugar .
column2: add 1 tsp of baking powder . add 1/4 tsp baking soda . add 1/4 tsp salt . add 2 t sugar . whisk all together .

column1: mix together flour baking powder baking soda salt and sugar .
column2: put flour into bowl . add 1 teaspoon of baking powder and 1/4 teaspoon of baking soda . add 1/4 teaspoon of salt for flavor . add 2 tablespoons of white granulated sugar which helps keep pancakes moist . use wire whisk to blend together until no lumps .

column1: mix together an egg butter and butter milk .
column2: put one large egg into a bowl . whisk the egg . add 3 tbsp of melted butter to the eggs , mixing them together . add 1 cup of buttermilk to the egg and butter . mix all the ingredients together .

column1: mix together an egg butter and butter milk .
column2: take a large egg and break into the bowl . beat the egg very clearly . add 40 grams of butter which we weighed using a machine into the egg . add 240 ml of buttermilk into the bowl with egg and butter .

column1: mix together an egg butter and butter milk .
column2: put one large egg into a bowl and whisk it . add 3 tablespoons of melted room temperature butter to the egg . mix the butter and egg thoroughly . add 1 cup of buttermilk to the egg and butter mixture . mix all the wet ingredients together thoroughly .

column1: pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir .
column2: put mixture in bowl first . add all wet ingredients . mix it , but not too much ( a few lumps is fine ) . put batter on hot pan in ladle fulls . let cook .

column1: pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir .
column2: put dry ingredients into one bowl and mix together . put wet ingredients into one bowl and mix together . put wet ingredients into dry ingredients . stir gently , do not over mix . lumps are okay in pancakes .

column1: pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir .
column2: add all the wet ingredients into the bowl of dry ingredients . gently mix the ingredients together . stir gently until lightly mixed together . if it 's mixed too much the batter will be tough .

column1: spray the pan with a nonstick spray .
column2: spray the skillet with a nonstick spray . you can also use butter or oil but they have more fat then the spray .

column1: spray the pan with a nonstick spray .
column2: spray the pan with non - stick vegetable spray . if you do n't have spray , you can use a little oil and spread it on the pan . if you do n't have oil you can use melted butter and spread it on the pan .

column1: spray the pan with a nonstick spray .
column2: take a skillet and spray with non stick spray . make sure you cover all the corners so nothing will stick . if you do n't have pam you can brush on melted butter to the whole skillet .

column1: pour some batter onto the pan .
column2: once you have mixed your batter , use your spoon or kitchen utensil of choice to pour batter onto your pan . make sure you leave enough room for spreading , especially if you plan on making several pancakes on the same pan at the same time .

column1: pour some batter onto the pan .
column2: use a ladle to put the pancake batter on the pan . make sure you leave enough room for the batter to spread .

column1: pour some batter onto the pan .
column2: let griddle heat up to 350 . make batter with buttermilk and pancake mix . with a large spoon , scoop up some of the batter and spoon it onto the griddle , make sure that the batter is in a circle . this is because it gives more room to add more cakes . when you see the batter bubbling wait 1 minute and flip with a flipper . let the cakes brown . take cakes off of the griddle .

column1: after bubbles form flip the pancake .
column2: start cooking the batter . look for bubbles on top then check if bottom is brown . do a quick flip . let other side cook .

column1: after bubbles form flip the pancake .
column2: put pancake batter onto pan . watch the batter . when top starts to bubble lift with spatula to check . look for the bottom to be golden brown . flip the pancake with spatula .

column1: after bubbles form flip the pancake .
column2: once you see bubbles popping on the top , check the bottom of the pancake with your spatula . if it is golden brown , flip the pancake .

column1: after both sides brown move the pancakes to a plate .
column2: check for color of pancake . if it is brown , pancake is ready . check both side of pancake for brown color . make a plate ready . move pancake one by one , side by side .

column1: after both sides brown move the pancakes to a plate .
column2: get out griddle and turn it on . spray griddle with pam oil from can . put a small amount of batter onto griddle . cook on each side until brown . remove from griddle and put onto plate next to each other .

column1: after both sides brown move the pancakes to a plate .
column2: take pancakes off the griddle onto plate . turn each side over to make sure they are a patchy brown color . if not then put it back on the griddle . once done do n't stack the pancakes as you 'll make them soggy . do one layer of pancakes so make sure you have a big platter .

column1: roll a lime and cut it in half .
column2: roll a lime between your palm and the cutting board . this will start to break down the lime . cut the lime in half .

column1: roll a lime and cut it in half .
column2: roll a lime on a cutting board . make sure you roll it a lot to get the juice loose in the lime .

column1: roll a lime and cut it in half .
column2: take a lime and roll it back and forth with the palm of your hand . cut the lime in half with a knife .

column1: squeeze lime into a bowl .
column2: carefully cut a whole lime into two halves . hold the cut lime half over the bowl and squeeze the juice out into the bowl . do the same for the second half of the lime .

column1: squeeze lime into a bowl .
column2: take a lemon on a board . cut the lemon in to two halves with a knife . take a clean small bowl . squeeze one half of lemon in to the bowl . now squeeze another half of lemon .

column1: squeeze lime into a bowl .
column2: grab a bowl . grab the green lime . grab a knife but have a adult supervision . cut in half . squeeze the lime in the bowl .

column1: add sugar to the lime juice in the bowl and mix .
column2: add the sugar to the bowl of lime juice . stir the juice and sugar together until the sugar dissolves .

column1: add sugar to the lime juice in the bowl and mix .
column2: take a clean medium sized bowl . take lemon juice in to the bowl . take a tablespoon measurement . add two tablespoons of sugar in to the lime juice . mix the sugar in the bowl with a spatula .

column1: add sugar to the lime juice in the bowl and mix .
column2: use a measuring spoon to measure out two tablespoons of sugar . add the sugar to the lime juice in a bowl . use a spoon to stir the sugar into the lime juice until it is dissolved .

column1: add fish sauce to the bowl and mix .
column2: pour fish sauce in the bowl . using your spoon , mix up the ingredients in the bowl .

column1: add fish sauce to the bowl and mix .
column2: add two table spoons of fish sauce to the bowl . mix well .

column1: add fish sauce to the bowl and mix .
column2: add 2 tablespoons of fish sauce in bowl . then mix .

column1: add water to the bowl while mixing .
column2: add water to the bowl . at the same time you are adding the water , stir it .

column1: add water to the bowl while mixing .
column2: add a table spoon of water to the bowl . continue stirring in the water as you pour .

column1: add water to the bowl while mixing .
column2: start mixing the things in the bowl . while mixing add a tablespoon of water to the bowl .

column1: add garlic and chili to the bowl .
column2: mince- you are going to cut it very small . mince the garlic and red chili peppers . add them to your bowl .

column1: add garlic and chili to the bowl .
column2: your important flavors are garlic and red chili . put the garlic and chili in the bowl .

column1: add garlic and chili to the bowl .
column2: chop the garlic very small with a knife . put the chopped garlic on the knife and slide it into a bowl . chop the red chili very small with a knife . put the chopped red chili on the knife and slide it into the bowl with the garlic .

column1: chop herbs and mix them into the bowl .
column2: cut up all the herbs into little pieces . add them into the bowl .

column1: chop herbs and mix them into the bowl .
column2: place herbs on a cutting board . use a sharp knife to cut herbs into very small bits , being very careful not to cut your fingers . the best was to do that is to hold the top of the knife down with one hand on top , and using an up and down chopping motion with the other . add the chopped herbs to the bowl , using the side of the knife to move them from the cutting board . use a spoon to stir the herbs into the sauce .

column1: chop herbs and mix them into the bowl .
column2: chop herbs really fine . add to bowl of dipping sauce . mix the herbs and oil together .

column1: fill soaked rice paper sheets with prawns cucumber carrots and spring onions .
column2: place 3 prawns in a row on the rice paper . add some slices of cucumber on top of them . then add a few slices of carrots . put some spring onions on the top of that .

column1: fill soaked rice paper sheets with prawns cucumber carrots and spring onions .
column2: place prawns on rice paper sheets . cut cucumbers , carrot and spring onions into long thin strips . add carrots on top of prawns . add cucumbers on top of shrimp . add spring onions on top of prawns .

column1: fill soaked rice paper sheets with prawns cucumber carrots and spring onions .
column2: add prawns to a sheet of soaked rice paper . top the prawns with sliced cucumber . add a little bit of sliced carrot to the cucumber . add spring onions on top of the cucumber .

column1: wrap the rolls tightly .
column2: put the contents on top of the rice paper . next fold the ends . then wrap the roll up as tightly as possible .

column1: wrap the rolls tightly .
column2: prepare the roll . put the vegetables into the roll . using both hands , put the roll into the vegetables in the middle . close them and make it tight . roll it gently .

column1: wrap the rolls tightly .
column2: place everything into the wrapper . pull both ends to the center . then take the other side and start wrapping the roll up into a cylinder . keep the wrap as tight as you can . once the whole wrap is tightly wrapped up your done .

column1: peel off some zest from a lemon .
column2: with a knife , carefully shave the zest from the lemon . cut off one piece about the size of a fingernail for each serving .

column1: peel off some zest from a lemon .
column2: get your clean lemon . use a sharp knife to slowly shave off only the top yellow layer of the lemon peel by holding the lemon with one hand and angling your knife until it 's pretty flat with the lemon . you need a piece as big as your finger nail .

column1: peel off some zest from a lemon .
column2: you can use a peeler or a knife . take a lemon and cut some of the skin off - that is what they call zest from a lemon .

column1: add snow peas to the broth .
column2: use your hands and carefully lower the snow peas into the broth . be careful not to touch the hot broth and pot .

column1: add snow peas to the broth .
column2: wait for your broth to simmer . now add six snow peas to your simmering broth with your hand , gently placing it in the pot as not to splash yourself . cook it for about 60 seconds .

column1: add snow peas to the broth .
column2: turn on stove . fill pot up with broth . let the broth heat up . place peas carefully into broth . let the broth simmer .

column1: cook udon noodles in a pot with boiling water .
column2: fill a pot with water and turn up the heat . wait until the water bubbles up . put the noodles in the wt .

column1: cook udon noodles in a pot with boiling water .
column2: fill a large pot with water . turn up the heat on the stove to make the water boil . slowly add the udon noodles to the boiling water so that the water does n't splash on you .

column1: cook udon noodles in a pot with boiling water .
column2: fill a pot with water and put it on high heat until it comes to a rolling boil ( bubbles that keep coming to the top all the time ) . place a package of noodles into the boiling water until the are done . usually they require 3 - 4 minutes of boiling .

column1: mix in soy sauce .
column2: hold the bowl of soy sauce over the pan . carefully pour in the soy sauce . mix with a wooden spoon .

column1: mix in soy sauce .
column2: add the rest of the soy sauce to the mix . use a spoon to stir the mixture . cook until the mixture thickens . take off the heat and set aside .

column1: mix in soy sauce .
column2: add the soy mixture to the pan . use a spoon to stir and cook until thickened . take the pan off the heat once thickened and set pan aside .

column1: mix brown sugar soy sauce and mirin .
column2: have a small bowl that you can mix your ingredients in . put two tablespoons of brown sugar in the bowl . pour in three tablespoons of soy sauce . pour in three tablespoons of mirin . using a whisk , mix the three ingredients together .

column1: mix brown sugar soy sauce and mirin .
column2: pour 2 tablespoons of brown sugar into a bowl . add 3 tablespoons of soy sauce . add 3 tablespoons of mirin . use a whisk to mix together all of the ingredients in the bowl .

column1: mix brown sugar soy sauce and mirin .
column2: get a small bowl . add 2 tb of brown sugar to the bowl . combine 3 tb each of soy sauce and mirin with the sugar . mix with a whisk until all the ingredients are dissolved ( you can no longer see the sugar ) .

column1: add lemon zest and then noodles to the bowl .
column2: add the lemon zest into the bowl . put the noodles into the bowl with chopsticks . using a spoon place the broth into the bowl .

column1: add lemon zest and then noodles to the bowl .
column2: add 1 piece of lemon skin to each bowl with your fingers . grab some noodles with chopsticks and put it on top of the lemon pieces in both bowls .

column1: add lemon zest and then noodles to the bowl .
column2: use a sharp knife to cut come lemon zest from a lemon . put a piece of lemon in the bottom of each bowl . add the strained udon noodles to each bowl . add soup stock to each bowl .

column1: fry mushrooms in a pan .
column2: cut the bottom off the mushrooms . use hands to shred the mushrooms . add to pan . cook on high heat . continue to cook until the mushrooms are golden brown .

column1: fry mushrooms in a pan .
column2: on a cutting board , cut the bottom off a bunch of oyster mushrooms . pull the mushrooms apart into smaller sized pieces that can be stirred easily . heat a frying pan on high heat and add 2 tb of butter until it is melted . add the mushrooms and cook ( saute ) them until they are golden brown and smell good .

column1: fry mushrooms in a pan .
column2: gather your bunch of mushrooms and using a knife , cut the bottom of them off . then using your hands , break apart the mushrooms into small pieces . measure out 2 tablespoons of butter and add to a pan on high heat until it starts to heat up and bubble a little bit . add the mushrooms to the pan of butter . saute , or mix , the mushrooms up in the pan until they reach a golden brown color and are done .

column1: add soup stock snow peas and an egg .
column2: take the noodles in a bowl . add soup stock in to the bowls . add snow peas in to the bowl . take a boiled egg in a bowl . add the egg in to the bowls .

column1: add soup stock snow peas and an egg .
column2: add soup stock to the bowl . then add some snow peas . put some mushroom on the top . finally add an egg .

column1: add soup stock snow peas and an egg .
column2: add soup stock with a large spoon to the bowl of noodles . add cooked snow peas , about 4 of them . add cooked mushrooms to the bowl . add a just barely cooked egg to the bowl .

column1: add dashi to the pan .
column2: hold the dashi cup over the pot . carefully and slowly pour the dashi in the pot .

column1: add dashi to the pan .
column2: get a measuring cup and the dashi . slowly pour the dashi into the measuring cup until it reaches the 2 1/2 cup marker line . slowly and carefully pour the measured dashi into the pan with the soy mixture . mix the dashi in with the soy mixture using a whisk . keep the burner on low heat to bring the mixture to a low boil ( simmer ) and then you can move on .

column1: add dashi to the pan .
column2: take a large pot on the stove . cook the contents of the pot . take the dashi in a bowl . add the dashi to the pan . mix everything properly with a whisk .

column1: garnish with furikake .
column2: top off the dish with a sprinkle of furikake . serve the dish .

column1: garnish with furikake .
column2: sprinkle some furikake on top . use your fingers to sprinkle .

column1: garnish with furikake .
column2: once the dish is complete , you need to sprinkle the furikake on it . using your hand , sprinkle the furikake on top of the other ingredients .

column1: heat the mixture in a sauce pan .
column2: put the soy sauce mixture in a sauce pan . heat the mixture and use a wire whisk to mix it . simmer until everything is dissolved and combined .

column1: heat the mixture in a sauce pan .
column2: take a small pan and heat it . take the sauce in a small bowl . add the sauce in to the hot pan . heat the mixture in the pan . whisk the mixture in the pan .

column1: heat the mixture in a sauce pan .
column2: pour 2/3 soy sauce in a small bowl . grab a pan and place it on the stove . heat up stove . add soy sauce to mixture . simmer until everything is dissolved .

column1: pour in boiling water bean curd and carnation milk .
column2: pour water into the mixture . pour carnation milk to the mixture . with a spoon scoop out the carnation milk mixture to make sure you get it all .

column1: pour in boiling water bean curd and carnation milk .
column2: pour the measured boiling water into the pot on the stove . add the fried bean curd into the pot . ( optional ? pour the coconut cream into the pot ) . pour the carnation milk into the pot . gently stir the mix in the pot .

column1: pour in boiling water bean curd and carnation milk .
column2: now you will pour in the boiling water into the pan . careful not to spill any . now you want to add in the fried bean curd . now take the coconut cream and carnation milk and pour them in as well . remember to keep stirring as you pour each ingredient in .

column1: place the noodle bean sprout prawn fish cake and eggs into a bowl and pour the gravy over .
column2: take a bowl and add the noodles in to the bowl . add bean sprouts in to the bowl . add prawn fish cake in to the bowl . cut the boiled egg in to halves and add it to the bowl . add the gravy in to the bowl .

column1: place the noodle bean sprout prawn fish cake and eggs into a bowl and pour the gravy over .
column2: put the noodles into a bowl . add bean sprouts and prawns to the bowl . put fish cake and eggs in the bowl on top of the noodles . pour gravy over everything in the bowl . garnish the bowl with chopped laksa leaves over the top .

column1: place the noodle bean sprout prawn fish cake and eggs into a bowl and pour the gravy over .
column2: boil some water in a pot . put prawns into the boiling water for about 5 minutes . take the prawns out of the boiling water with a big spoon after 5 minutes and put them in a separate bowl . put your noodles in another bowl and put the cooked prawns on top of your noodles . put your beansprouts , fish cakes , and eggs on top of the noodles and prawns . use a big spoon and pour gravy all over the noodles , prawns , eggs , and fish cakes .

column1: place the noodles and bean sprout in boiling water .
column2: put the noodles and bean sprout into boiling water . after they have cooked , drain each separately . pour into a serving bowl .

column1: place the noodles and bean sprout in boiling water .
column2: now we want to poach the noodles and bean sprouts . put them in boiling water and let them poach . now we can drain them separately and place them in the serving bowl .

column1: place the noodles and bean sprout in boiling water .
column2: get a medium size sauce pan and fill it half way with water . put the pan on the stove and turn the burner on to a medium low setting . when the water is very hot , carefully put the noodles and beansprouts in the water . wait until the noodles are cooked until tender . turn off the heat . get a colander and pour the noodles and beansprouts in the colander to drain thoroughly . put the noodles and beansprouts in a bowl .

column1: slice the fish cakes bean curd and boiled eggs .
column2: slice bean curd , hard boiled eggs and fish cakes on cutting board using knife . heat up cooking oil in pain .

column1: slice the fish cakes bean curd and boiled eggs .
column2: place the fishcakes , bean curd and hard boiled eggs on a cutting board . use a sharp knife to slice the fishcakes , bean curd and hard boiled eggs .

column1: slice the fish cakes bean curd and boiled eggs .
column2: before we start cutting our ingredients , make sure to choose a very sharp knife . a sharp knife is always safer because you wo n't have to force it to cut the food . forcing often leads to accidents . once you have a very sharp knife , place the hard boiled eggs on a cutting board . cut a small wedge from one side of each egg , so that you can set them down and they wo n't roll away while you cut them . then cut them into slices that are almost as wide as your pinkie finger . next , cut the fish cakes into quarters . first cut them in half , then turn them so you can cut them in half again . you should have four pieces . finally , cut four slices of bean curd . set all of your ingredients aside , and put the cooking oil we measured at the beginning into a pan .

column1: heat up cooking oil in a pan and add laksa paste .
column2: place a pan on one burner of the stove . pour cooking oil into the pan . adjust the heat for that burner to heat the pan . shake the jar of chng kee 's laksa paste too add the paste to the pan . use a ladle to stir the paste and oil in the pan to mix them together .

column1: heat up cooking oil in a pan and add laksa paste .
column2: with a spoon place some oil in a pan . place the whole jar of laksa paste into the pan . using a spoon mix the two together .

column1: heat up cooking oil in a pan and add laksa paste .
column2: add cooking oil to a pan and heat it up . put laksa paste to the pan . use the stirring spoon to stir the paste into the pan .

column1: sprinkle the bowl with laksa leaves .
column2: take a spoon and scoop up some laksa leaves . add the laksa leaves to the top of the bowl . spread the leaves evenly to the top of the bowl .

column1: sprinkle the bowl with laksa leaves .
column2: take your finely chopped laksa leaves . use a small teaspoon to add it to your bowl . use only the tip of the spoon to sprinkle it nicely over your bowl .

column1: sprinkle the bowl with laksa leaves .
column2: using a spoon scoop out laksa leaves . using a spoon place the laksa leaves on top of the mixture .

column1: mix bread crumbs milk 1 egg dried inly herbs granulated garlic splash olive oil pinch red pepper flakes whisk together .
column2: put bread crumbs , milk , 1 egg , dried herbs , granulated garlic , a little olive oil , and some red pepper flakes into the bowl . mix everything together with your whisk .

column1: mix bread crumbs milk 1 egg dried inly herbs granulated garlic splash olive oil pinch red pepper flakes whisk together .
column2: in mixing bowl add bread crumbs and then carefully pour measured milk on top . add your egg and be sure there are no pieces of egg shell that fall in too . add the herbs , garlic , and two teaspoons of olive oil . add a half a teaspoon of red pepper flakes or according to how you like it ( they can be spicy ) ! using a whisk mix everything together until it all looks the same , no identifiable egg bits or milk puddles .

column1: mix bread crumbs milk 1 egg dried inly herbs granulated garlic splash olive oil pinch red pepper flakes whisk together .
column2: gather the slurry ingredients you set aside in the beginning . put the plain breadcrumbs into a mixing bowl . make sure you do not use seasoned breadcrumbs . pour in the milk and add one egg . any type of egg will be fine for this slurry , but make sure not to include any egg shells . you do n't need to mix this until the rest of the ingredients are in the mixing bowl . add the italian herbs , the olive oil , and the red pepper flakes . use a whisk to mix everything until it is well blended . make sure all of the breadcrumbs are moistened before you stop mixing .

column1: take out meat balls put them to pasta sauce mix well bring to boil and let simmer for 30 minutes .
column2: use tongs to take meatballs from pan and place them in pot with pasta sauce . use wooden spatula to mix meatballs and sauce . wait till sauce simmers to eat . optional : let meatballs simmer in sauce for 30 minutes . use large spoon to put meatballs an sauce onto spaghetti .

column1: take out meat balls put them to pasta sauce mix well bring to boil and let simmer for 30 minutes .
column2: fill pot with pasta sauce and place on stove . turn burner on to medium heat . place cooked meatballs into pasta sauce . allow pasta sauce with meatballs to begin to boil . once boiling , reduce burner heat to low and allow pasta sauce and meatballs to cook for about thirty minutes .

column1: take out meat balls put them to pasta sauce mix well bring to boil and let simmer for 30 minutes .
column2: use tongs to take the meatballs and put them into the pasta sauce pan . discard the grease from the meatballs . mix the sauce and meatballs together . bring the pan to a boil and let simmer . simmer for 30 minutes .

column1: place the tray under broiler and bake the meat balls until well browned .
column2: put the tray of meatballs under the broiler . heat the meatballs until they are browned .

column1: place the tray under broiler and bake the meat balls until well browned .
column2: turn on the oven . get out a cookie sheet . line the cookie sheet with foil . spray with no stick spray . place the meatballs on the foil pan and into the oven .

column1: place the tray under broiler and bake the meat balls until well browned .
column2: set your broiler to high . once the meatballs are on the tray , and the broiler is hot , place them under a broiler . broil the meatballs until they are browned .

column1: take ground beef and ground veal in a bowl .
column2: pour the ground beef into a large bowl . add the ground veal into the bowl with the beef .

column1: take ground beef and ground veal in a bowl .
column2: get a large bowl to place the meats in . crumble the ground beef into small pieces and place in the bowl . crumble the ground veal into small pieces as well and place in the bowl too .

column1: take ground beef and ground veal in a bowl .
column2: get a medium size size bowl . put the ground beef in the bowl , crumble the ground beef up . put the ground veal in the bowl and crumble it up too .

column1: spread aluminum sheet on baking tray brush with olive oil and scoop meat mixture on foil into small balls .
column2: spread aluminum foil on a baking sheet . use a brush to spread olive oil on the foil . use a scoop to scoop the beef into meatballs . place the meatballs on the foil on the sheet .

column1: spread aluminum sheet on baking tray brush with olive oil and scoop meat mixture on foil into small balls .
column2: cover a baking tray with a large piece of aluminum foil making sure to secure it around the sides so it does not fall off . pour a small amount of oil into the center of the tray . using a silicone brush spread the oil over the foil until the bottom of the tray is completely coated with the oil . one by one , using a small scoop , place the meat balls on the tray until all the meat is used up . make sure the meat balls are close but not touching so they do n't stick together while they are cooking .

column1: spread aluminum sheet on baking tray brush with olive oil and scoop meat mixture on foil into small balls .
column2: line a baking sheet with tin foil and lightly brush the foil with oil . use the sorbet spoon to form the meat mixture into small balls . place each meatball onto the lined pan .

column1: top the sauce over spaghetti garnish with grated cheese and serve hot .
column2: use a deep spoon to put the meatballs and sauce over the spaghetti . top the spaghetti with some parmesan cheese and serve hot .

column1: top the sauce over spaghetti garnish with grated cheese and serve hot .
column2: use a ladle or big spoon to scoop the sauce . pour the scoop of sauce onto the pasta . shake some cheese on top of everything .

column1: top the sauce over spaghetti garnish with grated cheese and serve hot .
column2: using a not too full utensil carefully spoon or ladle the sauce , as much or as little as you want , over your meatballs and pasta . sprinkle your parmesan over the sauced pasta . remember with both the sauce and cheese you can always add more easily but it 's almost impossible to take away after , less can be more ! dig in and enjoy !

column1: meat balls can be flipped and broiled if needed .
column2: use tongs to flip the meatballs . cook them longer to brown the other side if needed .

column1: meat balls can be flipped and broiled if needed .
column2: line tray with tin foil and place meatballs on top . space the meatballs out evenly on tray . flip the meatballs over to brown the other side .

column1: meat balls can be flipped and broiled if needed .
column2: now we can flip the meatballs if you would like the meatballs to be evenly browned . this step is not necessary , but is up to your personal preference .

column1: now season the ground meat with salt black pepper and a little pinch of white pepper .
column2: add salt to the ground meat bowl . put in a some black pepper to the bowl . add one small pinch of white pepper .

column1: now season the ground meat with salt black pepper and a little pinch of white pepper .
column2: sprinkle meat with salt . sprinkle with black pepper . next a small pinch of your fingers of white pepper which is optional . now add some parmesan cheese .

column1: now season the ground meat with salt black pepper and a little pinch of white pepper .

column1: add grated parmesan cheese to the meat and transfer the slurry mixture into meat bowl and give a good mix .
column2: add grated parmesan cheese on top of the other seasonings . make sure you are using fresh , authentic parmesan - the kind that looks like shredded cheese , not the kind that looks like powder . now put the slurry mixture on top of the cheese and seasonings . use the spoon to gently mix the meat with the cheese and seasonings . keep mixing until everything is very well blended . do n't worry about over mixing - make sure you mix until everything is well blended .

column1: add grated parmesan cheese to the meat and transfer the slurry mixture into meat bowl and give a good mix .

column2: sprinkle grated parmesan cheeses over the raw meat in a bowl . pour the slurry mix over the meat and cheese . use a rubber spatula to mix everything til it is well mixed .

column1: now put the caramelized onions between the buns squeeze mustard over it to serve .

column1: oil the sausages and place them on a griddle pan .

column1: cut the onions into thin slices .

column1: cut the onions into thin slices .

column1: cut the onions into thin slices .

column1: preheat the oven to 350 degree fahrenheit and 175 degree celsius .

column1: preheat the oven to 350 degree fahrenheit and 175 degree celsius .

column1: preheat the oven to 350 degree fahrenheit and 175 degree celsius .

column1: in a sauce pan add the evaporated skimmed milk chicken bouillon granules and stir over a medium heat until the milk boils .
column2: find a small saucepan and add the evaporated milk and the chicken boullion granules . turn the stove on medium . stir it with a spoon and keep stirring until everything is mixed well and the milk starts boiling .

column1: in a sauce pan add the evaporated skimmed milk chicken bouillon granules and stir over a medium heat until the milk boils .
column2: put a sauce pan over medium heat . grind up bouillon cubes . add to sauce pan with evaporated skim milk . whisk until the granules disappear and the milk begins to boil .

column2: add evaporated to the sauce pan . add chicken bouillon pieces . stir with a spoon over a medium heat . stir until the chicken melts and the milk begins to boil .

column1: then add the corn starch slowly and stir for 1 - 2 minutes or until the mixture thickens .
column2: put cornstarch in a bowl and add water to make a thin paste . slowly pour the cornstarch and water into the pot . stir for 1 to 2 minutes to thicken .

column1: then add the corn starch slowly and stir for 1 - 2 minutes or until the mixture thickens .

column1: then add the corn starch slowly and stir for 1 - 2 minutes or until the mixture thickens .

column1: remove it from heat and pour it into a large mixing bowl to cool down .
column2: using oven mitts pick up the pot and remove it from the heat . carefully pour the mixture into a large mixing bowl . let cool .

column1: remove it from heat and pour it into a large mixing bowl to cool down .
column2: remove your pan from the heat . let the pan sit and cool down . when it is cool , pour it into a large mixing bowl .

column1: remove it from heat and pour it into a large mixing bowl to cool down .
column2: remove it from the heat and pour it into a large mixing bowl and wait until it 's not hot anymore .

column1: once it is cooled add the chopped onions grated cheddar yogurt salt pepper and melted butter and mix well .
column2: put everything in a mixing bowl and let it cool down . once it has cooled down , add in the onion and cheddar that we measured earlier . add in the salt and pepper that we measured earlier . put the butter on a platter and microwave it for 7 seconds . if it is n't melted all the way , use a butter knife to stir the solid butter with the hot , melted butter until all of the butter has completely melted . then pour the butter into the mixing bowl . stir everything in the mixing bowl until it is well mixed .

column1: once it is cooled add the chopped onions grated cheddar yogurt salt pepper and melted butter and mix well .
column2: cool the contents of the bowl . add the cut pieces of onions in to the bowl . add grated cheddar in to the bowl . add yogurt , salt and pepper in to the bowl . melt some butter and add it in to the bowl .

column1: pour the sauce mixture over the grated potatoes in a very large bowl and mix until everything is well combined .
column2: put the grated potatoes into a very large bowl . carefully pour the sauce mixture over the grated potatoes . mix the sauce and potatoes together with a spoon until it is well - blended .

column1: pour the sauce mixture over the grated potatoes in a very large bowl and mix until everything is well combined .
column2: pour the sauce mixture over the potatoes in a very large bowl . use a a spoon to mix everything together until everything is combined .

column1: pour the sauce mixture over the grated potatoes in a very large bowl and mix until everything is well combined .
column2: take a large bowl . add the grated potatoes in the large bowl . take the sauce mixture in a bowl . add the sauce mixture in to the large bowl . mix every thing until it is well mixed .

column1: now pour the prepared mix into the ready casserole and top with diced butter .

column1: now pour the prepared mix into the ready casserole and top with diced butter .

column1: add grape seed oil to a pan and spread it all around .
