column1: add the marinated meat spread out evenly and fry .
column2: use a spoon to place the marinated meat into the hot pan . spread the meat evenly in the pan . stir the other pot containing the onions . stir the meat in the pan and add some more meat . keep stirring and cooking the meat .

column1: add grated fresh pear to the marinade mix well and keep aside .
column2: adding some fresh pear into the marinade will make it extra yummy , and chemicals in the pears called enzymes  " will help to make the meat more tender . ! " " . " using a child safe grater carefully rub 2 pears over the grater to make pear mush . be careful not to get the seeds or rough center of the pears in the sauce , just the soft flesh of the pears . add the pear mush to the bowl with the other ingredients already in there , and mix it well . put the bowl aside for now .

column1: add grated fresh pear to the marinade mix well and keep aside .
column2: now we will take our fresh pair and start grating it . hold the grater with one hand and rub the pear across the surface of the grater . now once you grate your pears just mix them around with your marinade in the bowl .

column1: add grated fresh pear to the marinade mix well and keep aside .
column2: shave the pear by rubbing it on a grater . mix the pear in the marina well with a spoon .

column1: put the cooked meat on a plate and garnish with fried onions chopped spring onions and sesame seeds .
column2: put the cooked meat on a serving plate . put the fried onions on top of the meat . sprinkle a few chopped spring onions on top of the fried onions . sprinkle a little bit of sesame seeds on the food for decoration .

column1: put the cooked meat on a plate and garnish with fried onions chopped spring onions and sesame seeds .
column2: piece of ribeye meat is beef . slice into thin pieces wash and place in a bowl . mix up the ingredients , garlic , brown sugar honey . marinate meat in the sauce . place meat in oven and grill or place in a grill pan and let it cook . now add all the garlic and onion .

column1: put the cooked meat on a plate and garnish with fried onions chopped spring onions and sesame seeds .
column2: to serve this , start by putting the cooked meat on a plate . on top of the meat , add the fried onions , and then the chopped spring onions . sprinkle some sesame seeds on top to finish .

column1: mix soy sauce sesame oil sugar finely chopped spring onions and minced garlic .
column2: add 3 table spoons of soy sauce , 1 1/2 tablespoon of sesame oil , 1 1/2 tablespoons of sugar to a medium sized bowl . cut spring onions into small pieces until you have 1 1/2 tablespoons of the pieces and add the pieces to the bowl . cut garlic into tiny pieces until you have about 2 tablespoons and add the pieces to the bowl . mix everything in the bowl together .

column1: mix soy sauce sesame oil sugar finely chopped spring onions and minced garlic .
column2: you need 3 tablespoons of soy sauce , use a measuring spoon to measure it . now you will need sesame oil , again use your measuring spoon to measure 1.5 tablespoons . next up measure out 1.5 table spoon of sugar . add to the mixture and mix . now add 2 tablespoons of a spring onion that is finely chopped . add in 1 to 2 full table spoons of minced garlic and mix the mixture together .

column1: mix soy sauce sesame oil sugar finely chopped spring onions and minced garlic .
column2: get a mixing bowl . using a measuring spoon add soy sauce , sesame oil , sugar , finely chopped spring onions and minced garlic ( insert measurements ) . stir until all the ingredients are well blended .

column1: add pepper to the marinade mixture .
column2: grind pepper into the bowl of the marinade . use the fork to stir it in to the mixture .

column1: add pepper to the marinade mixture .
column2: take a medium sized bowl . take the marinated mixture in the bowl . take some pepper in a pepper grinder . add the pepper in to the bowl . mix the pepper and the marinated mixture .

column1: add pepper to the marinade mixture .
column2: now we can add in some ground pepper . 2 or less teaspoons of freshly grounded pepper should be plenty .

column1: mix it again and transfer it equally to 2 jars .
column2: mix everything with your hands . take everything and put them into jars .

column1: mix it again and transfer it equally to 2 jars .
column2: chop the cabbage . get 2 equal size jar . transfer the chopped cabbage in both jars half and half .

column1: mix it again and transfer it equally to 2 jars .
column2: mix the cabbage again . leave the cabbage for 1 hour . mix the cabbage again . put the cabbage into two jars .

column1: chop cabbage mix with salt and let it sit .
column2: use a knife or food processor and chop up 1 cabbage . put the sliced cabbage into a large bowl . add salt . mix it together with your hands . let it sit for 1 hour .

column1: chop cabbage mix with salt and let it sit .
column2: put the cabbage in the food processor . close it and press the on button . pour the cabbage out and mix some salt into it .

column1: chop cabbage mix with salt and let it sit .
column2: using your hands mix the cabbage mix . add salt and mix the cabbage mix with your hands .

column1: after filling the jars 3 quarters push the content inside .
column2: put the cabbage into a jar . smash down the cabbage . fill the jar only 3/4 full of cabbage .

column1: after filling the jars 3 quarters push the content inside .
column2: take three glass jars . add the filling in to the jar . fill up to 3 quarters of jars . take a pushing tool . push the contents in the jar .

column1: after filling the jars 3 quarters push the content inside .
column2: fill 3 jars 3/4 of the way full . push the stuff in the jars with a spoon to mash it down .

column1: leave the jars at the room temperature closing the lids not too tight for 5 - 6 days .
column2: leave the jars out at room temperature with the lid on top . do n't close the lids too tight .

column1: leave the jars at the room temperature closing the lids not too tight for 5 - 6 days .
column2: fill the jars two thirds full with the cabbage mixture . two thirds is just a little bit more than half . if you are having a hard time knowing how much space to leave empty , use a pencil or marker to draw two lines on the jar so that you have three equally sized areas . then , fill the jar up to the second line . this is two - thirds full . when you put the lids on , do not close them too tight . you can make sure you do this correctly by setting the lid on top of the jar , turning the lid only a small amount , and then gently shaking the jar . if the lid makes slight clinking sounds but does not fall off , you have done it correctly . when you are done , double check that each jar is only filled two thirds full and that each lid is not closed tightly . these steps are very important , because your cabbage will not ferment and will not become delicious sauerkraut if they are too full or their lids are too tight . if you are working with a lot of jars , start off with all jars on the left side of the table or workspace , and as you double check them , move them over to the right side of the table or workspace . that way you are sure to double check every jar .

column1: leave the jars at the room temperature closing the lids not too tight for 5 - 6 days .
column2: put the lids on the jars . do n't put the lids on too tight , so do n't completely turn the lid . let the jars sit for 5 to 6 days .

column1: chop up the garlic in the food processor .
column2: turn on the food processor . drop the garlic cloves into the processor over the top , one by one .

column1: chop up the garlic in the food processor .
column2: some processors have feed tubes on the top which let you add ingredients while the processor is running . separate the individual parts ( called cloves ) of your garlic . turn on the food processor , on slow at first . add the cloves of garlic one at a time . this will help to get the garlic chopped up nice and small .

column1: chop up the garlic in the food processor .
column2: turn the food processor on . drop the garlic pieces into the tube in the middle .

column1: add the chickpeas chickpea juice and cayenne pepper to the food processor .
column2: find the juice machine . put in a cup of chickpeas . add 1/4 cup of cooking liquid . add 1/8 teaspoon cayenne pepper . add a little lemon juice from a lemon .

column1: add the chickpeas chickpea juice and cayenne pepper to the food processor .
column2: drain chickpeas and add to the processor bowl . next add a 1/4 of the liquid from the can . then add an 1/8th of a teaspoon of cayenne to the processor bowl .

column1: add the chickpeas chickpea juice and cayenne pepper to the food processor .
column2: slowly pour the chickpeas into the container on top . add the cayenne pepper in after .

column1: juice a lemon into the food processor .
column2: put half of a lemon into a hand squeezed juicer . place the juicer over the opening of the food processor . squeeze the handles of the juicer tightly to squeeze the juice out of lemon . you do n't need to measure the lemon juice , you can just add it to taste . if you like it more acidic ( or lemon - y ! ) add more !

column1: juice a lemon into the food processor .
column2: squeeze a few table spoon of lemon juice into the food processor . put a quarter cup of tahini .

column1: juice a lemon into the food processor .
column2: set out 2 lemons , a chefs knife and a citrus press on a cutting board . get a can of tahini puree out , and a 1/4 cup measuring cup . cut the lemons into halves ( 4 ) . place a lemon half in the press , squeeze the juice out over the processor . fill the 1/4 cup measuring cup with tahini puree and put it in the processor .

column1: add tahini and salt to the food processor .
column2: add tahini and salt to the food processor . turn on the food processor and blend everything .

column1: add tahini and salt to the food processor .
column2: measure out one cup of tahini . if the package has a bunch of oil at the top , stir it really well before you measure it . add the tahini to the food processor . add two big pinches of salt to the food processor .

column1: add tahini and salt to the food processor .
column2: use a small spoon and scoop up the tahini and salt . slowly and carefully put it in the bowl of the machine .

column1: blend the ingredients until smooth .
column2: put all your ingredients into the food processor . cover with the lid . turn the processor on until all the ingredients are blended smoothly . turn the processor off and remove the mixture .

column1: blend the ingredients until smooth .
column2: put the lid on the blender . blend the ingredients until it is smooth .

column1: blend the ingredients until smooth .
column2: when ingredients are put into the blender you hit the button to process / mix / chop . continue until it smooth like icing / makes it easy to spread etc .

column1: marinade the chicken with dark soy sauce salt sugar and pepper .
column2: add 1/2 teaspoon of soy sauce . add 1/4 teaspoon of salt . add 1/4 teaspoon of sugar . take a small finger pinch of pepper and add it . finally , add 2 tablespoons of water .

column1: marinade the chicken with dark soy sauce salt sugar and pepper .
column2: put chicken into bowl . add 1/2 tablespoon of black soy sauce to the bowl with chicken . then add 1/4 teaspoon of salt and 1/4 teaspoon of sugar to the bowl . next add a little pepper to the bowl . finally add 2 tablespoons of water to the bowl .

column1: marinade the chicken with dark soy sauce salt sugar and pepper .
column2: soak chicken with . dark soy sauce , salt , sugar , and pepper . add water .

column1: add in some flour and baking soda to the chicken too and mix it well .
column2: add 1 teaspoon of corn flour and a quarter of a teaspoon of baking soda . use chopsticks to mix the corn flour and baking soda into the chicken .

column1: add in some flour and baking soda to the chicken too and mix it well .
column2: take a medium sized bowl . take some chicken in to the bowl . add tablespoon of flour in to the bowl . add teaspoon of baking soda in to the bowl . mix it well to coat it with chicken .

column1: add in some flour and baking soda to the chicken too and mix it well .
column2: use a small spoon . scoop out flour and baking soda into the bowl . mix everything up with chopsticks .

column1: pour boiling water to bouncy noodles and drain it .
column2: put 3 egg noodle balls in the bowl . pour boiling water over the egg noodles . once the noodles start to loosen up , use chopsticks to break them apart . pour noodles into a strainer . shake the strainer to get all the water out .

column1: pour boiling water to bouncy noodles and drain it .
column2: pour boiling hot water over 250 grams thin egg noodles . when there soft and bouncy like rubber bands drain them in a colander . and there ready !

column1: pour boiling water to bouncy noodles and drain it .
column2: carefully and slowly pour the boiling water into the bowl with noodles in it . be careful not to splash . when it 's soft slowly drain the water out by pour everything in a strainer .

column1: cook ginger garlic and the chicken with olive oil in a pan and set it aside .
column2: heat your wok until it is hot . add 2 tablespoons of oil . add your chicken , ginger , and garlic to the pan . shake the pan around , then put the top on and let everything cook .

column1: cook ginger garlic and the chicken with olive oil in a pan and set it aside .
column2: heat wok up so it is hot and add 3 tablespoons of olive oil . add half of the ginger and garlic to the wok . next lay out the chicken in a single layer and cook for two to three minutes . finally add 600 ml of water and cover quickly to trap in the flavors . cook for a minute and then set to the side .

column1: cook ginger garlic and the chicken with olive oil in a pan and set it aside .
column2: turn stove eye on high . place the wok on the eye , let it heat up . add 2 tablespoons of olive oil . add half of the ginger and garlic . add chicken allow to cook for 5 minutes , stir and cover , add 1/4 cup water .

column1: wash the pan and cook ginger garlic carrot bean sprouts and broccoli in the pan with oil .
column2: wash the pan with soap and warm water . turn on the stove . put one tablespoon of oil in the pan , and the rest of the garlic and ginger . cook until the smell of the garlic and ginger gets a little stronger . add in half a handful of carrots , a full handful of beansprouts , and a full handful of broccoli . give it all a good , 5 - 10 second stir .

column1: wash the pan and cook ginger garlic carrot bean sprouts and broccoli in the pan with oil .
column2: carefully pour in the oil into the pan . pour out the ginger garlic carrot bean sprouts and broccoli in the pan . let the vegetables sizzle and mix them around with a spatula .

column1: wash the pan and cook ginger garlic carrot bean sprouts and broccoli in the pan with oil .
column2: wash your pan . put it onto the stove again . add 1 tablespoon of oil then the rest of your ginger and garlic . let it cook until you smell it . add a half of a handful of carrots , 1 whole handful of bean sprouts and broccoli .

column1: cover it to cook and then add in the noodles .
column2: put the lid on the pot . turn the heat down to low . boil the noodles and cut them up with some scissors . add them to the pot .

column1: cover it to cook and then add in the noodles .
column2: cover the pan with lid . check whether it is cooked . add the noodles into it .

column1: cover it to cook and then add in the noodles .
column2: cover the lid on the pan and let it cook . turn the dial of the stove to low . carefully pour the noodles in the pan .

column1: add back the chicken with salt and dark soy sauce and stir .
column2: pour the chicken and gravy on top . add 3/4 teaspoon salt , 1 1/4 teaspoons of sugar and of 1 teaspoon duck soy . slide 2 spatulas underneath the noodles and pull them up a bit and jiggle the spatulas . keep doing this until everything is mixed .

column1: add back the chicken with salt and dark soy sauce and stir .
column2: put the gravy on top . put the chicken on top . carefully toss the noodles with the chicken . season with duck soy , 1 1/4 tspn of salt , 1 1/4 tsp of sugar .

column1: add back the chicken with salt and dark soy sauce and stir .
column2: pour gravy on top . add the chicken . add 3/4 tablespoon of salt . add 1 teaspoon of duck soy . use two spatulas to mix together everything .

column1: make shallow cuts into the foie gras .
column2: take a foie gras on a plate . take a sharp knife . pass the knife through the foie gras along the length . now cut the foie gras along horizontally . the cut should be shallow .

column1: make shallow cuts into the foie gras .
column2: take a knife . cut the tips of the foie gras making shallow cuts into it lengthwise .

column1: make shallow cuts into the foie gras .
column2: now we can take our crackers and score them with the end of our knife . just draw lines across the top of them in a criss - cross manner . this will help them sear evenly .

column1: add salt and pepper on top .
column2: pinch your fingers in the salt and sprinkle some salt on top . pinch some pepper and sprinkle it on top .

column1: add salt and pepper on top .
column2: sprinkle salt on the top . sprinkle pepper on the top .

column1: add salt and pepper on top .
column2: grab a pinch of salt with your fingers and sprinkle over top . do the same with pepper .

column1: spread jam on on the cracker .
column2: now you want to use a spoon to scoop out the jam . take the spoon and carefully smear the jam all over the surface of your cracker .

column1: spread jam on on the cracker .
column2: take some jam with a spoon . spread the jam onto the cracker .

column1: spread jam on on the cracker .
column2: get a spoon . dip the spoon into the jam and place the jam on the bread . spread the jam around with the back of the spoon until the bread is covered .

column1: flip the foie gras over .
column2: cook one side of the foie gras in a hot pan . next pick up the pan in one hand and grab a spoon with the other . use the spoon to flip the foie gras over . move hot pan back over the burner to cook .

column1: flip the foie gras over .
column2: use a spoon to flip over the foie gras . cook the other side of the foie gras until it is golden brown .

column1: flip the foie gras over .
column2: use a spoon to pick up the foie gras . flip it over with the spoon .

column1: place the foie gras on the crackers .
column2: use a spoon to get the foie gras out of the pan . set the foie gras on top of the crackers on a plate .

column1: place the foie gras on the crackers .
column2: cook the foie grass in a pan . remove the pan from the stove . take the crackers on a plate . now take the foie gras with a spoon . place the foie gras on top of crackers .

column1: place the foie gras on the crackers .
column2: you will need foie gras rounds , crackers , a saute pan , 2 tablespoons butter , a spatula or spoon and other cracker topping if you wish . put the butter into the saute pan and heat on medium - high until the butter melts . add the foie gras to the pan and cook until one side is brown . use a spatula or spoon to turn the foie gras over and cook the other side until it is brown . use the spoon or spatula to take the cooked foie gras out of the pan and serve on crackers with your choice of other toppings .

column1: place the foie gras in the pan .
column2: take a pan and place it on the stove . add some oil in to the pan . heat the oil in the pan . take the foie gras from the plate . place the foie gras in to the pan .

column1: place the foie gras in the pan .
column2: now , once the pan is hot set the scored side down into the pan . make sure to keep your hands clear , as there will be a lot of fat forming and popping in the pan .

column1: place the foie gras in the pan .
column2: place foie gras into the pan . be careful because the fat may start to spatter .

column1: spread peanut butter on the cracker .
column2: take some peanut butter with a spoon . spread about 2 spoonfuls of peanut butter onto a cracker .

column1: spread peanut butter on the cracker .
column2: using a spoon , put the peanut butter on the cracker . smooth the peanut butter on the cracker .

column1: spread peanut butter on the cracker .
column2: take peanut butter in a bowl . take a cracker in hand . take a spoon and take some peanut butter . add the peanut butter on to the cracker . spread the peanut butter on the cracker .

column1: mix yeast water and sugar in a cup .
column2: take a measuring jar . add 1/4 cube of yeast in to the cup . add table spoon of sugar in to the cup . add 140 ml of lukewarm water in to the cup . mix everything properly .

column1: mix yeast water and sugar in a cup .
column2: put one quarter cube of yeast into a measuring cup . add 1 tablespoon of sugar . add 140 ml of of lukewarm water , then stir with a spoon .

column1: mix yeast water and sugar in a cup .
column2: first breakup about 1/4th milligrams of yeast in a 1 litter container . add one table spoon of sugar . add 140 milliliters of water . stir with whisk until smooth .

column1: mix flour oil salt and the yeast mixture together .
column2: get a large mixing bowl and place it on a steady surface . pour the flour , oil , salt and yeast you have measured into the bowl . use a hand mixer to carefully and slowly mix the ingredients . keep mixing until the mixture makes a large ball .

column1: mix flour oil salt and the yeast mixture together .
column2: pour flour into the bowl . add salt to the bowl next . then add oil to the bowl . next add yeast to the bowl . mix all ingredients together with a mixer .

column1: mix flour oil salt and the yeast mixture together .
column2: add 250 g of flour in to the mixing bowl . add 2 - 3 tablespoons of oil in to the bowl . add a teaspoon of salt in to the bowl . add yeast mixture in to the bowl . mix everything in to a dough .

column1: form the dough into a ball and cover .
column2: the dough should be a little sticky but not overly sticky . the dough should also be smooth and easy to mold . form the dough into a bowl and place into a bowl . place a towel over the bowl and cover and let rest for 30 minutes .

column1: form the dough into a ball and cover .
column2: grab all of your dough and roll it in your hands until it forms a ball . place the ball back in your pot and cover it with a kitchen towel .

column1: form the dough into a ball and cover .
column2: put dough in your hands and roll into a ball . put the dough ball in mixing bowl . cover bowl with a clean kitchen towel . leave in covered bowl for 30 minutes .

column1: knead the dough and cut into pieces .
column2: place floor on cutting board . place dough on cutting board . kneed dough by moving around on cutting board . flatten dough out . slice dough in strips with knife .

column1: knead the dough and cut into pieces .
column2: flour the work surface . knead the dough on the floured surface . flatten it and cut it into several pieces .

column1: knead the dough and cut into pieces .
column2: roll the dough into a ball . press the dough into the table with your hands . fold it in half and press again . repeat for a few minutes . cut the dough into five pieces that are all the same size .

column1: form each piece into a ball roll out and roll up .
column2: roll each piece of dough into a ball the size of a golf ball . use a rolling pin to flatten and stretch the dough by gently rolling toward your body , then away from your body . when then dough is flattened into a rectangle , use your fingers to roll the long edges of the rectangle until the dough looks like a log .

column1: form each piece into a ball roll out and roll up .
column2: loosely hold the dough with one hand . move the dough around like you 're rolling a ball . use a rolling pin to roll the ball out long and flat . make sure they are pretty thin . use both hands to roll into a hot dog shape .

column1: form each piece into a ball roll out and roll up .
column2: put each piece of dough on cutting board and form into small balls . use a rolling pin to roll each ball flat into an oval shape . roll the long side with your hands until you have long bars of dough .

column1: place on a pan and cover with a towel .
column2: place the dough apart from each other because they will rise . cover the dough with a towel and let rest for 30 minutes .

column1: place on a pan and cover with a towel .
column2: place a baking pan on the counter . cut and place a piece of wax paper long enough to fit in the baking pan . place the first rolled bread dough into the pan . place the other dough rolls in the pan with 2 - 3 inches between each roll . cover the pan with a clean dish towel .

column1: place on a pan and cover with a towel .
column2: place a sheet of wax paper on a cookie sheet . place your long rolls of batter side by side on the cookie sheet so they do n't touch . place a clean , light weight dish towel over the pan so all is covered .

column1: bake the bread in an oven .
column2: place the bread on a baking sheet , about 1 - 2 inches between the loaves . gently place the tray in the oven . leave the bread in the oven until fully cooked . leave on the counter to cool .

column1: bake the bread in an oven .
column2: put the dough on parchment paper on a baking sheet . next place in 200 degree oven . cook for 10 to 12 minutes .

column1: bake the bread in an oven .
column2: grab a pan . put wax paper on the pan . grab pieces of long dough and place them on the sheet of wax paper separate from each other . take the pan and place it in the oven . let the bread bake in the over for 40 minutes , then take it out and let it cool down .

column1: slice the bun and open it up .
column2: take the bun and turn it on one side . take a knife and cut one side of the bun , straight down the middle , long ways . be careful to not cut all the way through the bun . use your hands to open the bun through the area you cut .

column1: slice the bun and open it up .
column2: take the bun and slice it with a serrated knife down the side . do n't slice the bun completely into two pieces . open the bun like a book .

column1: slice the bun and open it up .
column2: take the bun of the bread and very carefully take your knife and cut it down the middle . then open the bun up .

column1: spread the bun with mustard .
column2: open up the bread . scoop up some mustard with the knife . using the knife , spread mustard on the open bread until the bread is covered in mustard .

column1: spread the bun with mustard .
column2: open the sliced bun . use a butter knife to spread mustard . spread mustard on both sides of bun .

column1: spread the bun with mustard .
column2: use butter knife to put mustard on bun . you will want to make sure both sides of bun are coated in mustard .

column1: place cucumber salad and then the hot dog on the bun .
column2: put cucumber salad on both sides of the bun . next add hot dog to the bun .

column1: place cucumber salad and then the hot dog on the bun .
column2: put the cucumbers on the bun in a single layer , covering both sides . place the hot dog on the middle of the bun on top of the cucumbers .

column1: place cucumber salad and then the hot dog on the bun .
column2: place sliced cucumbers all along both sides of a hot dog bun . place the sausage on the bun .

column1: drizzle ketchup and fried onions on top .
column2: place the hotdog on top of the pickles that are on the bun . make sure the hot dog is in the middle of the bun where the crease is . drizzle ketchup on top of the bun and hotdog . next add fried onions on top of the hotdog and bun . serve promptly . ( serve right after you are done ) .

column1: drizzle ketchup and fried onions on top .
column2: squirt ketchup bottle over hotdog . put the ketchup across the whole hotdog . take a spoon and scoop some friend onions . with the spoon , add the fried onions to the hotdog . put the spoon , fried onions , and ketchup away .

column1: drizzle ketchup and fried onions on top .
column2: squirt ketchup evenly through the hot dog . once ketchup is on the hot dog , place onions on top of the hot dog using a spoon . make sure to place onion inside of the bun , so that onion does not spill out .

column1: fry the garlic and ground beef with soy sauce sesame oil and sugar .
column2: put the chopped garlic into the hot pan and stir . add ground beef , soy sauce , sesame oil and sugar to the pan . use chop sticks to stir everything together while cooking .

column1: fry the garlic and ground beef with soy sauce sesame oil and sugar .
column2: place your chopped garlic into your pan . with a wooden spoon mix the garlic around so it is all over the pan . add your ground beef to the pan . add your soy sauce to the pan . add sesame oil to the pan .

column1: fry the garlic and ground beef with soy sauce sesame oil and sugar .
column2: pour the garlic in the pan . stir the garlic with chop sticks . pour in the beef . carefully pour in the soy sauce sesame oil and sugar .

column1: fry the carrots with oil and salt .
column2: pour the oil onto the pan . grab the carrots with your hands and place them in the pan . put salt on the carrots .

column1: fry the carrots with oil and salt .
column2: put a fry pan on the stove and add a little oil . turn on the heat . when the oil is hot , add the carrots , which have been cut into thin strip . add kosher salt . stir the carrots .

column1: fry the carrots with oil and salt .
column2: pour olive oil on the frying pan . place the carrots on the pan and cook them . add salt to the carrots and stir with a spoon .

column1: fry the zucchini with oil and salt .
column2: put a pan onto the burner and turn it on to a medium - high heat setting . add oil to the pan and let it warm up for 2 - 3 minutes . carefully add the cut zucchini and salt to the pan . let the zucchini cook until it is soft , stirring with a wooden spoon or spatula . turn the burner off and carefully pour the cooked zucchini onto a plate from the pan .

column1: fry the zucchini with oil and salt .
column2: add oil to the frying pan . mix the oil around so it cover the pan . add the zucchini to the pan . stir around so that it cooks . add salt to the pan and continue to mix .

column1: fry the zucchini with oil and salt .
column2: put a small amount of oil into a hot frying pan . add the sliced pieces of zucchini to the pan . sprinkle some kosher salt onto the zucchini . stir the zucchini in the pan with a spoon or chopsticks while it cooks in the pan . when it 's finished cooking , empty the zucchini from the hot pan onto a plate .

column1: mix pepper paste soy sauce rice vinegar and sesame seeds .
column2: put korean hot pepper paste , soy sauce , rice vinegar and sesame seeds into a cup . use a spoon to mix it all together .

column1: mix pepper paste soy sauce rice vinegar and sesame seeds .
column2: use a spoon to scoop the pepper paste into the a cup . pour soy sauce rice vinegar and sesame seeds into the same cup . mix everything with the spoon .

column1: mix pepper paste soy sauce rice vinegar and sesame seeds .
column2: in a small cup combine korean hot pepper paste , soy sauce , seasoned rice vinegar and sesame seeds . using a small spoon gently mix the ingredients together until well mixed .

column1: chop the garlic finely .
column2: put big pieces of garlic on the cutting board . get a knife from the cutting block . cut the big pieces of garlic into a lot of small pieces . put the small pieces of garlic into a bowl .

column1: chop the garlic finely .
column2: take peeled garlic cloves and put on cutting board . with a chef 's knife carefully chop the garlic finely . put chopped garlic in bowl .

column1: chop the garlic finely .
column2: hold the garlic carefully . cut the garlic with a knife into small pieces .

column1: fry the onion and mushrooms with soy sauce and sesame oil .
column2: use a knife to cut mushrooms and onions into big pieces and put them into the hot pan . use chopsticks to stir mushrooms and onions for a moment while they cook . pour a little soy sauce on top . pour a little sesame oil on top and stir everything together . when it finishes cooking , carefully empty it all onto a plate .

column1: fry the onion and mushrooms with soy sauce and sesame oil .
column2: pour the onion and mushrooms in the pan . pour in the soy sauce and oil . let them cook while mixing them with chopsticks .

column1: fry the onion and mushrooms with soy sauce and sesame oil .
column2: put chopped white onions into a hot pan . add sliced mushrooms to the same pan with the onions . add soy sauce and sesame oil to the pan of mushrooms and onions . stir to mix it all together . put the food on a plate .

column1: mix soy sauce and sesame oil with the bean sprouts and spinach .
column2: pour in the soy sauce . add some sesame oil into the bowl . mix together the bowl together using your hands .

column1: mix soy sauce and sesame oil with the bean sprouts and spinach .
column2: pour the bowl of soy sauce and sesame oil in both the spinach bowl and sprout bowl . use your hand to mix both the bowls up .

column1: mix soy sauce and sesame oil with the bean sprouts and spinach .
column2: place bean sprouts in one bowl . place spinach in a separate bowl . put sesame oil and soy sauce in bowl with bean sprouts . put sesame oil and soy sauce in bowl with spinach . mix each bowl with hands in order to get all three ingredients in the bowl evenly mixed .

column1: slice the mushrooms and zucchini .
column2: take the mushrooms and hold them carefully . cut them into thin lines . do the same with the zucchini but cut it into thin circles .

column1: slice the mushrooms and zucchini .
column2: slice shiitake mushrooms on diagonal with large knife . lay out on plate . slice zucchini all of it in half , approx . 1 inch thick . after you slice it , tear pieces and slice into cubes . spread slices onto a plate .

column1: slice the mushrooms and zucchini .
column2: with a sharp knife , slice the mushrooms into slices about 1/2 thick .  " . " cut a zucchini in half , and then in half again . " slice the zucchini into about 1/2 thick slices . " " . " slice them again , cutting the zucchini into small cubes .

column1: slice the carrot and seaweed .
column2: using a knife slice the carrot in half . using a knife slice the carrot into thin pieces . using kitchen scissors cut the seaweed into strips .

column1: slice the carrot and seaweed .
column2: use a knife and cut the carrot in half . slice each half of the carrot into small sections . set the carrot on a plate . use scissors to cut the seaweed into smaller sections .

column1: slice the carrot and seaweed .
column2: put a carrot on a board . use a sharp knife to cut the carrots into thin strips . use kitchen scissors to cut the seaweed into strips .

column1: place the beef vegetables and egg on a plate with rice .
column2: use a spoon to add pre - cooked steamed rice to the middle of the place . use another spoon to add one spoonful of cooked ground beef to one section of the plate . do not place ground beef on top of the rice . with kitchen tongs , or cleaned hands , add a small amount of dried seaweed next to ground beef , followed by a handful of sliced carrots next to the dried seaweed . add a handful of zucchini slices next to the sliced carrots followed by the sliced mushrooms , white onion , soy bean sprouts , and spinach . your spinach should be next to the ground beer when the circle around the steamed rice is completed . to finish , use a spatula to add the cooked egg on top of the pile of steamed rice on the center of the plate .

column1: place the beef vegetables and egg on a plate with rice .
column2: take a large plate and add a cup of rice in the middle . add some beef on side of plate . add cut strips of carrot and cucumber on side of plate . add other vegetables on the sides of the plate . add a cooked egg on top of rice .

column1: place the beef vegetables and egg on a plate with rice .
column2: use a small bowl to shape a rice pile on the center of the plate . place ground beef , dry seaweed , carrots , zucchini , mushrooms , white onion , soy bean sprouts , and cooked spinach around the rice completing a circle . place a fried egg on top of the rice pile .

column1: fry the egg in the pan .
column2: gently crack the egg into a hot pan that has 2 teaspoons of oil in it . do not try to flip the egg or stir it . cook the egg until the entire egg white is fully cooked , it will be the same white as a piece of paper .

column1: fry the egg in the pan .
column2: take a frying pan on the stove . heat the pan and add some oil in to the pan . after the oil is hot , take an egg . break open an egg and place it in the pan . fry the egg with yellow side upwards .

column1: fry the egg in the pan .
column2: crack an egg . be careful not to let any of the shell fall into the pan . add the egg to the pan with the yolk side facing up .

column1: blanch the bean sprouts and spinach .
column2: take a pot on the stove . boil some water in the pot . take some bean sprouts in a steel strainer and immerse in hot water and blanch them . now take the spinach in the strainer and blanch the spinach . take the bean sprouts and spinach in a plate .

column1: blanch the bean sprouts and spinach .
column2: put the bean sprouts in a strainer and lower the strainer into boiling water . lift the strainer of bean sprouts out of the water and pour into a bowl . put the spinach in a strainer and lower the strainer into boiling water . lift the strainer of spinach out of the water and pour into a bowl .

column1: blanch the bean sprouts and spinach .
column2: put a pot of water on the stove . turn on the stove . let water boil until you see bubbles . put bean sprouts in a strainer , dip strainer into water , take bean sprouts out and put them into a bowl , put spinach into the strainer , dip strainer into water . pour spinach into a bowl .

column1: add yeast and oil to the water .
column2: add your yeast to the water . now slowly pour some oil into the water and mix it all around with your hands . do n't mix to fast as it will spill over the edges .

column1: add yeast and oil to the water .
column2: crumble the yeast into the bowl of water . pour a bit of oil into the water . use your fingers to mix it all together .

column1: add yeast and oil to the water .
column2: carefully pour in the oil to the water . add the yeast to the water .

column1: add the water to the flour on the table .
column2: take some flour on the table . create a space in middle of flour by pushing the flour to the sides . add water in to the center space . mix the flour with water . add some more water and mix the dough properly .

column1: add the water to the flour on the table .
column2: take the container of water and slowly pour it inside the circle . push the circle back against the water .

column1: add the water to the flour on the table .
column2: spread the flour into a circle , creating a large hole of empty space for the water to be poured . slowly pour the water into flour circle , just enough so that it does n't spill over the edges . drag a small amount of flour from the edges into the water and mush the flour into the water until it creates a doughy center . add more water and mush more flour into it until the circle of flour is now a roll of dough . once you have a dough roll , continue pressing and squishing it by using the dry flour left on the counter to keep it from sticking to your fingers .

column1: add salt to the dough .
column2: sprinkle salt on top of the dough . use your hands to fold the dough in half so that the salt is in between layers of dough . use your hands to roll the dough .

column1: add salt to the dough .
column2: sprinkle salt over the top of the ball of dough . use your hands to push in the dough . roll the dough up and keep pushing to get the salt mixed in .

column1: add salt to the dough .
column2: sprinkle bowl of salt onto dough . fold the dough and then press it together with your hands until its mixed in .

column1: knead the dough .
column2: squish the dough into a ball . squish the ball of dough flat . repeat this for awhile to knead it .

column1: knead the dough .
column2: push down on the dough and roll it . repeat this step several times . pour olive oil on top of the dough .

column1: knead the dough .
column2: put some flour on the surface to knead the dough . use your hands to push down , roll , wrap and then repeat . then brush the dough with olive oil .

column1: coat the dough with oil and cover .
column2: put some olive oil on the dough . rub the dough with the olive oil . go find a small towel . put the towel over the dough . wait 20 minutes .

column1: coat the dough with oil and cover .
column2: take the dough and pour some oil onto it . rub the oil into the dough softly . place the cover onto the dough and let it cover for 20 minutes .

column1: coat the dough with oil and cover .
column2: pour oil on the dough . use your hands to rub the oil all over the dough . cover it with a cloth .

column1: cut the dough into pieces .
column2: using a knife carefully cut the dough . separate the dough evenly into four pieces .

column1: cut the dough into pieces .
column2: cut your dough into 4 even pieces . pieces should be about the size of a baseball .

column1: cut the dough into pieces .
column2: cut dough into four pieces . knead dough .

column1: spread tomato sauce onto the dough .
column2: take a spoonful of tomato sauce and pour it into the middle of the dough . now take the rounded edge of your spoon , and smear / spread the sauce around your dough . spread it in circles and make sure you get it up to the edges .

column1: spread tomato sauce onto the dough .
column2: using a ladle , scoop up some tomato sauce . pour the sauce onto the dough somewhere in the middle . using the bottom of the ladle , spread the sauce toward the edge of the dough in a circular motion .

column1: spread tomato sauce onto the dough .
column2: use a curved spoon . grab a spoon full to tomato sauce . spread the sauce on your dough . using a circular motion .

column1: top with mozzarella cheese oil and basil .
column2: put mozzarella cheese on top of the sauce part of the pizza . drizzle a little oil all over the cheese . rip some basil and put on top of the pizza . take a pan . place pizza on the pan .

column1: top with mozzarella cheese oil and basil .
column2: pizza dough should be flat and topped with red sauce . sprinkle mozzarella cheese over whole pizza . pour a small amount of oil over pizza . rip basil leaves into small pieces . sprinkle basil leaves over pizza .

column1: top with mozzarella cheese oil and basil .
column2: take your mozzarella cheese and spread it all over your dough . now take your olive oil and gently pour it over the dough . do n't use to much though . just a light sprinkling . now take the cut basil and add as much as you would like on top of the cheese .

column1: cook the pizza in the oven .
column2: turn the oven on , so that it is set at 400 degrees . wait for the oven to beep . put the pizza pan with the pizza on it in the oven . wait 20 minutes while it cooks . take the pizza out of the oven using oven mitts .

column1: cook the pizza in the oven .
column2: carefully place your pizza on your pizza paddle . carefully place it into an oven that is turned onto 400 degrees . leave the pizza for 20 minutes .

column1: cook the pizza in the oven .
column2: move pizza onto wooden paddle . slide into wood fire oven . cook until golden .

column1: add butter to the macaroni and stir .
column2: add the butter to the macaroni . make sure the noodles are still hot . this will insure that the butter melts . stir it thoroughly . until the butter is melted .

column1: add butter to the macaroni and stir .
column2: put butter into the bowl of macaroni . use a spoon to stir the butter into the pasta .

column1: add butter to the macaroni and stir .
column2: take a table spoon . add 2 table spoon of fresh butter to the macaroni . stir the macaroni and butter together . stirring can be done with the help of a spatula .

column1: add cheez whiz and stir .
column2: put cheez whiz into the bowl of noodles . stir it into the noodles .

column1: add cheez whiz and stir .
column2: open a jar of cheez wiz . take a spoon and scrape all of the cheese out of the jar into the hot pot . hold the pot handle and stir the cheese into hot macaroni until it melts . you can also use velveeta cheese if you want .

column1: add cheez whiz and stir .
column2: open cheez whiz . put the cheeze whiz in . mix together .

column1: add milk and stir .
column2: add 4 cups of milk to the pot . use a spoon to carefully stir .

column1: add milk and stir .
column2: measure four cups of milk into a measuring cup . pour it into the macaroni mixture and stir it up well .

column1: add milk and stir .
column2: pour four cups of milk into the pot . stir it up !

column1: pour macaroni into a pan .
column2: pour some macaroni in the pan . use a spoon to spread it around some .

column1: pour macaroni into a pan .
column2: take a spoon and stir the macaroni . then pick up the pan , tilt it and pour the macaroni into the foil pan .

column1: pour macaroni into a pan .
column2: take your pan and slowly pour the macaroni into the pan . do n't pour to fast , or it will go everywhere . now spread the macaroni around so it lays in the pan flat .

column1: sprinkle cheese on top .
column2: make sure the noodles are evenly spread along the pan . open the bag of shredded cheese . sprinkle the cheese on top of the macaroni . make sure that the cheese is evenly distributed too . if there are any spots uncovered , add more cheese .

column1: sprinkle cheese on top .
column2: take mild cheddar cheese packets . cut open them . add cheese on the top of prepared dish . add second packet of cheese . spread the cheese properly .

column1: sprinkle cheese on top .
column2: sprinkle a layer of mild cheddar cheese on top of the macaroni noodles . sprinkle a layer of sharp cheddar cheese on top of the mild cheddar cheese .

column1: add layers of macaroni and cheese .
column2: pour the macaroni on the top . pour cheese on top of the macaroni evenly .

column1: add layers of macaroni and cheese .
column2: prepare the pan for the macaroni and cheese . put some macaroni into the pan and spread it . add some cheese to it and spread it on top . add some more macaroni for another layer . add more cheese to finish it .

column1: add layers of macaroni and cheese .
column2: add a layer of macaroni into the tray . add another layer of cheese . add another layer of macaroni into the tray . add another layer of cheese over the macaroni .

column1: mince cabbage and chop some green onions .
column2: take a half of a cabbage . mince it . take the green onions and mince them .

column1: mince cabbage and chop some green onions .
column2: cut the cabbage into long strands or pieces with a knife . be careful it 's probably sharp . get some green onions and cut them to small pieces also with a knife .

column1: mince cabbage and chop some green onions .
column2: take your clever or knife and slowly chop the cabbage starting at the edge . keep your fingers out of the way ! just slowly press the sharp edge down on the cabbage and mince the cabbage up with small chops . now we want to take the green onion and chop it up as well . just line up the long onion stems and make small cuts across all of the onions , until you have the desired amount that you want .

column1: add chopped green onions cabbage and ground pork to a large bowl .
column2: gather ground pork , already cut up green onions , and already cut cabbage . put ground pork in a big bowl . add in green onions an adult has cut up for you . put in cabbage an adult has cut for you .

column1: add chopped green onions cabbage and ground pork to a large bowl .
column2: hold the pork over the bowl and carefully push it out with chopsticks . add the green onions in the bowl .

column1: add chopped green onions cabbage and ground pork to a large bowl .
column2: add the ground pork to a bowl . cut green onions into small pieces . cut the cabbage into long strips . add green onions and cabbage to the bowl .

column1: add soy sauce sesame oil and salt and mix together .
column2: take the small bowl that has two tablespoons of soy sauce and pour it into the big bowl with the cabbage . next take your small bowl with two tablespoons of sesame oil and pour it into the big bowl as well . finally take the small bowl that has one tablespoon of salt and pour it into the big bowl with your other ingredients . shake the bowl to make sure you get all of it out . take your chopsticks and use those to mix all ingredients in the mix bowl together .

column1: add soy sauce sesame oil and salt and mix together .
column2: pour two tablespoons of soy sauce into the mixing bowl . pour two tablespoons of sesame oil . gently pour salt into a tablespoon and then add that to the bowl also . use a wooden spoon to mix your ingredients together . stir until the ingredients are very thoroughly mixed together .

column1: add soy sauce sesame oil and salt and mix together .
column2: put mixture in large metal bowl . dump in 2 tablespoons of soy sauce . dump in 2 tablespoons of sesame oil . dump in 1 tablespoon of salt . mix it all up with chopsticks , or a spatula .

column1: add chopped carrots and shiitake mushrooms and mix .
column2: add the cut up carrots and shiitake mushroom pieces . mix everything together .

column1: add chopped carrots and shiitake mushrooms and mix .
column2: mix the basic pot sticker ingredients well in a large bowl . chop 1 or more carrots on the cutting board into small pieces ( ~ 1 cup ) . chop shiitake mushrooms on the cutting board to make 1 cup of small pieces . add both the carrots and mushrooms to the pot sticker bowl . stir the carrots and mushrooms into the pot sticker ingredients .

column1: add chopped carrots and shiitake mushrooms and mix .
column2: you 're going to cut carrots and the shiitake mushrooms into small pieces . add small cut up carrots and mushrooms to the mix .

column1: place 1 tbsp of the filling in the center of a pot sticker wrapper .
column2: wash your hands and grab a clean spoon . open up your package of pot sticker wrappers . grab one pot sticker wrapper out of the bag . fill your clean spoon completely with the pork mixture that you made . add the pork mixture to the middle of the wrapper and seal the edges of the wrap tightly with your fingers .

column1: place 1 tbsp of the filling in the center of a pot sticker wrapper .
column2: 1 tbsp of ground pork mix in the center of the potsticker wrapper . keep filling one wrapper after the next .

column1: place 1 tbsp of the filling in the center of a pot sticker wrapper .
column2: take the filling in a bowl . take the pot stick wrapper in the hand . take a spoon . add one tablespoon of filling in the center of pot stick wrapper . place it aside from the hand .

column1: place the pot sticker wrapper on the dumpling and seal the edges with water .
column2: lay the potsticker down on top of a potsticker mold . put some water in a small dish and use your fingers to rub the water all over the edges of the dough . fold both sides of the mold together and press hard until both sides of the dough are stuck together and sealed . then open up the mold and there you have your potsticker .

column1: place the pot sticker wrapper on the dumpling and seal the edges with water .
column2: grab sticker dough onto the mold . next place your ingredients in the middle of the dough . now using your fingers , rub some water on the edges of the dough . finally , press each side of the mold together . press tightly .

column1: place the pot sticker wrapper on the dumpling and seal the edges with water .
column2: place the pot sticker on the dumpling mold . fill the dumpling with the mixture . spread water on the edges . close the mold to seal the pot sticker .

column1: heat a pan and spread vegetable oil on the surface .
column2: put 1 tablespoon of vegetable into a non - stick pan . spread the oil around the pan .

column1: heat a pan and spread vegetable oil on the surface .
column2: take a medium sized pan . place it on the stove and on the stove . heat the pan . add some vegetable oil on to the pan . spread the oil uniformly on the pan .

column1: heat a pan and spread vegetable oil on the surface .
column2: how to cook pot stickers . add 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil to a non stick pan . using chopsticks grab a frozen pot sticker . spread the oil around with pot sticker in circles .

column1: lay the pot stickers and cook both the sides until they are golden brown .
column2: lay in the pot sticker in the pan and cook until they are golden brown . once they are done , flip them over and browned the other side as well .

column1: lay the pot stickers and cook both the sides until they are golden brown .
column2: get a pan and put some oil in the pan . put the pan on the stove . turn the heat on and wait for the oil to heat up . when the oil is hot , gently and carefully lay your potstickers in the pan . make sure not to touch the pan or the oil . cook the potstickers until they are brown on the bottom . when the potstickers are a golden brown color , turn them over with chop sticks or a fork and cook the other side until the same color as the other side .

column1: lay the pot stickers and cook both the sides until they are golden brown .
column2: lay the pot stickers in the pan . cook until the first side is golden brown . next flip them over and cook until golden brown .

column1: once they are browned pour some water and cover with a lid and cook .
column2: when the potstickers are brown , pour a little water from a cup into the pan so that the bottom of the pan is covered . cover the pot with a lid . turn the heat down to medium . continue cooking for 3 - 5 minutes , or until the water is gone .

column1: once they are browned pour some water and cover with a lid and cook .
column2: when they look brown pour water in the pan . cover the pan with the top and like them cook like that more .

column1: once they are browned pour some water and cover with a lid and cook .
column2: take a small cup of water and pour it into your pan of pot stickers . the water should not cover the pot stickers up it should only come up a little under half way of the pot sticker . cover up your pan of pot stickers with a lid that fits your pan . turn the dial on your stove down to medium heat and let your pot stickers cook for about 3 to 5 minutes , this is around the same time it will take until all the water in the pan is gone .

column1: combine the cheeses mustard paprika and pepper in a small bowl .
column2: use measuring spoons to add the spices to the shredded cheese . first , 1 teaspoon of dry mustard . then , 1/2 teaspoon of paprika . last , 1/4 teaspoon of black pepper that was just ground by a pepper grinder . use your fingers to mix the spices and the cheese together really well .

column1: combine the cheeses mustard paprika and pepper in a small bowl .
column2: mix together in a bowl . 1 teaspoon of dry mustard . 1/2 teaspoon of smoke paprika . 1/4 teaspoon of freshly ground black pepper .

column1: combine the cheeses mustard paprika and pepper in a small bowl .
column2: mix together the cheeses , mustard , paprika and pepper . place in a small bowl .

column1: divide the cheese mixture evenly between the spatula - trays and set aside .
column2: take some foil and place it around the spatula . put some cheese onto the spatula .

column1: divide the cheese mixture evenly between the spatula - trays and set aside .
column2: take half of the cheese and put on one spatula tray . put the rest of the cheese on the other spatula tray .

column1: divide the cheese mixture evenly between the spatula - trays and set aside .
column2: make a tray on 2 hamburger turners . use foil to make the top of the hamburger turners into boats . now you have a bed for cheese . put one half of your cheese on each bed . it 's ok if one bed gets more than the other just try hard to make them even .

column1: set the cheese - filled spatula - trays on the grill .
column2: put the cheese down on the grill but make sure it is not on top of the coals . be sure it is on the other side so it receives indirect heat . make sure the cheese does not burn . shift the cheese often from one side to the other side facing the heat so it melts well . this will take 6 to 9 minutes .

column1: set the cheese - filled spatula - trays on the grill .
column2: put the cheese onto the grill . be sure the cheese is not on direct heat , or it will burn . leave the cheese on the grill for about 6 to 9 minutes .

column1: set the cheese - filled spatula - trays on the grill .
column2: put the cheese filled spatula trays on the grill . you will have to move the spatula trays around a few times while they cook . it will take 69 minutes to cook .

column1: cook the cheese until the cheese melts and bubbles around the edges .
column2: place on the grill and cook until the cheese begins to bubble , about 9 minutes . allow it to stay on the grill until it bubbles .

column1: cook the cheese until the cheese melts and bubbles around the edges .
column2: heat the charcoal grill . place tin foil boats on grill . cook for 8 to 9 minutes until it bubbles around the edges .

column1: grill the bread on each side .
column2: spread butter on each side of the bread using a knife . place the bread on the grill . grill each side until browned . flip the bread and repeat . take it off the grill .

column1: grill the bread on each side .
column2: put the bread on the grill with long tongs or pinchers . move the bread around a lot , flip it over . it is better to put it on the side of the grill where it is n't too hot . do not move the bread with your hands always use a grill tool . cook until it looks toasted .

column1: grill the bread on each side .
column2: use tongs to put the bread on the hot grill . do n't leave the bread alone ! it can burn quickly . as soon as you see dark lines on the bottom side of the bread , then flip it over . once both sides have dark lines , the slices of bread can be taken off the grill .

column1: remove the bread from the grill .
column2: use tongs to remove the break from the grill . place them on a sheet of tin foil .

column1: remove the bread from the grill .
column2: lay down enough foil to cover the counter top work area . get a pair of long handled tongs . open the lid of the bbq grill . carefully grip each bread slice . place each slice onto the foil .

column1: drizzle cheese onto one slice of bread .
column2: bend the foil with your tongs . use the tongs to scrape the cheese onto the bread .

column1: drizzle cheese onto one slice of bread .
column2: open your foil wrapper that has the hot cheese inside . take a fork and push the cheese onto the top of the bread . spread the cheese around the top of the bread .

column1: drizzle cheese onto one slice of bread .
column2: be extremely careful as the cheese will be really hot . have a parent help to fold down the front of the aluminum foil . holding the foil up pour the cheese onto the burger . you can use the tongs to help get the cheese onto the burger .

column1: top it with the a second slice of bread .
column2: place the other slice of bread on top . use foil to wrap up the sandwich .

column1: top it with the a second slice of bread .
column2: using a spoon , put the sauce on top of the bottom loaf of bread . then place the other loaf of bread on top of the sauce . wrap the sandwich with the foil paper .

column1: top it with the a second slice of bread .
column2: take two slices of bread on a foil . toast the two slices of bread . on one slice of bread add the mixture on top . place the other slice on top of other bread . wrap the sandwich in the aluminum foil .

column1: fold the foil around the sandwich .
column2: put the sandwich on its own piece of aluminum foil . roll the sandwich inside the foil to make a tube shape . then roll and scrunch up the ends of the tube so they are closed and the sandwich is all wrapped up .

column1: fold the foil around the sandwich .
column2: wrap the sandwich in the aluminum foil ( shiny silver foil ) to cover the whole sandwich . put the sandwich inside the oven for 2 - 3 minutes to warm it up . take the sandwich out of the oven .

column1: fold the foil around the sandwich .
column2: take the silver wrapping foil and put the bread in it . fold the wrapping foil up . put the wrapped up bread back on heat to keep it warm .

column1: place the wrapped sandwich on the grill .
column2: pick up foil - wrapped sandwich . place sandwich on the coolest part of the grill .

column1: place the wrapped sandwich on the grill .
column2: wrap the sandwich into foil tightly . walk over to grill and make sure it is on . place the foil onto the grill . step away so you do n't get burned .

column1: place the wrapped sandwich on the grill .
column2: wrap the sandwich up in aluminum foil where it is all covered . put it on the grill on the side where the coals are not .

column1: add chicken ribs to a bowl of water and let it boil .
column2: put the chicken ribs in the pan . let the water start bubbling .

column1: add chicken ribs to a bowl of water and let it boil .
column2: take a large cooking pot and place it on your stove . fill the pot with 8 cups of water . place chicken ribs into the water in the pot . turn the dial on the stove to high and wait for the water to start to boil .

column1: add chicken ribs to a bowl of water and let it boil .
column2: fill a pot with water . add chicken ribs to the water . " turn the stove on high " " setting . " " . " wait for the water to boil . have an adult near to help .

column1: pound the shallots cut the chili pepper cut the lemon grass into slices and cut some galongo .
column2: take the shallots and pound them . next take the peppers and pound them and slit them down the middle . take the lemon grass and slice it down the stalk into two pieces and then pound it . add about 4 slices of galonga to the ingredients .

column1: pound the shallots cut the chili pepper cut the lemon grass into slices and cut some galongo .
column2: crush the shallots to release their flavor . crush the chili peppers , cut them in the middle and set aside . cut the lemongrass in half , then crush it lightly . cut up 4 slices of galongo .

column1: pound the shallots cut the chili pepper cut the lemon grass into slices and cut some galongo .
column2: take some shallots and place the knife on the shallots and crush the shallots . take 2 - 3 red chilies and crush them with knife . cut the red chilies in to two halves . cut the lemon grass in to pieces . take some galongo and cut in to small pieces .

column1: remove the foamy froth from the boiling water .
column2: after the water boils , use a long ladle spoon to scoop out the foam . repeat the process and remove all of the foam from the soup . when the water is clear , most of the dirty foam should be out .

column1: remove the foamy froth from the boiling water .
column2: boil the water . using a ladle remove the foamy froth from the boiling water until it is clear .

column1: remove the foamy froth from the boiling water .
column2: once the water is boiling , get your ladle . use the ladle to scoop the foam off the top of the boiling water . once the foam changes to a white color and the water is clearer you can stop scooping out the foam .

column1: add the shallots chili pepper and lemon grass into the bowl and cover the lid .
column2: add the lemon grass in to the bowl . add 2 chili peppers in to the bowl . add some shallots in to the bowl . cover the lid . simmer the stove and let it boil for 30 minutes .

column1: add the shallots chili pepper and lemon grass into the bowl and cover the lid .
column2: add shallots to the broth in the pot . then add one or two lemon grass stalks to the pot . then add whole dried chili peppers . cover with lid and simmer and cook for 30 minutes .

column1: add the shallots chili pepper and lemon grass into the bowl and cover the lid .

column1: add chicken to water and cook until tender and remove .

column1: add tofu puffs lime juice fish sauce and brown sugar to pan .

column1: add tofu puffs lime juice fish sauce and brown sugar to pan .

column1: heat fragrant oil in sauce pan and cook prawn shells .

column1: heat fragrant oil in sauce pan and cook prawn shells .

column1: heat fragrant oil in sauce pan and cook prawn shells .
column2: clean the prawns by removing the shell and removing the vein . keep the shells in a bowl for the next step . next we will get the oil ready by heating it in a sauce pan . once it is hot , slowly add the shells to the pan with the oil and cook while stirring with a wood spoon for one to two minutes or until the shells are red in color and smell good . pour the oil over a bowl in a metal strainer and throw away the shells . keep the oil because we will use it to fry the paste . fill another pot of water and heat it until it bubbling hot . add the rice noodle to the boiling water , stirring occasionally . after straining and removing the rice noodles , add a little more water to the pot and heat back up until it is bubbling . use the slotted spoon or strainer to remove the prawns once cooked . use a spatula to stir the paste while cooking . make sure to keep stirring the paste and mixing all of the paste so none of it burns . cook until you can see oil spots on top of the paste . after frying the thinly sliced shallots , remove with a slotted spoon or strainer to a paper towel .
