column2: pick up the box with the chicken on the front . open the box . take out one cube . open the foil . drop the rectangle shaped seasoning in the pot .

column1: add one chicken stock cube .
column2: open the knorr chicken stock container open , and take one cube out . unwrap the chicken stock cube . place the chicken stock cube in the pot . stir with a spoon .

column1: add one chicken stock cube .
column2: unwrap one knorr chicken cube . put one chicken cube into the pot .

column1: add onion garlic and ginger slice and chicken filet to a sauce pan and cook .
column2: add your medium chopped onion first using your wooden spoon to push all of it into the pot give it a quick mix with your spoon . add your two cloves chopped garlic and one sliced ginger again using your spoon to push it into the pot and to give it a mix . then add the chicken breast filet pieces into the pot . again give it mix with your spoon and let it cook .

column1: add onion garlic and ginger slice and chicken filet to a sauce pan and cook .
column2: cut up garlic , onion and ginger . place sauce pan on stove . add vegetables to pan . stir vegetables . add chicken to pan and let it cook .

column1: add onion garlic and ginger slice and chicken filet to a sauce pan and cook .
column2: add chopped onion , chopped garlic and sliced ginger to hot pan . add chicken breast filet . use wooden spoon to stir chicken in pan .

column1: add some chopped cucumber and red chili .
column2: add the papaya to the pot . add the annatto to the pot . use a spoon to stir into the sauce .

column1: add some chopped cucumber and red chili .
column2: take a glass bowl on the stove . cook the ingredients in the bowl . cut the cucumber in to pieces . add the cucumber in to the bowl . add some red chili in to the bowl .

column1: add some chopped cucumber and red chili .
column2: with a spoon add some cumbers into the bowl . with a spoon add some red chili with a spoon .

column1: add spinach leaves to the pan .
column2: put chili leaves in the pot . use a spoon to stir the leaves in the pot .

column1: add spinach leaves to the pan .
column2: put speech leaves into the pan . use the spoon to stir the leaves in to the mixture .

column1: add spinach leaves to the pan .
column2: take spinach leaves with your hand and place them into the bowl . with a wooden spoon mix the mixture together .

column1: add milk to the onions and stir .
column2: hold the milk over the pan . carefully pour the milk in the pan slowly . use a wooden spoon to stir everything together .

column1: add milk to the onions and stir .
column2: now we want to add in our milk . as we pour the milk in with the onions , make sure you keep stirring with your spatula or spoon . add a little more milk if it looks like the dish could use it . you want your onions to be submerged in milk .

column1: add milk to the onions and stir .
column2: pour the milk onto the cooking onions . use a wooden spoon to mix the onions and milk . keep stirring so there are no lumps . keep cooking and stirring until the milk boils and the sauce gets thicker .

column1: mash the potatoes with a masher .
column2: take the lid off of the pot . use a potato masher to mash the potatoes . mash the potatoes until there are n't any lumps .

column1: mash the potatoes with a masher .
column2: drain the boiled potatoes . use a potato masher to mash the potatoes . keep mashing until the big chunks are broken up .

column1: mash the potatoes with a masher .
column2: now take your potato masher , or a large fork and start to smash you potatoes . make sure you smash them fine , because we do not want them to have chunks . we can also use an electric mixer if you have one available .

column1: add salt pepper and flour to the onions .
column2: be careful because the hot oil may spatter , and could burn you . stand back as you add the ingredients in the next steps . add the salt and pepper that you measured earlier to the pan with the onions . then add the flour that you measured earlier to the pan with the onions . stir the onions well until the flour is completely coated with oil and mixed with the onions .

column1: add salt pepper and flour to the onions .
column2: pour in salt and pepper to the pan . add the flour . use a stirring spoon to mix everything .

column1: add salt pepper and flour to the onions .
column2: add salt and pepper to the pot with the onions . add flour to the pot . mix carefully with a wooden spoon .

column1: add butter and milk to the mashed potatoes and mix .
column2: measure out about 2 tablespoons of butter . add it to the pot of potatoes . measure about 2 tablespoons of milk . you can use cream instead of milk . pour milk into pot of potatoes . use a fork to stir the potatoes .

column1: add butter and milk to the mashed potatoes and mix .
column2: add butter into the pot . pour in milk to the mashed potatoes . use a whisk and stir the mixture together .

column1: add butter and milk to the mashed potatoes and mix .
column2: cut a piece of a stick of butter into the potatoes . pour milk in the potatoes . use a fork to mix everything together .

column1: add butter and onions to the pan .
column2: take a pan on the stove . add some butter in to the pan . melt the butter in the pan . take an onion and cut in to small pieces . add the onions in to the pan and mix .

column1: add butter and onions to the pan .
column2: add butter to the pan . put the chopped onions in the pan . cook the onions in the butter but do n't let them turn brown .

column1: add butter and onions to the pan .
column2: chop an onion into small pieces , so that you have 4 ounces . melt some butter in a pan . cook the onions gently in the melted butter until they are softened and clear , but not browned . stir the onions while they are cooking .

column1: place the sausages mashed potatoes and onion sauce on a serving plate .
column2: use tongs to place a few sausages on a plate . get a big spoon and spoon some potatoes onto the plate . use a spoon to put some gravy on the plate .

column1: place the sausages mashed potatoes and onion sauce on a serving plate .
column2: use tongs to put two pieces of sausage on a serving plate . use a spatula to put mashed potatoes and onion sauce on a serving plate .

column1: place the sausages mashed potatoes and onion sauce on a serving plate .
column2: to plate your dish , you will need the cooked sausages , the mashed potatoes and the onion sauce and your serving plates . first use tongs to put 2 sausages on the plate at 12 o'clock . use a large spoon to serve a generous scoop of mashed potatoes at 3 o'clock on the plate . add the onion sauce to the plate at 9 o'clock . you can spread some onion sauce in toward the center of the plate between the sausage and potatoes . enjoy .

column1: add pork and shrimp into a bowl season with salt sugar garlic shallots pepper and chicken stock .
column2: take both your minced shrimp and pork and combine them into the same mixing bowl . you can then lightly season your meat mixture with salt , sugar , and some chicken stock . you only need 1/2 a teaspoon of each . now you can add a tablespoon of shallots and a tablespoon of minced garlic . now you can shake some pepper into your bowl . last , you will mix everything together in a circular motion using your hand .

column1: add pork and shrimp into a bowl season with salt sugar garlic shallots pepper and chicken stock .
column2: put on some gloves . place the pork and shrimp in the bowl . pour the salt sugar salt sugar garlic shallots pepper and chicken stock on top of the meat in the bowl .

column1: add pork and shrimp into a bowl season with salt sugar garlic shallots pepper and chicken stock .
column2: add chopped up pork and shrimp to the bowl . add sugar , salt , garlic , shallots , pepper , and chicken stock to the bowl . use your hands to mix everything up good .

column1: add the mushrooms carrots glass noodles into a bowl and mix .
column2: add the mushrooms , carrots , and glass noodles to the bowl . mix them with your hands . add some egg whites and mix them again . let them sit for about 15 minutes .

column1: add the mushrooms carrots glass noodles into a bowl and mix .
column2: pour all the shredded mushrooms , carrots , and glass noodles into a large bowl . mix everything in the bowl together really well with your hands . pour in one egg or egg white . this will make the mixed food sticky . mix well again with your hands and let it sit for 15 minutes without touching it .

column1: add the mushrooms carrots glass noodles into a bowl and mix .
column2: get a big bowl . add the shredded mushroom , shredded carrots and the glass noodles to the bowl and mix with your hands really well . now take an egg and crack it into a separate bowl . add the egg to the mixed - up vegetables and noodles in the bowl , and mix well with your hands . the egg will help it all stick together . leave it to sit for 15 minutes .

column1: wipe the rice paper with a damp cloth .
column2: take the rice paper and place it onto a damp cloth . press the damn cloth onto the rice paper . continue this until the rice paper is completely damp .

column1: wipe the rice paper with a damp cloth .
column2: get a small rag and set it slightly until it is damp . wring out excess water . lay your damp cloth on the table . place rice paper flat on top of the damp cloth . good cloth gently over the rice paper , and press gently to moisten the rice paper . repeat for each piece of rice paper .

column1: wipe the rice paper with a damp cloth .
column2: place the rice paper onto a large damp cloth . fold the damp cloth over the rice paper and press down . you are moistening the rice paper with the damp cloth . rotate until the whole rice paper is damp .

column1: place the fillings on one end of the rice paper and roll .
column2: lay out the rice paper . next add the filling to the top of the rice paper . start rolling the rice paper to just past the center . then fold the ends over . then continue rolling forward to the end of the paper .

column1: place the fillings on one end of the rice paper and roll .
column2: gather the fillings at one end of the sticky paper . make the filling into the shape of an thick tube . roll the sticky paper forward while keeping the fillings inside . fold each end of the sticky paper in , like you are wrapping a gift ! close it up when you get to the end and you 're done !

column1: place the fillings on one end of the rice paper and roll .
column2: take your fillings and place them into the rice paper roll . make sure you flatten the ingredients out well so you can roll the paper . push the filling to one end of paper circle . now begin rolling the paper with the fillings inward , until you make it halfway . now fold the ends in to the middle of the paper , and continue to roll the paper until you reach the end .

column1: place the rolls in a pan of hot oil .
column2: use tongs or chopsticks to grab the rolls . very slowly place rolls one at a time into the pan of hot oil . be careful of splashing the oil .

column1: place the rolls in a pan of hot oil .
column2: turn the stove onto medium . add the egg rolls into the pan with a metal hand cooking tool that looks like chop sticks . the rolls might be sticky at first so leave some space between the rolls .

column1: place the rolls in a pan of hot oil .
column2: pour oil in pan and turn gas onto medium heat . wait until oil begins to heat up . slowly place rolls in pan using tongs , leaving space between rolls . fry on each side for about 5 to 6 minutes . remove with tongs and place onto paper towels .

column1: remove the rolls from the oil and serve with a sauce .
column2: carefully remove the egg rolls with chopsticks from hot oil . place on a paper towel . after oil is off the rolls , place on a plate . you can dip them in sauce .

column1: remove the rolls from the oil and serve with a sauce .
column2: use tongs to carefully grab the rolls from the oil . grab them one by one and take them out of the oil .

column1: remove the rolls from the oil and serve with a sauce .
column2: use your tongs and remove the rolls from the hot oil . set the hot rolls on a paper towel . serve the rolls with sauce .

column1: add an egg to a bowl of carrots onions tofu mushrooms pork salt sugar and pepper .
column2: crack the egg in half . put the egg into the bowl . put salt in the bowl . put sugar in the bowl . put pepper in the bowl .

column1: add an egg to a bowl of carrots onions tofu mushrooms pork salt sugar and pepper .
column2: take a bowl and add grated carrot in to the bowl . add cut pieces of onion and mushrooms in to the bowl . add cut pieces of tofu and pork in to the bowl . add salt and pepper in to the bowl . break open an egg and add it in to the bowl .

column1: add an egg to a bowl of carrots onions tofu mushrooms pork salt sugar and pepper .
column2: once pork , shredded carrots , chopped onion , tofu have been added to the bowl , season with salt , sugar and pepper . crack and add a whole egg to the mix . mix thoroughly .

column1: place the filling on one end of the sheet and roll .
column2: place some of your filling into a sheet . take the corners of the sheet and push the filling . roll it slowly until its completely rolled .

column1: place the filling on one end of the sheet and roll .
column2: place the filling on one small end of the wrap sheet . pinch the end with the filling . while pinching it together wrap over the filling and keep rolling it .

column1: place the filling on one end of the sheet and roll .
column2: the sheet is fragile , so be careful not to rip or fold it . put the amount of filling we measured out before onto the right end of the sheet , leaving a little bit of the sheet uncovered . use both hands to grab the bit of sheet you left uncovered , and roll it over the top of the filling . keep rolling carefully until the entire sheet is wrapped around the filling . you do not need to fold the ends of the sheet when you are done .

column1: cut the rolls on top of a bowl of rice noodles and serve with herbs and sauce .
column2: cut the rolls in small pieces . put them on top of the noddles . add fresh vegetables and herbs . mix and serve .

column1: cut the rolls on top of a bowl of rice noodles and serve with herbs and sauce .
column2: take a bowl of rice noodles . take the rolls on a plate . cut the rolls in to inch sized pieces and add it to the rice bowl . add herbs in to the rice bowl . add some sauce in to the bowl and mix it .

column1: cut the rolls on top of a bowl of rice noodles and serve with herbs and sauce .
column2: take a roll and some scissors . cut the roll into bite - sized pieces on top of the bowl of noodles . add a few herbs and some sauce . mix the ingredients together in the bowl and serve .

column1: cook bulgur wheat in boiled water .
column2: take your bulgur wheat and slowly add it to the 2 cups of boiling water . do not pour it in to fast , or it may cause the water to splash out and burn you . now let the bulgur wheat cook until the water has evaporated .

column1: cook bulgur wheat in boiled water .
column2: the water in the pot will be bubbling . pour the wheat into the pot carefully and slowly so it does not spill . let the wheat cook in the pot .

column1: cook bulgur wheat in boiled water .
column2: boil two cups of water . now add a spoon to add your bulgur wheat with a spoon into the boiling water . cook it until the water evaporates or is completely gone .

column1: mix lemon juice minced garlic and olive oil .
column2: add 3 tablespoons of lemon juice to a small bowl . next add the cut up garlic to the bowl . then add the olive oil to the bowl . stir ingredients together in the bowl .

column1: mix lemon juice minced garlic and olive oil .
column2: get a spoon or whisk . stir in a circle : lemon juice , minced garlic , and olive oil .

column1: mix lemon juice minced garlic and olive oil .
column2: mix lemon juice , garlic , and olive oil . stir them together .

column1: add salt and pepper and mix again .
column2: take a small bowl . break open some eggs and add it in to the bowl . add some salt in to the bowl . add some pepper powder in to the bowl . mix everything properly with a spoon .

column1: add salt and pepper and mix again .
column2: put eggs in a bowl . use a fork to mix the eggs . add salt and pepper to the eggs . use a fork to mix the salt and pepper into the eggs .

column1: add salt and pepper and mix again .
column2: add salt to the dressing in the bowl . then add pepper to the dressing . stir the salt and pepper into the dressing .

column1: mix the cooked bulgur wheat boiled chickpeas diced tomato cucumber leeks and parsley .
column2: cook bulgur wheat according to package directions . boil chickpeas . chop up tomatoes , cucumbers , leeks and any other vegetables / whole herbs that you would like to add . mix all ingredients well in a bowl .

column1: mix the cooked bulgur wheat boiled chickpeas diced tomato cucumber leeks and parsley .
column2: take a small bowl and add cooked bulgur wheat in to the bowl . add the boiled chick peas in to the bowl . cut the tomatoes in to cube size pieces and add it to the bowl . cut the tomato in to small pieces and add it in to the bowl . cut green onions and parsley in to small pieces and add it in to the bowl .

column1: mix the cooked bulgur wheat boiled chickpeas diced tomato cucumber leeks and parsley .
column2: fluff the bulgur wheat with a fork after it has cooked in the pot . in a large bowl add all of your ingredients one at a time . add chickpeas , chopped tomatoes , chunks of cucumber , cut green onions , and fresh parsley . blend all of these ingredients until they are evenly mixed .

column1: pour in the prepared dressing and mix again to serve .
column2: pour in the dressing moving it around so it 's even . mix everything together .

column1: pour in the prepared dressing and mix again to serve .
column2: take a small bowl . add the ingredients in to the bowl . take the dressing in a bowl . add the dressing on to the ingredients . mix everything with a spoon .

column1: add broccoli to a pot of boiling water and set in an ice water bath .
column2: take a pot place water into it . put your oven on and let the water boil . once the water is boiled put broccoli into the pot . take a pot put some water into it . put the broccoli into the ice water using a spoon .

column1: add broccoli to a pot of boiling water and set in an ice water bath .
column2: put broccoli in a pot of boiling water and boil for 1 minute . remove broccoli from boiling water and put in ice and water in a bowl .

column1: add broccoli to a pot of boiling water and set in an ice water bath .
column2: fill a pot with water and place on stove . turn on stove to high heat and wait until boiling . add broccoli to water and let boil for 1 minute . remove broccoli from hot water with a spoon , or drain with a colander . add broccoli to bowl filled with ice and cold water to stop cooking .

column1: add the vegetables pasta pepperoni and mozzarella cheese to a bowl .
column2: add vegetables , cooked pasta , pepperoni and mozzarella cheese into bowl . stir well with big wooden spoon .

column1: add the vegetables pasta pepperoni and mozzarella cheese to a bowl .
column2: pour pasta into bowl . hold bowl near counter edge and push vegetables , pepperoni and mozzarella cheese into bowl .

column1: add the vegetables pasta pepperoni and mozzarella cheese to a bowl .
column2: place the vegetables , pasta , pepperoni , and mozzarella cheese into a deep bowl . mix all the ingredients until they are all well blended .

column1: add salad topping to the salad .
column2: take your jar that is filled with nuts and bits of bacon and other things and pour it on top of the salad . move it all over the top part of the salad .

column1: add salad topping to the salad .
column2: take a salad in a large bowl . take a salad topping in to a small jar . add the half salad topping on to the salad bowl . now take remaining amount of salad topping . add the remaining half of salad topping in to the bowl .

column1: add salad topping to the salad .
column2: take a bottle of the salad topping ( nuts , bacon bits , etc . ) . pour the entire bottle on top of the salad .

column1: add italian dressing to the salad .
column2: shake the bottle of italian dressing . pour the bottle on top of the salad .

column1: add italian dressing to the salad .
column2: take a bottle of italian dressing and shake gently . pour the entire bottle of dressing onto the salad . gently use the spoon to mix the salad , topping , and dressing together .

column1: add italian dressing to the salad .
column2: pour the whole bottle of dressing onto the salad . mix the salad with the dressing .

column1: mix the salad together .
column2: put the dressing on the pasta salad . mix the dressing with the pasta and vegetables using a wooden spoon .

column1: mix the salad together .
column2: gather vegetables from fridge . mix noodles and vegetables together . add sauce . cool in fridge cool in fridge .

column1: mix the salad together .
column2: mix the salad well with a wooden spoon . feel free to use whatever vegetables are in season or just whatever vegetables you want .

column1: add chicken broth rice vinegar soy sauce and brown sugar to a bowl .
column2: pour 1/4 cup of chicken broth into your bowl . then take 2 tablespoons of rice vinegar and put it into the bowl . then pour in 2 tablespoons of soy sauce . then put in 1 tablespoon of brown sugar into the bowl . finally , we will add some garlic .

column1: add chicken broth rice vinegar soy sauce and brown sugar to a bowl .
column2: put chicken broth into the bowl using a measuring cup . put the bowl of rice vinegar into the bowl . put the bowl of soy sauce into the bowl . put the bowl of brown sugar to the bowl . put the bowl of garlic into the bowl .

column1: add chicken broth rice vinegar soy sauce and brown sugar to a bowl .
column2: prepare a bowl and to it add chicken broth or stock , then add two tablespoons of rice vinegar . then add two tablespoons of soy sauce into the same bowl . then add a tablespoon of brown sugar . then add two cloves of garlic that are cut up very small .

column1: add garlic red pepper flakes ginger and green onions and mix .
column2: add about 1/4 tsp of red pepper flakes ( depending on how spicy you like your food ) . add in two teaspoons of ginger paste . whisk the ingredients together carefully , so they do n't spill out of the bowl . add about 1/2 of the scallions to the sauce .

column1: add garlic red pepper flakes ginger and green onions and mix .
column2: add 1/4 teaspoon of red pepper flakes . add 2 teaspoons of ground ginger paste . whisk the ingredients . add some green onions .

column1: add garlic red pepper flakes ginger and green onions and mix .
column2: you 're going to cut the chicken into small cubes . next , put a few teaspoons of ginger and a few teaspoons of scallions into a small bowl of soy sauce .

column1: coat the chicken in flour .
column2: hold the plate of chicken close to the bag . shake the chicken off the plate into the bag . shake the chicken in the bag and they will be covered .

column1: coat the chicken in flour .
column2: put the chicken in the bag with the flour . make sure the bag is closed . shake the bag until each piece of chicken is covered with flour .

column1: coat the chicken in flour .
column2: first you will want to add your pound and a half of cubed chicken into the bag . make sure you seal the ziplock bag real well before this next step . now start shaking the bag so that the chicken is completely coated in the flour mixture .

column1: fry the chicken in the pan .
column2: get skillet nice and hot . add the chicken until there 's nice brown crust . keep flipping them until it has a fried effect .

column1: fry the chicken in the pan .
column2: wait for the skillet to become very hot . this should take about two minutes . use tongs to add the chicken to the pan . you 'll know that your pan is hot enough if the chicken makes a sizzling sound as soon as it touches the pan . if it does n't make the sizzling sound , allow the pan to heat for another minute and try again . let the chicken cook until the bottom side is golden . when the chicken is golden , use tongs to carefully turn each piece of chicken over .

column1: fry the chicken in the pan .
column2: get the pan hot to where the oil is bubbling . use tongs to pick up the chicken pieces and place them into the pan .

column1: add the sauce to the pan .
column2: heat a pan on the stove . add the sauce to the heated pan . cook the sauce for about one minute , stirring while it cooks , to let it thicken .

column1: add the sauce to the pan .
column2: empty the sauce into the pan . cook sauce for one minute .

column1: add the sauce to the pan .
column2: very carefully , grab your sauce and place it close to the bottom of the pan . then begin to pour the sauce into the pan . avoid any splashes because the pan is hot and avoid touching the sides of the pan .

column1: toss the chicken with the sauce .
column2: sauce is in . put the chicken back in . the flour thickens the sauce . keep stirring with the tongs . no need to use cornstarch .

column1: toss the chicken with the sauce .
column2: once the sauce is in the pan , just slowly add your chicken into the pan by pouring it in off your plate . now just toss the chicken around in the pan on medium heat . keep tossing the chicken until the sauce is covering the chicken .

column1: toss the chicken with the sauce .
column2: keep the heat at medium heat . add the chicken to the sauce that is already in the pan . use your tongs or a spoon to move the chicken around in the sauce . keep moving the chicken around the help thicken up the sauce . make sure all the chicken is coated in the sauce from the pan .

column1: sprinkle green onions on top .
column2: add scallions to top of food . do n't add too many .

column1: sprinkle green onions on top .
column2: cut green onions into small pieces . use your fingers to sprinkle the green onions over the top of the dish .

column1: sprinkle green onions on top .
column2: use your hands and grab some green onions . sprinkle the onions over the top even not all in one spot .

column1: cut the pancetta into thin strips and fry them with oil .
column2: put the pancetta on the cutting board . use a sharp knife to cut the pancetta into nice thin strips . heat pan with no oil in the pan . put the pancetta into hot pan and let fat render out . while the pancetta is cooking , separate the eggs .

column1: cut the pancetta into thin strips and fry them with oil .
column2: get an adult to help you or very carefully , put the pancetta on a cutting board and use a knife to cut it into this strips the short way across . get out a saute pan and add 2 tsp . cooking oil . heat the saute pan on the stove until it is hot . add the pancetta strips and stir them constantly with tongs while they are cooking . cook the pancetta until it is browned and slightly crispy .

column1: cut the pancetta into thin strips and fry them with oil .
column2: take your knife and begin cutting nice thin strips of pancetta . cut the entire strip up and then toss them into the pan . we do n't need an oil , because the pancetta has a lot of fat in it . stir the pancetta in the pan with your tongs or a spatula .

column1: separate three egg yolks from the egg whites .
column2: take two small bowls and place them next to each other side by side . now take two eggs , using one egg at a time crack the egg into a cupped hand over one bowl . let the egg whites drip through your fingers and gently place the yoke in the other bowl . repeat this process with the second egg .

column1: separate three egg yolks from the egg whites .
column2: lightly tap one egg on the rim of the bowl to crack it . once it 's cracked , separate the egg shell with your thumbs , slowly , being careful not to drop the egg yolk ( the yellow portion ) . as you separate the egg shells , rock the yolk back and forth in the shell , moving the yolk ( yellow portion ) from one half of the shell to the other . while you are doing this rocking motion , the egg whites ( clear slimy part of the egg ) will fall into the bowl . place the yolks in a separate bowl and repeat two more times .

column1: separate three egg yolks from the egg whites .
column2: crack 3 eggs . put the yolks into a bowl . be sure not to put any of the white in the bowl .

column1: beat the egg yolks and add a little bit of salt and black pepper .
column2: beat the egg yolks in a bowl . use a fork to beat them . add seasoning and black pepper .

column1: beat the egg yolks and add a little bit of salt and black pepper .
column2: take egg yokes and put them into a bowl . using a fork break the egg yokes . using the fork move it in a circular motion until they are all mixed up . set the fork aside . add a pinch of salt and pepper to the egg yokes .

column1: beat the egg yolks and add a little bit of salt and black pepper .
column2: use a fork to quickly mix the egg yolks in a large bowl until the color looks the same throughout the bowl . for about 2 or 3 seconds shake some salt into the bowl . for about 2 or 3 seconds use your pepper grinder to add some pepper to the bowl by twisting the grinder back and forth .

column1: combine the pasta water eggs and parmesan cheese .
column2: use tongs to remove the pasta from the pot and put in the bowl with the eggs . use the tongs to toss the pasta into the eggs . add parmesan cheese to the pasta and some of the pasta water . use a fork to mix well . add the pancetta to the pasta .

column1: combine the pasta water eggs and parmesan cheese .
column2: use tongs to scoop up the pasta . add the pasta to the mixture with the water and eggs . use the tongs to stir the mixture in the bowl . add some parmesan cheese to the bowl . continue stirring . add water if it begins to get too thick .

column1: combine the pasta water eggs and parmesan cheese .
column2: put the pasta in the bowl with the eggs . stir them together with your tongs or spoon .

column1: place the fried pancetta on a towel .
column2: use tongs to pick up the fried pancetta from the pan . place it on a towel .

column1: place the fried pancetta on a towel .
column2: remove the fried pancetta with tongs . place the pancetta onto a towel .

column1: place the fried pancetta on a towel .
column2: place a towel on a plate . use tongs to remove the pancetta from the pan and put on the towel .

column1: place the spaghetti in hot water to cook .
column2: carefully lower the spaghetti into the pot of hot water . leave the spaghetti in there to cook it .

column1: place the spaghetti in hot water to cook .
column2: get out the spaghetti . add the spaghetti the pot of hot water . stir the spaghetti into the water with a stirring spoon .

column1: place the spaghetti in hot water to cook .
column2: take a pot on the stove . add some water in to the pot . boil the water in the pot . place the spaghetti in the pot . cook the spaghetti in the hot water .

column1: add some pancetta olive oil parmesan and black pepper .
column2: add some of the pancetta to the pasta . be sure to leave some pancetta to sprinkle on top later . stir the pancetta into the pasta . pour a very small amount of olive oil over the pasta and stir it in . using tongs , lift the pasta out of the bowl and place it in the center of a serving plate . try to make a nice little pile . sprinkle the rest of the pancetta on top of the pasta . sprinkle some parmesan and black pepper on top .

column1: add some pancetta olive oil parmesan and black pepper .
column2: use your hands and sprinkle in some pancetta . pour in a bit of olive oil . sprinkle in black pepper and stir everything with tongs .

column1: add some pancetta olive oil parmesan and black pepper .
column2: add the pancetta and mix . add a bit of olive oil . scrape the sides and stir . serve a small portion onto a plate . top with more pancetta , parmesan , and black pepper .

column1: put the chicken slices into boiling water .
column2: get an adult , stand back . put on an apron . grab a big spoon that can scoop . grab the bowl of chicken . give it to an adult to pour inside the hot water .

column1: put the chicken slices into boiling water .
column2: take the chicken slices and put them into the pan with boiling water . stir the chicken around a little bit with a ladle .

column1: put the chicken slices into boiling water .
column2: bring water to a boil . place chicken in boiling water . let boil for two to three minutes .

column1: add chicken peas salt and soy sauce to the pan and fry .
column2: add your chicken peas and sprinkle of salt and soy sauce to pan . stir until all mixed on med heat . then put on high heat for a min and all done .

column1: take two strips of breast chicken and cut it into thin slices .

column1: add 4tbsp of soya sauce 1 tbsp of white pepper and simmer for five min .
column2: find a tablespoon . it is a big silver spoon with the letters ' tbsp ' on it . fill the tablespoon all the way to the top four times with soy sauce . pour all of that soy sauce into the silver cooking pot . now you will find a teaspoon . a teaspoon is different than a tablespoon . a teaspoon will have the letters ' tsp ' on it . if this confuses you , think of this difference . tablespoons are bigger than teaspoons and tablespoons just so happen to have the letter ' b ' on them . ' b ' stands for big . so the letters ' tbsp ' mean it is a tablespoon and the letters ' tsp ' mean it is a teaspoon . add just one teaspoon of white pepper , now wait for five whole minutes and let everything cook on a low heat together .

column1: add 4tbsp of soya sauce 1 tbsp of white pepper and simmer for five min .
column2: measure out 4 tbsp of soya sauce . measure out 1 tbsp of white pepper ( this is where the hot flavor comes from ) . add both to your soup . simmer on low for 5 minutes .

column1: add 4tbsp of soya sauce 1 tbsp of white pepper and simmer for five min .
column2: using a tablespoon measuring spoon measure four tablespoons of soy sauce and add to pot . using a teaspoon measuring spoon measure one teaspoon of white pepper and add to pot . using a spoon stir the pot and cook on low for about five minutes .

column1: add the scallions bamboo shoots and the tofu and simmer for five min .
column2: put the scallions in the pot but save about 4 tablespoons for decoration . add the bamboo shoots . add the tofu . stir with a large wooden spoon . turn the heat on low and let it cook for 5 minutes .

column1: add the scallions bamboo shoots and the tofu and simmer for five min .

column1: add the scallions bamboo shoots and the tofu and simmer for five min .
column2: place the green part of the scallions ( 4 tablespoons place 4 tablespoons pf the green part of the scallions into the liquid . also , put the shoots and the tofu into the liquid , and place it in the liquid . turn the burner just high enough where it does not make bubbles .

column1: mix 2 tbsp of cornstarch with 4 tbsp of cold water in a bowl .

column1: mix 2 tbsp of cornstarch with 4 tbsp of cold water in a bowl .

column1: mix 2 tbsp of cornstarch with 4 tbsp of cold water in a bowl .

column1: add the cornstarch mix to the soup while whisking it .

column1: add the cornstarch mix to the soup while whisking it .

column1: add the cornstarch mix to the soup while whisking it .
column2: using the utensil that looks like wires in a loop you will whisk the soup . mix the cornstarch with water in a bowl , use the whisk to get out lumps . while the soup is cooking , whisk the soup in a circle . carefully and slowly , so you do not splash , pour the cornstarch liquid into the soup . continue to whisk the soup the whole time you are pouring the cornstarch liquid .

column1: chop cheese and grate in the food processor .
column2: you need an adult to help you with this . you will have to use a knife . chop the cheese in small pieces that will fit into the top of the food processor . you will need to put the grater attachment in your food processor . make sure you do this when the bowl is not on the base of the food processor . after you put the grater in , put the top of the food processor on the bowl . place and lock bowl on the food processor . turn the food processor on and you will see the grater spinning . carefully and slowly insert the cheese pieces into the hole in the top of the food processor . keep putting in the cheese . if you ca n't push the cheese down the hole , use the pushing tool that comes with your food processor .

column1: chop cheese and grate in the food processor .
column2: set up a food processor with a cheese grating disc and its feed tube ' pusher ' . move the large chunks of cheese from the fridge to the cutting board . " use a chef 's knife to cut chunks of cheese into squares no bigger than 2 - 3 " " , start the processor and begin to feed small chunks of cheese into the feed tube " " . " use the feed tube pusher to push the cheese through the feed tube for grating .

column1: coat the chicken pieces in the flour .
column2: choose which spices you 'd like to season your chicken breading with . for example , you could use red pepper for a hot and spicy breading , or garlic and onion powder for a milder breading . mix about two tablespoons of your chosen spices into the flour , and blend them in well using the whisk . to keep your hands clean , use tongs to pick up one piece of chicken and toss it into the flour mixture . to keep your hands clean , use a spoon to cover the chicken with flour mixture . tap the spoon against the chicken to help the flour mixture stick to it . use tongs to turn your chicken so that you can pat flour onto the entire surface of the chicken . when the chicken is covered in flour mixture , use tongs to set the chicken on a rack . using a rack will help the whole piece of chicken dry . if you do n't have a rack , you will have to allow the top side of the chicken to dry before turning it over with tongs to allow the bottom half to dry . repeat the breading steps for every piece of chicken , and make sure your last piece of chicken has time to dry before moving on to the frying steps .

column1: season the flour with salt pepper and celery salt .

column2: take one piece of cut up toasted pita bread . put the pita bread in .

column1: add 1 chopped toasted pita bread .
column2: this video has been . disabled by the video owner .

column1: add 1 chopped toasted pita bread .
column2: take a piece of pita bread and put it in the toaster . push the toaster button down and wait for the bread to pop back up . when it pops up it will be hot , so carefully place it on the cutting board . using a serrated knife , cut the pita bread into small squares . place the pita bread squares into the pan .

column1: toss everything well to combine .
column2: get a mixing spoon . slowly stir all the ingredients together until the sauce is mixed in well . it is now ready to eat !

column1: toss everything well to combine .
column2: get a wooden spoon and wooden spatula . to toss you mix use them both and stir with both hands lightly . make sure nothing sits a bottom of the bowl .

column1: toss everything well to combine .
column2: take a spoon . stir all the ingredients together .

column1: combine pomegranate molasses lemon juice salt and pepper and olive oil .
column2: take a bowl . add 1 cucumber cut in to small cubes , 4 tomatoes cut into small cubes , 1 red onion cut into thin slices . then add 1 pita bread which has been toasted and cut into square pieces . stir with a spoon and mix everything well to combine . for the molasses dressing , add 2 tablespoons pomegranate molasses to a bowl , add the juice of 1 lemon and stir vigorously with a spoon , add a pinch of salt and pepper , and stir in 1/2 a cup of extra virgin olive oil . mix everything well till its combined well . add the pomegranate dressing to the bowl containing all our other ingredients . mix well with a salad spoon . fatoush is ready to serve .

column1: combine pomegranate molasses lemon juice salt and pepper and olive oil .
column2: this video has been . disabled by the owner .

column1: combine pomegranate molasses lemon juice salt and pepper and olive oil .
column2: take a bowl . add the pomegranate molasses . add some lemon juice to the bowl . add salt and pepper to the bowl with other ingredients . add olive oil to the bowl and mix altogether .

column1: combine diced tomato and cucumber and sliced onions .
column2: get a bowl and put in your diced tomatoes , cucumber slice and onions . mix them all together with a spoon in the bowl .

column1: combine diced tomato and cucumber and sliced onions .
column2: take tomato , cucumber and onions and clean it properly . cut all the vegetables into round shape . mix all the vegetables in a bowl .

column1: combine diced tomato and cucumber and sliced onions .
column2: get a medium size mixing bowl . put the diced tomatoes in the bowl . add the cucumber . add the sliced onions .

column1: heat butter in a pan and cook the calamari .
column2: put a piece of butter on the pan and spread around . turn the heat on high medium . place the calamari on the pan . cook for 3 to 4 minutes . turn over after 2 minutes .

column1: heat butter in a pan and cook the calamari .
column2: take a pan on the stove . add some butter to the pan . melt the butter in the pan . add the calamari pieces in to the pan . cook the calamari till they become brown .

column1: heat butter in a pan and cook the calamari .
column2: take a slice of butter . put it in a pan and allow it to melt . then place breaded calamari in the pan . toss the calamari in the pan and allow it cook . repeat until the calamari turns light brown .

column1: mix bread crumbs cornflakes and parmesan cheese .
column2: add 1/2 cup of bread crumbs to a bowl . add 1/8 cup of cornflake crumbs to the bowl . put in 1/4 cup of parmesan cheese . mix all of the ingredients in the bowl together .

column1: mix bread crumbs cornflakes and parmesan cheese .
column2: pour one half cup breadcrumbs into a bowl . pour one quarter cup cornflake crumbs into the same bowl . add one quarter cup grated parmesan cheese . mix all three items around in the bowl with your dry fingers .

column1: mix bread crumbs cornflakes and parmesan cheese .
column2: add bread crumbs , corn flake crumbs and parmesan cheese to the bowl . use your hands to mix everything together .

column1: dip the calamari in the flour beaten egg and bread crumbs .
column2: dip the calamari in the flour , then into the egg , then into the crumb mix . repeat this with all of the calamari .

column1: dip the calamari in the flour beaten egg and bread crumbs .
column2: hold the calamari with your hand . dip a piece in the flour . now dip the same piece in the egg mix . now dip the piece in bread crumbs . repeat this to make more .

column1: dip the calamari in the flour beaten egg and bread crumbs .
column2: use your hand to dip the calamari in the flour . next coat the calamari in the egg mix . then dip the calamari into bread crumbs .

column1: cut the lettuce into bite size and put it in a bowl .
column2: take a cutting board and a knife . take the lettuce leaves on the cutting board . cut the lettuce in to bite size pieces . take the lettuce pieces from the board . add the lettuce in to the bowl .

column1: cut the lettuce into bite size and put it in a bowl .
column2: use a knife to carefully chop up the lettuce . cut into 1 inch pieces . put the lettuce into the bowl .

column1: cut the lettuce into bite size and put it in a bowl .
column2: place several lettuce leaves on the cutting board . " with a sharp knife , chop the lettuce into 3/4 - 1 pieces . " " . " chop all the lettuce , but one leaf , in the same way . save one lettuce leaf for a garnish ( decoration ) .

column1: add some salt and ground pepper and process .
column2: put a teaspoon of salt and a 1/2 teaspoon of pepper into the food processor . put the lid on the food processor and lock the lid in place . turn the processor on and mix for 3 seconds .

column1: add some salt and ground pepper and process .
column2: take the contents in the food processor . take some salt and add it to the food processor . take some pepper in a pepper grinder . add some pepper powder in to the food processor . close the lid of food processor .

column1: add some salt and ground pepper and process .
column2: add some seasoning into the processor . grind some pepper into the processor . put the lid on and blend .

column1: cut the bread into one inch cubes .
column2: carefully hold the bread loaf . cut the bread into 1 inch cube shapes .

column1: cut the bread into one inch cubes .
column2: get a very sharp , serrated knife ( the kind with a wavy cutting surface ) . cut the bread into one - inch slices . cut each slice in half . " slice the halves again so that you wind up with 1 cubes . " " . " you may use any kind of bread you like including stale bread .

column1: cut the bread into one inch cubes .
column2: use a knife to slice the bread into a few slices . cut the slices into one inch cubes .

column1: add sauce and bread toos and garnish with cheese and lettuce .
column2: use a spoon to scoop some sauce into the salad . add some croutons . use two forks to mix the salad together to evenly spread the sauce .

column1: add sauce and bread toos and garnish with cheese and lettuce .
column2: add 3 tablespoons of sauce to your big bowl of lettuce . add a handful of croutons to the bowl . mix the salad very well with large spoons , until the dressing is on all of the lettuce . use the spoons to serve the salad into a small bowl . add a pinch of parmesan cheese and the leaves from before .

column1: add sauce and bread toos and garnish with cheese and lettuce .
column2: take the vegetables in a large mixing bowl . take the sauce in a small bowl . add some sauce in to the small bowl . add some croutons in to the bowl . add some cheese and lettuce on top .

column1: add the yogurt lemon juice worcestershire sauce tabasco the mayonnaise and process to combine .
column2: add the ingredients to the salad . combine .

column1: add the yogurt lemon juice worcestershire sauce tabasco the mayonnaise and process to combine .
column2: use a spoon to add the yogurt . add the lemon and the sauces . if you use fresh mayonnaise make sure to use the sauce in a few days because their are raw eggs in it .

column1: add the yogurt lemon juice worcestershire sauce tabasco the mayonnaise and process to combine .
column2: add yogurt to the processor . pour in the lemon juice and worcestershire sauce . add tabasco sauce and mayonnaise . put the lid on the processor . blend everything together .

column1: place the garlic in the food processor add the anchovy fillets and the capers and process well .
column2: put the garlic into the food processor . add anchovy fillets in . put in capers . turn on the processor and blend the ingredients . use a spatula to push everything down and process again .

column1: place the garlic in the food processor add the anchovy fillets and the capers and process well .
column2: put the garlic , anchovies and capers into the food processor bowl . put the lid on the processor and process . take the lid off of the processor and use a spatula to scrape the sides . put the lid back on and process again .

column1: place the garlic in the food processor add the anchovy fillets and the capers and process well .
column2: place your garlic cloves , anchovy fillets and capers into your food processor . process them until well until it sticks to the wall of the processor . stop the food processor and scrape the mixture off of the sides and process it again .

column1: heat olive oil in a skillet and cook the bread .
column2: pour the olive oil into a large skillet which has been pre - heated . once the oil is hot , add the bread cubes . cook on high heat , making sure to get all the sides golden brown . you can shake the pan to turn the cubes , or use a spoon or spatula to turn them . cook the croutons until they are crispy and golden brown . you can also bake the croutons instead of frying them , if you wish . when finished , place the croutons on a paper towel to remove the excess fat .

column1: heat olive oil in a skillet and cook the bread .
column2: pour olive oil into a skillet and heat it . spread the olive oil all around so it cover the pan . turn the stove on high heat . add the croutons to the pan and cook until they are golden brown .

column1: heat olive oil in a skillet and cook the bread .
column2: poor olive oil into a large pan and turn burner on high . add chunks of bread to the pan . cook bread until it is golden brown . stir often by shaking the pan .

column1: cut the snow peas diagonally .
column2: use a knife and cut the snow peas . cut the snow peas diagonally across the long part of the snow pea .

column1: cut the snow peas diagonally .
column2: place the snow peas on a cutting board . using a sharp knife , cut them in half , diagonally ( slant - wise ) .

column1: cut the snow peas diagonally .
column2: hold the snow peas down flat with one hand . with your other hand cut them diagonal in half the long ways .

column1: add the garlic snow peas and bean sprouts to the pan .
column2: add garlic with a spoon or spatula to a heated frying pan . turn down heat a little in order not to burn the garlic . add snow peas to the pan . add bean sprouts to the pan .

column1: add the garlic snow peas and bean sprouts to the pan .
column2: add some garlic to a pan . add in vegetables . stir .

column1: add the garlic snow peas and bean sprouts to the pan .
column2: put in the garlic . add snow peas to the pan . add some bean sprouts . stir the mixture together for about 30 seconds .

column1: heat oil in a pan .
column2: heat a large pan or wok on the stove with some oil . shake the pan around to spread the oil in the pan . heat the pan until very hot .

column1: heat oil in a pan .
column2: put a pan onto the stove and turn the burner on to a medium - high setting . add three tablespoons of oil to the pan and let it cook until very hot .

column1: heat oil in a pan .
column2: take a large pan and pour oil into it . spread the oil around the pan . heat the oil in the pan .

column1: scramble the egg .
column2: using a fork mix the egg together . put the egg mixture into the bowl .

column1: scramble the egg .
column2: scramble egg with a fork . be careful not to spill the egg .

column1: scramble the egg .
column2: take a fork and hold the bowl of egg in the other hand . mix at the egg with the fork to scramble it .

column1: add water from the jar of sauce .
column2: while you 're stirring the dish you 'll want to make sure you ' ve added all of the sauce . get the empty sauce jar you used earlier . fill it a little ways with some hot water . swirl the water around in the jar to try to get all of the sauce out of the jar . pour that water with the sauce into the pan .

column1: add water from the jar of sauce .
column2: continue stirring the pan with tongs . add water to the jar of hot thai sauce . mix the water around with the sauce . pour the jar into the pan .

column1: add water from the jar of sauce .
column2: take the tongs and mix everything around in the pan . take the pad thai sauce jar and put a little bit of water into the jar . shake the jar really well , this will help to get the sauce out of the jar . pour the rest of the sauce from the jar into the pan . mix everything around with the tongs again , and let it cook for a couple more minutes .

column1: cook the egg and remove from the pan .
column2: take out the half cooked shrimp . add the egg and cook . take eggs out until they are just set .

column1: cook the egg and remove from the pan .
column2: take an egg and break it over the pot . cook it until it is not runny anymore , stirring it with the tongs you used for the shrimp . remove the egg after it 's cooked .

column1: cook the egg and remove from the pan .
column2: using tongs take out the shrimp and put them in a bowl . add eggs to the pan . with the tongs stir the eggs around until cooked . using tongs take the eggs out of the pan into the bowl .

column1: cook the shrimp until halfway cooked in the pan and then remove .
column2: put the shrimp in the pan with tongs . flip the shrimp over with the tongs until cooked .

column1: cook the shrimp until halfway cooked in the pan and then remove .
column2: put oil in the pan and heat on the stove top . put the shrimp in the hot pan . cook the shrimp about a minute on each side . use tongs to flip the shrimp over . be sure you do not overcook the shrimp .

column1: cook the shrimp until halfway cooked in the pan and then remove .
column2: take a pan on the stove . add some oil in to the pan . add the shrimp in to the pan . cook the shrimp till they are half cooked . remove the shrimps from the pan .

column1: soak the noodles in water .
column2: take a large bowl . add some water in to the bowl . take a pack of noodles . soak the noodles in the water . cover the noodles bowl .

column1: soak the noodles in water .
column2: fill a big bowl with water . take the noodles and put them in the water sinking them to the bottom .

column1: soak the noodles in water .
column2: fill a bowl with hot water . remove the noodles from the package . place the noodles in the bowl making sure the water covers all the noodles . place another bowl on top of the noodles to make sure all the noodles are covered by the water .

column1: add the pad thai sauce noodles shrimp and egg .
column2: when you smell the garlic , it is time to add the pad thai sauce . use tongs to add noodles to the pan . pour in the shrimp . add the egg . use the tongs to mix everything together as it cooks .

column1: add the pad thai sauce noodles shrimp and egg .
column2: take a pan on the stove . add thai sauce in to the contents of the pan . add rice noodles in to the pan . and shrimp and eggs in to the pan . mix everything in the pan .

column1: add the pad thai sauce noodles shrimp and egg .
column2: get a spoon and hold the pad thai sauce over the pan . scoop the sauce into the pan . take some tongs and pick the noodles up and place them in the pan . add the shrimp and egg .

column1: top with chopped peanuts .
column2: add chopped peanuts to the top of the mix . put on some chopped cilantro . serve the noodles with a wedge of lime .

column1: top with chopped peanuts .
column2: take a pan and place it on the stove . cook the contents of the pan . take some cut pieces of peanuts in a bowl . add the peanut pieces in to the pan . mix them with other ingredients in the pan .

column1: top with chopped peanuts .
column2: add chopped peanuts and fresh cilantro to the pan . remove from the pan and put on a plate . serve on a plate with a wedge of lime .

column1: roll it on a bamboo mat and cut them into thin pieces and serve .
column2: place the sushi in the bamboo mat . bring one side of bamboo to the middle of the sushi pulling tightly . now continue rolling it tightly . you can take it out of the bamboo and cut it once in half . then you can cut it into 6 or 8 pieces .

column1: roll it on a bamboo mat and cut them into thin pieces and serve .
column2: place the sushi onto a bamboo map . firmly roll the sushi together . take a knife and carefully cut the sushi roll . cut it into 8 pieces . put the sushi onto a plate and serve .

column1: roll it on a bamboo mat and cut them into thin pieces and serve .
column2: take the paper and roll it with the bamboo mat . take a knife and cut the roll into thick circles .

column1: place a small amount rice on the seaweed and spread it flat leaving about half inch of seaweed .
column2: place a little bit of rice on the seaweed . spread the rice out evenly . leave half inch of seaweed on the sides .

column1: place a small amount rice on the seaweed and spread it flat leaving about half inch of seaweed .
column2: place a small amount rice on the seaweed and spread it flat leaving about half inch of seaweed . take your fingers and pat the rice on the seaweed so it 's all packed together .

column1: place a small amount rice on the seaweed and spread it flat leaving about half inch of seaweed .
column2: place the rice onto the seaweed . spread the rice flat and evenly with your fingers , leaving about 1/2 of space at the top end of the seaweed .

column1: season it sesame seeds and fish eggs sauce .
column2: add some sesame seeds to the top of the rice . pour some fish eggs across the top . spread them evenly . flip over the seaweed .

column1: season it sesame seeds and fish eggs sauce .
column2: take the sea weed and sushi rice on a plate . now sprinkle some sesame seeds on top of sushi rice . add some fish eggs sauce on the rice . spread the sauce on the rice properly . now turn the seaweed to the other side .

column1: season it sesame seeds and fish eggs sauce .
column2: make sure the rice side of the sushi roll is facing up . get the sesame seeds out . sprinkle a pinch of sesame seeds down the middle of the rice , lengthwise . get the fish egg sauce out . sprinkle a little fish egg sauce on top of the sesame seeds spread a bit over the rice .

column1: flip it and place the crab meat and avocados .
column2: turn over the sushi to the rice is facing down . put the crab meat and avocados onto the seaweed . place them in the middle of the seaweed .

column1: flip it and place the crab meat and avocados .
column2: flip the seaweed wrap over so the seaweed is on top . put the crab meat and avocados in the middle of the seaweed in a line that goes long ways .

column1: flip it and place the crab meat and avocados .
column2: flip the sushi over . put the crab meat on the seaweed side down the middle . put the avocados on the seaweed side down in the middle .

column1: finely slice the cabbage .
column2: take a cutting board and knife . take a cabbage . cut the cabbage in to four halves . take each half and cut the cabbage in to very thin slices . now repeat the same with other pieces .

column1: finely slice the cabbage .
column2: place a small head of cabbage on your cutting board . using a sharp medium sized vegetable knife , cut the cabbage in half , then into quarters . remove the outside leaves and cut the core ( where it was attached to the stem of the cabbage plant ) out . slice each quarter from one pointed end to the other as thinly as you can . slice slowly so you can keep from cutting your fingers .

column1: finely slice the cabbage .
column2: you 're going to grab a cutting board big enough to fit your cabbage . make sure you have adult with you to make sure you 're using the knife correctly . carefully grab the knife and cut the cabbage in half . grab the leaves on the outside of the cabbage and take them away . also , find the core of the cabbage . it will be hard and be toward the middle . cut that off , too . grab one slice of the cabbage and put it on its side . cut it in half once more . once you are done , you will have created two quarters from what was once called a half . now , take the piece of cabbage that you have n't cut into quarters yet and turn it into two more quarters . carefully slice the first quarter you are working on and cut it into very small pieces . do this by starting from one of its ends and working your way to the other end . do the same thing for the rest of the quarters until everything has been sliced thinly , kind of like shredded cheese slices .

column1: cook the cabbage in a pot of water .
column2: take a large pot on a stove . add water in to the pot . boil the water in the pot . cut the cabbage in to small pieces . add the cabbage in to the pot of water .

column1: cook the cabbage in a pot of water .
column2: bring a pot of water to a boil . the water is boiling when bubbles rapidly rise to the surface . place cabbage pieces in boiling water . cook for 2 - 3 minutes . cabbage should be tender .

column1: cook the cabbage in a pot of water .
column2: get a large pot and fill it with water . place on stove and turn on the heat . while the water is heating up on the stove , you 'll need to cut the cabbage in half , then cut the half parts in half . this will make sure the cabbage cooks all the way through . you may need an adult to help you cut the cabbage . it can be tricky . when the water starts to boil , carefully , and slowly place the cabbage in the water . make sure not to touch the water or the pot . you can use tongs to pick up the cabbage and place it in the water if you feel more comfortable . cook the cabbage for a few minutes until it is tender . use a fork to try and slide it through the cabbage . if it goes through easily , it is tender and done .

column1: mash the potatoes until chunky .
column2: mash the potatoes with a potato masher . the potatoes do n't need to be smooth . this way they can give a little texture to the dish .

column1: mash the potatoes until chunky .
column2: take a large pot . add boiled potatoes in to the pot . take a potato masher in to the hand . mash the potatoes in the pot . repeat it until the potatoes are about small pieces .

column1: mash the potatoes until chunky .
column2: mash the potatoes . there should be some lumps in them .

column1: add the cabbage to the mashed potatoes .
column2: take your bowl of cabbage and place it near the mashed potatoes . add about half the amount of cabbage to the mashed potatoes .

column1: add the cabbage to the mashed potatoes .
column2: place colander in a pot . add cooked cabbage to the colander . allow cabbage to drain . add cabbage to pot containing potatoes by hand . add about half as much cabbage as you have potatoes .

column1: add the cabbage to the mashed potatoes .
column2: drain the water from the cabbage . taste cabbage to see if it is soft but not too soft . add cabbage to the potatoes so there is twice as much potato .

column1: add milk and spring onions to a pot .
column2: pour the milk into a pot on a stove . add the spring onions to the pot with the milk and leave it on your stove over high heat so it can come to a boil .

column1: add milk and spring onions to a pot .
column2: put the milk in the pot . put spring onions in the pot . bring the milk and onions to a boil .

column1: add milk and spring onions to a pot .
column2: put the milk into a pot . add the spring onions , which should be in tiny pieces , into the milk .

column1: mix the milk and spring onions with the mashed potatoes .
column2: boil milk in a pot . slowly pour milk into the pot containing mashed potatoes . stir until mashed potatoes are fluffy . it should taste somewhat like onion , continue to stir . consistently add more milk to the pot with potatoes .

column1: mix the milk and spring onions with the mashed potatoes .
column2: boil milk in a pot . pour a small amount of boiled milk into the potatoes . slowly stir the milk into the potatoes and add more of the milk as needed . keep stirring until the potatoes are the right texture .

column1: mix the milk and spring onions with the mashed potatoes .
column2: pour the heated milk / spring onion mixture from the saucepan into the pan with the mashed potatoes . mix the milk into the mashed potatoes with the spatula . scrape the sides and bottom of the mashed potato pan with the spatula so that all of the mashed potato is combined with the milk / spring onion mixture .

column1: add butter to the mashed potatoes .
column2: put about 3 tablespoons of butter on top of the mashed potatoes right in the middle . leave it to melt .

column1: add butter to the mashed potatoes .
column2: take the butter from the freezer . cut a small portion of butter with the help of a knife . add the butter into the mashed potatoes .

column1: add butter to the mashed potatoes .
column2: put your mashed potatoes in a bowl . push potatoes down in the middle to make a bowl shape . use a knife to cut out a chunk of softened butter . put butter into the middle of the mashed potatoes .

column1: skin and cut the salmon into pieces .
column2: put fish on a cutting board . use a sharp knife to cut the fish into smaller pieces . put a sharp knife in between the fish meat and skin . slowly move the knife to cut the skin off of each piece of fish .

column1: skin and cut the salmon into pieces .
column2: cut the salmon in half horizontally . cut off three hand widths of the salmon off each of the halves from the previous step .

column1: skin and cut the salmon into pieces .
column2: get a knife . slice the salmon piece in half long way . then slice the salmon in half again down the middle . repeat for the other half of the salmon .

column1: sprinkle salt on both sides of the pieces .
column2: lay the salmon out in one layer . salt one side of the salmon then turn it over and salt the other side .

column1: sprinkle salt on both sides of the pieces .
column2: take some salt in your finger tips . put it all over , on both sides .

column1: sprinkle salt on both sides of the pieces .
column2: put salt on one side of each piece of fish . turn the fish over and put salt on the other side of each piece of fish . .

column1: wash the salmon pieces .
column2: get a pan . put water in the pan . place the salmon pieces in the water . take the salmon out of the water . place the clean salmon in a bowl .

column1: wash the salmon pieces .
column2: put a bowl or large container in the sink . fill the container with cold water . put each of your salmon pieces into the water . swish the salmon around in the water and gently rub it with your fingers . shake the extra water off each piece and place it in a basket .

column1: wash the salmon pieces .
column2: put the salmon pieces in a pan of cold running water . rinse each piece of salmon under the running water . take each piece out of the water and place in basket .

column1: dip the pieces in ice cube water and dry them using paper towel .
column2: place ice cubes in a bowl and cover with water . dip the pieces completely under the water one by one . place all the pieces flat on top of a paper towel . cover the pieces with another paper towel . pat them lightly to dry them off .

column1: dip the pieces in ice cube water and dry them using paper towel .
column2: put fish in the cold ice water . remove the fish from ice water and lay it on top of paper towels . put another towel on top of the fish . push the towel gently on top of the fish . remove the paper towel and throw it in the trash . check to make sure the fish is dry .

column1: dip the pieces in ice cube water and dry them using paper towel .
column2: take a bowl and add water . add ice cubes in to the bowl of water . take the fish pieces and dip them in ice cubes water bowl . take a paper towel and place the fish on it . cover them with another paper towel and dry them .

column1: wrap the pieces in thin plastic wrap .
column2: rip off a piece of saran wrap about the size of a cutting board . take 1 piece of the cut fish and place it on the wrap . fold over the excess edges of the saran wrap until the plastic is wrapped around the entire piece of fish .

column1: wrap the pieces in thin plastic wrap .
column2: place fish onto a large piece of plastic wrap . fold the plastic wrap over the fish wrapping it tightly around the fish .

column1: wrap the pieces in thin plastic wrap .
column2: put fish on clear wrap . cover entire fish with clear plastic wrap .

column1: add rice urad dal and fenugreek seeds into a bowl .
column2: get another container . slowly pour both the bowls into the container .

column1: add rice urad dal and fenugreek seeds into a bowl .
column2: measure the fenugreek seeds . put rice in a large bowl . add urad dal and fenugreek seeds to the bowl of rice .

column1: add rice urad dal and fenugreek seeds into a bowl .
column2: get a large bowl . add the rice urad dal and fenugreek seeds into the bowl . mix with spoon ,

column1: rub oil over a pan .
column2: pour oil onto a paper napkin . use the napkin to rub oil around the pan .

column1: rub oil over a pan .
column2: fold up a paper towel into a square . use the paper to rub the oil around the pan in a circle .

column1: rub oil over a pan .
column2: carefully pour a teaspoon of oil onto a paper towel . slowly rub paper towel onto your pan , being sure not to burn yourself .

column1: add dosa batter to the pan and spread into a big circle .
column2: use a big spoon to scoop the batter into the pan . use the spoon to spread the batter into a circle shape .

column1: add dosa batter to the pan and spread into a big circle .
column2: take a pan and heat it on the stove . take dosa batter in a bowl . take a large spoon and take dosa batter . pour dosa batter on to the pan . spread the batter with the spoon in to a circle .

column1: add dosa batter to the pan and spread into a big circle .
column2: use a spoon to add the dosa batter to the pan . use the back of the spoon to spread the batter into a big circle .

column1: roll the dosa onto itself and remove from the pan .
column2: use a spatula to lift one edge of the dosa from the pan so that the edge touches the middle of the circle . fold the edge over so that it touches the center of the circular dosa . continue rolling the dosa . use the spatula to remove the dosa from the pan .

column1: roll the dosa onto itself and remove from the pan .
column2: do not flip the dosa to the other side like you would a pancake . instead , fold it gently as if you were rolling it so that it stays crispy .

column1: roll the dosa onto itself and remove from the pan .
column2: when the dosa is done . get the spatula ready . take the spatula and gently lift one side up and start to carefully and loosely roll it inward . try to make it look like a log . if you do not want to use your fingers , use a fork to help roll the dosa with the spatula . when you have rolled the dosa all the way up , remove it from the pan with your spatula . be careful the pan will be very hot .

column1: add a potato curry in the middle of the dosa while on the pan .
column2: take your cooked curry . add it to the pan with the dosa in it . place the curry in a line in the center of the dosa , but not going all the way to the top or bottom edge .

column1: add a potato curry in the middle of the dosa while on the pan .
column2: use your spoon to add potato curry to the middle of the dosa . line it up in the middle of the dosa in the pan .

column1: add a potato curry in the middle of the dosa while on the pan .
column2: put the potato curry in the center of the dosa . then put some ghee ( clarified butter ) on top of the curry .

column1: add tahini to a food processor .
column2: using a spoon , stir the tahini while it is still in the bottle . pour the tahini into a measuring cup until you have 1/4 cup . pour the 1/4 cup of tahini into the food processor .

column1: add tahini to a food processor .
column2: pour tahini into the measuring cup . using a spatula pour the tahini into the blender .

column1: add tahini to a food processor .
column2: stir the tahini in the jar . next pour the tahini into a measuring cup . using a rubber spatula pour the tahini to a food processor bowl .

column1: top the hummus with olive oil and paprika .
column2: blend the hummus in a blender . pour some olive oil on top of the hummus . spread some paprika in the hummus .

column1: top the hummus with olive oil and paprika .
column2: use a spoon to remove the hummus from the mixer . place the hummus on a plate . put a small amount of olive oil and paprika on top of the hummus . it is now ready for you to eat and enjoy .

column1: top the hummus with olive oil and paprika .
column2: pour olive oil in circles over the hummus . shake some paprika on the hummus moving so it covers it evenly .

column1: blend the chickpeas in the food processor .
column2: was the chickpeas by putting them under the water in the sink . put the washed chickpeas into the blender . with a spatula scrape the edges of the blender . add more chickpeas to the blender . with the spatula scrape the hummus off the blender .

column1: blend the chickpeas in the food processor .
column2: add half of the chickpeas into the bowl of the food processor and turn processor on for a minute . use silicone spatula to scrape the sides of the bowl . add remaining chickpeas to the food processor . turn processor on for 1 - 2 minutes until mixture is very smooth . use silicone spatula to scrape the bowl again .

column1: blend the chickpeas in the food processor .
column2: open can of chickpeas pour into drainer in sink to drain and rinse . add 1/2 of chickpeas into food processor . turn food processor on for 1 minute then stop machine and scrape bowl . add the other rest of the chickpeas . turn food processor on for 1 - 2 minutes until very smooth .

column1: add water to the hummus and blend .
column2: add 2 to 3 tablespoon of water to hummus while in blender . add more water in you want it less thick .

column1: add water to the hummus and blend .
column2: add 2 to 3 tablespoons of water to the mixture . continue to blend the hummus . add water as necessary to make it thinner .

column1: add water to the hummus and blend .
column2: use a measuring spoon to measure the 2 spoons of water . put the water in the blender . cover the lid and press blend .

column1: drain and rinse the chick peas .
column2: put the chick peas into a colander . rinse warm water over the chickpeas .

column1: drain and rinse the chick peas .
column2: open a can of chick peas with a can opener . pour them into a strainer . rinse the chick peas under the sink .

column1: drain and rinse the chick peas .
column2: open a can of chickpeas with a can opener . over the sink pour the chickpeas into a strainer , let the water from the can drain . rinse the chickpeas .

column1: squeeze a lemon and add the juice to the food processor .
column2: cut a lemon in half with a knife carefully . hold the lemon over the bowl . use a grinder to squish into the lemon and get the juice out .

column1: squeeze a lemon and add the juice to the food processor .
column2: cut the lemon in to two halves . take a half lemon and squeeze juice in to the bowl . remove the pulp from the lemon juice with a strainer . add the lemon juice in to the food processor . close the lid of the food processor .

column1: squeeze a lemon and add the juice to the food processor .
column2: use a knife and careful cut a lemon in half . squeeze the juice of the lemon into a measuring cup . add about 1/4 of a cup of juice . pour the lemon juice to the bowl . pour through a strainer so the seeds do n't get in .

column1: crush and mince the garlic and add it to the food processor .
column2: now we want to take the edge of our knife and press on it to crack open our clove of garlic . now we just need to dice half the clove up . do n't forget to peal it and keep your fingers clear . once the garlic is minced finely , just scrape it into the food processor .

column1: crush and mince the garlic and add it to the food processor .
column2: crush the garlic under a flat metal surface like the side of a wide knife . be careful not to put your hand by the blade . then use the knife to cut the garlic into small pieces , this is called mincing . then carefully scoop it up with the knife and add it to the food processor .

column1: crush and mince the garlic and add it to the food processor .
column2: get one clove of garlic . mash it flat under a knife and remove the skin . mince it into very fine pieces with your knife so no one will get a big chunk of garlic in their mouth . add the minced garlic to the food processor .

column1: blend the ingredients in the food processor .
column2: add tahini and lemon juice into food processor . blend for 1 minute or until ingredients are at a creamy consistency .

column1: blend the ingredients in the food processor .
column2: add the ingredients in to the food processor . close the lid of the food processor . turn on the food processor . blend the contents for about a minute . open the lid of food processor and check .

column1: blend the ingredients in the food processor .
column2: after all of the ingredients are in the food processor , put the lid on tightly and make sure it clicks so you know it wo n't come off . push the button to process it and do this for one whole minute . make sure it 's ready by checking to see if the mixture is thick , whipped , and creamy .

column1: mix and blend the ingredients in the food processor .
column2: use a spatula to scrape everything to the bottom of the food processor . put the lid on . blend the ingredients . take the lid off . scrape the bottom of the bowl again .

column1: mix and blend the ingredients in the food processor .
column2: use a spatula to scrape the bottom of the food processor bowl . place the lid back on the food processor and process again . after about a minute , open up the lid and scrape again .

column1: mix and blend the ingredients in the food processor .
column2: put you ingredients into a blender or food processor and put the lid on . push the button on blender or food processor to make it blend / mix the ingredients .

column1: add oil cumin salt to the food processor .
column2: in the food processor add 2 tablespoons of olive oil . add 1/2 teaspoon of ground cumin . add 1/2 teaspoon salt .

column1: add oil cumin salt to the food processor .
column2: get a spoon to scoop with . carefully add cumin and sale to the food processor .

column1: add oil cumin salt to the food processor .
column2: add 2 tablespoons of olive oil . put in 1/2 teaspoon of cumin to the food processor . add 1/2 teaspoon of salt .

column1: add spicy mayo to the tuna .
column2: use a spoon to add spicy mayonnaise to the tuna . use a spoon to mix the mayonnaise into the tuna .

column1: add spicy mayo to the tuna .
column2: take the mayo mixture in a bowl . take the tuna pieces in a bowl . take a tablespoon of mayo mixture . add the mixture in to the tuna . mix the tuna and the mixture .

column1: add spicy mayo to the tuna .
column2: use a regular spoon to add a heaping spoonful of the spicy mayonnaise to the tuna . use the spoon to mix the mayonnaise and the tuna all the way .

column1: slice the avocado .
column2: place the avocado on a cutting board . use a sharp knife to cut the avocado into slices .

column1: slice the avocado .
column2: hold the avocado on one end . take a knife and cut long strips diagonally on the avocado .

column1: slice the avocado .
column2: use a knife to cut the avocado . slice the avocado into a few small pieces .

column1: pour in spicy sauce .
column2: open the sriracha sauce , and squeeze in about one teaspoon . you can add more if you want your sauce to very hot , or less if you want it to be milder . if you are unsure what a teaspoon of sauce looks like , squeeze the sauce into a teaspoon - sized measuring spoon first . to be sure you have the right level of spiciness before moving on , mix the sauce and taste a very small amount of it . if you 'd like it to be hotter , add a pea - sized amount of sriracha sauce , mix , and taste it again . keep doing this until it has the hotness that you want .

column1: pour in spicy sauce .
column2: add 1 teaspoon of sriracha sauce into the cup . mix the sauce together with a spoon .

column1: pour in spicy sauce .
column2: hold the bottle of spicy sauce over the bowl . carefully squeeze out some sauce into the bowl .

column1: flip the rice upside down .
