column2: transfer the rice unto the mat . flip it upside do . add chicken and other ingredients and fold .

column1: flip the rice upside down .
column2: transfer the rice and seaweed onto the plastic on top of the bamboo sheets . flip the rice so it is facing upside down on the plastic .

column1: flip the rice upside down .
column2: take a mat on the board . take a seaweed and spread the rice on it . take the seaweed in the hand . flip the rice upside down . put the seaweed side above .

column1: flatten a ball of rice onto the seaweed .
column2: place the ball of rice onto the seaweed . flatten the rice onto the seaweed . spread the rice around evenly on the seaweed .

column1: flatten a ball of rice onto the seaweed .
column2: roll a handful of rice into a ball in your hands . press the rice down on the seaweed . use your hands to flatten and spread the rice to cover the seaweed .

column1: flatten a ball of rice onto the seaweed .
column2: put a seaweed sheet on the counter top . use your hands to roll the rice into a large ball . place the rice ball on the seaweed . use your fingers to flatten and spread the rice across the seaweed .

column1: spread black sesame seeds on the rice .
column2: use your fingers to sprinkle black sesame seeds over the rice . then sprinkle some white sesame seeds over the rice .

column1: spread black sesame seeds on the rice .
column2: put black sesame seeds onto the bed of rice . spread the seeds evenly around on the rice .

column1: spread black sesame seeds on the rice .
column2: take black sesame seeds with your fingers . coat the rice with the black sesame seeds .

column1: add the tuna to the rice and seaweed .
column2: add the tuna into the center of the roll . place cucumbers on top of the tuna .

column1: add the tuna to the rice and seaweed .
column2: prepare rice and seaweed base with avocado . scoop out tuna from bowl . place heavy tuna layer on top of avocado layer using both fingers and spoon . place celery on one side of tuna in preparation for rolling .

column1: add the tuna to the rice and seaweed .
column2: use a spoon to spread tuna on top of rice , seaweed and avocado slices . put cucumber sticks on top of the tuna . use the bamboo sheet to roll everything together .

column1: roll it all up in plastic wrap .
column2: line up the food roll evenly on the cutting board . your plastic wrap and straw rolling mat should be uniform on the surface . using your fingers , begin rolling the entire wrap , tucking food in with your fingers as you go . once you have completed a single roll , use your fingers to tuck the roll all the way under and give it a squeeze to make sure the food components stay inside the roll . push down on the roll and squeeze firmly . roll straw mat away from the food roll . plastic wrap should still be holding in the food roll and the food wrap should look neat and firmly in place .

column1: roll it all up in plastic wrap .
column2: roll the bamboo sheet . squeeze the sushi roll and pack all the ingredients in . continue to roll the sushi until the roll is packed securely in the plastic wrapper .

column1: roll it all up in plastic wrap .
column2: take the sushi . roll in plastic wrap .

column1: dice the tuna .
column2: take a cutting board and a knife . take the tuna on the board . cut the tuna in to small pieces . take a small sized bowl . add the tuna in to the small bowl .

column1: dice the tuna .
column2: put the tuna on a cutting board and use a sharp knife to cut into tiny squares . place the chopped tuna in a bowl .

column1: dice the tuna .
column2: use a knife to carefully cut the tuna . take the tuna and dice it into small squares .

column1: unwrap the roll and cut it with a sharp knife .
column2: unwrap the sushi roll from the plastic . take a nice and carefully cut the sushi into pieces . cut into 8 equal pieces .

column1: unwrap the roll and cut it with a sharp knife .
column2: grab the end of the roll and unwrap it . use a sharp knife and carefully cut 1 inch circles out of the roll .

column1: unwrap the roll and cut it with a sharp knife .
column2: we now want to unwrap our roll . now grab a very sharp knife and wet it down . take the knife and slice the roll int even chunks , about an inch and half wide .

column1: fry some sausage on a pan .
column2: heat oil in a pan over high heat . add sausage links . get until brown on all sides .

column1: fry some sausage on a pan .
column2: the oil in the pan will be bubbling when its hot . slowly put the meat in the pan carefully the oil is hot and will burn you .

column1: fry some sausage on a pan .
column2: once your pan is hot , put the sausage in the pan . cook the sausage on both sides . wait until both sides are brown .

column1: cook some chopped onion and leek in another pan .
column2: carefully and slowly push the cut up onion and leek into the pan . use a spatula to mix them around while they cook .

column1: cook some chopped onion and leek in another pan .
column2: put an onion and a leek on a cutting board . use a knife to chop the onion and leek into small pieces . use your hand to push the chopped onion and leek from the cutting board into the pan .

column1: cook some chopped onion and leek in another pan .
column2: put some chopped onion into the pan . add some leeks to the pan . stir the pan until the mixture of leeks and onions are soft .

column1: add some water to the vegetables and add stock cube and black pepper .
column2: add water to the pot . after you add water add the stock cube . sprinkle a little pepper into the pot . stir it all together with a spatula .

column1: add some water to the vegetables and add stock cube and black pepper .
column2: add 500 ml of water to the pan . put in a stock cube to the pan . put in a little black pepper .

column1: add some water to the vegetables and add stock cube and black pepper .
column2: there are some cut up vegetables in the pot on the stove . the stove is already turned on . find a glass measuring cup with red writing and red lines on the outside of the cup , turn on the water at the sink and fill it to the top . cut the water off . pour all the water into the pot on the stove that has the cut up vegetables in it . unwrap the small cube that reads stock on it , mash it up in your hand and put in the same pot of vegetables . take the pepper shaker , looks like salt but darker . put a little bit in the vegetable pot too . stir with the thing that looks like a flat spoon .

column1: pour dry parsley leaves to the pan .
column2: put a small amount dry sage into the pot . use a spatula to stir .

column1: pour dry parsley leaves to the pan .
column2: get your sage ready . very carefully pour it into your pot of boiling water .

column1: pour dry parsley leaves to the pan .
column2: boil the contents in the pot . add some dry parsley leaves to the pan . stir the pot .

column1: mix boiled potato butter milk mustard and mash them .
column2: put half a stick of butter over the potatoes . the heat from the potatoes will help it melt . measure out 100 milliliters of cream into a measuring cup . pour it over the potatoes . ( you could also use milk ) . put in an overflowing tablespoon of whole grain mustard . sprinkle in 1 teaspoon of sage . mash it up with a masher . use a big metal spoon as a substitute if you do n't have a masher .

column1: mix boiled potato butter milk mustard and mash them .
column2: put the boiled potatoes , butter , cream or milk , 1 tsp of sage , and 1 tsp mustard into a bowl . mash everything together .

column1: mix boiled potato butter milk mustard and mash them .
column2: add butter , milk , mustard and sage to the bowl with the potatoes . use a masher to mash the potatoes and mix everything together .

column1: place the sausage and vegetable mixture on the potatoes .
column2: place the potatoes in the center of the plate so they make a nice , centered mound . place 2 sausages onto the potatoes , spaced evenly and secured into the potatoes so they do n't roll off . cover the potatoes and sausages with the vegetable and gravy mixture .

column1: place the sausage and vegetable mixture on the potatoes .
column2: put the potatoes onto the plate and flatten . next add the sausages to the top of the potatoes . then add the vegetable gravy to the top of the sausages and potatoes .

column1: place the sausage and vegetable mixture on the potatoes .
column2: make sure your potatoes are centered on the plate . place the 2 pieces of cooked sausage on top of the pile of mashed potatoes . leave a dash of salt on top of the plate . then , pour 2 large spoonfuls of gravy mix onto the sausage and potatoes .

column1: add flour corn starch salt and water to a bowl and stir .
column2: get a large mixing bowl , a fork and a whisk . put 1/2 cup of flour , 1/2 cup corn flour , and 1/8 teaspoon of salt in the bowl . get a large measuring cup and put 3/4 cup of water in it . slowly add a little bit of water to the flour mixture . stir the flour mixture with the whisk . keep adding water until it looks like a thick batter . use the fork to get the flour lumps out of the batter by squeezing the lumps against the side of the bowl . keep doing this until the batter has no lumps .

column1: add flour corn starch salt and water to a bowl and stir .
column2: add half a cup of plain flour , half a cup of corn flour and a pinch of salt . this will be added to a large mixing bowl . stir to combine all of the dry ingredients . add a little of water at a time to make a batter that is free of lumps . if need be use a sieve to remove any lumps .

column1: add flour corn starch salt and water to a bowl and stir .
column2: in a mixing bowl add half a cup of flour . in a mixing bowl add half a cup of flour . add half a cup of corn flour to your mixing bowl . add half a cup of corn flour to your mixing bowl . add a pinch of salt to your mixing bowl . slowly add 3/4 cup of water while you are stirring everything in your mixing bowl together . stir until your there are no more lumps .

column1: heat and grease a pan and pour the batter on the pan .
column2: heat the pan up and grease it lightly with oil . turn the stove top on by turning the knob on the oven . tilt the pan on all tides to grease the entire bottom of the pan . you can use a paper towel to absorb and excess oil . pour in a ladle of batter into the pan and tilt the pan on all sides to thin out the batter . this will create a larger circle .

column1: heat and grease a pan and pour the batter on the pan .
column2: pour a small amount of oil into a frying pan . use a paper towel to spread the oil in the pan . heat the pan on the stove . using a deep spoon pour batter into pan and move pan around to form a circle .

column1: heat and grease a pan and pour the batter on the pan .
column2: heat the pan and put oil in it . pour some batter in the pan . tilt the pan around to make a thin circle .

column1: cook the wrapper .
column2: turn the heat on to medium under the pan . cook the batter to make a wrapper by cooking it until the edges start to come up off of the pan . then , flip the wrapper over and cook the other side for just a few seconds . repeat this with the rest of the batter to make more wrappers .

column1: cook the wrapper .
column2: switch on the stove . place a pan on the stove . keep the wrapper on the pan until it cooks . flip the wrapper and cook the other side when the sides get peeled off . remove and keep it aside .

column1: cook the wrapper .
column2: heat a pan on your stove top with the dial at medium . when the pan is hot put your wrapper into the pan . when the sides start to come up from the pan , use a spatula to flip the wrapper over . leave in pan for a few seconds . use spatula to move the wrapper to a plate .

column1: heat oil and add chopped onions grated ginger green peppers .
column2: turn on the stove to high heat and place down pan . pour some oil into the pan and let it heat up . then add 1/4 cup of sliced onions . now add a teaspoon of grated ginger . finally 1/4 cup of sliced green peppers and let it all heat up in the oil .

column1: heat oil and add chopped onions grated ginger green peppers .
column2: pour 1 tablespoon into a wok that is on top of your stove with the dial turned to high . add in 1/4 cup of sliced onion , 1 teaspoon of grated ginger , 1/4 cup of sliced green peppers .

column1: heat oil and add chopped onions grated ginger green peppers .
column2: put 1 tablespoon of oil in a wok on high heat . wait for the oil to get hot . add 1/4 cup of cut up onions and 1/4 cup of cut up green pepper and 1 teaspoon of ginger cut up into very small pieces .

column1: add shredded cabbage julienned carrots salt and pepper .
column2: add shredded cabbage to heated pan . add julienned ( small match shaped slices ) of carrot to pan . stir occasionally and cook until veggies are soft . add salt and pepper and stir again .

column1: add shredded cabbage julienned carrots salt and pepper .
column2: cut the cabbage into thing string like structures . cut the carrots really thin almost like paper . add some salt and pepper .

column1: add shredded cabbage julienned carrots salt and pepper .
column2: put your shredded cabbage into the pan . put your julienned carrots into the pan . add salt into the pan . add pepper into the pan . use a spoon to mix all together .

column1: add flour and water .
column2: put 3 tablespoons of flour in a bowl . add a small splash of water . mix with a fork until it becomes a paste .

column1: add flour and water .
column2: add 3 tablespoons of flour to a small bowl . add a small amount of water to the flour . use a spoon to stir until it makes a smooth , thick paste .

column1: add flour and water .
column2: put 3 tablespoons of flour in a small bowl . add a small amount of water and stir . you want a thick paste that is smooth . if the paste is too think , or not smooth , add in small amounts of water until it looks the way you want it to .

column1: place the wrapper and filling down and put paste on the edges .
column2: take the spring roll wrapper on a plate . take the filling in a bowl . place the filling in one half of wrapper . take the flour past in a bowl . apply the flour paste to the edges of wrapper .

column1: place the wrapper and filling down and put paste on the edges .
column2: take 1 wrapper and put onto cutting board . take a spoonful of filling and place onto middle of wrapper . dip finger into paste and paint around the edge of the wrapper .

column1: place the wrapper and filling down and put paste on the edges .
column2: place the rice paper on a very flat surface . put 1 tablespoon of your filling in the lower portion of the rice paper . gently rub flour paste around the edges of the rice paper . the flour paste works like glue to keep the spring roll sealed while it is cooking .

column1: fold roll and seal the wrapper .
column2: without applying a lot of pressure pull up the wrapper and fold over the filling . roll until you reach the center of the wrapper . add a little paste on the edges and fold in the sides . continue to roll the wrapper until the end has been reached . seal the edges well so nothing falls out when it is fried .

column1: fold roll and seal the wrapper .
column2: put the mix on the wrapper . put paste around the edge of the wrapper . next without too much pressure roll wrapper to the center . then add more paste to folded edges . fold each end in and then roll until you reach the end .

column1: fold roll and seal the wrapper .
column2: take one end and carefully roll it until you get to the middle . put a tiny bit more paste on the folded sides of the roll . pick up the left edge and fold it to the center of the roll . pick up the right edge and fold it to the center of the roll . roll the entire folded piece forward until it 's completely closed and nothing leaks out .

column1: fry the rolls in oil .
column2: place a pan onto the stove top . add about a cup of oil to the pan . turn the stove heat to medium by turning the control know to halfway . add the rolls , one at a time into the pan . once the roll is a golden brown color , ( about 4 - 5 minutes ) , use a spoon to lift the roll . once the oil is drained , place the roll on a plate .

column1: fry the rolls in oil .
column2: heat the oil in a pan . once the oil is heated , put one roll at a time in the oil . cook roll for 4 to 5 minutes until golden brown in color . using a slotted spoon take the roll out of the pan and allow oil to drain off of roll . put cooked rolls on serving plate .

column1: fry the rolls in oil .
column2: once you have your spring rolls wrapped , put the oil in a frying pan to medium heat . once the oil is heated , put one roll at the time into the frying pan . each roll should be left in the oil for about 4 - 5 minutes , or until the roll turns into golden brown completely . using a deep fry skimmer , take the roll out of oil , and leave it on top of pan , so that the extra oil in the roll drips back into the pan . place 2 - 3 pieces of paper towel on top of a place , and place roll on top of this plate .

column1: boil and strain the potatoes put them into a pan and mash .
column2: boil the potatoes in a pan . then strain the potatoes to get rid of the extra water . pour the potatoes into a pan . use a masher or fork to smash down the potatoes .

column1: boil and strain the potatoes put them into a pan and mash .
column2: the peeled potatoes are taken out of the pot they were cooked in . they were put into a strainer . the put into an to mash . she mashes them with a potato masher . then she adds milk .

column1: boil and strain the potatoes put them into a pan and mash .
column2: take potatoes and enough water to cover them in a large pot and put it on the stove with a medium - high heat setting . let these boil . when the potatoes have boiled and are soft , carefully drain the potatoes into a strainer being careful not to splash yourself . use pot holders . once your potatoes are drained , put them back into the pan . use a potato masher to smash up all of the potatoes in the pan until they look like mashed potatoes .

column1: transfer the mashed potatoes into a mixing bowl and mix with cabbage .
column2: with a big spoon , scoop the mashed potatoes from the pot to a mixing bowl . with large tongs , move the cabbage into the bowl with the mashed potatoes . take the large spoon and gently mix the potatoes and cabbage together by moving the bottom of the mixture to the top and repeat until blended .

column1: transfer the mashed potatoes into a mixing bowl and mix with cabbage .
column2: use a spoon to scoop the mashed potatoes into a mixing bowl . add cabbage to the mixing bowl . use a stirring spoon to mix the potatoes and cabbage together .

column1: transfer the mashed potatoes into a mixing bowl and mix with cabbage .
column2: transfer a couple spoons of potatoes into another bowl . add a scoop or two of cooked cabbage to the potatoes . do n't forget to add the salt . fold the ingredients together with a large spoon until they are well - mixed , but do n't stir them .

column1: add some milk and mash the potatoes .
column2: now we are going to add in our milk to the pan . once the milk is in , we can start mashing the potatoes . using our masher , just keep pressing until they are smooth and creamy .

column1: add some milk and mash the potatoes .
column2: cut potatoes with a knife into small pieces . put them in a pot and cook until soft . drain them and add milk . take a tool to mash them . mash until all potatoes are thick and mashed .

column1: add some milk and mash the potatoes .
column2: pour milk into the potatoes in the pot . use a potato masher to mash the potatoes until smooth and creamy .

column1: scoop the mixture on a plate and garnish with chopped parsley .
column2: take a scooper and scoop up some mixture . place it on a plate like ice cream scoops . sprinkle some parsley on top of the scoops on the plate .

column1: scoop the mixture on a plate and garnish with chopped parsley .
column2: use your ice cream scoop . scoop the mixture onto the plate . sprinkle some parsley on top of the mixture with your fingers .

column1: scoop the mixture on a plate and garnish with chopped parsley .
column2: use an ice cream scoop and scoop the mashed potatoes onto a plate . take some parsley and sprinkle it over the top of the potatoes .

column1: sprinkle some salt and pepper and continue mixing .
column2: add some salt and pepper to the bowl . use a spoon to keep mixing .

column1: sprinkle some salt and pepper and continue mixing .
column2: add some salt and pepper . you will continue folding the mixture together with your large spoon . fold it over into its self a few times .

column1: sprinkle some salt and pepper and continue mixing .
column2: grab some salt and pepper with your fingers . sprinkle the salt and pepper in the bowl . keep mixing with a big spoon .

column1: boil some water in a pan and add cabbage green onions salt and pepper .
column2: get a cooking pan and add water about half way up . let the water come to a boil . add some cabbage and some cut up green onions . add a little bit of salt and pepper .

column1: boil some water in a pan and add cabbage green onions salt and pepper .
column2: pour water in a pan . turn the heat up on the stove . wait until the water is bubbling up quickly . use tongs to push in the cabbage green onions salt and pepper .

column1: boil some water in a pan and add cabbage green onions salt and pepper .
column2: bring a pan of water to a boil . add cabbage , green onions and salt and pepper to the pan of water . put a lid on the pan , and let it simmer for about 5 to 7 minutes .

column1: place celery and carrot sticks into water .
column2: put your celery and carrot sticks into the water and ice in a bowl to make them crispy . leave them in the cold water and ice while you are cooking .

column1: place celery and carrot sticks into water .
column2: put some water and ice into a bowl . put the celery and carrots sticks into the ice water to make them crisp .

column1: place celery and carrot sticks into water .
column2: grab a cutting board . cut up carrot and celery into sticks . fill up cup with water . add ice . place celery and carrots into ice bath .

column1: coat the wings with sauce .
column2: put the wings in the hot pan . use a spoon to toss the wings in the sauce and make sure they are coated . remove the wings from the pan and put on a plate .

column1: coat the wings with sauce .
column2: slowly add the wings to the sauce being careful not to splash the hot sauce . use a large mixing spoon and stir the wings and the sauce together . when the wings are covered with the sauce turn off the heat . put the wings on a plate .

column1: coat the wings with sauce .
column2: gently and carefully pour the chicken wings into the wok . using a large spoon , gently stir the wings into the sauce . keep stirring until all wings are covered with the sauce .

column1: add baking powder black pepper and salt and mix .
column2: first add about a tablespoon of baking powder . then add a teaspoon of crushed black pepper and three quarter of a tablespoon of regular sea salt . mix it using your gloved hands to incorporate all the flavors . let the mixture sit out for about ten to fifteen minutes before adding it to the oil so they 're not ice cold .

column1: add baking powder black pepper and salt and mix .
column2: use measuring spoons . put 1 tablespoon of baking powder . put 1 teaspoon of pepper powder . put 3/4 teaspoon of salt . mix the meat and make sure the powders have coated the meats .

column1: add baking powder black pepper and salt and mix .
column2: pour in the baking powder . pour in the salt and black pepper . use your hands to squeeze and squish everything together mixing it .

column1: heat cooking oil and fry the chicken wings .
column2: add 3 cups cooking oil to pan . heat oil on high . add chicken wings to oil . make sure when you add the chicken that the oil is making a sizzling sound . while chicken wings are cooking take a metal cooking spoon and stir gently to make sure the chicken does not stick together or to the bottom . have the chicken evenly coated in oil , then lower the heat to medium high heat to cook the chicken through and not burn .

column1: heat cooking oil and fry the chicken wings .
column2: place a pan on the stove . add some oil in to the pan . heat the oil in the pan . add the chicken wings in to the hot oil . fry the chicken wings in the oil .

column1: heat cooking oil and fry the chicken wings .
column2: put 3 cups of cooking oil into a frying pan . pour the chicken wings into the pan of oil . stir the chicken around in oil . set on medium high and cook for 15 minutes .

column1: cut chicken wings and drumette .
column2: with a knife cut the legs off the chicken . cut the wing and drumette so you have 2 pieces .

column1: cut chicken wings and drumette .
column2: hold the end of the chicken . use a butcher knife and carefully chop the end of the chicken off by the foot .

column1: cut chicken wings and drumette .
column2: put the chicken wing on a cutting board . use a sharp knife to cut off the chicken toe . use a knife to cut the wing into two portions - wing and drumette . repeat the same steps for all 20 pieces of chicken .

column1: add butter hot sauce vinegar cayenne and tomato ketchup .
column2: first , put in a tablespoon of butter into the wok . shake the butter around in the wok and let the butter melt . now once the butter is melted , add in the hot sauce of your choice . around 3 tablespoons of so . next we can add in 2 tablespoons of vinegar . use a spoon to mix the sauce around and then add a little cayenne followed by about 3 tablespoons of ketchup straight into the wok . now stir some more !

column1: add butter hot sauce vinegar cayenne and tomato ketchup .
column2: add a tablespoon of butter to your hot wok that 's on the stove . add franks red hot sauce of about three tablespoons to your wok . now add about two tablespoons of vinegar to your wok and cook it for a bit using a spoon to mix it . add a pinch of cayenne . now add about three tablespoons of ketchup and mix it with your spoon .

column1: add butter hot sauce vinegar cayenne and tomato ketchup .
column2: take a pan and heat the pan . melt some butter in the pan . add some hot sauce in to the butter . add some vinegar and cayenne pepper in to the pan . add some tomato ketch up in to the pan and mix everything in the pan .

column1: spread rice onto the sheet and flip over .
column2: spread the rice gently onto the sheet . flip the sheet over .

column1: spread rice onto the sheet and flip over .
column2: use your fingers to press rice onto sheet . then turn the sheet over .

column1: spread rice onto the sheet and flip over .
column2: lightly pat the rice onto the sheet and spread the rice evenly . flip the sheet over carefully .

column1: place the tuna in the center of the sheet .
column2: add the spicy tuna on top of the sheet that you have flipped over . make sure to put it in a line along the middle of the sheet .

column1: place the tuna in the center of the sheet .
column2: take the tuna in a bowl . take the sheet . place the tuna mixture on the sheet . spread the mixture along the center of the sheet . cover the entire length of sheet .

column1: place the tuna in the center of the sheet .
column2: place your tuna into the middle of the sheet in a row . have it touch the sheet on the left and right side but it does n't need to go all the way to the top and the bottom of the sheet .

column1: place the cucumber next to the tuna .
column2: place a spoonful of tuna onto the pastry . using a vegetable knife , slice a cucumber into thin sticks . lay a cucumber stick beside the tuna .

column1: place the cucumber next to the tuna .
column2: place a strip of cucumber next to your line of tuna . you may need two strips to get it all the way to the edge .

column1: roll up the sheet .
column2: fold the roll over . keep rolling and be careful not to let the inside of the roll fall out .

column1: roll up the sheet .
column2: once you place all the ingredients onto your roll you can start to roll it . you first fold it and tightly tuck it and roll it . it 's better to roll it away from you .

column1: roll up the sheet .
column2: once you add your ingredients into your sushi wrapper . slowly roll it away from you . like you are rolling a log . careful not to squish it or you will end up with a flat sushi roll .

column1: place tuna on top of the roll .
column2: after you roll the sushi roll , it is time for the tuna . make sure your surface is clean and the tuna is kept cold until right before using . this will make sure the tuna tastes fresh . the tuna should be cut into strips about 1 1/2 to 2 inches long , just enough to cover the top and sides of the roll . lay the tuna across the top of the roll like you are draping a blanket over the roll . ( imagine you are laying the tuna on the roll like railroad track but much closer together ! ) . repeat with the tuna until you have covered the entire roll and there is no rice showing . we want this roll to be all pink on top ! wash your hands after handling any raw fish .

column1: place tuna on top of the roll .
column2: take the roll on a plate . take the tuna on a cutting board . cut the tuna in to thin strips . take the tuna strips on a bowl . place the tuna slices on top of roll .

column1: place tuna on top of the roll .
column2: lay the sliced tuna over the top on the roll . keep adding slices of tuna next to each other so the whole roll is covered in tuna .

column1: place saran wrap and a mat on top of the roll and press the roll .
column2: place saran wrap on top so it does n't come apart . then cover with bamboo and press just enough to mold .

column1: place saran wrap and a mat on top of the roll and press the roll .
column2: use a square of plastic wrap and place flat over top of roll . place a bamboo mat on top of place wrap flat . press inward around the roll with the bamboo mat . do not press too hard , just enough to keep it molded together .

column1: place saran wrap and a mat on top of the roll and press the roll .
column2: put plastic wrap and bamboo mat on top of roll . use your hands to press to form a roll . be sure side are tucked in , so nothing is loose .

column1: cut the roll into pieces .
column2: leave the saran wrap on the roll . you will want to cut the roll into 5 or 6 pieces .

column1: cut the roll into pieces .
column2: find a sharp knife . use the knife to slice the roll into small pieces .

column1: cut the roll into pieces .
column2: use a sharp knife and cutting board . carefully slice the roll into eight even sized pieces .

column1: place the spinach on top of the rolls .
column2: place your spinach on top of the rolls . one piece on top of each slice of roll is plenty .

column1: place the spinach on top of the rolls .
column2: grab the spinach from the bigger plate and put it in your hands . take each piece of spinach and put them one at a time on top of the rolls . make sure to create layers .

column1: place the spinach on top of the rolls .
column2: place the spinach on top of the sushi rolls . serve afterwards .

column1: add the cut pork to the sauce and mix well to marinate and leave for 20 minutes .
column2: you 're going to take the pork that you have already cut . using a knife to carefully slide the pork off of the cutting board , add the pork into the bowl of sauce . grab a large spoon . using the spoon , you 're going to mix the pork in with the sauce by shifting it around in the bowl , making sure to stir from the bottom up . allow the pork to sit in the sauce to marinate for 20 minutes .

column1: add the cut pork to the sauce and mix well to marinate and leave for 20 minutes .
column2: mix the sauce in the bowl . place the cut pork into the bowl of sauce . move the pork around into the sauce until the sauce is covering all of the pork . leave the pork in the sauce for 20 minutes so that the flavor of the sauce soaks into the pork for better flavor .

column1: add the cut pork to the sauce and mix well to marinate and leave for 20 minutes .
column2: hold the bowl of cut pork pieces over the sauce bowl . use a spoon to scoop the pork into the sauce . mix everything together well with the spoon .

column1: put chopped onions and stir for 2 - 3 minutes until it is fragrant .
column2: put in the cut up onions into the pan . use chopsticks to mix the onions around while they cook . they are ready when they smell nice after 2 or 3 minutes .

column1: put chopped onions and stir for 2 - 3 minutes until it is fragrant .
column2: put the chopped onions into the pan . stir for 2 to 3 minutes until you can smell the onions .

column1: put chopped onions and stir for 2 - 3 minutes until it is fragrant .
column2: now we want to take our chopped onions and put them into our oiled pan . we will heat them for 2 - 3 minutes . while heating them , make sure you stir the noodles around using a spoon or cooking utensil .

column1: then put a layer of white rice in the center of vegetables .
column2: cover the bottom of the plate with the lettuce . next , add a handful of your carrot sticks . then add one spoonful of the cut tomatoes . next , add a spoonful of the yellow corn . finally , use a spoon to cover the middle of the plate with rice .

column1: then put a layer of white rice in the center of vegetables .
column2: take a spoon or paddle to scoop the rice . gently place a scoop of rice and put it in the middle of the vegetables .

column1: then put a layer of white rice in the center of vegetables .
column2: get a plate . place all the vegetables on the plate . have the cooked white rice ready . get a spatula . use a spatula and put the white rice on top of the colorful vegetables .

column1: add the marinated pork and cook while stirring until the pork cooks through .
column2: take the marinated and put it into the pan . stir it around for 6 - 8 minutes and you hear the marinated sizzle nicely in the pan . now you just want to keep stirring until it is all heated up .

column1: add the marinated pork and cook while stirring until the pork cooks through .
column2: pour the marinated pork into the frying pan . use your stirring sticks to spread the pork around the pan allow it all to cook . continue to cook until the pork cooks through on all sides .

column1: add the marinated pork and cook while stirring until the pork cooks through .
column2: marinate the pork with the sauces and keep it for sometime . add the marinated cook into the pan . keep stirring until the pork gets cooked . the color looks orangish and tasty .

column1: chop cucumber lettuce tomatoes and carrots into slices .
column2: cut cucumbers in half and slice each half about one centimeter thick . chop lettuce in one inch wide slices each way . chop tomatoes in half . then cut the half into quarters . cut carrots in halves . then chop into thin slices . then chop into strands . chop the carrot slices into four or five inch thin strands .

column1: chop cucumber lettuce tomatoes and carrots into slices .
column2: chop the cucumbers using a knife diagonal . cut the lettuce lengthwise . cut the lettuce again . cut the tomatoes in half . cut the tomatoes in half again .

column1: chop cucumber lettuce tomatoes and carrots into slices .
column2: take a large cleaver and cut the cucumber , at a slight diagonal , into an eighth inch slices . repeat with the lettuce , tomatoes , and carrots .

column1: cut pork into bite size pieces .
column2: put the pork on the cutting board . get a sharp knife from the knife block . very carefully hold the pork , folding your fingers under to protect them . cut the pork into small bite size pieces . repeat until you ' ve cut all the meat .

column1: cut pork into bite size pieces .
column2: cut pork into cubed pieces . start by cutting pork into strips . then cut strips into small cubed bite sized pieces .

column1: cut pork into bite size pieces .
column2: get 200 grams of pork . chop the pork into bite sized pieces with a sharp knife .

column1: heat a frying pan on a medium heat and drizzle little sesame oil .
column2: place the frying pan on the stove . heat the frying pan to a medium heat . sprinkle the sesame oil in small drops over the whole pan .

column1: heat a frying pan on a medium heat and drizzle little sesame oil .
column2: put a frying pan on the stove . turn the stove to medium heat . take sesame oil and put it across the bottom of the pan .

column1: heat a frying pan on a medium heat and drizzle little sesame oil .
column2: put the pan on the stove and turn the knob up halfway . slowly pour sesame oil in circles on the pan .

column1: combine gochujang soy sauce white sugar lime juice garlic and black pepper to prepare the marinade .
column2: to make the sauce , add 1 tb korean red pepper paste , 1 tb soy sauce , 1 tb white sugar , about 1 tb lemon juice , finely chopped garlic and sprinkle with a little black pepper . use a spoon to combine all the ingredients very well . this sauce can be used as marinade for the pork , or also as sauce for the rice .

column1: combine gochujang soy sauce white sugar lime juice garlic and black pepper to prepare the marinade .
column2: add 1 tablespoon of soy sauce . add white sugar . put in 1 tablespoon of lime juice . add garlic and black pepper . use a spoon to stir the mixture together .

column1: combine gochujang soy sauce white sugar lime juice garlic and black pepper to prepare the marinade .
column2: take a medium sized bowl to prepare marinade . add a tablespoon of gochujang sauce and soy sauce in to the bowl . add a tablespoon of white sugar in to the bowl . add some lime juice in to the bowl . add some pepper powder in to the bowl and mix .

column1: cut an onion into wedges and chop some garlic .
column2: find a large kitchen knife .. . find one medium onion and a couple of cloves of garlic . chop the onion in wedges . chop the garlic into tiny , tiny pieces .

column1: cut an onion into wedges and chop some garlic .
column2: get out a cutting board . take out a sharp knife . put the onion onto the cutting board and cut in half . after the onion is cut in half , cut it into wedges that look like the shape of lemon slices . put the garlic on the cutting board and cut into very small pieces .

column1: cut an onion into wedges and chop some garlic .
column2: take a cutting board and a knife . take half an onion and cut it in to long thin pieces . then cut the other half of onion in same way . take some garlic cloves on the cutting board . cut the garlic in to small pieces .

column1: finally top the rice with spicy pork bibimbap and serve drizzling little bit of sesame oil on top .
column2: add little rice on top of other ingredients . take the spicy pork in a bowl . add the spicy pork bibimbap on top of rice . take some drizzling sesame oil . add the sesame oil on top .

column1: finally top the rice with spicy pork bibimbap and serve drizzling little bit of sesame oil on top .
column2: put rice on top of the veggies with a spoon . put the pork on top of the rice using chopsticks .

column1: finally top the rice with spicy pork bibimbap and serve drizzling little bit of sesame oil on top .
column2: after the rice is on top , put the spicy meat on top of the rice . if you want you can put seaweed slices on top . if you want you can put sesame seeds on top also .

column1: to assemble the dish place a layer of lettuce leaves then arrange carrots tomatoes cucumber and a tbsp of sweetcorn .
column2: place some chopped iceberg lettuce on a plate . arrange the other vegetables on top of the lettuce in any way you like , so that it looks nice .

column1: to assemble the dish place a layer of lettuce leaves then arrange carrots tomatoes cucumber and a tbsp of sweetcorn .
column2: first add your lettuce leaves to your plate using your fingers to spread them nicely . add your thinly sliced carrots carefully to one side of your lettuce nicely arranging them . after that add the slice tomatoes and cucumbers nicely to your plate using your fingers to spread them and arrange them nicely . now add a tablespoon of sweet corn to your plate . now it 's complete .

column1: to assemble the dish place a layer of lettuce leaves then arrange carrots tomatoes cucumber and a tbsp of sweetcorn .
column2: place your chopped iceberg lettuce in a nice pile in the middle of a large plate . take a handful of carrot sticks and leaving them in a bunch place them on one side of the mound of lettuce . next to your carrot sticks , arrange some sliced tomatoes on top of the lettuce . then arrange your sliced cucumbers next to your tomatoes on top of the lettuce . finally , top off the rest of the lettuce with about a handful of sweet corn .

column1: put bread crumbs in food processor process transfer to a bowl and soak in milk .
column2: rip up pieces of bread and put the pieces in a food processor bowl . put the lid for the food processor on the food processor bowl . push the button on the food processor to chip the food . hit the stop button when all the pieces are very small . take the lid off the food processor bowl . pour the bread crumbs from the food processor bowl into a large mixing bowl . pour the milk from the measuring cup into the bowl with the bread crumbs . stir with a fork so that the crumbs soak up the milk .

column1: put bread crumbs in food processor process transfer to a bowl and soak in milk .
column2: tear apart 2 slices of fresh sandwich bread and place into food processor . put lid on processor and push the start button to process for 10 seconds . dump breadcrumbs out of processor bowl into a medium bowl . pour 1/3 cup of milk into the bowl and stir with a fork so the bread can absorb it .

column1: put bread crumbs in food processor process transfer to a bowl and soak in milk .
column2: tear the bread into smaller pieces . place the pieces into the food processor and close the lid . turn the food processor on and wait 10 seconds . pour the processed bread into a bowl . pour 1/3 cup of milk onto the bread , use a fork to stir the bread just a little , and let the bread sit still in the bowl .

column1: put 28 ounces of tomato into the processor and puree .
column2: pour your 28 oz can of tomatoes into the food processor . turn your food process on and allow the tomatoes to puree for about 20 seconds .

column1: put 28 ounces of tomato into the processor and puree .
column2: read the can label to see how many ounces of tomatoes you have . you will need 28 ounces of tomato . pour the tomato into the food processor . put the lid on the food processor and turn on . keep the food processor on until the tomatoes are cut up and look like liquid .

column1: put 28 ounces of tomato into the processor and puree .
column2: take 28 ounces of tomato in a jar . take a blender , add the tomato in to the blending jar . close the lid of the blender . blend the tomato in to puree .

column1: add olive oil and garlic to a pot and saute it till the garlic is turns gold .
column2: add olive oil and garlic to the pot . stir the garlic in the pot until it turns a gold color .

column1: add olive oil and garlic to a pot and saute it till the garlic is turns gold .
column2: turn stove on medium heat . using a tablespoon , pour olive oil into pot and place pot on stove . when the oil begins to bubble add the garlic . watch the garlic change from white to a dark , golden yellow . remove pot from stove .

column1: add olive oil and garlic to a pot and saute it till the garlic is turns gold .
column2: take a pot and heat it . add some olive oil in to the pot . heat the oil for few seconds . cut the garlic in to very small pieces . fry the garlic till they are golden brown .

column1: add the tomatoes 1/2 tsp of italian spice 2 tsp of sugar 1/4 of salt and some pepper and stir .
column2: add the tomatoes to the pot on the stove . add 1/2 teaspoon of italian seasoning , two teaspoon of sugar , 1/4 teaspoon of salt , and some pepper . stir well . next add some fresh basil .

column1: add the tomatoes 1/2 tsp of italian spice 2 tsp of sugar 1/4 of salt and some pepper and stir .
column2: after it has cooked for a minute , add the tomatoes . next add a 1/2 teaspoon of italian spice . then add 2 tablespoons of sugar . next add 1/4 teaspoon of salt and pepper to taste . stir all ingredients together .

column1: add the tomatoes 1/2 tsp of italian spice 2 tsp of sugar 1/4 of salt and some pepper and stir .
column2: add the tomatoes . add 1/2 tsp of italian spice , 2 tsp of sugar , 1/4 tsp salt and a little pepper . stir everything together and let it cook .

column1: add an egg parsley parmesan italian spice garlic salt and pepper to the bread crumbs and mix .
column2: break open an egg in to the bowl . add 1 table spoon of cut parsley in to the bowl . add 1 tablespoon of parmesan and italian spice in to the bowl . add little salt and pepper in to the bowl . mix everything with bread crumbs in the bowl .

column1: add an egg parsley parmesan italian spice garlic salt and pepper to the bread crumbs and mix .
column2: gather ingredients : egg , parsley , parmesan , italian spice , a clove of garlic , salt , pepper . cut the garlic clove into very tiny pieces . add all ingredients to the meat . mix well with hands .

column1: add an egg parsley parmesan italian spice garlic salt and pepper to the bread crumbs and mix .
column2: add an egg to the mixture to the bread crumbs in the bowl . 1 tablespoon of parsley and 1 tablespoon of parmesan cheese . next add 1/2 teaspoon of italian spice . then add 1 clove of chopped garlic and 1/4 teaspoon of salt and some fresh pepper . then mix together well before adding the meat .

column1: add 3/4 pound of ground beef and mix well to incorporate all the ingredients .
column2: make sure to grab some gloves before the mix . put the 3/4 pounds of meat inside of the bowl with the mixture . once the meat is on top of the mixture , flip the meat to the bottom of the mixture . using your hand , mix with meat with the mixture . you can squeeze the meat and mixture together until all ingredients are well blended .

column1: add 3/4 pound of ground beef and mix well to incorporate all the ingredients .
column2: put the meat into the bowl . you can use gloves if you want . grab the meat with your hands and smash it together . fold it over the unmixed part . keep grabbing handfuls and folding it over itself until it 's all mixed together .

column1: add 3/4 pound of ground beef and mix well to incorporate all the ingredients .
column2: pick up the tray of beef and turn it over so it goes into the bowl . then put on a pair of latex gloves . next , begin squeezing and moving around the beef so it mixes with the other ingredients .

column1: make 8 meat balls out of the mixture prepared .
column2: divide the meat into four sections . each section will make two meatballs . roll all of the meat into meatballs first . you should have a total of 8 meatballs . afterward , you will drop them into the sauce to cook .

column1: make 8 meat balls out of the mixture prepared .
column2: divide the meat into eight balls . each ball should be the same size . pick up one of the balls and roll it in between your hands . put the ball on the tray . do the same thing with each of the seven balls you have left .

column1: make 8 meat balls out of the mixture prepared .
column2: divide the meat mixture into 4 equal parts . each part will make 2 meatballs . use your hands to roll each meatball for a total of 8 . place each meatball on a plate and then add to pot of sauce to cook .

column1: drop all the meatballs into the boiling pot of sauce and cook .
column2: place 7 inch saucepan on stove and pour sauce in the pot . turn on the burner to high until sauce starts to boil . once sauce is boiling , gently add the meatballs to the pot . cover meatballs by pressing down on them with a spoon . cook meatballs for 20 minutes . you may have to turn down the heat if the pot starts boiling over .

column1: drop all the meatballs into the boiling pot of sauce and cook .
column2: place the sauce into a pot and place the pot on the stove . turn the heat to medium heat . let the sauce cook until bubbly . place the meatballs into the sauce with your hands . be careful not to touch the sauce . take a spatula and tap the tops of the meatballs down in the sauce until the sauce covers them . let the sauce cook on the stove for about 20 minutes .

column1: drop all the meatballs into the boiling pot of sauce and cook .
column2: get a seven inch sauce pan . add enough marinara to sauce pan so that it will cover meatballs . heat the marinara up so it is simmering . add the meatballs carefully by hand . submerge any meatballs that are not covered .

column1: add 3 ounces of spaghetti into boiling water .
column2: put 3 ounces of spaghetti into a pot of boiling water . boil according to package directions .

column1: add 3 ounces of spaghetti into boiling water .
column2: once your water is boiling grab 3 ounces of spaghetti noodles . place the noodles into the boiling water .

column1: chop and add fresh basil and stir .
column2: chop 2 tablespoons of basil into small pieces . add in pot and stir in for flavor .

column1: chop and add fresh basil and stir .
column2: slice fresh basil into small strips . right before the dish is done add basil to pot and stir .

column1: chop and add fresh basil and stir .
column2: take fresh basil and pinch slightly . bring down knife in slicing or sawing motion to make strips . measure 2 tablespoon of basil . pick up and add to pot . stir in .

column1: drain the spaghetti .
column2: once the spaghetti is finished cooking , we must remove the water from the pot . using potholders or mitts , because the pot will be hot , grab on both sides of the pot . take the pot to a sink . put a colander , which is like a bowl with holes in it , into the sink . carefully pour the water and the spaghetti noodles into the colander to separate the noodles from the water .

column1: drain the spaghetti .
column2: put your strainer in the sink . carefully pick up the pot of spaghetti and water . pour the spaghetti and water into the strainer .

column1: drain the spaghetti .
column2: take a colander . put the colander into the sink . take the pot of spaghetti into the colander . take the colander of spaghetti and put it into a bowl .

column1: stir sauce into the spaghetti serve with meatballs in the center and sprinkle on parmesan .
column2: put cooked spaghetti into a bowl and add some cooked sauce to the spaghetti . use some tongs to toss the spaghetti noodles around until the are coated with the sauce . put the coated spaghetti onto a plate . take two meatballs out of the pot and place them on top of the spaghetti that is on the plate . add a bit of extra sauce and then sprinkle some parmesan cheese over the top off the whole plate .

column1: stir sauce into the spaghetti serve with meatballs in the center and sprinkle on parmesan .
column2: put a little sauce on your spaghetti . use a pair of tongs to stir the spaghetti and sauce together . put the spaghetti in a serving dish . use a spoon to scoop two meatballs and more sauce on top of the spaghetti . sprinkle parmesan cheese on top .

column1: stir sauce into the spaghetti serve with meatballs in the center and sprinkle on parmesan .
column2: use a spoon to scoop up sauce . spoon sauce onto the spaghetti , use tongs to mix . use spoon to pick up meatballs and place on top of spaghetti . lastly , put some parmesan cheese on top .

column1: blend the onions and garlic .
column2: pour the chopped onion and garlic into the food processor bowl . place the lid on the food processor and lock lid into place . turn the food processor on to process the onion and garlic . add the processed onion and garlic to the bowl of chick peas .

column1: blend the onions and garlic .
column2: add cut up onions to the food processor . add cut up garlic into the food processor .

column1: blend the onions and garlic .
column2: place cut up onion into food processor . next add garlic cloves to the food processor . put the lid tightly on the food processor . turn on the food processor to blend the two together .

column1: peel slice and grate the cucumber .
column2: first , peel the skin off of the cucumber with a vegetable peeler . next , cut the cucumber in half on a cutting board with a knife . using a spoon , scoop out the soft insides of the cucumber . grab a vegetable grater and rub the cucumber on the side with the holes . put the grated cucumber into a bowl .

column1: peel slice and grate the cucumber .
column2: take a cucumber . remove the peel of the cucumber . cut the cucumber in to two halves vertically . scoop out the seeds of the cucumber . grate the cucumber .

column1: peel slice and grate the cucumber .
column2: cut a cucumber in half and use only one end . peel the cucumber with a vegetable peeler . slice the cucumber in half , lengthwise . scoop out the seeds from the middle using a teaspoon . with a grater , grate the flesh of the cucumber into a bowl .

column1: fry the falafel .
column2: at 180 degrees c for about three minutes . make sure to evenly space them out so they do not touch each other .

column1: fry the falafel .
column2: heat oil to 180 degrees celsius or 356 degrees fahrenheit . slowly lower fry basket into oil . fry falafel for 3 minutes .

column1: fry the falafel .
column2: roll the prepared falafel into balls , about the size of a golf ball . pour cooking oil into the deep fryer and heat to 180 degrees celsius . once fully heated , place falafel balls on frying grate . cook for about 3 minutes and then carefully remove using ladle . transfer cooked falafel onto a serving platter and enjoy !

column1: blend the chickpeas in a food processor .
column2: pour the chickpeas into the food processor . screw the lid on the food processor . spin the food processor for about 30 seconds . using a spatula scrape the ends off the food processor . tighten the lid and blend the chickpeas again .

column1: blend the chickpeas in a food processor .
column2: put the chickpeas in the food processor . blend . scrape the chickpeas off the side of the food processor with a spatula . blend again .

column1: blend the chickpeas in a food processor .
column2: pour half of the chickpeas into a food processor . put the lid on the food processor and turn it on for a few seconds . turn the food processor off , open the lid , and scrape the sides with a spatula . put the lid back on and turn the food processor to blend the chickpeas into a smooth mixture . repeat with the other half of the chickpeas .

column1: form the mixture into balls .
column2: take the mixture around the size of a golf ball in your hand . press the mixture together into a ball shape . continue until all the mixture is used .

column1: form the mixture into balls .
column2: take some mixture into your hands . shape the mixture into balls using your hands .

column1: form the mixture into balls .
column2: first , clean your hands , we 'll be using our hands for this part . with one hand , grab a bit of the ingredients and put it into the palm of the other hand . then , you 'll want to roll the ingredients into a ball about the size of a golf ball in your hands . place the golf ball sized ball onto a plate and make another ball . keep doing this until the entire mixture of ingredients has been turned into balls .

column1: mix tahini lemon garlic and salt .
column2: pour the lemon juice and salt into the tahini . use a whisk to mix together .

column1: mix tahini lemon garlic and salt .
column2: mix salt , lemon , garlic , and tahini together . whisk it until everything is combined .

column1: mix tahini lemon garlic and salt .
column2: start with a bowl of tahini . get 1 clove of chopped garlic and put in a bowl with 1/2 teaspoon salt . put 1/4 cup lemon juice into a bowl . pour the salt and the lemon juice into the bowl of tahini . next pour the salt and garlic mixture and the lemon juice into the tahini . use a whisk to stir all the ingredients until they are mixed well .

column1: mix the cucumber garlic mint yogurt and black pepper .
column2: take a medium sized bowl . add grated cucumber in to the bowl . add little cut pieces of garlic in to the bowl . add 2 tablespoons of mint leaves and a cup of yogurt in to the bowl . add little pepper powder in to the bowl and mix .

column1: mix the cucumber garlic mint yogurt and black pepper .
column2: place small cubed up cucumber in a medium size mixing bowl . add one clove of garlic that has been crushed to the cucumber . add 2 tablespoons of mint that has been chopped to the cucumber and garlic . measure 1 cup of yogurt and add it to the same bowl . mix everything together with a spoon . add ground black pepper and mix again .

column1: mix the cucumber garlic mint yogurt and black pepper .
column2: add 1 crushed garlic clove to the bowl . put in 2 tablespoons of chopped mint . add 1 cup of yogurt . use a spoon to mix everything together . add some crushed black pepper and then mix again .

column1: mix the chickpeas onions garlic coriander and spices together .
column2: add the chickpeas to a medium sized bowl . use a spatula to get the onion and garlic out of your food processor and on top of the chickpeas . now add your previously chopped coriander to bowl . now you can add all the spices to the mixture . use your hand to mix it all together making sure it 's all incorporated .

column1: mix the chickpeas onions garlic coriander and spices together .
column2: get a large bowl and have all of your ingredients ready . add the chickpeas , onions , garlic , coriander , and spices all to the large bowl . mix well with your hands so that all the ingredients are combined .

column1: mix the chickpeas onions garlic coriander and spices together .
column2: pour the chickpeas evenly into the bowl . pour the onions evenly onto the chickpeas in the same bowl . pour the garlic , coriander and other spices into the bowl . use your hands and gently mix the ingredients all together , be sure to scoop down ! you 're done mixing when you can see bits of onion all through the chickpeas end to end , top to bottom .

column1: add some diced vegetables and ground beef to a sauce pan .
column2: take the sauce pan on the stove . take the ground beef in a bowl . cut the vegetables in to small pieces . add the vegetables in to the sauce pan . add the ground beef in to the pan .

column1: add some diced vegetables and ground beef to a sauce pan .
column2: pour chopped vegetables into pan with oil in it on stove . stir vegetables a few minutes and add bay leaf . when vegetables are soft , add thyme and beef to the pan and stir .

column1: add some diced vegetables and ground beef to a sauce pan .
column2: take the vegetables and clean it properly . cut the vegetables into small pieces . add the diced vegetables into the sauce pan . toss the vegetables for some time . add the ground beef into the pan .

column1: cover the sauce pan .
column2: now , you 'll have a hot pot and you 'll need to cover it . get the lid to the pot out . make sure the lid fits the pot . carefully , place the lid onto the pot . this will help you to simmer your ingredients .

column1: cover the sauce pan .
column2: place the lid on top of the pan . wait 1 hour .

column1: cover the sauce pan .
column2: place lid on pot . simmer for 1 hour .

column1: blend the potatoes .
column2: now take your mixer and set your potatoes in larger pan and begin mixing . if your potatoes are dry , you can add a little milk . make sure your potatoes are in a tall pan so they do not go every where . mix for about 2 minutes or until they are smooth .

column1: blend the potatoes .
column2: put the mixer into the pan . mix the potatoes . if needed , add some more milk as you blend the potatoes .

column1: blend the potatoes .
column2: you will need a mixer to mix the potatoes . put the potatoes in a high sided bowl . mix the potatoes with the mixer , add milk if they seem too dry . mix until the potatoes are smooth .

column1: cover the dish with mashed potatoes .
column2: use a spoon to put the mashed potatoes on top of the dish . use the spoon to spread the mashed potatoes in an even layer across the top . make sure to flatten them so they are equal .

column1: cover the dish with mashed potatoes .
column2: using a spoon cover the dish with mashed potatoes . make sure the dish is covered and even using a spoon .

column1: cover the dish with mashed potatoes .
column2: mix the mashed potatoes with your wooden spoon . take a big scoop of the potatoes and slowly and gently spread the potatoes on top of your mixture in the pan . repeat adding the potatoes and spreading out the potatoes until the whole thing is covered .

column1: cook it in the oven and then serve .
column2: turn the dial of the oven to 400 . let it beep . carefully put the pan in the oven and do not touch the hot oven .

column1: cook it in the oven and then serve .
column2: take the pan and carefully place it in a 400 degree f preheated oven . cook for 15 minutes . take out with hot pads and place it on top of the oven . serve using a spatula in desired portions .

column1: cook it in the oven and then serve .
column2: pick up the pan with both your hands . place it into the oven carefully not to burn yourself . cook it for 15 minutes at 400 degrees fahrenheit or 200 celsius . once your timer is off you can carefully remove it from the oven using oven mitts . carefully avoiding touching the pan as it 's very hot , use a spatula to cut a piece of the cottage pie and carefully place it into a dish .

column1: add milk and pepper while mashing the potatoes .
column2: put parsnips and rutabaga into a bowl . add milk to the bowl from a cup . then add the pepper from a small bowl . next use a potato masher and mash the parsnips and rutabaga .

column1: add milk and pepper while mashing the potatoes .
column2: find a potato masher . remove drained vegetables from heat . while still hot add in milk and cumin . mash until smooth .

column1: add milk and pepper while mashing the potatoes .
column2: put parsnips and rutabaga in a bowl . add milk and cumin to the parsnips and rutabaga . use a potato masher to mash the mixture .

column1: add salt tomato paste and stock to the pan .
column2: today we are preparing curried cottage pie with spiced parsnip mash , and you are in the kitchen with bloggin ' out . using a large saucepan that is on and cooking , and a wooden spoon , sprinkle the flour into the cooking sauce . the flour should be pre - measured and ready to toss in . stir after adding . next , add the pre - measured curry powder , lightly sprinkling it in to get it spread evenly . stir . next , add the tomato paste from the tube . you will want to squeeze the tube , giving it about a three second squeeze , about a large tablespoon . stir . next , add the pre - measured beef stock . continue to stir .

column1: add salt tomato paste and stock to the pan .
column2: add the flour , curry powder and tomato paste ( from a tube ) to the pot , while continuing to stir . add the pre - measured beef stock to the pot , and stir it in .

column1: add salt tomato paste and stock to the pan .
column2: pour the cup of tomato paste in the pan carefully . add the salt to the pan .

column1: boil peeled potato and sweet potato in water .
column2: bring a large pot of water to a low boil . pour chopped potatoes into pot .

column1: boil peeled potato and sweet potato in water .
column2: take your potatoes and slowly put them into your boiling water . the peeled potatoes should not be dropped in real fast or it may send hot water everywhere and burn you .

column1: boil peeled potato and sweet potato in water .
column2: put water into a pot and put on the stove . turn stove on high . wait for water to bubble and boil . put your peeled potatoes and sweet potatoes in a bowl . slowly put potatoes one by one into the boiling water .

column1: pour the mixture into a baking tray .
column2: set a baking tray on the counter . pour the pot with the mixture carefully into the baking dish .

column1: pour the mixture into a baking tray .
column2: have a baking dish available . pour the mixture from the pot into the baking dish .

column1: pour the mixture into a baking tray .
column2: get your baking dish ready . now add the hot mixture carefully to your pot . use a wooden spoon to get all of the mixture into your dish . then place your dirty pot into the sink .

column1: drain and dry the potatoes .
column2: take pot off hot stove . strain water out of pot into sink . pour potatoes into bowl .

column1: drain and dry the potatoes .
column2: you now will want to take your pot of potatoes from the stove and carry them over to the sink . we will slowly pour them into our colander and strain them . be careful , the steam and water will be very hot .

column1: drain and dry the potatoes .
column2: take your cooked potatoes carefully to your strainer in the sink . carefully pour the potatoes and water into the strainer . bring your bowl you 're going to use to mash the potatoes in close to the sink and your strainer . give the potatoes a shake over the sink to make sure all the water has strained . carefully pour the potatoes into your bowl .

column1: add red bell pepper green onion and garlic to a hot pan and stir .
column2: add the red bell pepper , green onion , and garlic to the hot pan . stir them in the pan with a spoon to soften . add 1/4 cup of spiced scallions to the pan and stir . add 2 cloves of chopped garlic to the pan and stir .

column1: add red bell pepper green onion and garlic to a hot pan and stir .
column2: have the pan get hot on the stove first . take handfuls of the veggies and slowly add the cut up vegetables to the pan . mix them together with a wooden spoon .

column1: add red bell pepper green onion and garlic to a hot pan and stir .
column2: take a pan and heat the pan . cut the bell pepper in to thin strips . add the bell pepper in to the pan . cut the green onion in to small pieces and add it to the pan . cut the garlic in to small pieces and add it to the pan .

column1: add frozen peas tomato paste turmeric and white pepper to the pan and stir .
column2: add frozen peas in to the pan . mix and cook it for few minutes . add tomato paste in to the pan and mix . add a teaspoon of turmeric powder and mix . add white pepper powder in to the pan and mix well .

column1: add frozen peas tomato paste turmeric and white pepper to the pan and stir .
column2: use a spatula . scoop out the frozen peas tomato paste turmeric and white pepper in the pan slowly without spilling . use the spatula to mix everything all up .

column1: add frozen peas tomato paste turmeric and white pepper to the pan and stir .
column2: add peas to the pan with the chilies . add 1 teaspoon of tomato paste . then add 2 teaspoons of curry powder . next add 1/8 teaspoon of turmeric and white pepper . stir the ingredients in the pan as you add more .

column1: add rice noodles to the pan .
column2: prepare rice noodles according to package directions . put two packets of cooked rice noodles into the pan . use a wooden spatula to stir noodles in pan .

column1: add rice noodles to the pan .
column2: take a pan on a stove . cook the vegetables in the pan . take the rice noodles and boil them . remove excess water from the noodles . add the rice noodles in to the pan .

column1: add rice noodles to the pan .
column2: pick up all of the rice noodles from the bowl with your hand . place the noodles on top of the items that are already in the pan , being careful not to touch anything that is hot .

column1: stir the rice noodles with the vegetables .
column2: use your spatula and stir the noodles with the vegetables . mix together so they are all mixed up .

column1: stir the rice noodles with the vegetables .
column2: first soak the rice noodles in a little bit of water for a couple of minutes . then add to pan and stir into the ingredients in the pan with a wooden slatted spoon . next add a cup of vegetable stock .

column1: stir the rice noodles with the vegetables .
column2: get a wooden spoon . use it to slowly mix around the noodles with the vegetables . mixed everything together evenly .

column1: add chicken stock to the pan .
column2: use a spoon to add the chicken stock to the pan . stir the mixture in the pan together .

column1: add chicken stock to the pan .
column2: take a pan on the stove . cook veggies and noodles in the pan . take chicken stock in a mug . pour chicken stock in to the pan . mix the noodles and chicken stock .

column1: add chicken stock to the pan .
column2: take your measuring cup with chicken stock and pour it evenly over the noodles in the pan . stir together .

column1: place the meatballs in the sauce .
column2: take a pan on the stove . fry the meat balls in the pan . cook the sauce in another pan . take the meat balls from the pan . add the meatballs in to the sauce pan .

column1: place the meatballs in the sauce .
column2: use a spatula to remove the meatballs from the pan . place the meatballs into the sauce pan .

column1: place the meatballs in the sauce .
column2: once the meatballs are browned , remove them from the frying pan . place the meatballs into the marinara sauce . stir the sauce until the meatballs are coated .

column1: add oil and herbs to a pan .
column2: add oil to the pan by using a spoon . pour the oil from the spoon all around the pan . sprinkle the herbs into the heated oil that is in the pan . stir the herbs around in the oil by carefully moving the pan around .

column1: add oil and herbs to a pan .
column2: place a pan on the stove over a medium flame . using a measuring spoon carefully add 3 teaspoons of oil and 1/4 teaspoon of mixed herbs to the pan .

column1: add oil and herbs to a pan .
column2: use a spoon to put the oil into the pan . put the herbs into the pan with the oil . lift the pan and tilt to mix the oil and herbs .

column1: add garlic and tomatoes to the pan .
column2: add chopped garlic to hot pan and stir and cook for about two minutes . add the chopped tomatoes to the hot pan and stir .

column1: add garlic and tomatoes to the pan .
column2: cut the garlic into small pieces . add the garlic into the pan . cook the garlic for 2 minutes . add the tomatoes into the pan .

column1: add garlic and tomatoes to the pan .
column2: pour the cut up garlic into the pan . add tomatoes to the pan . stir everything with a spatula .

column1: add oregano pepper salt paprika tomato puree water and sugar to the sauce .
column2: use a spoon to scoop in some oregano pepper salt and paprika . pour tomato puree water and sugar to the sauce . mix everything with a spatula .

column1: add oregano pepper salt paprika tomato puree water and sugar to the sauce .
column2: add oregano to the pan . put in pepper and salt . add paprika to the mixture and stir in . pour in tomato puree and water . add 1 teaspoon sugar and mix everything together with a stirring spoon .

column1: add oregano pepper salt paprika tomato puree water and sugar to the sauce .
column2: add dried oregano , pepper , salt to the pan and stir . add paprika , tomato puree and water to the pan and stir . add a small teaspoon of sugar to the pan and stir again .

column1: add oil and onions to the pan .
column2: put 3 spoons of oil in the pan pouring the spoons in circles on the pan . drop in the cut up onions to the pan .

column1: add oil and onions to the pan .
column2: place a pan on the stove , turn the stove on to a medium heat and wait 2 minutes for the pan to heat up . measure about 3 teaspoons of your olive oil with a spoon and dump into the pan . add the onions and garlic you cut up to the pan , and use the spatula to stir the onions and garlic . you will hear a sizzling sound .

column1: add oil and onions to the pan .
column2: put 2 or 3 teaspoons of oil and add it to the pan . spread the oil around the pan . add chopped onions into the pan . stir the onions around the pan .

column1: add pasta to the pan .
column2: add the cooked spaghetti to the pan with oil . toss the spaghetti around with tongs to get the oil all over the noodles . the oil will help loosen up the noddles and make it more manageable .

column1: add pasta to the pan .
column2: make sure the oil is spread across the entire bottom of the pan , and then add the cooked spaghetti to the oiled pan . use tongs to gently shake , lift , and turn the clumps of noodles , so that the oil starts to coat most of each noodle . when you can lift some noodles out of the pan without all the noodles being stuck to them , you have mixed the oil in well enough . this will allow you to separate the noodles into servings when the meal is ready . for an easier method , next time put oil in the pan while you strain your pasta in a colander . then return your noodles to the now oily pan , and add a bit more oil on top of them . lift the noodles using a fork , over and over until they are coated in oil . this works very well because the noodles wo n't have much time for the starch to cool and stick to other noodles .

column1: add pasta to the pan .
column2: hold the pasta over the pan . scoop it out with the tongs into the pan .

column1: add oil to a pan .
column2: turn the stove on to medium and let the pan warm up . add a few spoonfuls of oil to the pan .

column1: add oil to a pan .
column2: add a teaspoon of oil to pan . then add meat . cook the meat until brown . add spice the meat . then add tomato sauce and allow to simmer for about ten minutes .

column1: add oil to a pan .
column2: take a pan on the stove . heat the pan on the stove . take some oil in a bowl . add 3 tablespoons of oil in to the pan . heat the oil in the pan .

column1: form the meat into balls and fry .
column2: pour oil into a pan . roll meat into meatballs . set the balls onto the frying pan . cook the balls until they are brown .

column1: form the meat into balls and fry .
column2: using your hands , roll the meat into a ball . put the balls into the pan to fry .

column1: form the meat into balls and fry .
column2: using your hands , form the meat into small balls . you do n't want to make the meatballs too large , so make them a little smaller than golf balls . put the formed meatballs into a hot pan with a little oil . cook the meatballs until the pink color is gone .

column1: add basil leaves to the sauce .
column2: add a few basil leaves to the pan . use a spoon to mix the basil into the sauce .

column1: add basil leaves to the sauce .
column2: get fresh basil leaves and wash them . add a handful of leaves to the pot of sauce .

column1: add basil leaves to the sauce .
column2: get basil leaves . place a few leaves into the meat sauce , just enough to cover the top roughly . turn up the heat and let the sauce take in the flavor . mix leaves into sauce using a spatula .

column1: mix breadcrumbs with the meat .
column2: add breadcrumbs to the bowl . use a fork to mix the breadcrumbs together with the meat .

column1: mix breadcrumbs with the meat .
column2: in a bowl , pour some breadcrumbs , about 1/2 cup , on top of the ground meat . use a fork to mix the meat and breadcrumbs until it is combined .

column1: mix breadcrumbs with the meat .
column2: take a small mixing bowl . take some meat in to the bowl . take some bread crumbs in a cup . add the bread crumbs in to the meat . mix them together with a spoon .

column1: mix garlic salt pepper worcestershire sauce and an egg with the meat .
column2: add garlic , salt , pepper and worcestershire sauce to the meat . whisk and egg and add to the meat . use a fork to mix everything together .

column1: mix garlic salt pepper worcestershire sauce and an egg with the meat .
column2: use a spoon to add some cut up garlic to the contents of the bowl . then add some salt and pepper with a spoon . next add some worcestershire sauce to the bowl . use a fork to gently mix one egg and then pour into the bowl with other contents . mix all the ingredients together gently with a fork .

column1: mix garlic salt pepper worcestershire sauce and an egg with the meat .
column2: take a bowl and add some meat in the bowl . add some garlic salt and pepper powder in to the bowl . add a teaspoon of worcestershire sauce in to the bowl . add one beaten egg in to the bowl . mix everything in the bowl properly .

column1: fold the tortilla into a roll and tuck it at the ends .
column2: fold the tortilla , roll and press it . after rolling , tuck in the ends .

column1: fold the tortilla into a roll and tuck it at the ends .
column2: pull the ends of the burrito up toward the center until almost touching . bring the side of the burrito nearest you up to the center while you hold the ends up . press the bottom edge of the burrito down toward the ingredients and tuck it in underneath , being sure to secure the ends . pull the edge under the ingredients until it feels secure , then continue rolling it toward the top edge until you have one big roll .

column1: fold the tortilla into a roll and tuck it at the ends .
column2: fold the sides of the tortilla in . now fold in the other ends and roll it up .

column1: top it off with some salsa guacamole and a spoon of sour cream .
column2: the next topping to spoon onto the burrito filling in the middle of the tortilla is salsa . add one or two spoonfuls of salsa evenly on the filling mixture . next , add a spoonful of guacamole . use your spoon to spread it evenly across the filling mixture . next add sour cream . use the spoon to drop little dollops of sour cream on top of the filling mixture . be careful not to use too much filling , as that will make it hard to wrap the burrito . make sure there is an inch of bare tortilla at one end of the filling , and two inches of bare tortilla at the other end of the filling . when you have added all of the toppings , we can move on to wrapping the burrito .

column1: top it off with some salsa guacamole and a spoon of sour cream .
column2: on top of the burrito mixture add a spoon full of salsa . then add a spoonful of guacamole to the top of that . and at last add a spoon of sour cream .

column1: top it off with some salsa guacamole and a spoon of sour cream .
column2: with a spoon take some salsa and spoon it onto your mixture . with a spoon take some guacamole and spoon it onto the mixture . with a spoon take some sour cream and spread it onto your mixture .

column1: repeat the steps for each tortilla and serve .
column2: place your ingredients , in the same way , onto the center of the next burrito shell . add the beans , rice , guacamole , salsa and sour cream . you may add cheese if you wish . pull the ends into the center and wrap the side closest to you over the ends . squeeze the top down over the ingredients and then roll it over until it is completely wrapped . cut the burrito diagonally and serve .

column1: repeat the steps for each tortilla and serve .
column2: spread the refried beans on the tortilla . add mexican rice . place guacamole . put cheese on the burrito . roll up the burrito starting with the edge .

column1: repeat the steps for each tortilla and serve .
column2: use a spoon to spread refried beans in the center of the tortilla . next add the mexican rice , salsa , guacamole , sour cream and cheese . then fold each side over and roll to keep all the stuffing inside . use a sharp knife to cut in half .
