column1: spread the refried beans on the tortillas and add the cooked mexican rice over it .
column2: take tortillas on a plate . take some refried beans paste in a bowl . spread some refried beans on to the burrito . take mexican cooked rice in a bowl . spread some mexican rice in to the tortillas .

column1: spread the refried beans on the tortillas and add the cooked mexican rice over it .
column2: place the tortilla on a cutting board or counter top . put 2 tablespoons of refried beans into the middle of the tortilla and spread it into a rectangle shape . put 2 large tablespoons of the mexican rice on top of the refried beans and spread the rice to cover the refried beans .

column1: spread the refried beans on the tortillas and add the cooked mexican rice over it .
column2: use a spoon to spread the refried beans in the center of the tortilla . use the spoon to spread the mexican rice on top of the refried beans .

column1: place the chicken on a bowl of rice and garnish with spring onion .
column2: scoop the chicken with a big spoon and put it on a bowl of rice . sprinkle some spring onions on top .

column1: place the chicken on a bowl of rice and garnish with spring onion .
column2: put rice in a bowl . spoon the chicken on top of the rice . put spring onion on top .

column1: place the chicken on a bowl of rice and garnish with spring onion .
column2: spoon a serving of cooked white rice into an individual bowl / . use a spoon to scoop up 2 spoonfuls of chicken stir - fry from the cooking pan . spoon the chicken onto the white rice in the bowl . using a knife or scissors , slice a spring onion ( green onion ) into half - inch pieces . garnish the dish by putting the spring onion slices ( green part , not white part ) on top of the chicken in the bowl .

column1: add soy sauce chinese rice wine corn starch to a bowl of chicken .
column2: to your small bowl of chopped chicken , measure and add about a tablespoon of soy sauce . then measure about a tablespoon of chinese rice wine or dry sherry and pour it over the chicken . measure about 1 tablespoon of corn starch and add it to the chicken . use a spoon to stir everything together with the chicken and then set the bowl aside .

column1: add soy sauce chinese rice wine corn starch to a bowl of chicken .
column2: measure a tablespoon of soy sauce , and add to a bowl of chicken that is cut into cubes . measure a tablespoon of rice wine or dry sherry into the bowl of chicken . measure a tablespoon or corn flour or corn starch and add . mix well with the spoon . leave to the side until you are ready to cook .

column1: add soy sauce chinese rice wine corn starch to a bowl of chicken .
column2: add 1 tablespoon of soy sauce to the bowl . add 1 tablespoon of rice wine or sherry to the bowl . add 1 tablespoon of corn starch to the bowl . use a spoon to mix them all together .

column1: add the red chilies chicken garlic ginger peanuts spring onions and sauce to a pan and stir .
column2: add the red chilies to pan with a little oil . next add in the chicken and toss it around with a spatula . once the chicken is brown , add garlic , ginger , peanuts , and some spring onions and some of the sauce to the pan . save some of the onions for later . continue to mix and stir everything with your spatula .

column1: add the red chilies chicken garlic ginger peanuts spring onions and sauce to a pan and stir .
column2: pour the red chilies into your wok . add the chicken to your wok and use your spatula to mix with the chilies . make sure the heat on the stove is n't up too high so you can slowly cook the chicken without burning your chilies . add your garlic , ginger , peanuts , spring onions , and sauce once the chicken has browned . keep stirring until everything is coated with the oil and cooked .

column1: add the red chilies chicken garlic ginger peanuts spring onions and sauce to a pan and stir .
column2: take a pan and heat it . add some oil in to the pan . add some red chilies and some peanuts in to the pan . add some chicken , ginger and garlic in to the pan . add some cut pieces of spring onions in to the pan and mix .

column1: cut the red chilies in half and remove the seeds .
column2: using a knife , carefully cut the chilies straight down the middle . using a shaking motion , remove the seeds from the chilies .

column1: cut the red chilies in half and remove the seeds .
column2: cut the red chilies in half lengthwise . shake them out or gently scrape with tip of knife . discard seeds , and use red chilies .

column1: cut the red chilies in half and remove the seeds .
column2: use a knife to cut the red chilies in half . cut the chilies along the long end . take the seeds out of the center of the chilies .

column1: add soy sauce chinese rice vinegar sugar water and corn starch to a bowl and mix .
column2: put in 2 tablespoons of soy sauce . add 1 teaspoon of rice vinegar . put in 1 teaspoon of sugar . add 2 tablespoons of water . add 1 teaspoon of corn flower and mix everything together with a spoon .

column1: add soy sauce chinese rice vinegar sugar water and corn starch to a bowl and mix .
column2: take a small mixing bowl and add soy sauce in to the bowl . add some chinese rice and vinegar in to the bowl . add little sugar in to the bowl . add some water in to the bowl . add little corn starch in to the bowl and mix them .

column1: add soy sauce chinese rice vinegar sugar water and corn starch to a bowl and mix .
column2: pour in the soy sauce chinese rice vinegar sugar water and corn starch into the same bowl . mix everything with a spoon very well .

column1: slice the spring onions into thin pieces .
column2: use a knife to cut the spring onions . slice the onions into medium to small sized pieces .

column1: slice the spring onions into thin pieces .
column2: put the spring onions on a cutting board . use a sharp knife to slice the spring onions .

column1: slice the spring onions into thin pieces .
column2: put spring onions on a cutting board . grab a knife . cut spring onions into thin pieces with the knife .

column1: heat some butter in the pan and pour in some mixture in to cook .
column2: place some butter into a pan . move the butter around the frying pan evenly . place the mixture on the frying pan and begin to cook .

column1: heat some butter in the pan and pour in some mixture in to cook .
column2: make sure the pan is on medium - high heat . if the pan is too hot , the butter will melt too quickly and burn . get the butter we measured out at the beginning , and put it into the pan . pick the pan up and tilt it back and forth , so that the butter slides around the pan and covers the entire bottom of the pan . set the pan back down on the stove until the butter begins to gently bubble . this should only take a few seconds . if you are unsure of how long to wait , count to 12 . add large dollops of the batter to the pan . do n't add too many at once ! be sure to leave about an inch between each dollop , because they will expand while they cook , and we do n't want to have siamese pancakes , now do we ? .

column1: heat some butter in the pan and pour in some mixture in to cook .
column2: take the pancake mixture and stir together . add butter to pan . then add pancake mixture . allow to heat up . when pancakes are ready you need to flip and cook on both sides .

column1: cook some bacon on a pan .
column2: take a pan . place it on the pan . heat the pan . cut the bacon in to small pieces . add the bacon in to the pan and cook .

column1: cook some bacon on a pan .
column2: set the bacon onto a pan . let the bacon cook . turn over the bacon and allow both sides to cook .

column1: cook some bacon on a pan .
column2: put the bacon into a hot pan . do n't cook it fully because you have to allow for extra cooking time .

column1: grate the potatoes and rinse and drain them on a towel .
column2: use a grater and grate the potatoes into a pan . rinse the potatoes off with water . pour the potatoes onto a towel . use the towel to dry the extra water off of the potatoes .

column1: grate the potatoes and rinse and drain them on a towel .
column2: carefully use a potato peeler to peel the skins from the potatoes . use one hand to hold the grater by its handle . rest the grater against a table or counter top so that it does n't move while your work . hold the potato in your other hand . place the potato at the top of the grater , and drag it downwards over the grater . do n't drag the potato upwards , as that wo n't grate your potato and may even damage it and cause large chunks to break off . always drag the potato downwards against the grate only . when the potato becomes small , start grating more slowly so that you can watch closely and make sure you do n't cut your hand while grating . it is okay to throw away the potato nubs at the end , or to use a knife to cut them into strips . once you have enough grated potato , rinse it in very cold water , pour the potato onto a tea towel , spread the potato out evenly , and fold the other half of the towel over and press on it to remove the extra water from the potato strips .

column1: cook the onions in the pot .
column2: place 1/2 cup of thinly sliced onions into the pot . cook them until they turn clear and shiny .

column1: cook the onions in the pot .
column2: pour 1/2 cup of thinly sliced onions into a heated pan . cook onions until translucent ( somewhat see - through ) .

column1: cook the onions in the pot .
column2: take a cooking pot on the stove . cut the onions in to small pieces . take the cut onions in to the big bowl . add the onions in to the cooking pot . cook the onions in the pot .

column1: add the potatoes to the pot .
column2: grab the steam bowl wearing finger mitts . pour the potatoes into the pot .

column1: add the potatoes to the pot .
column2: get the potatoes out of the steamer . add the hot potatoes to the pot , being careful not to touch them .

column1: add the potatoes to the pot .
column2: take the colander full of potatoes and , using hot pads , pour them into the pot . scrap any leftover potatoes into the pot with the hot pads .

column1: mash the potatoes in the pot .
column2: get the potato masher or a large fork . using a pot holder , hang onto the pot , be careful , it 's hot . using the potato masher or a large fork , squish the potatoes . the potatoes do n't have to be smooth . keep squishing them until they are how you like .

column1: mash the potatoes in the pot .
column2: take your hands our a potato masher and begin mashing the potatoes . mash around the potatoes in the pain until it is smaller chunks of potato .

column1: mash the potatoes in the pot .
column2: now you want to take your masher or a larger fork and start smashing the potatoes in the pot . you do n't have to smash them to small . we want them to be more old fashioned and have skins and larger pieces still in there .

column1: add the cabbage to the pot .
column2: take a large pot on the stove . cut the cabbage in to thin long strips . place the cabbage in a bowl . add the cabbage in to the pot . mix it with other contents in the pot .

column1: add the cabbage to the pot .
column2: take 6 cups of cabbage and use a knife to slice it thinly . pour the sliced cabbage into the pot .

column1: add the cabbage to the pot .
column2: thinly slice about six cups of cabbage using your chefs knife . make sure you use a cutting board and make very thin slices of the cabbage until they look like shredded cabbage . while your pot is on the stove and hot add your cabbage making sure to get it all in there .

column1: add the milk to the pot .
column2: hold the cup of milk over the pot . slowly pour it in the pot careful not to spill .

column1: add the milk to the pot .
column2: take a big pot on the stove . take a cup of milk . add the milk in to the pot . take a big wooden spoon . mix the milk in the pot .

column1: add the milk to the pot .
column2: pour 1/2 cup to a cup of milk into the pot where your other ingredients are cooking . as soon as you pour the milk into the pot start stirring with your cooking spoon .

column1: add the grated potatoes to the mixture and blend .
column2: pour the grated potatoes into the bowl with the mixture . use a stirring spoon to mix all of the ingredients in the bowl together .

column1: add the grated potatoes to the mixture and blend .
column2: add the potatoes with your hands into the bowl . with a wooden spoon mix the mixture together .

column1: add the grated potatoes to the mixture and blend .
column2: take a large mixing bowl . grate some potatoes in to small strips . add the potatoes in to the bowl . add the potatoes in to the mixture bowl . mix the contents in the bowl .

column1: mix an egg milk and the mashed potatoes .
column2: crack one egg and add it to your bowl . pour one tablespoon of skim milk and whisk it together with the egg . dump one cup of mashed potatoes into the bowl . mix everything together with a spoon .

column1: mix an egg milk and the mashed potatoes .
column2: crack 1 egg into a cup . pour the egg into a medium sized bowl . measure 1 tablespoon of skim milk and add it to the bowl . whisk the egg and milk together . add one cup of mashed potatoes to the bowl and mix it all together .

column1: mix an egg milk and the mashed potatoes .
column2: add an egg into the bowl . use a whisk to mix the egg into the bowl . add mashed potatoes into the bowl . use the whisk to stir everything together .

column1: grate squeeze and add potato to a bowl .
column2: measure one and a half cups of grated potato . pour the grated potato into a large bowl .

column1: grate squeeze and add potato to a bowl .
column2: clean your potatoes . peal your potatoes . get out your grate for the potatoes . run the potatoes over the grate into a plate or bowl . grate your potatoes until you have one and half cups .

column1: grate squeeze and add potato to a bowl .
column2: now use 1 and 1/2 cup of grated potato to your mixing bowl . just take the potatoes and slowly poor them in the mixing bowl , being sure not to spill any .

column1: scoop the batter on the pan .
column2: take a pan on the stove . take some butter in a bowl . take a large wooden spoon . take the butter out of the bowl . add the butter in to the pan .

column1: scoop the batter on the pan .
column2: use the spoon to scoop the batter . put the batter into the pan on the stove .

column1: scoop the batter on the pan .
column2: use a spoon to put the batter into the hot pan . let the batter cook for a little while .

column1: add the potato starch salt and pepper .
column2: pour the starch into the bowl . add salt and pepper . use a stirring spoon to mix the ingredients in the bowl together .

column1: add the potato starch salt and pepper .
column2: slowly pour in the potato starch in the bowl . pour in the salt and pepper in the bowl .

column1: add the potato starch salt and pepper .
column2: pour the leftover potato starch into the bowl . add in the salt and pepper . stir all the ingredients together in the bowl .

column1: add flour to the potatoes and mix .
column2: measure a cup of all - purpose flour . place the mixing bowl with the potatoes onto the work space - counter . pour the flour into the mixing bowl . using a wooden spoon or a spatula , mix the flour and potatoes well .

column1: add flour to the potatoes and mix .
column2: take a flour in a cup . take the potatoes in a large mixing bowl . add the flour in to the bowl of potatoes . take a large wooden spoon . mix the flour to the potatoes .

column1: add flour to the potatoes and mix .
column2: add 1 cup of flour into the bowl . mix the flour into the bowl with a stirring spoon . add the potatoes . continue to mix all of the ingredients together in the bowl .

column1: add thyme bay leaves onion and clam juice and boil the mixture .
column2: first , you will need to add 1/2 a teaspoon of thyme to the pot . second , you will need to add 1/2 a teaspoon of bay leaves to the pot . third , you will need to chop up an onion and add it to the mixture . fourth , you will need to add 2 bottles of clam juice to the pot . fifth , you will need to let the mixture boil on medium heat .

column1: add thyme bay leaves onion and clam juice and boil the mixture .
column2: take a pan and cook the ingredients . add a teaspoon of thyme in to the pan . add some bay leaves and onions in to the pan . add 2 jars of clam juice in to the pan . boil the ingredients in the pan .

column1: add thyme bay leaves onion and clam juice and boil the mixture .
column2: add a little more than one - half tsp of thyme to your cooked veggies , and mix . add a bay leaf , and stir until the vegetables are tender . add 2 cups of raw , diced onions and mix everything together . add two 8-ounce bottles of clam juice and bring to a boil . add clams .

column1: add salt and pepper .
column2: take a spoon and measure the salt in it and pour it in the soup . shake some pepper into the pot after .

column1: add salt and pepper .
column2: add 1/2 teaspoon of salt . add fresh crack black peppercorn to taste . stir to combine .

column1: add salt and pepper .
column2: use a 1/2 teaspoon measuring spoon . pour salt slowly into measuring spoon . try not to overfill the measuring spoon . black peppercorns are pepper that has n't been ground up or crushed . use the pepper mill by twisting the ring 5 times . this grinds the pepper .

column1: cook onion green peppers and red peppers .
column2: take a pan on the stove . cut onions in to small pieces . cut green and red peppers in to small pieces . add the onions and peppers in to the pan . cook them for few minutes .

column1: cook onion green peppers and red peppers .
column2: melt a half cup up butter in a large pot . use a spoon to mix the onions , peppers and butter in the pot .

column1: cook onion green peppers and red peppers .
column2: put the cut up pieces of onion green peppers and red peppers in a pan . cook the vegetables while stirring with a spatula .

column1: add clams flour worcestershire sauce and hot sauce to the pot .
column2: carefully open your cans of clams . open 4 cans all together . next add a cup of half and half into your mix . add 10 tablespoons of flour . make sure to mix with each scoop added .

column1: add clams flour worcestershire sauce and hot sauce to the pot .
column2: open and pour 3 cans of clams into the pot . add 2 cups of half and half and mix . mix a table spoon of flour continuously until it gets thick . add 2 teaspoons of worcestershire . add as much hot sauce and stir with a spoon .

column1: add clams flour worcestershire sauce and hot sauce to the pot .
column2: you need to open the can of clams with a can opener . then add all three cans to soup . add two cups of half and half then stir . add 10 tablespoons of flour to soup gradually while stirring the soup . add 2 teaspoons of worcestershire sauce while stirring soup . add 1 teaspoons of any hot sauce of you choice . then stir .

column1: cover the pot .
column2: put water in large stockpot . bring to a boil . then put mussels in pot . allow them to cook . then drain and serve .

column1: cover the pot .
column2: place the lid onto the pot . continue to cook the mussels .

column1: cover the pot .
column2: now we want to make sure the steam stays in with the clams . so take your lid and set it on top of your pot .

column1: add garlic pieces into the pot .
column2: lift the garlic off of the cutting board using the side of the knife blade and your hand . add the chopped garlic pieces to the pot .

column1: add garlic pieces into the pot .
column2: scoop up the garlic pieces with your hand . drop the garlic pieces into the pot .

column1: add garlic pieces into the pot .
column2: garlic will now be added into the bowl once it is minced . scrape the garlic on top of your knife and slowly lower it into the pot . be careful not to cut your hand .

column1: take mussels out from the pot and pour some parsley .
column2: get a big straining spoon . scoop the mussels out of the pot with the spoon . place a few mussels into each bowl that you will eat from . place the butter and flour in a bowl and mix together .

column1: take mussels out from the pot and pour some parsley .
column2: take mussels out of the pot using a strainer and i is them into serving bowls . put some parsley on each serving bowl .

column1: take mussels out from the pot and pour some parsley .
column2: use a scoop to take the mussels out of the pot . put the mussels into different serving bowls . add some parsley on top of the mussels .

column1: add wine stock and simmer into the pot .

column1: add wine stock and simmer into the pot .

column1: add wine stock and simmer into the pot .

column1: add parsley flakes into the pot .
column2: get cut parsley flakes . sprinkle them in the pot .

column1: add parsley flakes into the pot .
column2: grab some cup up parsley with your hands . drop the parsley in the pot .

column1: add parsley flakes into the pot .
column2: take a cutting board and a knife . take some parsley in to the board . cut the parsley in to small pieces . add the parsley in to the pot . mix them with the contents in the pot .

column1: add onion pieces into the pot .
column2: grab the onion pieces with your hand . put the onions in the pot on the oil .

column1: add onion pieces into the pot .
column2: pour oil into the bottom of the pot . add diced onions into the pot .

column1: add onion pieces into the pot .
column2: put some oil in a large pot . put the chopped onion and garlic into the pot .

column1: mix butter and flour .
column2: use a fork to scoop butter into a bowl . add flour into the bowl . use the fork to mix the butter and flour together .

column1: mix butter and flour .
column2: soften some butter to room temperature . put it in a small bowl . add flour to the butter . mix together with a fork .

column1: mix butter and flour .
column2: using room temperature butter put it in a small bowl . then add your flower and use a fork to mix well . it should have a paste like consistency .

column1: add oil to pot .
column2: use spoons to fill with oil . take the spoon and pour the oil out into the pot .

column1: add oil to pot .
column2: pour out into the soup pot . heat the oil over medium heat .

column1: add oil to pot .
column2: get a spoon of oil . pour it into the pot .

column1: pour the soup on the mussels .
column2: use a scoop to scoop up the soup . pour the soup over the mussels .

column1: pour the soup on the mussels .
column2: cook the soup in a large pot . take the mussels in a bowl . take a large spoon . pour the soup on to the mussels . cover the entire mussels with the soup .

column1: pour the soup on the mussels .
column2: make sure the mussels are in a medium sized bowl . use a ladle to pour the broth you just made over the mussels .

column1: add mussels into the pot .
column2: pick up the bowl of mussels . use your hands to add the mussels to the pot .

column1: add mussels into the pot .
column2: take your bowl of mussels . use your hand to drop the mussels into the pot .

column1: add mussels into the pot .
column2: make sure you have a large metal pot on the stove . use your hands to add your mussels into the large pot .

column1: add hot pepper flakes into the pot .
column2: take a pot on the stove . cook the other ingredients in the pot . take a teaspoon of chili flakes . add the chili flakes in to the pot . mix everything in the pot .

column1: add hot pepper flakes into the pot .
column2: use a scoop and add hot pepper flakes into the pot . use a stirring spoon to mix the pepper into the pot .

column1: add hot pepper flakes into the pot .
column2: using a spoon put the hot pepper flakes into the bowl . mix them together using a spoon .

column1: boil mixture in the pan .
column2: take a pan on the stove . add the mixture in the pan . mix the contents in the pan . boil the contents in the pan . mix the contents in between .

column1: boil mixture in the pan .
column2: drop the mixture into the boiling liquid . stir , using a whisk , to mix everything together .

column1: boil mixture in the pan .
column2: in the pot of boiling water put spoon full at a time of the mixture into the pot .

column1: cover the pot and steam .
column2: put the lid on the pot . let it simmer for about ten minutes .

column1: cover the pot and steam .

column1: cover the pot and steam .
column2: put the lid onto the pot . leave the pot to simmer for 10 minutes .

column1: cut a cabbage into quarters and remove the stem .
column2: take the large knife and cut the cabbage down the middle , hot - dog style . cut each large piece of cabbage down the middle again , hot - dog style . cut off the stems of each piece . the stem is the hard part at the ends of each piece of cabbage .

column1: cut a cabbage into quarters and remove the stem .
column2: take your knife and carefully cut the cabbage at the top . after cutting it , pull the cabbage open . take your knife and carefully cut the stems off the end of the cabbage .

column1: cut a cabbage into quarters and remove the stem .
column2: using a large knife make a split from the stem down toward the leaves . using your hands , pull the cabbage apart so it is in 2 pieces . cut each half into half again using the large knife . use the knife to cut off the stem .

column1: prepare some water in a large bowl and add some rock salt .
column2: pour some water into a bowl . then add a tablespoon or two of rock salt to the water . mix the salt into the water with your hand .

column1: prepare some water in a large bowl and add some rock salt .
column2: pour some water into a big bowl . grab some rock salt with your fingers and drop it into the water . mix the salt around in the water with your hands .

column1: prepare some water in a large bowl and add some rock salt .
column2: get a large bowl . pour some water into the bottom of the bowl . add rock salt . mix the salt to help it dissolve .

column1: combine the cabbage and salt water .
column2: put some water and rock salt into a large bowl . put the cabbage in the bowl with the salt and water . use the salt water to wet the cabbage . put salt in between the cabbage leaves and let sit for 4 hours .

column1: combine the cabbage and salt water .
column2: add the cabbage to the water in the bowl . pull up each leaf of the cabbage and add salt so the whole cabbage is salted . let the cabbage sit in the bowl for 4 hours .

column1: combine the cabbage and salt water .
column2: pour the water and salt into bowl . put cabbage in the bowl . use your hands and sprinkle the water onto the cabbage . next , sprinkle salt into each layer of cabbage . finally , turn cabbage over in bowl so each side is covered with water .

column1: pour water on dried cod .
column2: fill a container with water . pour the water onto the bowl with dried cod in it .

column1: pour water on dried cod .
column2: put a little bit of warm water into a cup . pour the warm water on top of the dried cod . put some gloves on and then gently mix it up just a little with the water using your hands .

column1: pour water on dried cod .
column2: add some warm water . this will help make it soft .

column1: add chopped daikon radish green onion apple puree and minced ginger and garlic to a large bowl .
column2: add chopped daikon into the bowl . then add green onion . put 1 cup of apple puree into the mixture . add garlic to the bowl . pour 1/4 cup of onion puree to the bowl .

column1: add chopped daikon radish green onion apple puree and minced ginger and garlic to a large bowl .
column2: chop daikon and add to bowl . chop green onion , puree half an apple , chop ginger finely . add all ingredients to bowl and mix well with hands .

column1: add chopped daikon radish green onion apple puree and minced ginger and garlic to a large bowl .
column2: take a large bowl . add the cut pieces of radish in to the bowl . cut the green onions in to small pieces and add it in to the bowl . add a cup of apple puree in to the bowl . add ginger and garlic that is cut in to very small pieces .

column1: add salted shrimp anchovy fish sauce and lance fish sauce .
column2: add a cup of salted shrimp . add a cup of anchovy fish sauce . add a cup of lance fish sauce .

column1: add salted shrimp anchovy fish sauce and lance fish sauce .
column2: add salted shrimp , anchovy fish sauce , and lance fish sauce to the bowl . add plum extract to the bowl .

column1: add salted shrimp anchovy fish sauce and lance fish sauce .
column2: set up large cups of salted shrimp , anchovy fish sauce and lance fish sauce . fill a 1/4 cup measuring cup with salted shrimp , and add it to the vegetable mix . fill a 1/4 cup measuring cup with anchovy fish sauce , and add it to the mix . fill a 1/4 cup measuring cup with lance fish sauce , and add it to the mix .

column1: add plum extract onion puree and the cod .
column2: add plum extract to the bowl using a scoop . next break the fish apart with your hands and add to the bowl .

column1: add plum extract onion puree and the cod .
column2: pour in plum extract to the bowl . add pieces of the cod to the bowl .

column1: add plum extract onion puree and the cod .
column2: when you have added all the other ingredients to the bowl you can start adding the next step . add plum extract , the onion puree ( looks like a soup ) and the codfish . mix them together well .

column1: add korean red chili pepper flakes to the mixture and mix with hand .
column2: add 1/2 cup of red chili pepper flakes to the mixture . mix the ingredients in the bowl with hands .

column1: add korean red chili pepper flakes to the mixture and mix with hand .
column2: add a big spoonful of the chili pepper in the mix . use your hands and mix everything around so it looks the same .

column1: add korean red chili pepper flakes to the mixture and mix with hand .
column2: add korean red chili pepper flakes to the mixture . mix it together with your hands until everything is combined . rub the mixture in a circular motion .

column1: spread the mixture between the cabbage leaves .
column2: take the lettuce from the bowl and put it in the same bowl as the red mix . rub the red mix on the outside of the lettuce . make sure it is totally covered . then separate each lettuce leaf from each other and rub the red mix on each leaf . repeat step 3 until the lettuce is totally covered in the red mix .

column1: spread the mixture between the cabbage leaves .
column2: take some of the mixture with your hands and rub it onto the cabbage so it 's completely covered . make sure you get the mixture in between the leaves too .

column1: spread the mixture between the cabbage leaves .
column2: put the cabbage into the bowl . start rubbing the mixture all over the cabbage . make sure you get the mixture between each leaf of the cabbage .

column1: heat the pan for about fifteen minutes .
column2: stir the pan with a spatula as it cooks . put it on low heat . cook for 15 to 20 minutes .

column1: heat the pan for about fifteen minutes .
column2: heat over low heat . stir with spatula . heat for 15 - 20 minutes .

column1: heat the pan for about fifteen minutes .
column2: heat dal mixture on the stove on low heat for up to several hours . the longer it cooks the better it will taste . if there is not much time , you can turn the heat up to medium heat and cook for about fifteen minutes , stirring it occasionally with a spoon .

column1: close the cooker and put on high flame .
column2: we want to cook our dish on a high flame . so make sure your pot is on a burner and turn heat all the way up .

column1: close the cooker and put on high flame .
column2: put a lid on the cooker and close it . place the cooker on a high flame .

column1: close the cooker and put on high flame .
column2: put the lid on the pressure cooker . put the pressure cooker on a high flame on the stove top .

column1: mash some of the dal with a spatula .
column2: use a spatula to mash down the dal . continue to mix the dal together as it cooks .

column1: mash some of the dal with a spatula .
column2: take a spatula and stick it in the pot . use the spatula to squish the dal down .

column1: mash some of the dal with a spatula .
column2: using a spatula mash the dal . using a spatula stir the dal .

column1: add cilantro and heavy whipping cream .
column2: put some chopped cilantro into the pot . add some heavy whipping cream to the pot . stir the ingredients to mix everything together .

column1: add cilantro and heavy whipping cream .
column2: use your hands and grab some cilantro . drop the cilantro in the pot . pour some heavy whipping cream into the pot . stir everything with a spatula .

column1: add cilantro and heavy whipping cream .
column2: cook the dal in a pot . cut the cilantro in to small pieces . add the cilantro in to the dal . add heavy whipping cream in to the pan . mix everything in the pan .

column1: add onion and cook until golden brown .
column2: add the chopped onion into the cooking pan . mix the onions around the pan with a spatula . cook into they are golden brown .

column1: add onion and cook until golden brown .
column2: in a heated pan put your cut up onions into the pan . as it cooks stir around . when the onions are done the should be a golden brown color .

column1: add onion and cook until golden brown .
column2: chop one medium size onion . put into a cup and carefully pour it into the frying pan . mix with spatula until the onions are golden brown .

column1: melt butter in a pan and add cumin seeds and garlic .
column2: add 2 tablespoons of butter to the red pan and let it melt . add the cumin seeds to the pan and stir . add 1 tablespoon of minced garlic and stir .

column1: melt butter in a pan and add cumin seeds and garlic .
column2: place pan on the stove top and add butter . melt two tablespoons of butter in the pan . add cumin seeds to the pan and use a spatula to stir while cooking . add one tablespoon of chopped garlic to the pan . use a spatula to stir in the garlic while cooking .

column1: melt butter in a pan and add cumin seeds and garlic .
column2: put butter in the pan and let the butter become liquid . add the cumin seeds and garlic and mix with a spatula .

column1: add salt chili powder and green chili .
column2: cook the contents in the pan . add 2 tablespoons of salt in to the cooking pan . add one tablespoon of coriander powder in to the pan . mix them with the contents in the pan . cook the contents in the pan properly .

column1: add salt chili powder and green chili .
column2: put in 1 teaspoon of salt to the pan . put in some red chili powder . add green chili powder .

column1: add salt chili powder and green chili .
column2: use a tiny spoon to scoop salt chili powder and green chili . scoop in the salt chili powder and green chili into the pot .

column1: add soaked dal and kidney beans ginger and oil into the pressure cooker .
column2: add the water to the pressure cooker that was used for soaking the dal . put dal , kidney beans , ginger and oil into the pressure cooker .

column1: add soaked dal and kidney beans ginger and oil into the pressure cooker .
column2: add 1 cup of soaked dal into a pressure cooker . put in 3 cups of water . add some ginger . put in some oil .

column1: add soaked dal and kidney beans ginger and oil into the pressure cooker .
column2: soak dal and kidney beans and add cloves to pressure cooker . add soaked dal and kidney beans to pressure cooker . add ginger and oil into pressure cooker .

column1: put the dal into sauce pan .
column2: use a scoop to scoop up the dal from the pressure cooker . place the scooped dal into the sauce pan .

column1: put the dal into sauce pan .
column2: using a spoon take out the dal into the sauce pan . make sure you leave the water in the pan .

column1: put the dal into sauce pan .
column2: grab a spoon . scoop dal into pan . repeat until dal is all in the pan . stir together ingredients . set aside .

column1: add tomato puree and cook until it starts to lose oil .
column2: take a large spoon and scoop the tomato puree into the pan . stir the tomato puree around the pain . continue to cook the tomato until it begins to lose oil .

column1: add tomato puree and cook until it starts to lose oil .
column2: put 4 tomatoes that are blended in the pan . once the tomatoes start to let out clear liquid it is done .

column1: add tomato puree and cook until it starts to lose oil .

column1: cut the tofu into squares .
column2: take a knife and cut the aburaage in half . the aburaage will look like a square when you cut it .

column1: cut the tofu into squares .
column2: place 2 pieces of tofu , stacked , onto a cutting board , take a large knife and cut the tofu in half , making 4 large squares .

column1: cut the tofu into squares .
column2: grab a knife . place the rectangle pieces of tofu on top of each other . cut the rectangle pieces of tofu in half to make 2 squares per piece . place the knife down .

column1: chop up the green onion .
column2: place the green onion on a cutting board . find a sharp knife and cut about an inch of the bottom white part off , and half of the dark green part . starting from the bottom white part , cut the green onion into very thin slices , carefully .

column1: chop up the green onion .
column2: chop green onions . set green onions to the side once chopped .

column1: chop up the green onion .
column2: grab a large knife . chop the green onions into very thin slices .

column1: boil the tofu .
column2: take a large pot on the stove . pour some water and boil it . add the pieces of tofu in to the boiling water . boil for few seconds . take the tofu out of the water and strain the water .

column1: boil the tofu .
column2: quickly boil to help remove grease . only boil it for a few seconds , then remove it . use a colander , the metal item with holes , to strain the water .

column1: boil the tofu .
column2: put the tofu into the boiling water . wait until the tofu is soft .

column1: add water sugar soy sauce sake and mirin to a pan .
column2: add sugar to a pot of water . then add sake , soy sauce , and mirin . turn the dial on the stove up halfway and heat up the mixture . stir with a wooden spoon while it 's heating up .

column1: add water sugar soy sauce sake and mirin to a pan .
column2: take a pot on the stove . add some water in to the pot . add some sugar and soy sauce in to the water . add some sake and some mirin in to the pot . mix everything in the pot with chop sticks on a medium heat .

column1: add water sugar soy sauce sake and mirin to a pan .
column2: add water to the pan . add sugar to the pan using a cup . add soy sauce to the pan using a cup . add sake to the pan using a cup . add mirin to a pan using a cup .

column1: add the tofu and cook until the liquid is gone .
column2: bring the mixture to a medium heat . add the tofu to the pot . cook tofu until all the liquid is gone .

column1: add the tofu and cook until the liquid is gone .
column2: turn the dial of the stove halfway up . put the tofu in the pot . let it cook until the water is not there .

column1: add the tofu and cook until the liquid is gone .
column2: add the tofu to the liquid and cook . flip the tofu with chopsticks . cook until the liquid is completely gone .

column1: heat dashi soy sauce mirin and sake in a pan .
column2: fill a big pot half way with water then place it on the stove . then , turn the stove to medium heat and wait until it begins to boil / bubble . turn the heat of the pot to low using the dial on the stove . add a dash of salt with your fingers , add soy sauce that should have been measured beforehand after you add the salt . after that , add the rest of your liquid ingredients . stir the pot of seasoned water with a large spoon . add the udon noodles last directly into the pot .

column1: heat dashi soy sauce mirin and sake in a pan .

" boil pasta for 8 - 10 minutes , stirring occasionally with a slotted spoon , until it is soft , but firm to the bite ( this is called al dente " " ) . " " . " take a single piece of pasta out with the spoon , being careful not to burn yourself , and taste it to make sure it is cooked thoroughly . if it is cooked thoroughly , use potholders to lift the pan and pour away from you into a colander a bowl with holes in it ) that has been placed in the sink .

column1: add mustard and worcestershire sauce and stir .

column1: add mustard and worcestershire sauce and stir .

column1: mix the meat mixture together .
column2: take meat from package . add onions and meat to bowl . using hands , mix all together very well . then put in pan . add spices and put in oven to cook .

column1: mix the meat mixture together .

column1: mix the meat mixture together .

column1: put the rest of the sauce on the meatloaf and cook again in the oven .

column1: cook the meatloaf in the oven .

column1: place the meat mixture into the pan .

column1: place the meat mixture into the pan .

column1: dissolve yeast and a little sugar into warm water .

column1: roll out the dough .

column1: roll out the dough .

column1: roll out the dough .

column1: spray some oil in a bowl and put the dough in .

column1: spray some oil in a bowl and put the dough in .

column1: chop garlic slice onion and place them in a bowl .

column1: add some rib eye beef to the sauce and mix them together .

column2: put oil in a deep pan on the stove . turn on the heat under the pan .

column1: heat oil for deep frying later .
column2: grab pot from cabinet . place pot on top of a burner . fill with oil . ignite burner until flame underneath appears .

column1: heat oil for deep frying later .
column2: turn up the heat on the stove . heat the oil in the pot .

column1: knead dough and roll into oval shape .
column2: take the dough and knead it once or twice . separate the dough into two equal parts and roll it into balls using your hands . now use your rolling pin to roll the dough onto your cutting board . keep rolling the dough into an oval or round shape by flipping it to different sides . roll it until it 's fairly thin .

column1: knead dough and roll into oval shape .
column2: put the dough on a board and , knead it once by pressing and rolling . split the dough into two equal parts . use a rolling pin to roll the dough into an oval or round shape .

column1: knead dough and roll into oval shape .
column2: take the dough ball and squish it flat . squish it into a ball again . keep doing this several times . now roll the dough into an oval with a rolling pin .

column1: add chopped coriander mix and cook .
column2: add your chopped coriander to your pot . use your wooden spoon to mix it all together . now you can turn the heat off and your stuffing is ready .

column1: add chopped coriander mix and cook .
column2: take some coriander on a cutting board . cut the coriander in to small pieces . take the pot on the stove . cook the contents in the pan . add the coriander in to the pot and mix .

column1: add chopped coriander mix and cook .
column2: add 1 teaspoon of chopped coriander . use the stirring spoon to mix the coriander into the bowl while it cooks .

column1: add a little water and mix .
column2: add water into the bowl . use hands to mix the water in with the rest of the ingredients in the bowl . mix until it becomes one firm ball .

column1: add a little water and mix .
column2: hold the cup of water over the bowl . slowly pour water into the bowl . mix everything together with your hands .

column1: add a little water and mix .
column2: sprinkle a bit of water into the dry ingredients and mix together with your fingers . sprinkle a little bit more water and mix again with your fingers . mix this together with your hands until it forms a dough . if the dough is too sticky , add a teaspoon of cornstarch to it and mix it up again . use your hands to knead the dough by mashing it down and folding over again until it makes a nice ball and is ready .

column1: add stuffing to cone and use some water to seal the top edges .
column2: use a spoon to fill the cone almost to the top with stuffing . use your fingers to press down the stuffing a bit . dip your fingers in the water . put the water on the open edges of the cone . press the sides of the open end of the cone together , sealing it .

column1: add stuffing to cone and use some water to seal the top edges .
column2: take a tortilla from a pack . form it into a small cone shape . fill it with pepper mix from the bowl . take water and seal the edges closed . then repeat the process until all are complete .

column1: add stuffing to cone and use some water to seal the top edges .
column2: use a spoon to scoop stuffing and stuff it in the cone . brush some water on the edges and squeeze the top shut .

column1: cut into two halves and roll one half into a cone .
column2: roll the dough in to an oval shape . take a knife and cut the dough in to two halves . take one half of dough . take the dough in the hand . roll the dough in to a cone .

column1: cut into two halves and roll one half into a cone .
column2: place the dough on a cutting board . use a sharp knife to cut the dough in half . use your hand to fold the dough and form into a cone . press the edge of the dough to seal it .

column1: cut into two halves and roll one half into a cone .
column2: cut the dough into two equal halves . pick up one portion and hold it in your palm . roll it from one end to the other forming a cone . make sure the seam is sealed by pressing it with your fingers and pinching the sharp point or edge to make sure it 's sealed .

column1: drain on paper towel .
column2: line a plate with paper towels . use a spatula to remove the samosas from the pain . put the samosas on the paper towel lined plate to drain . place the samosas on a serving plate to serve .

column1: drain on paper towel .
column2: grab a plate and lay a couple paper towels on it . next , grab a skimmer ( looks like a long spatula with tiny holes at the end . ) . when the samosas turn a light golden yellow color they are done cooking . gently lift up the samosas with the skimmer and lay them down on the paper towel . let the samosas cool down for a couple minutes , as they will be hot !

column1: drain on paper towel .
column2: prepare a plate with paper towel on it and bring it close to your pot . use a straining spoon or a spoon with holes to get your samosas out of the frying pot . gently place them on your plate with the paper towel to drain the excess oil . now they 're ready to be served on your nice serving plate .

column1: deep fry sealed samosa on medium heat until golden brown .
column2: scoop the samosa on a spoon . set the samosa into the hot oil . set the stove to medium heat . cook the samosas until they are golden brown .

column1: deep fry sealed samosa on medium heat until golden brown .
column2: take a pot on the stove . add some oil in to the pot . heat the oil in the pot . add the samosas in to the oil and deep fry them . turn the samosas until they are brown in color .

column1: deep fry sealed samosa on medium heat until golden brown .
column2: use a spoon and lower the samosas in the oil slowly . set the stove to medium heat . cook until they turn golden brown .

column1: add garam masala dry mango powder whole coriander seeds and salt .
column2: cook the ingredients in the pan . add 1 teaspoon of garam masala powder in to the pan . add 1/4 th teaspoon of dry mango powder in to the pan . add some coriander seeds in to the pan . add little salt and mix every thing in the pan .

column1: add garam masala dry mango powder whole coriander seeds and salt .
column2: add 1/2 teaspoon of garam masala . add 1/4 teaspoon of mango powder . put 1/4 teaspoon of coriander seeds into the pan . pour in salt as needed .

column1: add garam masala dry mango powder whole coriander seeds and salt .
column2: add 1/2 teaspoon of garam masala to mixture on stove . next , add 1/4 teaspoon dry mango powder . next , add 1/4 teaspoon of whole coriander seeds . lastly , add salt to taste ( about 1/2 teaspoon ) .

column1: cover the dough and let rest for 15 minutes .
column2: put a lid on the bowl of dough . let the bowl sit for 15 minutes .

column1: cover the dough and let rest for 15 minutes .
column2: cover the bowl with another plate . let it sit covered for another 15 minutes .

column1: cover the dough and let rest for 15 minutes .
column2: put a plate on top of the bowl to cover the bowl of dough . set the dough aside and let sit for 15 minutes .

column1: heat oil in pan and add cumin seeds asafoetida ginger potatoes and peas .
column2: heat up some oil in a pan until it is really hot . add the cumin seeds , the asafoetida , the ginger green chili paste , and mix it all up . add the potatoes you cut up and the peas you cooked . mix it until the potatoes and peas are covered in the spices .

column1: heat oil in pan and add cumin seeds asafoetida ginger potatoes and peas .
column2: pour 1 teaspoon of oil into the pan and spread the oil around . heat the pan . add 1/2 teaspoon of cumin seeds . add a pinch of asafoetida . add ginger , potatoes , and peas and mix together with a stirring spoon .

column1: heat oil in pan and add cumin seeds asafoetida ginger potatoes and peas .
column2: take a pan and heat it on the stove . add one tablespoon of oil in to the pan and heat it . add one tablespoon of cumin seeds and little asafoetida in to the pan . add 1 1/2 teaspoons of cut pieces of ginger in to the pan . add i bowl of potato pieces and a bowl of green peas in to the pan .

column1: crush coriander seeds and fennel seeds and put it in a bowl .
column2: the roasted coriander seeds and fennel seeds are to big and hard to eat whole and need to be crushed into smaller pieces . put the whole coriander and fennel seeds on a cutting board . take a rolling pin and roll over the seeds crushing them into smaller pieces . scrape up the crushed seeds and put into a bowl .

column1: crush coriander seeds and fennel seeds and put it in a bowl .
column2: get a rolling pin ready . it is time to crush the roasted coriander and fennel seeds . remove both types of seeds from the bowls and put them together on a cutting board or hard , clean surface . take the rolling pin and slowly roll over the seeds , crushing them into tinier pieces . make sure to crush them the best you can and as small as you can . scoop up the seeds with your hands or spoon then the crushed seeds in a bowl .

column1: crush coriander seeds and fennel seeds and put it in a bowl .
column2: put roasted coriander seeds and roasted fennel seeds onto a cutting board . move a rolling pin over the seeds crushing them into small pieces . put the crushed seeds into a small bowl .

column1: heat oil in a nonstick pan and add 1 tsp cumin seeds finely chopped ginger green chilies and salt .
column2: put a non stick pan on the stove . heat the pan and add 1 tablespoon of oil to the pan . add cumin seeds to the oil , stir , then add chopped ginger . add chopped green chilies . if you do n't want it spicy , then do n't add chilies .

column1: heat oil in a nonstick pan and add 1 tsp cumin seeds finely chopped ginger green chilies and salt .
column2: place nonstick pan on burner and turn on . add 2 tablespoons oil till hot . add 1 teaspoon of cumin seeds to oil . once cumin starts to crackle add 1 thinly chopped ginger root , salt , and 2 chopped green chilies to pan .

column1: heat oil in a nonstick pan and add 1 tsp cumin seeds finely chopped ginger green chilies and salt .
column2: turn on the stove to medium high and place a frying pan on the stove . add oil to cover the bottom of the frying pan and let the oil get hot , about a minute . get a teaspoon measuring spoon and fill with cumin seeds to the edge . add the cumin seeds to the frying pan and let it fry a few seconds . chop ginger green chilies with a knife and add to the frying pan . add a little salt to the frying pan and stir with a spoon .

column1: add mashed potatoes and green peas and mix .
column2: put green chilies in hot pan . add the boiled potatoes and peas to the pan . use a wooden spatula to mix all in pan . turn the flame down , so the cumin seeds do not burn .

column1: add mashed potatoes and green peas and mix .
column2: when the ginger has a brown color , take your wooden spoon and put in the potatoes . then using the same spoon , add in the green peas . mix everything together with the spoon . turn down the heat a little .

column1: add mashed potatoes and green peas and mix .
column2: mix ginger until it is brown . using a wooden spoon , place the smashed potatoes and green peas inside of the pan . turn the heat to low so that the ingredients do not burn . mix all the ingredients inside of the pan using the wooden spoon .

column1: add red chili powder turmeric powder chat masala salt ground spice mixture and garam masala powder and mix .
column2: use a measuring spoon to scoop 1/2 teaspoon of red chili powder , then pour it onto the food in the pan . next , use the measuring spoon to scoop 1/4 teaspoon of turmeric powder , then pour it onto the food in the pan . scoop 1 teaspoon of chat masala with measuring spoon and pour onto food in the pan . scoop up a little bit of salt and ground spice mixture with a spoon and sprinkle onto the food in the pan . scoop 1 teaspoon of garam masala powder , pour onto the food , and mix together with large wooden spoon .

column1: add red chili powder turmeric powder chat masala salt ground spice mixture and garam masala powder and mix .
column2: take the chili powder and pour into pot . take turmeric powder and pour into pot . take chat masala salt and pour into pot . take ground spice and gram masala powder and add to pot . stir everything together with a spoon .

column1: add red chili powder turmeric powder chat masala salt ground spice mixture and garam masala powder and mix .
column2: first dump your chili powder and turmeric powder into the pan . next dump in the chaat masala and salt . finally , dump the ground spice mixture and garam masala powder in to the pan . use your wooden spoon mix all the spices into the food .

column1: add lemon juice .
column2: get a teaspoon measure . pour lemon juice into the teaspoon measure until it is full . pour the lemon juice that is in the teaspoon into the food .

column1: add lemon juice .
column2: slowly pour two teaspoons of lemon juice . pour the juice over top of your pan .

column1: add lemon juice .
column2: add 2 teaspoons of lemon juice using measuring spoons . mix well with a wooden spoon . set aside to cool for 10 - 15 minutes .

column1: roll and cut the dough .
column2: roll a one tablespoon piece of dough into a ball with your hands . dab oil all around your ball of dough using one finger . roll dough into a thin oblong shape . cut rolled dough in half width wise .

column1: roll and cut the dough .
column2: take the big ball of dough . divide the dough in to small balls . roll it round using palms . apply oil and roll it with a stick in to long strip . take a knife and cut it in half .

column1: roll and cut the dough .
column2: put the dough in your hands and roll into small balls and apply oil . put the balls on a cutting board and flatten down . use a rolling pin to roll into an oval shape . use a sharp knife to slice the dough .

column1: shape the dough fill it and seal the edges .
column2: take the cut pieces of dough . shape the dough in to cone like shape . place the filling in the center . apply the water along the sides of the cone . seal the edges to close the filling .

column1: shape the dough fill it and seal the edges .
column2: cut pasta in half first . then shape into cone . next fill with the mixture . moisten the edges and fold to seal it .

column1: shape the dough fill it and seal the edges .
column2: fold the dough a little bit . put the food in the dough . close the dough .

column1: deep fry the samosas .
column2: place frying pan on stove top . heat oil in frying pan to medium heat . lower food item in frying pan of medium hot oil . when nice golden brown take out of pan . drain on a plate lined with paper plate .

column1: deep fry the samosas .
column2: place the samosas in the fryer . fry until golden brown .

column1: deep fry the samosas .
column2: put oil into a pot so it is almost full and place it on the stove . turn the cooking stove to medium heat , or the middle number . place a napkin on top of an empty plate . slowly drop the samosas into the oil . wait until the samosas turn golden brown , not very dark and use a spatula to take them out and place them on the napkin on the plate .

column1: melt a piece of butter in a heavy saucepan over medium heat .
column2: put the dial on the stove to medium . put a piece of butter into the pan . wait for it to melt completely .

column1: melt a piece of butter in a heavy saucepan over medium heat .
column2: get a heavy sauce pan . turn on stove burner to medium or turn stove knob half way . you want to melt the butter . drop butter in sauce pan and let cook for about a minute .

column1: melt a piece of butter in a heavy saucepan over medium heat .
column2: place saucepan on burner . turn on burner to medium . place butter in pan . let it melt for about a minute .

column1: add in some flour and milk and whisk it .
column2: add some flour in to the butter in the pan . whisk it until the bubbles pop up for a minute . add the milk and whisk properly . and make it boil nicely .

column1: add in some flour and milk and whisk it .
column2: add flour to the pan . add milk to the pan . using a whisk , stir the ingredients together .

column1: add in some flour and milk and whisk it .
column2: you have your butter in the pot . add flour to the pot and whisk it until it bubbles . then add in the milk . whisk it until it thickens up .

column1: preheat an oven to 425 f degrees .
column2: set your oven temperature to 425 degrees . keep the oven door closed . wait for the inside of the oven to be heated to 425 degrees .

column1: preheat an oven to 425 f degrees .
column2: preheat the oven to 425 degrees fahrenheit . preheat the oven for at least 5 minutes so that it heats up .

column1: preheat an oven to 425 f degrees .
column2: turn on the oven . press the button or turn the dial , whatever method your oven has . stop when you reach the number 425 f . the oven needs time to get hot , so you need to wait a while until you hear a beep or a timer ( if your oven has one ) that tells you the oven reached the correct temperature .

column1: brush the sauce on two piece of bread and add ham and cheese on top of them .
column2: take two slices of bread . put some sauce on top of bread with a spoon . put some ham on top of each bread . add 2 slices of cheese on to each bread . place the bread on to a tray and bake .

column1: brush the sauce on two piece of bread and add ham and cheese on top of them .
column2: turn the oven on and set it to 425 , when it beeps you know it 's ready . take two pieces of bread , use a spoon and cover them with the sauce . then put a piece of ham on top of the spread . now cover the ham with two slices of cheese . move both pieces of bread onto an oven safe baking sheet . let them bake until you see the cheese turn brown and begin to bubble .

column1: brush the sauce on two piece of bread and add ham and cheese on top of them .
column2: add some sauce on both slices of bread . add as slice of ham to each slice . add two slices of cheese to each slice . bake it in the oven until the cheese is bubbling and brown .

column1: bake it in the oven for 10 minutes and they are ready to serve .
column2: put them in the oven and wait 10 minutes . once 10 minutes is up , let them cool for 2 minutes and they 're ready to eat !

column1: bake it in the oven for 10 minutes and they are ready to serve .
column2: place the pan in the oven . after 7 min , turn the oven light on and peak into the oven . check to see if the cheese is bubbly and brown , usually 10 - 12 minutes . once it 's bubbly and brown , take it out of the oven . cool for 2 minutes .

column1: bake it in the oven for 10 minutes and they are ready to serve .
column2: put on oven mitts . put the baking sheet in the oven . let it bake until the cheese is bubbly and brown , about 10 to 12 minutes . put on your oven mitts and remove the baking sheet from the oven . let it cool 1 to 2 minutes .

column1: add ginger and green onion to the wok .
column2: hold the bowl of ginger and onion over the pan . use something to push them out of the bowl into the pan slowly .

column1: add ginger and green onion to the wok .
column2: take a medium bowl . cook the wok in the bowl . cut the ginger in to small pieces . add the ginger in to the bowl . add cut pieces of green onion in to the bowl .

column1: add ginger and green onion to the wok .
column2: have a spoonful of thin ginger slices ready in a separate bowl . have 2 spoonfuls of chopped green onion ready in a separate bowl . add the ginger to the wok . add the green onion to the wok . stir and mix the wok 's contents while they are still cooking .

column1: roll up the spring roll .
column2: grab a plate . place pastry on plate . add fillings into the spring roll . fold pastry in front and sides with finger . and roll .

column1: roll up the spring roll .
column2: take a spring roll sheet on a paper . fill the contents in the sheet . take one side of the sheet and roll it on to the filling . roll the sides of the sheet . complete the rolling of the spring roll to the other side .

column1: roll up the spring roll .
column2: take one corner of the roll and bend it not quite in half over the stuffing . fold the two side corners over the middle . start rolling from the first folded edge . before it is completely rolled , wet the little corned sticking out with a little water .

column1: seal the roll with water .
column2: now we want to roll it up and get ready to seal it . gently wet your finger with some water and seal up the wrap by rubbing your finger on the edge and rolling once again .

column1: seal the roll with water .
column2: take the spring roll sheet on a plate . fill the center of the sheet with the filling . complete the rolling of spring roll . take some water on the finger tip . apply some water on the free end of roll and seal it .

column1: seal the roll with water .
column2: dip your finger in a small bowl of water . place the water on the remaining corner of the roll . press the corner into the roll to seal .

column1: add cabbage and carrot to the wok and stir fry .
column2: julienne both cabbage and carrots . add to hot wok . stir fry for 2 minutes .

column1: add cabbage and carrot to the wok and stir fry .
column2: put the cabbage and carrots into the pan . use chopsticks to stir the cabbage and carrots . cook for about 2 minutes .

column1: add cabbage and carrot to the wok and stir fry .
column2: hold the cabbage and carrot over the wok . slowly push them into the wok . mix them around with chopsticks while you cook them .

column1: fry pork in oil in a wok .
column2: take a pan on the stove . add some oil in the pan . cut the pork in to small slices . add the pork in to the oil . fry the pork in the oil .

column1: fry pork in oil in a wok .
column2: put the fried pork in the pork . cook for 1 minute on medium high heat .

column1: fry pork in oil in a wok .
column2: put a little cooking oil in a wok or deep frying pan . heat the wok or pan over medium high heat . when pan is hot , carefully add sliced pork . stir the pork with chopsticks and cook for about one minute .

column1: place the filling in the center of a pastry wrapper .
column2: put one pastry sheet on a plate . use chopsticks to put the filling in the center of the pastry sheet . roll up the pastry like so .

column1: place the filling in the center of a pastry wrapper .
column2: take one spring roll pastry and lay it on a plate . use a scoop and scoop up the filling . put the filling in the center of the wrapper of the pastry . roll up the pastry .

column1: place the filling in the center of a pastry wrapper .
column2: place a spring roll wrapper on a plate . remove a pair of chopsticks from a drawer . take the spring roll filling and place it on the wrapper . then roll the wrapper up like a tube . finally , repeat until all the wrapper are full .

column1: add salt and pepper to the wok .
column2: take a medium sized bowl . place the contents in the bowl . add some salt in to the bowl . add some pepper powder in to the bowl . mix everything in the bowl .

column1: add salt and pepper to the wok .
column2: sprinkle a small spoonful of salt on to your ingredients in the wok . then , you will need to add a few sprinkles of red pepper powder to the wok .

column1: add salt and pepper to the wok .
column2: sprinkle some salt and pepper sparingly to wok / dish . stir .

column1: fry the spring rolls in oil until golden .
column2: add spring rolls into the cooking oil . turn them over throughout the cooking process . remove them when they 're golden and brown .

column1: fry the spring rolls in oil until golden .
column2: place the spring rolls into the cooking oil . cook at medium high heat . turn over the rolls so both sides are equally fried .

column1: fry the spring rolls in oil until golden .
column2: take the prepared spring rolls in a plate . take a pot and add some oil in to the pot . heat the oil in the pot . place the spring rolls in the oil . fry the spring rolls till they are golden brown .

column1: cut the avocado and place in a bowl .
column2: take a knife and down the center cut it down the middle . take your knife and grab the pit with it and take it out . take a fork and scrape all of the avocado . put the avocado into the bowl .

column1: cut the avocado and place in a bowl .
column2: use a knife to cut one large ripe avocado in half . remove the seed . use a fork to scoop out the avocado and place into a small bowl .

column1: cut the avocado and place in a bowl .
column2: take your knife and carefully cute the avocado into two pieces . take the pit in the middle of the avocado out . use a fork to scoop out the green middle of the avocado . scoop the middle into an empty bowl . use your fork to mash up the avocado .

column1: cut a lime squeeze on the avocado and stir .
column2: roll a lime on your table , pressing it gently to help release the juice . cut the lime in half through its middle . squeeze 1/2 of the lime so the juice mixes with the avocado . stir the juice until it is completely mixed with the avocado .

column1: cut a lime squeeze on the avocado and stir .
column2: roll lime on the counter . cut in half with a knife . squeeze each half over avocado .

column1: cut a lime squeeze on the avocado and stir .
column2: roll lime on counter . cut lime in half . squeeze lime into avocado . stir .

column1: add 1 tbsp of olive oil to it and season it with a pinch of salt and stir .
column2: put in 1 tablespoon of olive oil in the bowl . take your thumb and pointer finger - and pinch up some salt . mix the stuff in the bowl around .

column1: add 1 tbsp of olive oil to it and season it with a pinch of salt and stir .
column2: put 1 teaspoon in of olive oil . take your fingers and add a little salt . mix it up .

column1: add 1 tbsp of olive oil to it and season it with a pinch of salt and stir .
column2: use a measuring spoon to measure out one tablespoon of olive oil . add olive oil to the bowl . add a small amount of salt to the bowl . stir it all together with a spoon .

column1: lay bacon slices over the coin rack .
column2: take your bacon with your fingers . put the bacon on the rack with some space in between them .

column1: lay bacon slices over the coin rack .
column2: first , get your materials . you will need a metal tray , a coiled rack , aluminum foil that fits on the metal perfectly , and 4 bacon strips . second , place your aluminum foil onto the metal tray . fun fact : the foil will collect the oil from the bacon ! third , put your coil rack on top of the foil . fourth , put your bacon onto the coiling rack one by one in a line . make sure the strips are not touching one another . lastly , put the tray with your bacon strips into the oven for 10 to 15 minutes , and happily serve the bacon nice and hot .

column1: lay bacon slices over the coin rack .
column2: cover the bottom of a cookie sheet with aluminum foil . put a cooling rack on top of the foil . put bacon on the rack , each slice not touching the other . make sure your oven is heated to 350 . put the cookie sheet in the oven for about ten minutes .

column1: cut firm artisan bread into slices .
column2: put your bread on a hard surface . use a sharp knife and cut 4 slices about 1/2 inch thick . put the 4 slices into a pan . turn the oven dial to broil . place pan under the broiler in oven .

column1: cut firm artisan bread into slices .
column2: using a bread knife slice loaf in half . cut 1/2 inch slices of bread from the center . cut 4 slices .

column1: cut firm artisan bread into slices .
column2: using a sharp knife cut bread into half inch slices . four slices are needed for two sandwiches . place bread on a pan and place in broiler to toast .

column1: add 2 eggs and season with salt and pepper .
column2: break two eggs and put it in the pan . spread salt all over the egg into the pan . also spread pepper all over the egg .

column1: add 2 eggs and season with salt and pepper .
column2: use the side of the pan to gently crack the egg shell and pour the contents into the pan . sprinkle a little bit of salt and pepper on top of the eggs in your pan .

column1: add 2 eggs and season with salt and pepper .
column2: spray a large pan with non stick spray . crack two large eggs lightly onto the side of a firm clean surface and add them to the pan . season the eggs lightly with salt and pepper .

column1: slice tomatoes into thin slices .
column2: use a knife cut the tomatoes into thin slices . hold the tomato on its side and carefully use the knife to slice .

column1: slice tomatoes into thin slices .
column2: start frying the eggs and bacon and have it cooking o medium heat . toast your bread . spread the bread with avocado and butter . slice the tomatoes and get them ready for the sandwich . slap them all together once the egg and spinach is done cooking .

column1: slice tomatoes into thin slices .
column2: get 1 tomato and put it on a cutting board . cut the tomato into thin slices using a kitchen knife .

column1: spread avocado mixture on one toast and on the other toast spread olive oil mayonnaise .
column2: take one table spoon of avocado mix . spread this to one toast . take some olive oil mayonnaise . spread this to another toast .

column1: spread avocado mixture on one toast and on the other toast spread olive oil mayonnaise .
column2: get two slices of bread , some avocado spread and a jar of olive oil mayonnaise . generously add avocado spread on one slice of bread and spread with a butter knife . add olive oil mayonnaise to the other slice of bread , and spread with the butter knife . place the two slices of bread together to create your sandwich . enjoy .

column1: spread avocado mixture on one toast and on the other toast spread olive oil mayonnaise .
column2: put the bread on the plate with the toasted side down . with a spatula , spread the avocado mixture on one piece of the bread . with a spoon or spatula , spread a small amount of olive oil mayonnaise on the other piece of bread .

column1: place few leaves of spring greens over the avocado spread slightly press them and add sliced tomatoes on them .
column2: take your leaves and put them onto of your bread . put a tomato on top of your leaves . with your fingers press on your tomatoes and leaves into your bread lightly .

column1: place few leaves of spring greens over the avocado spread slightly press them and add sliced tomatoes on them .
column2: put some lettuce leaves on top of the avocado layer . press on them a little so they stay put . put some sliced tomatoes on top of the lettuce . having the lettuce between the tomatoes and the bread keeps the bread from getting soggy .

column1: place few leaves of spring greens over the avocado spread slightly press them and add sliced tomatoes on them .
column2: add the avocado spread onto one piece of the bread . put the lettuce on top of the avocado spread . add tomatoes on top of the greens .

column1: break the 2 bacon slices into pieces and lay them on the tomatoes .
column2: break two slices of freshly cooked bacon in half . lay slices of bacon over the top of the rest of the ingredients .

column1: break the 2 bacon slices into pieces and lay them on the tomatoes .
column2: cut the bacon in half . put the two pieces of bacon on top of the tomatoes .

column1: break the 2 bacon slices into pieces and lay them on the tomatoes .
column2: take the first slice of bacon and fold it back and forth until it breaks . lay each part of the slice on top of the tomatoes . put them side by side . take the next slice and do the same thing .

column1: place sunny side egg over the top and serve .
column2: take the fried egg out of the pan with a spatula . place the egg on top of the bacon . serve the food right afterwards .

column1: place sunny side egg over the top and serve .
column2: carefully use a spatula to place the cooked egg on top of the bacon . serve your sandwich and eat .

column1: place sunny side egg over the top and serve .
column2: do not turn the egg over in the pan . using the spatula , slide the egg out of the pan . put it on the sandwich , with the part that was in the pan touching the rest of the sandwich .

column1: add lard into a pot .

column2: use a butter knife to slice two pieces of butter off of the stick of butter . place the pieces of butter onto a pan placed on the stove . once the butter melts place the sandwich in the middle of the pan .

column1: heat some butter in a pan and put the sandwich on the pan .
column2: get a medium sized pan . with parental supervision , turn the stove on to medium heat . using a butter knife , cut some thick slices of butter . carefully , place the butter on to the pan making sure not to touch the pan . once you see the butter starting to bubble up , place your sandwich onto the pan .

column1: heat some butter in a pan and put the sandwich on the pan .
column2: turn the burner on medium and let the pan heat up . when the pan is hot , put in two pieces of butter . when the butter has melted and starts bubbling , put the sandwich in the pan . be careful , it is hot !

column1: cook the sandwich in an oven .
column2: turn the oven on medium . put the sandwiches on the pan and place the pan into the oven . wait for 8 minutes . use a pot holder to remove pan with sandwiches from the oven and place on counter .

column1: cook the sandwich in an oven .
column2: turn your oven on to 350 degrees . grab the pan from the stove with your sandwich on it and place it into the hot oven . leave it for 8 minutes . remove the pan carefully from the oven and turn the oven off .

column1: cook the sandwich in an oven .
column2: take the pan off heat . place the pan into the heated oven . once it 's melted and looks browned , remove it . remember : it 'll be hot so use an oven mitt .

column1: add some fresh parsley leaves and black pepper and mix it well .
column2: put some fresh parsley and black pepper into the bowl . use a mixing spoon to mix all together .

column1: add some fresh parsley leaves and black pepper and mix it well .
column2: chop up some fresh parsley , about a tablespoon , and add it to the bowl . add about half a teaspoon of black pepper to the bowl . mix the ingredients in the bowl with a wooden spoon .

column1: add some fresh parsley leaves and black pepper and mix it well .
column2: grab some fresh parsley leaves with your hands and throw them in . throw in some black pepper . mix everything mix a spoon .

column1: add red bell pepper and green peppers onto the bowl .
