column1: sprinkle salt and pepper on top .
column2: use your fingers and pinch up some salt . sprinkle the salt on top . shake some pepper on top like the salt .

column1: sprinkle salt and pepper on top .
column2: put a little bit of salt and pepper on the food on the plate . eat and enjoy .

column1: sprinkle salt and pepper on top .
column2: use your fingers to sprinkle a small dash of salt on top . then put a little bit of pepper from a pepper grinder over everything .

column1: cook the apple slices in the pan .
column2: put the apple slices in a single layer in a hot pan . cook the apples for 8 to 10 minutes .

column1: cook the apple slices in the pan .
column2: place apples in the pan edge - to - edge . cook 8 - 10 minutes .

column1: cook the apple slices in the pan .
column2: set the apple slices into the frying pan . allow the apple slices to cook in the pan . turn over the slices to both sides get cooked .

column1: pour the juice onto the foie gras .
column2: pour the juice onto the foie gras . make sure it is plated correctly .

column1: pour the juice onto the foie gras .
column2: first , we want to add the juice . just take the juice and slowly let it run onto your dish off its plate .

column1: pour the juice onto the foie gras .
column2: hold the plate with the juice on it over the foie gras . carefully pour the juice on the meat .

column1: place the apples and the foie gras on a plate .
column2: bring your plate of apples near your pretty plate . use your wooden spoons to place the cooked apple slices in the middle of the plate . now bring the foie gras to your plate . use your wooden spoons to nicely place the foie gras on top of the apple slices .

column1: place the apples and the foie gras on a plate .
column2: take a medium sized plate . place the apples on the plate . take the foie gras on the pan . place the foie gras on top of apples . put the pan aside .

column1: cut the foie gras into slices .
column2: hold the foie gras carefully . take a knife and slowly cut the very end of the meat into a small slice . keep slicing thin lines carefully .

column1: cut the foie gras into slices .
column2: place foie gras on cutting board . get a long knife from the knife block . take knife and make a have inch wide cut . remove carefully as to not break the slice .

column1: cut the foie gras into slices .
column2: place the foie gras on a small cutting board . get a sharpened chef 's knife . cut a slice down one long side of the foie gras . " slicing should be done carefully with the slice about 1/4 thick " " . " cut slices from the remaining foie gras down the same side , same width .

column1: cook the foie gras in the pan .
column2: place the foie gras in the oil . fry on each side for a 2 minutes .

column1: cook the foie gras in the pan .
column2: heat the pan . using a wooden spatula put the foie gras . once cooked remove the pan from the heat .

column1: cook the foie gras in the pan .
column2: use a spatula to set the foie gras into the pan . cook it on both sides until it is hot and brown .

column1: melt the butter in a pan .
column2: once the pan is hot , place the butter in the pan . using a spatula or some other kitchen tool , move the butter around the pan so that it covers the pan as it melts .

column1: melt the butter in a pan .
column2: put butter in pan . spread it around . keep spreading until it has fully melted .

column1: melt the butter in a pan .
column2: scoop some butter into the frying pan . spread the butter around the pan until it melts .

column1: pour oil into a hot pan .
column2: place the pan on the stove and turn on the heat . pour 1 - 2 tablespoons of oil into pan . wait a few seconds for the pan to get hot . use a spoon to give it a little stir . when it is hot enough , the oil should have steam rising up . that is how you will know that the pan is ready .

column1: pour oil into a hot pan .
column2: pour the oil into the pan . wait until the oil heats up .

column1: crack an egg into the pan and stir .
column2: gently hit the egg on the edge of the pan until it crack . pour the contents of the egg into the oil in the pan . use a spatula to stir up the egg while it cooks .

column1: crack an egg into the pan and stir .
column2: grab an egg with both hands . with your thumbs on the bottom , holding the egg over the pan , squeeze the egg slightly with both thumbs . make sure the pressure is slight and you 're squeezing as hard with your right and left hands . stir it up .

column1: crack an egg into the pan and stir .
column2: take one egg and tap it lightly on side of pan to crack it . open shell with your thumbs to empty contents into the pan . pull egg to side of pan and spoon out some oil . stir egg until it hardens and cooks .

column1: add pork sprouts onion and green onion to the pan and stir .
column2: heat the pan . cut onion and green onion in to small pieces . add pork and sprouts in to the pan . add cut pieces of onion and green onion . mix all with a spoon .

column1: add pork sprouts onion and green onion to the pan and stir .
column2: pour the pork , sprouts , onion , and green onion into the pan . use a large spoon or spatula to stir the food in the pan .

column1: add pork sprouts onion and green onion to the pan and stir .
column2: dump pork , sprouts and green onion into a hot pan . use a metal spatula in one hand and metal spoon in the other to stir those things together . mix the pork , sprouts and onion back onto themselves using a shoveling motion .

column1: add rice to the pan and stir .
column2: take a measuring cup and weigh the rice . soak the rice for 15 minutes . strain the rice using a strainer . add the strained rice into the pan . stir the rice with other ingredients using a spatula .

column1: add rice to the pan and stir .
column2: place rice in pan . stir .

column1: add rice to the pan and stir .
column2: cook what is in the hot wok . add rice to wok and stir until cooked .

column1: add white pepper to the pan .
column2: while the ingredients are cooked in the pan . add some amount of white pepper into the dish . stir the mixture thoroughly in order to blend all the ingredients together .

column1: add white pepper to the pan .
column2: cook your meat in a hot wok . add a little bit of white pepper to pan . stir the salt into the mixtures as the mixture cooks .

column1: add white pepper to the pan .
column2: shake some white pepper into it . mix the food up more .

column1: add soy sauce to the pan and stir .
column2: take a large pan . cook pork in a pan . take two spoons of soy sauce . add soy sauce with a spoon . mix the soy sauce with other things in the pan .

column1: add soy sauce to the pan and stir .
column2: using a ladle , add soy sauce to hot pan . use a spoon to stir sauce into rice .

column1: add soy sauce to the pan and stir .
column2: get the bottle of soy sauce . measure out how much you need into a measuring cup . pour what you measured in to the pan . stir the mixture .

column1: place the rice onto a serving plate .
column2: fill a round serving spoon with rice using your cooking utensil . gently pat down the rice in the serving spoon . keep the rice in the serving spoon while you put the remaining rice on the serving plate using another utensil . after all of the rice is on the serving plate , carefully turn the filled round serving spoon full of rice over on to the pile of rice in the plate so that you have a nice round mound of rice .

column1: place the rice onto a serving plate .
column2: stir in wok and take out of pan and put it on a plate .

column1: place the rice onto a serving plate .
column2: once the rice is cooked , take a spatula . take the serving plate . put the cooked rice into the serving plate . have it tasty .

column1: add fish sauce to a bowl .
column2: take a table spoon from your silverware drawer . fill it with fish sauce , while holding it over a small bowl . once it is full dump it in the bowl . do this again two more times ( until you have three spoon fulls in the bowl ) .

column1: add fish sauce to a bowl .
column2: measure three tablespoons of fish sauce into a small bowl . it 's ok if it 's a little over as it does n't have to be perfect .

column1: slice chilies and a lime and add the pieces and juice to the bowl .
column2: decide how many chilies you want to add to your dish . once you have that decided , pull off the stems . be careful and do not touch your eyes or face once you have handled the chilies . next , you will slice the chilies carefully . add the chilies to the dish . then you need to cut a lime in half , and squeeze half of it into the dish . now , mix the dish together .

column1: slice chilies and a lime and add the pieces and juice to the bowl .
column2: pull the stems off of the chilies you decide to use . slice them finely and then add the to the fish sauce in the bowl . next , cut a lime in half and squeeze the juice of a half of lime into the bowl .

column1: slice chilies and a lime and add the pieces and juice to the bowl .
column2: take the stem of the chili off . cut the chilies into small pieces , cut the lime and squeeze the juice into the bowl .

column1: peel the shrimp .
column2: the head and outer hard shell covering on the shrimp needs to be removed . leave the tail on the shrimp .

column1: peel the shrimp .
column2: take the shrimp . pull off all the shell that 's covering the shrimp .

column1: peel the shrimp .
column2: you will need to pick out ten small shrimp for this recipe . to begin with the shrimp , first carefully peel off the head and then the outer shell . you will leave only the tail on the shrimp .

column1: chop the garlic onion green onion and chinese broccoli .
column2: peel 2 cloves of garlic and chop them up . take half of a small white sweet onion and slice it into wedges lengthwise . then take 3 or 4 green onions and cut off the bottom and cut them up finely . take one half of a large leaf from a chinese broccoli and slice it into 1 centimeter strips .

column1: chop the garlic onion green onion and chinese broccoli .
column2: peel 2 cloves of garlic and finely chop them into small pieces . cut a small white onion in half . cut one half of the onion into slices . trim and discard the roots off of 3 - 4 green onions , then cut the green onions into tiny pieces . cut one big leaf of chinese broccoli or other leafy green and slice into small strips .

column1: chop the garlic onion green onion and chinese broccoli .
column2: peel two cloves of garlic and coarsely mince them . use half of a small sweet white onion and cu into slices t length wise . take 3 or 4 of your green onions and cut up finely into very small pieces . take your chinese broccoli and cut one leaf in half , and then cut into 1 cm length strips .

column1: heat up oil in a wok .
column2: turn on the stove . put your pan on the stove . add one tablespoon of oil and let it get hot .

column1: heat up oil in a wok .
column2: he on the stove in a stir fry wok or ask mom for a pan that will work . heat the oil in a wok type . you can google that if you like .

column1: heat up oil in a wok .
column2: turn your stove on medium and set your pan down . add 1 tablespoon of oil to the pan . wait for the oil to get nice and hot . stay back , because it will begin to pop and that can hurt !

column1: fry garlic and shrimp in the wok .
column2: make sure the oil is hot before adding ingredients . add the chopped garlic to the oil . stir fry the garlic for 15 seconds . add the shrimp to the pan . cook the shrimp , stir frying continuously for 30 seconds .

column1: fry garlic and shrimp in the wok .
column2: when the oil in the wok is hot , add garlic and stir in the pan for about 15 seconds . after cooking garlic for 15 seconds , add shrimp and stir for about 30 seconds .

column1: fry garlic and shrimp in the wok .
column2: put wok on stove . put oil into wok and turn on stove . add garlic to hot oil . stir fry garlic for 15 seconds . add shrimp and cook by stir frying for 30 seconds .

column1: mix rice and an egg with the shrimp .
column2: add half the bowl of rice to combine flavors . move the rice to half of the skillet to make room for the egg . cracked the egg in the open half and start to mix in with the rice that is in the skillet . mix well until the egg is a yellow color and all cooked . add the rest of the white rice from the bowl .

column1: mix rice and an egg with the shrimp .
column2: add half of the rice to the pot . stir fry it with the shrimp so that the flavors blend in very good . move rice to one side of the wok and add an egg to the cleared side . stir the egg mixture for a few seconds , then stir it into the rice . toss in the rest of the rice , stirring everything together well .

column1: mix rice and an egg with the shrimp .
column2: the shrimp is already in the hot wok . a wok is a skillet with high sides . add one half of the cooked rice and mix quickly with the metal spoon . push the rice and shrimp to one side of the wok and pour the egg into the empty half . stir the egg until it is cooked and add the rest of the rice . stir everything together .

column1: add soy sauce oyster sauce and sugar to the wok .
column2: add half a tablespoon of soy sauce to the pan . add half a tablespoon of oyster sauce to the pan . add a small pinch of sugar . mix all the ingredients well .

column1: add soy sauce oyster sauce and sugar to the wok .
column2: with rice in a hot wok . add 1/2 tablespoon of soy sauce . add 1/2 tablespoon of oyster sauce . add a tiny bit of sugar . stir it all together in the wok .

column1: add soy sauce oyster sauce and sugar to the wok .
column2: with rice and shrimp in the hot wok pan . add 1/2 tablespoon of soy sauce . add 1/2 tablespoon of oyster sauce . add a tiny amount of sugar . mix everything together in pan .

column1: add the onion and broccoli to the wok .
column2: stir rice with shrimp for a little bit . toss in chinese broccoli . toss in white onion . mix together . fry the rice for another 30 seconds .

column1: add the onion and broccoli to the wok .
column2: cut one small onion and add into wok . put one cup chinese broccoli into pan . mix around for 30 seconds constantly .

column1: add the onion and broccoli to the wok .
column2: add the broccoli to the wok . add the sliced onion to the wok . stir fry it for another 30 seconds .

column1: add the green onions to the wok .
column2: get wok hot on stove . add rice , shrimp and other ingredients . stir fry in hot wok . toss in green onions . keep stirring and in a few seconds it is done .

column1: add the green onions to the wok .
column2: toss in the chopped green onions to the stir fried rice . mix up the green onion with the stir fried rice for a few seconds . remove the pot from the heat , it is finished cooking .

column1: add the green onions to the wok .
column2: take the chopped greens onions . put them in the wok pan that 's on the stove .

column1: mix bread crumbs and parmesan cheese .
column2: take out a bowl . put bread crumbs in the bowl . put parmesan cheese in the bowl . take a spoon and mix the crumbs and cheese together . take out a plate and pour the mixture of crumbs and cheese onto your plate .

column1: mix bread crumbs and parmesan cheese .
column2: take a medium sized bowl . take a cup of bread crumbs in a bowl . add the bread crumbs in to the bowl . add a cup of parmesan cheese in to the bowl . mix them with a spoon .

column1: mix bread crumbs and parmesan cheese .
column2: mix bread crumbs and parmesan cheese in a bowl with a spoon . transfer the mixture onto a plate . this makes it easier to coat the chicken .

column1: pound the chicken .
column2: get a chicken breast from the store . lay the chicken flat . put the chicken in a plastic bag . e here 's the fun part , use a hammer and lightly hit the bag of chicken . pound the chicken until it is flat .

column1: pound the chicken .
column2: with the metal tool , hit the chicken all over . this makes the chicken tender .

column1: pound the chicken .
column2: place your chicken into a zip lock bag and seal the bag . use a meat tenderizer , looks like a little hammer , and hit the chicken breasts . the chicken will flatten out .

column1: rub salt and pepper onto the chicken .
column2: take chicken breasts on a plate . take salt in a bowl . take pepper powder in a bowl . rub some salt on to the chicken . rub some pepper on to the chicken .

column1: rub salt and pepper onto the chicken .
column2: with a pounder tap the chicken . grab your chicken breast with your hand . put salt onto each side of your chicken . put pepper onto each side of your chicken . rub the salt and pepper all over the chicken .

column1: rub flour onto the chicken    dip it in egg and coat with breadcrumbs .
column2: rub the white powdery stuff called flour all over the chicken . make sure to get both sides . dunk the chicken in the yellow juice which has been made from eggs that have been mixed together . make sure to put it all the way in and get everything covered in the egg juice . put the wet chicken in the crumbly yellow and white stuff called parmesan cheese . make sure to cover the entire chicken just like you did with the egg juice . make sure to press firmly so that the crumbles do n't fall off . put the food aside for a moment . focus on the oven and find the heating knob . this is what turns the oven on . it will have lots of numbers on it like ' 100 , 200 , 300 ' and even a word that says , ' broil . ' find this knob and turn it to the number ' 450 . ' . grab a frying pan . it might be heavy . it is a large pan that is shaped like a circle and is dark on the inside . it has a handle too . put the chickens on the pan .

column1: rub flour onto the chicken    dip it in egg and coat with breadcrumbs .
column2: rub flour onto the chicken . dip the chicken in eggs . push the chicken into the parmesan cheese and bread crumbs .

column1: rub flour onto the chicken    dip it in egg and coat with breadcrumbs .
column2: take some flour and rub it on both sides of the chicken . next put your chicken into the bowl of egg and cover it with the egg sauce . then rub both sides of the chicken in your breadcrumb mix . then pre - head your oven to 350 degrees .

column1: fry the chicken in a pan .
column2: add about 1 inch of olive oil in a pan . heat the on a stove top to medium high . add breaded chicken to the oil in a single layer . wait for 1.5 minutes . flip each piece of chicken and cook for 3 minutes total .

column1: fry the chicken in a pan .
column2: take the chicken and roll the chicken in meal to completely cover the outside of the chicken . put olive oil into a frying pan and place on the stove . turn the eye on to medium high . let the oil heat up for a minute or two . place the chicken pieces into the oil and wait about 1 1/2 minutes . take tongs and turn the chicken to the other side and wait 1 1/2 more minutes . you want to get both sides of the chicken brown and crispy .

column1: fry the chicken in a pan .
column2: once the pan is heated , place some olive oil in the pan . fry the chicken in the pan . cook the chicken for three minutes to make it firm on the outside . the chicken will not be cook through . it will still be raw on the inside .

column1: spread sauce over the chicken .
column2: put tomato sauce onto each piece of chicken . use the bottom of the spoon to spread the sauce on the chicken . put shredded cheese on top of sauce .

column1: spread sauce over the chicken .
column2: put chicken in metal pan . spread tomato sauce on chicken . cover the sauce with a little cheese .

column1: spread sauce over the chicken .
column2: place the three cooked pieces of chicken in a large rectangular pan that is silver . a rectangle is like a square , but imagine if you stretched out a square just a bit and made it longer and look like a funny square . find a spoon . dip the spoon into the sauce jar , the one filled with the thick red liquid . spread the sauce on the top of each chicken by using the spoon . make it thick but not too much .

column1: top the chicken with mozzarella cheese .
column2: take chicken pieces on a foil tray . take some tomato sauce and cheese on a bowl . apply some tomato sauce on to the top of chicken pieces . add lots of mozzarella cheese on top of sauce . repeat the same on all the chicken pieces .

column1: top the chicken with mozzarella cheese .
column2: use a spoon to spread pasta sauce on top of the chicken . make sure to cover the entire chicken . add mozzarella cheese with your fingers . make sure to put enough cheese to cover the chicken .

column1: top the chicken with mozzarella cheese .
column2: use a spoon to put tomato sauce on top of chicken . use the back of the spoon to spread the sauce on the chicken . then put mozzarella cheese on top of the sauce .

column1: bake the chicken in the oven .
column2: bake the chicken in the oven . it needs to cook for about 15 minutes .

column1: bake the chicken in the oven .
column2: now you are ready to bake . put it in the oven . bake it for about 15 min or until the chicken breast looks cooked .

column1: bake the chicken in the oven .
column2: place the pan in your preheated oven . bake for about 15 minutes until the chicken is cooked .

column1: chop the meat into pieces .
column2: clean the meat with hot water . cut the meat into small portions . again cut the meat into small pieces .

column1: chop the meat into pieces .
column2: put your meat on a cutting board . with a sharp knife , slice the meat into pieces that are 1 - 2 inches thick . ( while you are cutting the meat , carefully hold it in place with your other hand ) .

column1: chop the meat into pieces .
column2: use a knife to carefully cut the meat . cut the meat into a few medium sized chunks .

column1: add water salt cayenne pepper chili powder and cumin and boil the water .
column2: find a medium pot and fill up halfway with filtered or purified water . find measuring spoons and measure out spices . measure out 1 teaspoon salt , 2 teaspoons chili powder , 1 teaspoon cumin . sprinkle salt chili powder and cumin into the water . also sprinkle a little bit of cayenne pepper into the pot . turn up the burner to high , and bring the water to boil .

column1: add water salt cayenne pepper chili powder and cumin and boil the water .
column2: fill a pan about half full of water . add a tsp of salt and a few shakes of cayenne pepper . add 2 tsp of chili powder and 1 tsp of cumin . turn on the heat and bring the water to a boil .

column1: add water salt cayenne pepper chili powder and cumin and boil the water .
column2: pour in the water halfway up the pot with cumin . shake some salt cayenne pepper chili powder in . heat up the water until it boils .

column1: cook the meat in the water .
column2: before the water starts bubbling up grab the meat with your hands . carefully lower the meat into the water . let the meat cook in the water .

column1: cook the meat in the water .
column2: gently put the meat into the water . add the meat before it boils . when the water starts to boil turn down the heat to a simmer . mix the water as it simmers . scoop out the sludge that rises to the top .

column1: cook the meat in the water .
column2: slowly add the meat into the water before it begins to boil . be sure not to let the meat splash into the pot . bring the water to a boil , so that it is bubbling a lot . turn down the heat so that it does n't boil too vigorously . stir the foam down into the water . when the foam rises again , scrape it off the top of the water . boil the meat long enough to evaporate a lot of the water ( reduce the water ) .

column1: chop the tail end off .
column2: put the fish on a cutting board . the tail end is usually too chewy , so use a sharp knife to chop it off .

column1: chop the tail end off .
column2: with a knife slice off the tail of the fish . throw away the tail .

column1: chop the tail end off .
column2: put salmon on a cutting board . take the salmon and get a sharp nice and cut the tail off , watching your fingers .

column1: cut the fish at an angle .
column2: begin at the tail end of the fish . line the blade up at an angle . carefully slice the fish into slices as large of small as is wanted .

column1: cut the fish at an angle .
column2: hold your knife at angle ( almost flat on the fish ) . cut the fish that way to make a nice big flat piece and continue .

column1: cut the fish at an angle .
column2: put the fish on the cutting board . start cutting at the tail end . hold the knife at and angle and cut slices that are about a half an inch wide . repeat this cut to make many pieces of nigiri .

column1: slice the fish into smaller pieces .
column2: take a cutting board and a knife . . take a big fish on the board . take the knife and pass horizontally . cut the fish horizontally in to thin slices . repeat the same to cut the whole fish .

column1: slice the fish into smaller pieces .
column2: next , we need to cut our very large pieces of fish into smaller and thinner pieces . get a very sharp , long knife . carefully place one hand on top of the slab of fish , and place the knife about two inches ahead of your hand . slowly move the knife back and forth , slicing through the fish towards your hand . when the knife get close to the hand you have on top of the fish , move that hand back several inches to steady the part of the slab you are about to cut . if you need to , take a step backwards , too . keep moving the knife back and forth slowly , paying careful attention to the thickness of your slices , until you reach the end of the slab .

column1: slice the fish into smaller pieces .
column2: hold the fish from one end . take a knife and carefully slice the fish into smaller pieces from the middle .

column1: cut the fish into thin pieces .
column2: place fish on cutting board . retrieve filet knife from block . slice fish at a downward angle . press lightly against knife .

column1: cut the fish into thin pieces .
column2: place fresh fish on cutting board . grab a knife . carefully angle the blade from heal to the tip in one motion . stand the blade up to cut side down . repeat until fish is all cut .

column1: cut the fish into thin pieces .
column2: use your knife to cut the fish into thin pieces with your knife . cut across in one slice to make it look nice .

column1: grate the peeled potato and soak .
column2: peel the potato and wash . have a pot of cold water ready and grate the potatoes over the pot to soak . also grate some onion in the same pot and let soak .

column1: grate the peeled potato and soak .
column2: use a grater and grate the peeled potatoes . put the potatoes into the bowl in the water .

column1: grate the peeled potato and soak .
column2: hold a grater with one hand . rub the potato on the grater to shave it into the water . let the potatoes soak .

column1: fry the patties in shallow oil .
column2: heat pan of oil on medium - high heat . put the pancake mixture in the pan and use spatula to flatten . let the pancake brown on one side and use a spatula to flip it over .

column1: fry the patties in shallow oil .
column2: make sure there is a good amount of oil in the pan . let the patty cook in the oil . flip the patty with a spatula .

column1: fry the patties in shallow oil .
column2: put 1/4 inch of oil into a pan . turn the heat to medium high . place the patties in the oil . flip over with a spatula when one side become crispy .

column1: add the mixture to the potatoes and mix them well .
column2: shred potatoes with a shredder . place in a bowl . add sauce . using a spatula , mix well . continue mixing until completely coated .

column1: add the mixture to the potatoes and mix them well .
column2: add the dry potatoes to a bowl . to the potatoes , add the egg mixture by dumping into the potatoes . mix together the egg mixture and potatoes with your spatula .

column1: add the mixture to the potatoes and mix them well .
column2: add the egg mixture to the potatoes . use a spatula to mix everything together evenly .

column1: drain the potatoes and squeeze the water out .
column2: squeeze the potatoes in the strainer . drain all of the water from the potatoes into the bowl .

column1: drain the potatoes and squeeze the water out .
column2: grate some potatoes in to small strips . take the grated potatoes on a colander . drain the potatoes . squeeze the water out of the potatoes with hand . keep them aside .

column1: drain the potatoes and squeeze the water out .
column2: chop the potatoes into very small pieces . then make sure all the water is drained . form into small patties . put onto a hot skillet with oil and fry . repeat until all the patties have been cooked .

column1: whisk eggs flour black pepper salt and cayenne powder .
column2: crack two eggs into a bowl . add 1 tablespoon of flour . add black pepper . add a small bit of cayenne pepper . add a pinch of salt and whisk together .

column1: whisk eggs flour black pepper salt and cayenne powder .
column2: crack 2 eggs into a large bowl . add flour , black pepper , a pinch of cayenne and some salt . using a whisk , mix the ingredients until they are very smooth . set the mixture to the side .

column1: whisk eggs flour black pepper salt and cayenne powder .
column2: put two eggs in a bowl . add flour . put in some black pepper , salt and cayenne powder . use a whisk to mix everything together until it is smooth . set aside .

column1: add the beans and dal to boiling water .
column2: let the pot of water come to a boil . remove the lid from the pot . add the beans and salt to the boiling water . turn off the stove , put the lid on the pot and let it soak .

column1: add the beans and dal to boiling water .
column2: pour beans and dal into the pot of boiling water . add salt to the pot . put the lid on the pot . turn off the heat .

column1: add the beans and dal to boiling water .
column2: wait until the water is bubbling very fast . carefully pour the beans and dal in the water .

column1: add red chili powder garam masala and cream to the pan .
column2: hold the seasonings over the pan . throw in the red chili powder and garam masala . stir with a wooden spoon . slowly pour cream in the pan .

column1: add red chili powder garam masala and cream to the pan .
column2: add red chili pepper to the pan . pour in garam masala . add 1/4 cup of green . use the stirring spoon to mix everything together .

column1: add red chili powder garam masala and cream to the pan .
column2: add red chili powder and garam masala to the pan and stir . pour the cream into the pan and stir while cooking .

column1: add tomato puree and cover .
column2: add the tomato puree to the pan . use a stirring spoon to mix the puree into the pan . put the lid on the pan .

column1: add tomato puree and cover .
column2: pour the tomato puree in the pan slowly . cover the pan with a lid .

column1: add tomato puree and cover .
column2: put tomato puree in the pan and stir . put the lid on the pan and let it cook .

column1: add onion to the pan .
column2: pour onions into the pan . stir the onions in the mixture .

column1: add onion to the pan .
column2: hold the onions over the pan . carefully pour the onions in . mix everything up with a wooden spoon .

column1: add onion to the pan .
column2: put onions in the hot pan and stir . saute the onions for a short time .

column1: add the beans and lentils to the pan .
column2: open the pressure cooker with the beans . add all of the beans to the pan that is on the stove . use a spoon to get all of the beans out . add a little bit of water , about 1/2 a cup .

column1: add the beans and lentils to the pan .
column2: take beans from pan . add them pan with tomato mixture . then add in broth mixture . using a wooden spoon , stir the mixture over heat . keep stirring until completely heated and serve .

column1: add the beans and lentils to the pan .
column2: pour the pan of beans and lentils into the mixing pan . add water to the pan . use the stirring spoon to stir the pan as it cooks .

column1: add the lentils and cover .
column2: pour the lentil into the pan . put the lid of the pan on top and cover it .

column1: add the lentils and cover .
column2: before adding the lentils wash them well with water . add the lentils to the pot . then put the lid of the pressure cooker on securing it .

column1: add the lentils and cover .
column2: pour the lentils into the pan . put the cover over the pan and cook .

column1: add butter cumin seeds turmeric powder ginger and garlic to a pan .
column2: put butter in a pan . let it melt . add cumin seeds , turmeric powder , and ginger to a pan . mix all together . keep on medium heat and continue to mix .

column1: add butter cumin seeds turmeric powder ginger and garlic to a pan .
column2: take a pan and heat the pan . add some butter in to the pan and melt it . add some cumin seeds in to the pan . add some turmeric powder in to the pan . add some ginger and garlic paste in to the pan .

column1: add butter cumin seeds turmeric powder ginger and garlic to a pan .
column2: add 1 tablespoon of butter to the pan . add cumin seeds and turmeric . add ginger . put in some garlic . use a stirring spoon to mix it around the pan .

column1: add salt and oil to a pot of water .
column2: put the water on to boil . add salt , a couple table spoons full should be enough . add a few drops of olive oil to the salted water . mix it together . cover with lid to boil .

column1: add salt and oil to a pot of water .
column2: add quite a bit of salt to a pot of water that has been put on the heat and is about to boil . add a few drops of olive oil to the water as well .

column1: add salt and oil to a pot of water .
column2: get a spoon and scoop up some salt . pour the salt in the water . carefully pour in some olive oil slowly .

column1: when the bacon is cooked add ham to the pot .
column2: when the bacon looks darker and a little crispy get your ham ready . carefully add the ham to the pot being careful of oil splatter .

column1: when the bacon is cooked add ham to the pot .
column2: after the bacon has cooked , pour the ham into the pot . use the stirring spoon to mix the ham into the pot with the bacon .

column1: when the bacon is cooked add ham to the pot .
column2: the pancetta ( bacon ) must be cooked ( brown and crispy ) . add the ham to the pot and stir lightly .

column1: heat oil in a pot .
column2: take a pot and place it on the stove . turn on the stove . take oil in a jar . add some oil in to the pot . heat the oil in the pot .

column1: heat oil in a pot .
column2: put some olive oil in a big pot . heat the pot on the stove top .

column1: heat oil in a pot .
column2: pour a bit of oil in the pot . turn the heat up on the stove . let the oil heat up in the pot .

column1: add tomato sauce to the pot .
column2: to the meat simmering in the pot , add the tomato sauce . be careful to add it slowly , while stirring , so it does n't spatter up into your face .

column1: add tomato sauce to the pot .
column2: add a can of tomato sauce to the pot that you have your bacon cooking in . be careful , because bacon can spit hot grease , so do n't burn yourself !

column1: add tomato sauce to the pot .
column2: hold the sauce container over the pot . carefully pour the sauce into the pot without spilling .

column1: add bacon to the pot .
column2: chop up the bacon into medium size pieces . add it to the pan and toss it around with a spatula while it is cooking .

column1: add bacon to the pot .
column2: heat a large pot on the stove and put a little oil in the bottom . " chop up some pancetta into 1/2 to 1-inch cubes . " " . " put the pancetta into the pot and begin frying it . stir while frying .

column1: add bacon to the pot .
column2: take the cut up chunks of ham . add to the heated pot .

column1: add the vodka to the pot .
column2: pour the vodka into the pot ( be careful because the pan may flame up ) . use a wooden spoon to stir the vodka in the pot .

column1: add the vodka to the pot .
column2: take a pot on the stove . add the cooking contents in to the pot . take a cup of vodka . add the vodka in to the pot . mix the vodka with the other ingredients in the pot .

column1: add the vodka to the pot .
column2: hold the cup of vodka over the pot . slowly pour the vodka into the pot .

column1: mix the pasta and the sauce together .
column2: boil a pan of water until bubbly . add half a box of the noodles . cook for 10 min or until soft .

column1: mix the pasta and the sauce together .
column2: make sure your pasta is cooked through . drain your pasta carefully . add the pasta back into the pan . add the sauce to your pasta and mix it all together .

column1: mix the pasta and the sauce together .
column2: continue stirring the warm pasta . then add the sauce into the pan . stir together getting the pasta throughout the whole pan so it covers the pasta .

column1: add peas to the sauce .
column2: with your sauce in a large pot on the stove , dump your peas in . stir it up with a large wooden spoon .

column1: add peas to the sauce .
column2: hold the container of peas over the pot . carefully pour the peas into the pot slowly . stir it with a wooden spoon and mix it all together .

column1: add peas to the sauce .
column2: you will have a metal pan on the burner with the sauce simmering and hot . take the measured amount of peas that will add color and body to the sauce , and dump these into the sauce . using a wooden spoon , mix these peas into the sauce so that they are spread out evenly in the sauce . stir the sauce from in a circular pattern several times .

column1: mix hot pepper flakes hot chili paste and soy sauce .
column2: you need 10 tablespoons of hot chili flakes - if you do n't like spicy foods then use 5 tablespoons . add 1 tablespoon of hot chili paste to the flakes . add 5 tablespoons of soy sauce . just add they type you like . mix with a spoon . it should look like a volcano of red .

column1: mix hot pepper flakes hot chili paste and soy sauce .

column1: mix hot pepper flakes hot chili paste and soy sauce .
column2: use a measuring spoon to scoop hot pepper flakes into a bowl . use a measuring spoon to scoop the hot chili paste into the bowl . use a measuring spoon to add soy sauce to the bowl . use the back of a spoon to mash and stir everything together in the bowl .

column1: add sake to the mixture and mix it well .

column1: add sake to the mixture and mix it well .

column1: add sake to the mixture and mix it well .
column2: pour two tablespoons of sake over the mixture . mix the sake into the mixture . mix until the sake is evenly mixed into the mixture .

column1: boil the pork .
column2: take your pieces of pork with your grabbing tool and place them into the boiling hot water . leave them in the water for 5 minutes . then remove them with your grabbing instrument .

column1: boil the pork .
column2: once your water is boiling use a ton to place your pork into the boiling water . leave the pork in the water for 5 minutes .

column1: boil the pork .
column2: place a pot of water on the stove . turn the dial to the highest setting and wait for the water to boil . use a pair of tongs to slowly add the pork to the boiling water . once the pork has been boiling for 5 minutes , drain the water out and rinse the pork with cold water .

column1: add tofu to the boiling water .

column1: add tofu to the boiling water .

column1: add tofu to the boiling water .

column1: put the pork in a large bowl and add chili paste .

column1: put the pork in a large bowl and add chili paste .

column1: now add sesame oil and mix it well .

column1: now add sesame oil and mix it well .
column2: find the measuring spoon for 1/2 a tablespoon . ( if you do n't have this , you 'll need one teaspoon and one 1/2 a teaspoon . ) remember : tablespoon may look like this : tbsp . teaspoon may look like this : tsp . fill the spoon ( or spoons ) with sesame oil by pouring slowly . ( hold the spoon over the bowl in case any spills . ) . dump the oil into your bowl . using your hands , mix everything until all the pork is red with the sauce .

column1: now add sesame oil and mix it well .

column1: add garlic ginger brown sugar and chopped onion and mix it well .

column1: add some ground black pepper bamboo salt and chopped green onions and mix it well .
column2: step one you add one teaspoon of ground black pepper . step two you add one teaspoon of bamboo salt . step three cut up a cup of green onions to the size you like . step four add the green onions to the boil . step five mix everything lightly together .

column2: sprinkle a small amount of pepper onto the food . pour bamboo salt into teaspoon ( tsp ) to measure . sprinkle salt onto food . chop green onions into 1 - 2 inch pieces and add to food . mix with your hands until everything is combined .

column1: cook the mixture .
column2: being careful of the hot pan , cook everything until the vegetables start to feel a bit soft . when it 's cooked , remove the pan from the heat .

column1: cook the mixture .
column2: stir the mixture with a spoon often to prevent burning . cook the food thoroughly .

column1: cook the mixture .

column1: marinate boneless and skinless chicken breast pieces in egg white and cornstarch and keep ready .

column1: marinate boneless and skinless chicken breast pieces in egg white and cornstarch and keep ready .

column1: place a patty on the bottom bun of the burger .

column1: spread mayonnaise on the top bun .
column2: apply mayonnaise on the top bun . be sure to use a spatula to apply the mayonnaise evenly .

column1: spread mayonnaise on the top bun .
column2: take a knife or a spatula --- a spatula is long and flat and shaped like a fish 's fin --- and spread twenty - one grams of mayonnaise onto the top bun of the burger . the top bun is a circular piece of bread that is humped like a short hill . you can measure twenty - one grams of mayonnaise by taking the mayonnaise and putting it on something called a scale . a scale is like someone 's skin . when you press on it , it can feel it . since we have plastic packets of mayonnaise , we can make a guess about how much they press on the scale . put the packet on the scale . do you see the numbers going up ? look at the first two numbers . start with the one on the left . do you see that dot after the first two numbers . do you see the third number after the dot ? ignore that last number for now . tell me what the first two numbers say .

column1: add lettuce to the top bun .

column1: add lettuce to the top bun .

column1: chop the cabbage .
column2: you are going to add 5 lbs of cabbage . quarter the cabbage first . then cut out the cores . next cut the cabbage to about the size of a dime .

column1: chop the cabbage .
column2: first , cut each head of cabbage into 4 large pieces . next , cut off the center stem of the cabbage . finally , cut each piece of cabbage into thin strips .

column1: chop the cabbage .
column2: cut the cabbage in half . and then cut the cabbage in half again . cut the cabbage corners off . then cut the cabbage into small pieces like a dime . or you can use a food processor to cut the cabbage .

column1: pour salt on the cabbage and mix .
column2: take a a few spoons of salt and pour it on top of the cabbage in the bowl . reach in the bowl and mix the cabbage and salt together so the salt is all over the cabbage .

column1: pour salt on the cabbage and mix .

column1: pour salt on the cabbage and mix .
column2: put 1/3 of the sliced cabbage into a large bowl and put 1 tbsp of canning salt over to top of the cabbage . add another 1/3 of the cabbage to the bowl and sprinkle another tablespoon of the canning salt to the top of the cabbage . take the final 1/3 of the cabbage and add it to the bowl , then one more tablespoon of the canning salt to the top . using your hands mix all the cabbage and salt together in the bowl .

column2: pour 2 cups of cold water into a bowl . measure 3/4 tablespoons of salt and pour into the water . take the saltwater mixture and pour into the bowl of cabbage .

column1: mix salt and water and pour on top of the cabbage .
column2: mix 3/4 tablespoon of salt with 3 cups of cold water . pour this water and salt mixture over your sliced cabbage .

column1: cover the cabbage with cheese cloth and weigh down .
column2: pour some water over the cabbage . take a cheesecloth and put it over the cabbage . put a plate over the cheese cloth . put a can on top of the plate .

column1: cover the cabbage with cheese cloth and weigh down .
column2: put the cabbage container on the counter , at room temperature . get a small plate , a large can of vegetables and a piece of cheesecloth . place the cheesecloth on top of the cabbage . press the cheesecloth down inside the container along all sides . place the small plate and then the can on top of the cheesecloth .

column1: cover the cabbage with cheese cloth and weigh down .
column2: get out your cheese cloth . place it over the cabbage and press down really hard . make sure it covers every part of the cabbage . put something heavy over it and leave it alone for a few weeks .

column1: put some of the vegetables in to the pot and let it come to boil by slightly separating the noodles .
column2: use chopsticks to add the vegetables to the pot . use the chopsticks to press the vegetables into the pot . use the chopsticks to separated the noodles .

column1: put some of the vegetables in to the pot and let it come to boil by slightly separating the noodles .
column2: cut up the bok choy . rinse and wash it with fresh clean water . add it to the pot of hot water . it 's okay if it fills the pot , it will get very small as it cooks . use chopsticks to start separating the noodles in the pot .

column1: put some of the vegetables in to the pot and let it come to boil by slightly separating the noodles .
column2: put the vegetables gently into the pot . use the chopsticks to push them into the water , but not drowning them ! take the chopsticks and reach down into the water grabbing some noodles . mix the noodles around , lifting them up a little , then grabbing another bit of noodles and moving them around . the water should be boiling , so be very careful . keep moving the noodles and vegetables around for a while .

column1: add frozen vegetables into the bowl let it boil for a minute .
column2: make sure that the pot is boiling . find and open the bag of frozen vegetables . add as many of the frozen vegetables as you want into the pot . let the pot boil for another minute .

column1: add frozen vegetables into the bowl let it boil for a minute .
column2: let the pot continue to cook . pour in enough frozen vegetables for 5 servings . allow the vegetables to boil for 1 minute . put in the udon noodles to the pot .

column1: add frozen vegetables into the bowl let it boil for a minute .
column2: let potatoes boil for a few moments to cook through . add your desired amount of vegetables to the boiling water . bring to a boil and let them cook a few moments . give it a quick stir with chopsticks or other utensil . add noodles . do not overcook your noodles .

column1: boil water with can of chicken broth add 2 packs noodles flavor fish balls and boil to cook .
column2: add the can of chicken broth in the pot . tear open 2 packets of noodle flavor in the pot . wait until the broth is bubbling .

column1: boil water with can of chicken broth add 2 packs noodles flavor fish balls and boil to cook .
column2: take a pot on the stove and add some water in the pot . boil the water with can of chicken broth in the pot . add 2 packets of noodles flavor in to the pot . add fish balls in to the pot . boil the contents in the pot .

column1: boil water with can of chicken broth add 2 packs noodles flavor fish balls and boil to cook .
column2: uncover a pot of boiling broth . add a couple of packs of flavoring one at a time . add fish balls in one at a time . make sure to drop them in close to the broth so the water does not splash around .

column1: cut the base and wash the pad choy .
column2: take a cutting board and a knife . take a pad choy on the cutting board . cut the base of it with the knife . separate the leaves from it . place the leaves in the bowl .

column1: cut the base and wash the pad choy .
column2: place pad choy on cutting board . cut bottom off of pad choy . separate into pieces . wash pieces .

column1: cut the base and wash the pad choy .
column2: pre - wash all bok choy . place the bok choy on a cutting board . use a sharp knife to cut off the base of the bok choy .

column1: add the udon noodles into the boiling water and take some of the soup out of the pot .
column2: now you will add your udon noodles carefully into the soup . if it beings to try and overfill the pot , carefully take out some of the soup . use a ladle to dip some of the soup out into a bowl to discard .

column1: add the udon noodles into the boiling water and take some of the soup out of the pot .
column2: bring water to boil . add udon noodles into the pan . grab a bowl and spoon . use the spoon to scoop out extra soup . place bowl aside .

column1: add the udon noodles into the boiling water and take some of the soup out of the pot .
column2: place the udon noodles into the boiling water pot . use a scoop and remove some of the soup from the pot and put it in a bowl .

column1: open 6 udon noodles .
column2: open 6 packages of udon noodles . take the noodles out of the clear plastic package as well . add a can of chicken brother to some water and heat to boiling .

column1: open 6 udon noodles .
column2: take 6 packages of udon noodles . use scissors to cut open the packages .

column1: open 6 udon noodles .
column2: grab those udon noodles packages and with scissors be careful while cutting them open . udon noodles are like thick spaghetti but packaged differently , you 'll like them . as usual , with most noodles , they have to be cooked in boiling water so soften . take the noodles over to the stove and place them carefully into the hot water and stir . after 15 - 20 minutes , take the heavy hot pot over to sink and pour noodles into the strainer to drain .

column1: add grease to a cooking tray .
column2: grease your 9x12 cooking dish with cooking spray . add 2 cups of milk to the dish .

column1: add grease to a cooking tray .
column2: take a baking tray . take an oil sprinkling bottle . add oil in to the bottle . sprinkle oil on to the tray . cover the entire tray with oil .

column1: add grease to a cooking tray .
column2: take a can of cooking spray and point it at the tray . spray all over the pan evenly .

column1: add milk to a bowl of eggs green onions onion powder and salt .
column2: get a large mixing bowl , a measuring cup , a cutting board , knife , and a whisk . crack open 8 large eggs and add to the bowl , be careful not to get any egg shells in the bowl . measure 2 cups of milk and add to the eggs . using the cutting board and knife , chop up 3 green onions into small pieces . add the onions to the bowl . add 1 teaspoon of onion powder and 1 teaspoons of salt . use the whisk to mix everything up until it 's mixed well .

column1: add milk to a bowl of eggs green onions onion powder and salt .
column2: crack eight large eggs into a bowl and add two cups of milk . add in the three green onions we chopped earlier . add in the teaspoon of onion powder we measured out earlier . add in the teaspoon of salt we measured earlier . you can use less salt if you prefer your food to taste less salty . whisk everything together until it is very well mixed .

column1: add milk to a bowl of eggs green onions onion powder and salt .
column2: take a big glass bowl . break open some eggs and add it to the bowl . add cut pieces of green onion in to the bowl . add onion powder in to the bowl . add some salt in to the bowl and mix everything .

column1: add canadian bacon cut english muffins and more bacon to the tray .
column2: take a large pan . cut the bacon in to small square shaped pieces . cut the english muffins in to the tray on top of bacon . add the bacon on top of muffins . spread on the tray equally .

column1: add canadian bacon cut english muffins and more bacon to the tray .
column2: add canadian bacon pieces and spread them along the bottom evenly . cut english muffins and spread them around . more bacon to the tray on the bread pieces .

column1: add canadian bacon cut english muffins and more bacon to the tray .
column2: cut the canadian bacon into small squares . spread half the bacon around in the bottom of a baking dish . get six english muffins and cut them into small squares . put the english muffin pieces in the dish on top of the bacon . put the other half of the bacon all over the top of the english muffin pieces .

column1: pour the egg mixture over the bacon .
column2: put the bacon onto the bread in the casserole dish . take the bowl of egg custard . pour the egg custard over the bacon . make sure to pour it evenly over all areas . cover the casserole dish with plastic wrap .

column1: pour the egg mixture over the bacon .
column2: place bacon mixture in cooking dish . lift bowl of egg custard above cooking dish . pour the egg custard into the cooking dish without dropping . be sure to pour all of the egg custard mixture into the cooking dish . make sure all the bacon mixture has liquid on it .

column1: pour the egg mixture over the bacon .
column2: pour the egg custard over the bacon in the pan . cover the pan with plastic wrap .

column1: sprinkle paprika into the tray .
column2: using your fingers , sprinkle a teaspoon of paprika across the dish . cover the dish with aluminum foil .

column1: sprinkle paprika into the tray .
column2: you will need a measuring spoon . you will also need paprika . scoop out one teaspoon of paprika into the measuring spoon . use your fingertips to sprinkle the paprika across the top of the food .

column1: sprinkle paprika into the tray .
column2: sprinkle 1 teaspoon of paprika evenly onto the dish . cover the casserole pan with aluminum foil .

column1: make hollandaise sauce in a separate bowl .
column2: during the last few minutes of baking , prepare a .9 oz package of store bought hollandaise sauce mix by reading the directions on the sauce package .

column1: make hollandaise sauce in a separate bowl .
column2: prepare a .9 ounce package of hollandaise sauce mix . use a whisk or blender to mix it .

column1: make hollandaise sauce in a separate bowl .
column2: read the directions on the package . add the liquid and the dry powder together in the pot . mix everything together and let it cook .

column1: drizzle the hollandaise sauce onto the casserole .
column2: cook the casserole in a tray . transfer the casserole in to a plate . take hollandaise sauce in a bowl . start pouring sauce on to the plate . add sufficient amount of sauce on to the casserole .

column1: drizzle the hollandaise sauce onto the casserole .
column2: pour the hollandaise sauce on top of the casserole . serve the finished casserole .

column1: drizzle the hollandaise sauce onto the casserole .
column2: lightly and slowly pour the hollandaise sauce over the casserole . the casserole is the large deep dish that contains your hot food . try this meal with asparagus that has been steamed which means cooked in a steamer with boiling water underneath . try some fresh fruit with this meal as well .

column1: place the bread on top of the bread .
column2: add 3 or 4 slices of cheese to the top of one of the bread slices . pick up the slice of bread without cheese and flip it over on top of the cheese covered bread . be careful not to burn your fingers , as the bread will be very hot . use a spatula to flatten the sandwich and let it finish cooking .

column1: place the bread on top of the bread .
column2: add 3 - 4 slices of cheese to one piece of bread . take the other slice of bread and place it on top . gently press your spatula onto the grilled cheese sandwich .

column1: place the bread on top of the bread .
column2: add 3 to 4 slices of cheese to the bread . set the top half of the bread on top of the cheese . press down the bread with the spatula .

column1: place the bread in the pan .
column2: pick up the bread with your hand . put the bread in the pan side by side .

column1: place the bread in the pan .
column2: put oil on the pan and turn on the stove . wait until pan gets hot . put white bread slices into the pan .

column1: place the bread in the pan .
column2: add two slices of white bread onto the pan . let the face down side cook on the pan .

column1: place cheese on the bread .
column2: the bread should be lightly frying in the pan . add 2 - 3 slices of cheese to one piece of the bread .

column1: place cheese on the bread .
column2: put 3 or 4 slices on the bread . make sure it 's evenly placed on the bread .

column1: place cheese on the bread .
column2: take a pan on the stove . heat the pan and add some butter . fry the bread on one side . take 3 - 4 slices of cheese . add 3 - 4 slices of cheese on the bread .

column1: melt butter in a pan .
column2: place stick of butter on cutting board . use knife to cut 1 tbsp of butter from stick . remove paper from butter . place butter in hot pan . tilt pan so that butter is all over bottom of pan .

column1: melt butter in a pan .
column2: cut one teaspoon of butter . add the butter to the hot pan . let the butter melt . spread the butter evenly around the pan .

column1: melt butter in a pan .
column2: cut a square of butter off with a knife . drop the butter in a hot pan . let the butter become liquid .

column1: spread mustard on the bread .
column2: use a knife and scoop out the mustard . use the knife to spread the mustard all over the bread evenly .

column1: spread mustard on the bread .
column2: take a knife and scrape about a spoon of mustard onto the piece of bread . with the knife , spread the mustard into a thin layer on the top of the piece of bread so that it covers the entire piece of bread . do the same thing for each of the slices of bread .

column1: spread mustard on the bread .
column2: add 1 tablespoon of mustard . spread the mustard on top of the spread .

column1: flip the slices of bread over .
column2: let the bread cook in the melted butter for 3 - 4 minutes or until the under side is golden brown . using a spatula turn the bread over ( do n't show kids a video flipping the bread using your hands as they will get burnt for sure ) .

column1: flip the slices of bread over .
column2: use your hands to carefully grab the bread . flip the bread pieces onto the other side .

column1: flip the slices of bread over .
column2: toast the bread in the pan for 3 to 4 minutes . flip the bread over to toast the other side .

column1: soak gram and place water salt and turmeric powder in pressure cooker .
column2: take some gram and put it into a bowl and pour a little bit of water on it . let the bowl with the gram sit on the counter for the entire night . the next day , put some water , salt , and some turmeric powder into the pressure cooker .

column1: soak gram and place water salt and turmeric powder in pressure cooker .
column2: take 2 cups of black gram and one cup of chana dal in a bowl . wash the dal and soak the dal overnight . add the dal in to the pressure cooker and add 5 glasses of water . add little turmeric powder and little salt for taste . cook the dal with 3 whistles .

column1: pressure cook the dal and grind .
column2: put the dal in some water . leave the dal in water over night . put the dal in a pressure cooker with 4 to 5 cups of water . turn your oven on and cook the pressure cooker for 18 - 20 minutes .

column1: pressure cook the dal and grind .
column2: soak dal over night . cook dal in pressure cooker . cook 20 to 30 minutes . grind the dal .

column1: pressure cook the dal and grind .
column2: take 2 cups of black gram and 1 cup of chana dal . wash them and cook dal in a pressure cooker . take the cooked dal from the cooker in to a bowl . remove water from dal . grind it in to a paste .

column1: heat ghee in a pan .
column2: put 2 tablespoons of butter in skillet . let the butter melt , then add the ghee , cook for about 5 minutes till it 's hot .

column1: heat ghee in a pan .
column2: put pan on stove and turn it on . put a scoop of ghee in the pan to heat it up .

column1: heat ghee in a pan .
column2: take the measuring spoon that says tbsp . put 2 spoons of the ghee in the pan . heat up the pan .

column1: add asafetida cloves of garlic and ginger and salt .
column2: add 8 little pieces of the garlic . add the ginger and salt .

column1: add asafetida cloves of garlic and ginger and salt .
column2: get a pot or bowl , whatever the recipe calls for . take out the ingredients needed , asafetida , cloves of garlic , ginger , and salt . add each ingredient to the pot .

column1: add asafetida cloves of garlic and ginger and salt .
column2: add the spice asafetida to the pan . add cloves of garlic to the pan . add ginger and salt to the pan .

column1: add chopped green chilies and salt .
column2: cut green chilies into small pieces with a knife . add the green chilies to the pan with garlic .

column1: add chopped green chilies and salt .
column2: put the chopped green chilies in the pan . stir with a spoon until the garlic is a little brown .

column1: add chopped green chilies and salt .
column2: cut the green chilies . cut the garlic into small pieces . prepare your salt . put the garlic into the pan . put the green chilies and salt into the pan .

column1: add chopped onion mix well and saute .
column2: cut one large onion into very small pieces . add these pieces into the pan . using a plastic spoon , mix the contents of the pan . cook until the onion turns soft .

column1: add chopped onion mix well and saute .
column2: grab the bowl you have put your chopped onion in , and the utensil you are using to cook with . add the onion into your pan . cook the onions until they are nice and translucent .

column1: add chopped onion mix well and saute .
column2: add the cut up onions . cook the onions and mix them around .

column1: add chopped tomato mix well and saute .
column2: use a knife to cut one large tomato into small cubes . add the chopped tomato into the pan and stir to mix .

column1: add chopped tomato mix well and saute .
column2: take one large tomato . cut the tomato in to small pieces . take the cut tomato in to a bowl . add the tomato in to the pan . cook till they become soft .

column1: add chopped tomato mix well and saute .
column2: add the chopped tomatoes . continue stirring . the pan should heat back up and sizzle . stir it continuously . this will insure that nothing burns .

column1: add red chili powder a pinch of turmeric powder and garam masala and mix .
column2: add one teaspoon of red chili power in to the pan . add little turmeric powder in to the pan . add half a teaspoon of garam masala powder in to the pan . take a spatula . mix everything in the pan with spatula .

column1: add red chili powder a pinch of turmeric powder and garam masala and mix .
column2: first , just slowly add a teaspoon of chili powder . this will give it a great color . now add just a little bit of turmeric powder . be careful , do n't add to much turmeric powder . now just add 1/2 teaspoon of garam masala . now gently mix all together .

column1: add red chili powder a pinch of turmeric powder and garam masala and mix .
column2: add red chili powder to the pan . add a tiny amount of turmeric powder . add garam masala to the pan . mix everything together with a spoon .

column1: stir in cooked dal and ground paste mix well .
column2: add the cooked dal to the pot . add the ground paste . mix it up !

column1: stir in cooked dal and ground paste mix well .
column2: pour the bowl of cooked dal into the pan . pour the ground paste into the pan . use a spoon to scrape every last bit of the paste into the pan . stir the pan with a plastic spoon .

column1: stir in cooked dal and ground paste mix well .
column2: pour the cooked dal into the pan . put the ground paste into the pan . mix everything together in the pan with a spoon .

column1: cover dal and cook while stirring and add a spoon of ghee .
column2: cover the dal and cook for 10 minutes more . stir dal often . add a spoon of ghee to dal .

column1: cover dal and cook while stirring and add a spoon of ghee .
column2: put the cover on the pan of dal . stir the dal while it is cooking . add a spoonful of ghee .

column1: cover dal and cook while stirring and add a spoon of ghee .
column2: cover and cook the dal for 15 more minutes . keep stirring during the 15 minutes . when the dal covers a spoon nicely it is finished .

column1: heat hopped carrot celery garlic onion in a large pot with oil .
column2: put carrots , celery , garlic and onion into a large pot . coat the pot with olive oil . stir the ingredients as the cook in the pot .

column1: heat hopped carrot celery garlic onion in a large pot with oil .
column2: get the chopping block . cut up the carrots . cut up an onion . cut up a celery . put these vegetables into a pot on the stove .

column1: heat hopped carrot celery garlic onion in a large pot with oil .
column2: take a large pot and add some oil in to the pot . cut the carrots and celery in to inch sized pieces . add the carrots and celery in to the pot . cut the garlic and onion in to small pieces . add the garlic and onion in to the pot and cook .

column1: add herbs spices salt and pepper .
column2: in a large pot , heat up chopped onions , celery , and carrots until they are soft . add in a sprig of rosemary . add salt and pepper to taste . usually about 1/4 - 1/2 teaspoon each .

column1: add herbs spices salt and pepper .
column2: carefully add spices herbs and salt to the pot . mix in with wooden spoon .

column1: add herbs spices salt and pepper .
column2: get some herbs as the recipe calls for and the spices / seasoning . put he in the pan along with some salt and pepper along with herbs and spices . stir all together .

column1: add tomato paste to the pot .
column2: pour the crushed tomatoes into the pot with the other ingredients . once most of the tomatoes have been poured into the pot , rinse the can with half a cup of water so that you can get the last bits out of the can .

column1: add tomato paste to the pot .
column2: now we want to take our crushed potatoes and pour them into your pot . go ahead and rinse your can out with water once you have emptied as much as you can into your bowl . make sure you remember to remove your spoon before pouring the tomatoes into your pot .

column1: add tomato paste to the pot .
column2: pour in crushed tomatoes to the pot . use the stirring spoon and mix the ingredients together in the pot .

column1: stir and cook it to simmer .
column2: use a wooden spoon to stir the soup . let the soup simmer for about two hours .

column1: stir and cook it to simmer .
column2: take a pot on the stove . add the ingredients in the pot . stir the contents in the pot . turn the heat to simmer . cook the contents in the pan in simmer .

column1: stir and cook it to simmer .
column2: use a spatula to stir the pot of soup which is on the stove . simmer it in the pot for about 2 hours till it becomes thick like stew . cook it till it becomes thick to a stew like consistency .

column1: add in the kidney beans and butter .
column2: open a can of kidney beans and rinse them off with water . pour the beans in the pot with the rest of the ingredients . take a piece of parmesan cheese rind and set it in the pot while everything cooks . when it 's finished , make sure to take the cheese rind out of the pot .

column1: add in the kidney beans and butter .
column2: take a can of kidney beans and open it carefully . drain the beans using a strainer and rinse them for a couple of minutes . put your rinsed and drained beans into the pot . put your butter into the pot carefully .

column1: add in the kidney beans and butter .
column2: take a pot and add the ingredients in the pot . take a can of red kidney beans . add the red kidney beans in to the pot . take a small block of butter . add the butter in to the pot .

column1: add kale and pasta to the soup and season with salt and parmesan .
column2: use a wooden spoon to scoop the kale into the soup . pour in half the box of pasta into the soup .

column1: add kale and pasta to the soup and season with salt and parmesan .
column2: cut the kale in to small pieces . add the kale in to the pot of soup . add the pasta in to the soup pot . add some salt in to the soup . add some parmesan cheese in to the soup .

column1: add kale and pasta to the soup and season with salt and parmesan .
column2: take your kale and slowly add it into your pot with the soup . now we can add in our noodles , and make sure to mix in the kale with the broth and noodles . season the soup with the salt , and parmesan once you place it in the bowl and are ready to serve it .

column1: add the chicken broth and water to the pot .
column2: gather about ten cups of liquid into a pitcher ( this can be broth and water ) . slowly and carefully pour the liquid into the pot being careful not to splash yourself .

column1: add the chicken broth and water to the pot .
column2: hold the chicken broth and water over the pot . carefully pour in the water and chicken broth .

column1: add the chicken broth and water to the pot .
column2: add a mixture of chicken broth and water . add about 10 cups to the pot .

column1: roll a piece of dough into a ball and dip in flour .
column2: use clean hands to tear a small ball of dough , about half an inch in diameter , from the large part of dough . roll it in your hand to get it spherical . roll it in a small bit of flour , applying a small coat of flour .

column1: roll a piece of dough into a ball and dip in flour .
column2: using your hands take a piece of dough . roll the dough into a ball using your hands . dip the ball of dough into the flour .

column1: roll a piece of dough into a ball and dip in flour .
column2: take a piece of dough off of the end of the dough . roll the dough into a ball . take the ball of dough and dip it into the flour .

column1: roll the dough into a thin oval .
column2: using a roller , press firmly rolling the dough . roll the dough into a shape of an oval .

column1: roll the dough into a thin oval .
column2: take a big ball of dough . divide the dough in to small balls . take a rolling pin and a board . place the small ball of dough on the board . roll the dough in to thin oval .

column1: roll the dough into a thin oval .
column2: make the dough with the flour and water . take the roller and start rolling . roll the dough into a the oval shape . roll it to a thin oval shape .

column1: knead the dough until it is soft .
column2: use your hands to roll the dough . continue kneading the dough until it is soft .

column1: knead the dough until it is soft .
column2: put the dough on a cutting board . knead the dough by pushing and rolling it with your hands until it is soft .

column1: knead the dough until it is soft .
column2: knead the dough on a smooth surface . knead for a minute to make smooth .

column1: add flour oil and salt in a bowl and mix .
column2: take a large mixing bowl . add one cup of flour in to the bowl . add 2 tablespoons of oil in to the flour . add some salt in to the flour and mix . add water in to the bowl and mix it in to a dough .

column1: add flour oil and salt in a bowl and mix .
column2: now we are going to take the flour and add it to our mixing bowl . next we want to add 2 teaspoons of oil to the flour . take a small spoonful of salt and add it as well . now mix all of the ingredients by hand .

column1: add flour oil and salt in a bowl and mix .
column2: place your good quality whole wheat flour into a bowl . add about 2 tsp of oil to the flour in the bowl . add salt until it tastes good to you . mix all the ingredients together with your hand .

column1: fold the dough in half and roll again .
column2: pinch the middle of the dough together . press the dough together . on cutting board roll out the dough into a circle .

column1: fold the dough in half and roll again .
column2: pinch the dough in the center until it is almost cut in half . then fold one side of the dough over on top of the other side . roll out again until the dough is formed into a circle of the correct size .

column1: fold the dough in half and roll again .
column2: add oil on the dough . then fold it in half . then put it in dry flour . then roll it again . then let your parents handle it in the skillet .

column1: place the roti to a hot pan ad flip .
column2: put your roti one side down onto a pan that is heated with the burner on . leave your roti cooking on one side until you see bubbles start to appear on the side facing up . use a spatula and carefully flip the roti to cook the other side .

column1: place the roti to a hot pan ad flip .
column2: roll the roti in to a thin circle . place the pan on the stove . heat the pan on the stove . place the roti on to the stove and fry it on one side . flip it to the other side and fry it on the other side .

column1: place the roti to a hot pan ad flip .
column2: pick up the roti . carefully place the roti into a heated pan . grab a spatula and watch the roti . wait until you see small bubbles beginning to rise on the roti . slide the spatula underneath the roti and flip it over .

column1: pour water into the bowl while mixing .
column2: pour the water into the bowl . using your hands mix the mixture together . add water again to your bowl .

column1: pour water into the bowl while mixing .
column2: take the flour contents in a mixing bowl . take some water in a cup . slowly add some water in to the flour and mix . add remaining water in to the bowl . mix the flour with the water in to a dough .

column1: pour water into the bowl while mixing .
column2: pick up the container of water in one hand . use your other hand to carefully stir the contents of the bowl . while you stir , slowly pour in a small amount of water . after you pour in a small amount of water , keep stirring the contents of the mixing bowl with your other hand . repeat these steps until all the water is fully mixed into the mixing bowl .

column1: add oil and flour to the dough .
column2: use a spoon to add oil to the dough . use your hand to spread the oil around on the dough . then add a bit of flour over the dough .

column1: add oil and flour to the dough .
column2: take a rolling board and rolling pin . take a ball of dough . roll the dough in to thin oval . add little oil in to the dough . sprinkle some flour on to the dough .

column1: add oil and flour to the dough .
column2: take your dough and lay on a cutting board . take a spoon and do 3 t0 4 drops of oil and spread around . take pinch of flour and sprinkle on dough . fold dough like triangle .

column1: add the prawns to the pan and mix .
column2: take the prawns in a plate . take a pan on the stove . cook the contents of the pan . add the prawns in to the pan . mix the prawns in the pan with other ingredients .

column1: add the prawns to the pan and mix .
column2: once the contents of the pan are cooked , add the prawns . stir the prawns into the contents of the pan with a wooden spoon . cook for about 3 minutes stirring constantly .

column1: add the prawns to the pan and mix .
column2: take the raw prawns and add them to the hot pan with everything else . use a spoon to stir everything all together . let it all cook for about three minutes , and be careful not to breathe in the spicy steam while it cooks .

column1: pour the soup into the bowl with the noodles .
column2: get a ladle to spoon out the soup . pour the soup into the bowl , using the ladle , until the noodles are covered .

column1: pour the soup into the bowl with the noodles .
column2: place noodles in a bowl . pour soup mixture on top of the noodles and fill up the bowl .

column1: pour the soup into the bowl with the noodles .
