column1: take flour in bowl and pour little water in batches and mixing with hand knead dough until medium soft .
column2: prepare your work area ! take your bowl that has flour in it and get a cup filled with water to have beside you . dig a small hole in the middle of your flour . you will pour your water into this hole . while pouring your water count out loud ' one mississippi ' . put your hands in the bowl and start squishing the flour and water together . this is called kneading . if your dough still feels stiff and looks powdery , add another ' 1 mississippi ' of water . keep adding water and kneading the dough until it feels like play dough .

column1: take flour in bowl and pour little water in batches and mixing with hand knead dough until medium soft .
column2: take your flour in a bowl . add a little bit of water to your bowl of flour . mix the water and flour with your hands slowly . keep mixing the flour and water until soft .

column1: take flour in bowl and pour little water in batches and mixing with hand knead dough until medium soft .
column2: make sure your hands are cleaned and dry . pour small amounts of water into the bowl and with your hands mix the water flour together . keep mixing and adding water until you have a dough . you are kneading the dough with your hands . the dough should be medium in softness . the dough should not be hard and should not be sticky .

column1: sprinkle water on top cover the lid and let it aside for 15 minutes .
column2: get your fingers wet . shake the water from your fingers onto the dough . feel to see if dough is a little soft . sprinkle more water if it is n't soft . cover with a lid for 15 minutes .

column1: sprinkle water on top cover the lid and let it aside for 15 minutes .
column2: sprinkle water with your hands onto the dough . cover the dough with a big round lid . wait 15 minutes .

column1: sprinkle water on top cover the lid and let it aside for 15 minutes .
column2: sprinkle a little bit of water onto the dough ball inside the bowl . cover the bowl with a metal plate that fits inside the bowl , and is large enough to cover the dough ball . keep the dough ball under the lid for 15 minutes .

column1: spread flour on pan and take piece of dough coat with flour roll into round shape using rolling pin .
column2: put some flour onto a plate . dip your fingers in the flour . roll dough into a ball and roll into a circle using a rolling pin . keep dipping dough in flour to stop it from sticking .

column1: spread flour on pan and take piece of dough coat with flour roll into round shape using rolling pin .
column2: fill a bowl almost all the way with flour . take the dough we used earlier and pull apart into smaller pieces . these pieces should each be a small ball that would fit in your palm . grab a plate or cutting board and put a few pinches of flour on it . spread flour around plate with your fingers . take one dough ball and place in bowl of flour . evenly coat ball in flour and then place on plate . use your rolling pin to roll into a flat circle . it should be thin , but a little thicker than paper . place round piece of dough in bowl of flour again and coat .

column1: spread flour on pan and take piece of dough coat with flour roll into round shape using rolling pin .
column2: get a bag of flour and carefully put some of it in a bowl . pull a small piece of dough and make a ball with your hands and dunk it in the flour . press the ball between your palms to make it flat and dunk it again in the flour covering both sides . use a rolling pin to roll it and dunk it into the flour again . using the rolling pin , roll the circular dough sheet even thinner .

column1: cook it on the skillet and cook it on both sides by flipping .

column1: cook it on the skillet and cook it on both sides by flipping .

column1: cook it on the skillet and cook it on both sides by flipping .
column2: cook it on a skillet , one side and then the other . then after they have been cooked on the skillet you need to set it over a flame . this will made it puff up and made the inside light rather than dense . put it off to the side once all side have been cooked over the flame .

column2: slice the cucumber into thin slices with a knife . slice the jalapeno into slices with a knife .

column2: using a sharp knife slice cucumber into thin round slices . do the same with the jalapeno .

column1: add the pork to a pan of hot oil .
column2: turn on a stove top burner to med high . add some oil to a frying pan til it gets hot but not boiling . then add the pork slowly and carefully so the oil does n't splash on you . let it cook for a few minutes , then carefully lift one end of one piece to look at the underside . if it is brown enough , turn turn all piece over and finish cooking .

column1: add the pork to a pan of hot oil .
column2: with adult supervision take pork and add to pot . watch out for oil as it might splash out of pot .

column1: add the pork to a pan of hot oil .
column2: put your pork into a lowering utensil . put the pork into the hot oil .

column1: remove the pork from the pan and place on paper towel .
column2: take the cooked pork out of the pot with a wire basket . put it on a paper towel . increase the heat to medium or medium high .

column1: remove the pork from the pan and place on paper towel .
column2: remove the pork from the pan and place on a paper towel . this will allow the excess oil to be removed from the pork .

column1: add the pork back into the hot oil .
column2: slowly lower 2 or 3 pieces of meat into the hot oil with a slotted metal spoon . stir the meat with wooden tongs to keep from sticking together . keep adding meat 2 or 3 pieces at a time until all the meat is browned . remember to stir after each time you add meat . work slowly so you do n't splash hot oil and burn yourself .

column1: add the pork back into the hot oil .
column2: with spider ( or web shaped strainer ) scoop up pork . add slowly back into oil .

column1: add the pork back into the hot oil .
column2: place oil in pot . turn on burner . wait until oil is hot . add pork slowly . stir for equal cooking .

column1: cut the bread lengthwise with a knife .
column2: set a cutting board on the counter . get a sharp knife . set the bread on the cutting board . start cutting down the middle of the bread with the knife . go slow so that you do n't cut yourself .

column1: cut the bread lengthwise with a knife .
column2: use a knife with a serrated or non - straight blade . cut the bread from one end to the other on the side , so that it opens in half like a book .

column1: cut the bread lengthwise with a knife .
column2: being careful of the sharp knife , cut the bread down the middle from one end to the other . make sure you use a chopping board so you do n't damage the counter !

column1: remove the pork from the hot oil .
column2: using a spoon that has holes in it , or a strainer , scoop the pork out of the hot oil . make sure the oil has stopped dripping before moving the spoon away from the pot . also , make sure not to touch the oil as it will be very hot !

column1: remove the pork from the hot oil .
column2: use a deep fry skimmer to remove the pork from the pan with oil and pork . place the pork in a plate with paper towel .

column1: remove the pork from the hot oil .
column2: if the pork is brown enough on both sides then take a slotted spoon and carefully lift some out of the oil . let the excess oil drip into the pan for a few seconds , then put on a plate that has several layers of paper towels on it . keep removing the pork until all is out of the oil . turn off the burner . pat pork on top with more paper towels to absorb more grease , then serve .

column1: add the pork to the bowl with the dressing .
column2: add the pork to the bowl of dressing you just made . be sure to mix the pork and dressing together really well .

column1: add the pork to the bowl with the dressing .
column2: put the pork meat into the bowl with the dressing . use a spoon to mix the pork into the dressing .

column1: add the pork to the bowl with the dressing .
column2: place your pork into the bowl with your dressing . use a spoon to mix it together really good .

column1: add mayonnaise maggi sauce cucumber pork pickled radish and carrot jalapeno chicory and cilantro to the bread .
column2: line the bread with mayonnaise and maggi sauce . line the bread with cucumber on one side . add the pork then the pickled radish and carrot . next add the jalapeno , chicory , and cilantro . .

column1: add mayonnaise maggi sauce cucumber pork pickled radish and carrot jalapeno chicory and cilantro to the bread .
column2: add mayonnaise to the bread and spread . add maggi sauce and cucumber slices to the bread . add pork slices and pickled radish in to the bread . add carrot , jalapeno and chicory in to the bread . add cilantro in to the bread .

column1: add mayonnaise maggi sauce cucumber pork pickled radish and carrot jalapeno chicory and cilantro to the bread .
column2: squeeze the mayonnaise across the bun . use a spoon to spread the mayonnaise evenly . squeeze maggi sauce over the bread . only use a small amount . place pork , pickles , radish , carrots , jalapenos , chicory and cilantro on the bread next . the jalapenos is optional , you do n't have to use it .

column1: add sriracha sauce to the sandwich .
column2: squeeze sriracha bottle over sandwich . spread sauce in an even layer .

column1: add sriracha sauce to the sandwich .
column2: point bottle of sriracha sauce down at once end of sandwich . then with a back and forth motion squeeze out desired amount in zig - zags .

column1: add sriracha sauce to the sandwich .
column2: take the bottle of sriracha . squeeze the bottle and squirt sauce onto sandwich . make lines up and down the sandwich .

column1: rinse the dried garbanzo beans thoroughly under running water .
column2: get a colander and pour the garbanzo beans into it . turn on the cold water at the sink . put the colander under the faucet and let the water pour over the beans . gently shake the colander to make sure all the beans get washed . when all the beans have been rinsed , turn off the faucet and gently shake the colander to get any extra water off the beans .

column1: rinse the dried garbanzo beans thoroughly under running water .
column2: place container of beans in sink . turn on water to run into container over beans . move them around with your hand to get them all clean . continue this until they all beans have been rinsed good .

column1: rinse the dried garbanzo beans thoroughly under running water .
column2: get garbanzo beans . turn on cold water . rinse 1 pound of dried garbanzo beans thoroughly . discard and discolored or bad beans . remove anything that is not a bean .

column1: cover the beans with cold water and allow it to soak overnight .
column2: pour beans into clean bowl . pour water into bowl totally covering all the beans . make sure to check on the water a couple of times because the beans will absorb the water . when the water is low , add more to submerge the beans again .

column1: cover the beans with cold water and allow it to soak overnight .
column2: once you have cleaned all of the beans , cover them with cold water . let the beans soak over night in the water . check on them a few times because you will need to add a little water to them . to begin the next day , prep the other ingredients you will need for this dish .

column1: cover the beans with cold water and allow it to soak overnight .
column2: pour the clean beans in a large bowl . pour water into the bowl until the beans are completely covered . the beans will get bigger as they soak so check them several times . add more water so the beans stay covered with water . let the beans stay in the water all night .

column1: cut the onions and potatoes mince 4 cloves of garlic and squeeze 2 tsp of lemon juice .
column2: you are going to cut up the onions into small squares . cut up the potatoes into small cubes . squeeze lemon juice from lemon .

column1: cut the onions and potatoes mince 4 cloves of garlic and squeeze 2 tsp of lemon juice .
column2: get a pot and add water . quarter one onion into 4 pieces . peel and quarter one potato into 4 pieces . cut up 4 cloves of garlic into tiny pieces . squeeze two teaspoons of fresh lemon juice from lemon .

column1: cut the onions and potatoes mince 4 cloves of garlic and squeeze 2 tsp of lemon juice .
column2: cut onion straight down the middle then cut those two pieces in the middle so you will have 4 equal pieces . peel all brown skin off a potato and cut the potato in half . take those 2 half 's and cut in the middle . take 4 cloves of garlic and cut into very small pieces . you should end up with about 12 per garlic glove . cut a lemon in half and take one half and squeeze the lemon to get 2 teaspoons of lemon juice .

column1: rinse and drain the soaked garbanzo beans and add it into the food processor .
column2: put the garbanzo beans in a bowl . rinse the beans with fresh water , and then drain the water you added from them . then you will place the garbanzo beans into the bowl of your food processor .

column1: rinse and drain the soaked garbanzo beans and add it into the food processor .
column2: squeeze lemon over bowl of garbanzo beans . take bowl of garbanzo beans and rinse over water . take rinsed beans and put into the food processor .

column1: rinse and drain the soaked garbanzo beans and add it into the food processor .
column2: put the garbanzo beans in a strainer . rinse the beans in the strainer under running water . gently shake the strainer to remove any water . now put the garbanzo beans into the food processor .

column1: add cut onion and potato into the food processor and grind it until finely chopped .
column2: cut up onion into small pieces . cut potato into large pieces . add onion first . add potato second . add to process & cover it till its chopped all the way .

column1: add cut onion and potato into the food processor and grind it until finely chopped .
column2: put the onion in the food processor . then put the potatoes in too . put the lid on the processor , make sure it 's on tight . turn the food processor on until the onion and potatoes are blended together . they should look like lumpy mashed potatoes .

column1: add cut onion and potato into the food processor and grind it until finely chopped .
column2: get out food processor . put beans into bowl of processor . cut onion into 6 pieces and add to bowl of processor . cut potato into pieces and add to bowl . cover bowl with lid and mix until finely chopped .

column1: pour the bean mixture into a bowl and retain one cup of it in the processor .
column2: take the lid off of the processor and remove the bowl from the machine . pour the bean mixture into a mixing bowl . leave one cup of the bean mixture in the processor .

column1: pour the bean mixture into a bowl and retain one cup of it in the processor .
column2: pour the bean mixture into a mixing bowl . make sure you leave about one cup of it in the processor bowl .

column1: add garlic cilantro coriander ground cumin salt ground black pepper cayenne pepper and blend .
column2: add garlic to bowl of processor . add 1/2 cup of cilantro leaves . add 1 teaspoon of coriander and 1 teaspoon of cumin . add 2 teaspoon of salt , 1/2 teaspoon of black pepper , and 1/2 teaspoon of cayenne pepper . mix the mixture in the processor until blended together .

column1: add garlic cilantro coriander ground cumin salt ground black pepper cayenne pepper and blend .
column2: add your garlic to the processor bowl . then add half a cup of cilantro leaves . then you will add 1 tsp of ground coriander and one 1 tsp of ground cumin . 2 tsps of salt , 1/2 tsp of black pepper , and 1/2 tsp of cayenne pepper needs to be added . finally , process all of these ingredients together .

column1: add garlic cilantro coriander ground cumin salt ground black pepper cayenne pepper and blend .
column2: add garlic to processor bowl . add 1/2 cup of cilantro leaves to processor . add 1 teaspoon of ground coriander and 1 teaspoon of ground cumin . add 2 teaspoons of salt , 1/2 teaspoon of ground black pepper and 1/2 teaspoon of cayenne pepper . mix this mixture in the processor until blended thoroughly .

column1: add the garbanzo bean mixture lemon juice olive oil and flour to the food processor and process .
column2: add the mixed garbanzo beans back until the food processor . add one tablespoon lemon juice . add one tablespoon olive oil then one tablespoon flour . turn the processor back on until you get an oatmeal texture .

column1: add the garbanzo bean mixture lemon juice olive oil and flour to the food processor and process .
column2: blend mixture together . put lemon juice next with olive oil . then flower is added . process till it resembles a meal . eat !

column1: add the garbanzo bean mixture lemon juice olive oil and flour to the food processor and process .
column2: once the mixture is blended , add the bean mixture back to the processor bowl . add the lemon juice . add 1 tbsp olive oil . add 1 tbsp of flour . turn on the processor until the mixture is thick .

column1: transfer the mixture into a bowl and refrigerate it .
column2: once everything is mixed together in the food processor . take lid off of processor . transfer the falafel mix from processor to mixing bowl . cover the mixing bowl . refrigerate the mixture for at least two hours .

column1: transfer the mixture into a bowl and refrigerate it .
column2: put the falafel mixture into a bowl . place bowl with falafel mix into the refrigerator .

column1: transfer the mixture into a bowl and refrigerate it .
column2: place the mixture in a bowl . cover with bowl with clear plastic wrap . place bowl in refrigerator for 2 hours or longer .

column1: add baking soda and stir until well blended .
column2: with mixture in the bowl . add 2 teaspoons of baking soda . with wooden spoon mix together . make sure you mix baking soda in well . get ready to cook the mixture .

column1: add baking soda and stir until well blended .
column2: we need to cook the falafel . add 2 teaspoon of baking soda . mix with the help of a spatula . we can get a very tasty dish from this .

column1: add baking soda and stir until well blended .
column2: add 2 teaspoons of baking soda into the mixture . stir the baking soda well until it is well blended with the mixture .

column1: form the falafel balls and place them on a baking sheet .
column2: wet your hands . scoop the falafel dough with a scoop . roll the falafel dough into a ball with your hands . put the balls onto the pan . make sure the falafel balls are not touching .

column1: form the falafel balls and place them on a baking sheet .
column2: get a bowl of water . dampen your hands . form falafel ball into balls . balls should be 1 1/2 inches around . place on a parchment paper lined baking sheet .

column1: form the falafel balls and place them on a baking sheet .
column2: wet your hands in a bowl . take some of the batter and form it into bite sized balls . place the balls onto a baking sheet . make sure the baking sheet is lined with parchment paper .

column1: heat the oil and fry the falafel balls until golden brown .
column2: poor oil only 1 - 2 inches deep . let oil get hot . put falafels in oil . cook them 4 at a time and turn frequently . eat them up .

column1: heat the oil and fry the falafel balls until golden brown .
column2: pour oil into a pot until it is filled 2 inches deep . heat the oil over medium high heat or to 350 degrees fahrenheit . place the balls into the hot oil . fry them until golden brown , for 5 minutes each batch . turn them as they cook , so the other side can brown too .

column1: heat the oil and fry the falafel balls until golden brown .
column2: turn the burner heat setting to medium high heat to heat oil . read thermometer temperature . oil is ready once it reaches 365 degrees . place 4 - 5 falafels into oil slowly with a spoon . flip them around with your spoon every few seconds . leave in oil 5 minutes and remove with spoon carefully once golden brown .

column1: finely chop the garlic and parsley and grate some parmesan cheese .
column2: use a chopping knife , place garlic down and chop it into small pieces . chop the parsley into small pieces . use a grater and cut the parmesan cheese into small pieces . boil some water in a pot . add all the ingredients together after you boil the noodles and make them soft . drain the water out pot then add other ingredients into the pot .

column1: finely chop the garlic and parsley and grate some parmesan cheese .
column2: cut the garlic carefully using the knife . cut the parsley with the knife into small pieces . take the cheese and place it against the grater and motion up and down to grate the cheese .

column1: finely chop the garlic and parsley and grate some parmesan cheese .
column2: cut one piece garlic and parsley into very small pieces . grate the parmesan cheese using a grater . cook the pasta .

column1: cook the spaghetti in salted water .
column2: get a large pot and fill it half way with water . put pot on a burner and turn the burner on . bring water to a boil . measure the amount of salt that the pasta packet calls for . put the salt into the water and then stand the pasta up in the water .

column1: cook the spaghetti in salted water .
column2: cook the spaghetti in a large pot of water . make sure to add salt to the water . follow the instructions on the packet for the pasta .

column1: cook the spaghetti in salted water .
column2: pour water into a large pot and place it on the stove . turn the stove top dial to the highest setting . when the water begins to boil with a lot of steam and bubbles , add a pinch of salt . slowly place your pasta into the salted boiling water . let the pasta cook for however long it says on the outside of the package .

column1: heat olive oil in a pan and fry pancetta until it turns brown .
column2: while the pasta boils on the stove , pour the olive oil in a large frying pan and turn the heat on medium . put the pancetta in the frying pan , and then put the garlic in the frying pan . cook the pancetta and garlic in the frying pan by stirring until the pancetta begins to turn brown . when the pancetta turns brown , turn the heat under the frying pan to low .

column1: heat olive oil in a pan and fry pancetta until it turns brown .
column2: add olive oil in a pan in a circular motion covering about 1/4 of the bottom of the pan . add the pancetta and garlic in the pan using a spatula to help scrape ingredients out of the container and into the pan . fry the pancetta by turning it over with the spatula until it is brown and crisp looking . lower the heat when cooked .

column1: heat olive oil in a pan and fry pancetta until it turns brown .
column2: heat olive oil in a pan . fry the pancetta in the pan until it turns brown . be sure to stir it .

column1: lightly beat the eggs with cream grated cheese and season it with black pepper .
column2: take a bowl and break open an egg in to the bowl . beat the egg and add cream . add grated cheese in to the bowl . add black pepper in to the bowl . mix everything in the bowl .

column1: lightly beat the eggs with cream grated cheese and season it with black pepper .
column2: put eggs in bowl and use a wire whisk to beat . add cream to eggs and add grated cheese use whisk to beat . add some black pepper to the egg , cream and cheese mixture and mix well .

column1: lightly beat the eggs with cream grated cheese and season it with black pepper .
column2: put the eggs in a bowl with cream and grated cheese . mix with a whisk until its all combined . add black pepper .

column1: drain the spaghetti then mix it with the pancetta egg and cream .
column2: first drain the spaghetti in the strainer . keep 3 tablespoons of the cooking water to the side . add the spaghetti to the pan of pancetta . add egg and cream over the spaghetti . mix well over low heat .

column1: drain the spaghetti then mix it with the pancetta egg and cream .
column2: drain the spaghetti by lifting strainer out of pot . put a few tablespoons of pasta cooking water to the side . put spaghetti in pan with the pancetta . pour the egg and cream mixture over the top of the spaghetti and pancetta . mix well over low heat , add some pasta water if needed .

column1: drain the spaghetti then mix it with the pancetta egg and cream .
column2: drain the cooked spaghetti and set aside a few tablespoons of the cooking water . add spaghetti to the pan with the pancetta in it . pour the egg and cream mixture over the spaghetti and pancetta . mix everything together over love heat in the pan . if need bee add the cooking water . be sure to do this over low heat .

column1: sprinkle parsley and cheese before serving .
column2: divide the pasta into two bowls . sprinkle parsley on pasta . sprinkle on cheese on top .

column1: sprinkle parsley and cheese before serving .
column2: put parsley and parmesan cheese on he spaghetti . serve .

column1: sprinkle parsley and cheese before serving .
column2: have two bowls ready for spaghetti . divide spaghetti into the bowls . with hands use a pinch of parsley on top . along with a pinch of some remaining cheese . placing the parsley and cheese on top for decoration .

column1: as the water boils add choi sum stems and cook before setting aside .
column2: add the stems to the boiling water pan . after 20 seconds add the vegetables to the water . when the color changes to a darker green , remove them from the water .

column1: as the water boils add choi sum stems and cook before setting aside .
column2: put the stems into the boiling water . cook until they are darker green and remove from pan .

column1: as the water boils add choi sum stems and cook before setting aside .
column2: put in the choi sum stems when the water is boiling . allow it to cook . set it aside when it is done cooking .

column1: add the cooked noodles to the sauce mix    toss and mix well to incorporate the sauce .
column2: take a pan on the stove . add the sauce mix in the pan . add the noodles in to the sauce . mix the noodles well . coat the noodles with sauce mix properly .

column1: add the cooked noodles to the sauce mix    toss and mix well to incorporate the sauce .
column2: take all of the noodles and place them in the sauce pan . stir the noodles around so that the sauce in the pan mixes with the noodles . take the noodles back out of the pan and place them in the bowl .

column1: add the cooked noodles to the sauce mix    toss and mix well to incorporate the sauce .
column2: pick up the plate that has the noodles on it . gently add the noodles to the pan on the stove . using a utensil such as spoon , stir the noodled until they 're covered in sauce . lift the noodles carefully , allowing extra sauce to drip back into pan . carefully transfer the noodles from a pan into a bowl .

column1: boil some water in a pot add egg noodles and cook them .
column2: take the noodles into a pot of boiling water . boil the noodles for 2 minutes .

column1: boil some water in a pot add egg noodles and cook them .
column2: put water in a small pot and heat to boiling . add the egg noodles to the boiling water . cook the noodles for two minutes , stirring occasionally .

column1: boil some water in a pot add egg noodles and cook them .
column2: put a pot of water on the stove . turn the heat up on the stove knob until the water is bubbling up fast . add the egg noodles with your hands and cook .

column1: serve with char siew wonton soup and pickled green chilies .
column2: once you have your plate set , you will want to move on to the char siew wonton soup . now set the soup on the side and get ready to add the most important ingredient . pickled green chilies should always go along with the wonton soup .

column1: serve with char siew wonton soup and pickled green chilies .
column2: put some of your sliced char siew next to the noodles . put a small amount of wonton soup into a tiny bowl . put a few pickled green chilies on a very tiny dish .

column1: serve with char siew wonton soup and pickled green chilies .
column2: eating begins with your eyes . make sure your plate is served as attractively as possible to delight your diners . place the main dish in the middle of the plate with the greens to one side and the char siew spread out attractively on the other side of the noodles . place the wonton soup to the left of the plate in a small bowl filled two thirds full . your wonton noodles will not be complete without the wonton soup . in malayasia , when there are wonton noodles , you must have pickled green chili . take a spoon and place a large spoonful into a small white porcelain dish .

column1: transfer the noodles to a plate and place blanched choi sum .
column2: grab the noodles out of the pan with a spatula . place the noodles in a plate with the spatula . grab bok choy with chop sticks and place on the plate .

column1: transfer the noodles to a plate and place blanched choi sum .
column2: take your noodles out of the pan and set them onto your plate . we will then assemble everything . take your vegetables and place the blanched choi sum next to the noodles .

column1: transfer the noodles to a plate and place blanched choi sum .
column2: put your finished noodles onto a plate . add a couple pieces of your green vegetables to the plate .

column1: add some salt and sugar and the prepared garlic oil to the sauce and stir .
column2: add some salt into the pan . add sugar into the pan . squeeze the garlic to get the oil out of it . add all the components to the sauce . mix all the ingredients together .

column1: add some salt and sugar and the prepared garlic oil to the sauce and stir .
column2: add some salt and sugar to the pan . turn the temperature of the stove to low heat . pour the garlic oil into the sauce . use the chopsticks to stir the mixture together in the pan .

column1: add some salt and sugar and the prepared garlic oil to the sauce and stir .
column2: sake in some salt and sugar . turn the heat knob to low . add the garlic oil to the sauce and stir with chopsticks .

column1: add some water to the pan and bring it to boil .
column2: add water to a hot pan . turn the heat up high enough to bring the water to a boil .

column1: add some water to the pan and bring it to boil .
column2: pour some water into a hot pan . let the water come to a boil .

column1: add some water to the pan and bring it to boil .
column2: add water to the pan . turn the heat up until the water boils .

column1: heat oil in a wok and saute chopped garlic .
column2: get a wok or a skillet . place it on the stove and turn the heat to medium high . when the wok is hot , pour the oil in . add the garlic to the oil and stir it around with a wooden spoon . cook for only a minute . remove the garlic and put it in a small bowl .

column1: heat oil in a wok and saute chopped garlic .
column2: pour some oil to the frying pan . spread the oil around . add chopped garlic to the frying pan .

column1: heat oil in a wok and saute chopped garlic .
column2: put oil in a hot wok . add chopped garlic . cook both on the hot pan .

column1: heat another pan and add soy sauce sesame oil kicap manis water and cook .
column2: in a large skillet add dark soy sauce . then add regular soy sauce . keep stirring as you add the ingredients with your chopsticks . add your sesame oil , kicap manis and your one tablespoon of water to make sure the mixture is watery . cook the mixture and slightly turn the pot to distribute the mixture around the pot .

column1: heat another pan and add soy sauce sesame oil kicap manis water and cook .
column2: while the noodles are cooking , heat another pan until it 's nice and hot . put the soy sauce and sesame oil into the pan and add the kicap manis . add a tablespoon of water - this is to stop it from being too thick and gooey ! put a little salt and sugar in as well .

column1: heat another pan and add soy sauce sesame oil kicap manis water and cook .
column2: put a pan on the stove and turn the heat on . pour in the soy sauce sesame oil and water . stir everything with chop sticks .

column1: place the patties in between the buns .
column2: grill the patties on a grill . take a bun and place it on the plate . add some vegetables on top of bun . add the patties on the bun . now place the top bun .

column1: place the patties in between the buns .
column2: with a large metal spatula , remove a burger from the grill . place each burger on top of the vegetables and buns . place each upper bun on top of a meat patty .

column1: place the patties in between the buns .
column2: scoop up the patties with a spatula . set the meat patty on the bottom of the bun . put the top of the bun on top of the patty .

column1: slice the tomatoes spread the sauce on the burger base and place tomato and spinach on top .
column2: put a tomato on a cutting board . use a sharp knife to cut the tomato into slices . use a spatula to spread the sauce on each bun bottom . spread some mustard on the bun top . put a slice of tomato and some spinach on the bun bottom .

column1: slice the tomatoes spread the sauce on the burger base and place tomato and spinach on top .
column2: use a sharp or serrated knife and a cutting board to cut the tomatoes into thin slices , about 1/4 inch thick . use a spatula to spread the special sauce on the inside of each bun top . then , open your mustard and use a knife to spread it on the inside of each bun base . place one tomato slice onto each bun base . place fresh spinach leaves on top of the tomato slices , then you 're ready for the burgers .

column1: slice the tomatoes spread the sauce on the burger base and place tomato and spinach on top .
column2: cut the tomatoes in to thin slices . take the sauce in a bowl . add the sauce on top of burger base . place tomato slice on burger bread . add some spinach on top of tomato slice .

column1: divide the blue cheese into pieces .
column2: cut the blue cheese into pieces with a knife . make sure the pieces are even .

column1: divide the blue cheese into pieces .
column2: lay cheese down horizontally on its side . grab serrated knife from chopping block . make slow downward slicing motion through the horizontal cheese . cut into 8 total pieces .

column1: divide the blue cheese into pieces .
column2: get a large knife . cut up the cheese with the knife into 8 pieces .

column1: add mayonnaise red pepper white wine vinegar and pepper to a food processor and process it .
column2: get a food processor . we will make the sauce in the food processor . put 1 cup mayonnaise in the food processor . add 1/4 cup of chopped roasted red peppers , 1/4 teaspoon white wine vinegar , and 1/8 teaspoon pepper . put the lid on the food processor and turn on the food processor to combine all the ingredients .

column1: add mayonnaise red pepper white wine vinegar and pepper to a food processor and process it .
column2: find a one cup measure and measure out mayonnaise . you can use light mayonnaise . put the mayonnaise into the top of the food processor . find a 1/4 cup measuring cup . measure out 1/4 cup of chopped roasted red peppers . put peppers in food processor . find 1/2 teaspoon measure . measure out 1/2 teaspoon of white wine vinegar . pour into food processor . find a 1/8 teaspoon measure . measure out 1/8 pepper . pour pepper into food processor . start the food processor and mix until ingredients are combined .

column1: add mayonnaise red pepper white wine vinegar and pepper to a food processor and process it .
column2: now to make our sauce , add one cup of mayonnaise to the food processor . next add a quarter cup of red peppers into the processor . now add just a splash of white wine vinegar . next we will put in an 1/8 teaspoon of pepper . once all your ingredients are in , just cover the processor and start blinding it .

column1: add salt black pepper and flavored salt to ground chopped meat and mix .
column2: add ground beef to a bowl . put on gloves to be more clean . add a tablespoon of salt . add a teaspoon of black pepper . add two tablespoons and two teaspoons of worcestershire sauce and mix .

column1: add salt black pepper and flavored salt to ground chopped meat and mix .
column2: now we are going to add a teaspoon of salt into the burger . now we will add in some pepper of the same amount . once these are added in , and our sauce and we can get ready for the next step . mix the meat around with your hands , gloves are suggested . keep doing this until the seasoning are mixed in well .

column1: add salt black pepper and flavored salt to ground chopped meat and mix .
column2: pour in the salt black pepper and flavored salt to the meat . use your hands to mix everything up .

column1: grill the patties .
column2: place the hamburgers on the grill with your tongs . cook them about 4 to 6 minutes per side .

column1: grill the patties .
column2: place the patties on the grill with tongs . line the patties up in rows . let them cook on the grill .

column1: grill the patties .
column2: take the ground beef and form it into burger sized patties with your hands . turn on the grill to warm it up . put the patties on the grill and cook them for 4 - 6 minutes per side . while burgers are cooking , get your special sauce ready .

column1: place the cheese inside the meat .
column2: shape the meat into a burger shape , and add a hole in the middle of the burger . then place in your blue cheese , and gently cover the hole with the meat again . make sure the cheese is in the middle of the meat , and covered completely on top and bottom .

column1: place the cheese inside the meat .
column2: make a pouch or bowl in the middle of the meat with your hands . place the cheese in the middle of this meat bowl .

column1: place the cheese inside the meat .
column2: put gloves on your hands . use your fingers to make a hole in the center of each burger . put a piece of cheese in each hole . use the meat to cover the cheese and press together .

column1: flip the burger patties on the grill and cook .
column2: add the burger patties on the grill . fry the burgers to brown on one side . flip the burgers on the grill . fry the burgers on the other side . repeat the same with the other burgers .

column1: flip the burger patties on the grill and cook .
column2: after cooking for a few minutes , get some tongs . carefully grab the burger on each side and flip . it 's ready when they have black lines and the burger is nice and brown . flip all the burgers and continue to cook for 3 or 4 more minutes .

column1: flip the burger patties on the grill and cook .
column2: take the spatula and flip over the burger patties . make sure that the patty are charred and do not stick when you try to flip . cook the other side of the patty .

column1: roll the dough into a thin circle .
column2: take your dough and roll it into a small ball . now smash out the ball and roll it flat . put some flour on it , so it does not stick , and use your rolling pin to make a flat thin circle .

column1: roll the dough into a thin circle .
column2: to make this vegetable samosa , you will need to have your dough ready to roll out . make sure you have a clean surface to roll your dough , and have some flour and a rolling pin ready to use . take a small amount of dough , about the size of a golf ball between your palms and roll it til you have a nice ball . place some flour on the clean surface and place your ball of dough onto this floured surface . pat the ball with your hand to flatten it and then turn it over so that both sides of the pressed ball have some flour . you will flatten the ball to about the size of the base of a soda can . take your rolling pin and flatten it out til it is nice and thin , about the thickness of a dime . roll the pin once or twice over the surface and turn the flattened dough over and roll the pin across the surface again . continue until the dough is about the size of the top of a coffee mug and is consistently flat across the dough , about the thickness of a coin .

column1: roll the dough into a thin circle .
column2: roll the dough with the hand . pour some flour onto it . roll it with the help of a roller . roll the flour into a thin circle shape .

column1: pour oil into a hot pan and add onion ginger green chili and carom seeds .
column2: take a pan on the stove . pour some oil on to the pan . cut onion and ginger and green chili in to small pieces . add cut pieces of onion , ginger and green chili in to the pan . add carom seeds in to the pan and mix them .

column1: pour oil into a hot pan and add onion ginger green chili and carom seeds .
column2: with a spoon pour oil into the pan . add onions into the pan . using a spoon spread the onions around the pan . add ginger into the pan . add green chili into the pan .

column1: pour oil into a hot pan and add onion ginger green chili and carom seeds .
column2: once the pan is hot , add three teaspoons of oil . pour the onions in the pan . pour the ginger in the pan . pour the green chili in the pan . sprinkle the carom seeds in the pan .

column1: add cashews and coriander leaves to the pan .
column2: pour in cashews to the cooking pan . add in some coriander . use the stirring spoon to mix everything together .

column1: add cashews and coriander leaves to the pan .
column2: add some cashew nuts or peanuts to the mixture in the pan . ( you can also use peanuts ) . after cashews , add some coriander leaves into the mix . stir mixture together .

column1: add cashews and coriander leaves to the pan .
column2: grab some cashews with your hands and drop them in the pan . grab coriander leaves and drop them in the pan .

column1: place the samosas into a pan of hot oil to fry .
column2: add samosas into the hot oil . flip the samosas in the hot oil . flip until brown .

column1: place the samosas into a pan of hot oil to fry .
column2: very carefully put the samosas in hot oil using a spatula or spoon . if the oil is hot enough it will bubble . be very careful not to touch or splash the oil .

column1: place the samosas into a pan of hot oil to fry .
column2: make sure the oil is hot . flip the samosa with a spatula . put in two at a time . take the samosa out when it is brown and crispy . eat and enjoy .

column1: add turmeric chili powder coriander powder garam masala and salt to the pan and mix .
column2: add 1/4 teaspoon of turmeric . add some chili powder and coriander powder . add 1 teaspoon of garam masala . put in some salt . use a stirring spoon and mix the ingredients together .

column1: add turmeric chili powder coriander powder garam masala and salt to the pan and mix .
column2: place some turmeric and chili powder onto your food . then add some coriander powder , garam masala and salt to it . mix them all together .

column1: add turmeric chili powder coriander powder garam masala and salt to the pan and mix .
column2: take a pan and cook the ingredients in the pan . add a teaspoon of turmeric powder and chili powder in to the pan . add a teaspoon of coriander powder and garam masala powder in to the pan . add some salt in to the pan . mix the contents in the pan .

column1: add potatoes carrots green beans and peas to the pan .
column2: add the cut up pieces of potatoes carrots green beans and peas to the pan one at a time . stir everything with a wooden spoon .

column1: add potatoes carrots green beans and peas to the pan .
column2: pick up the bowl of potatoes and put it in the pan . pick up the bowl of carrots and put it in the pan . stir it up . pick up the bowl of beans and put it in the pan . pick up the bowl of peas and put it in the pan . stir everything together .

column1: add potatoes carrots green beans and peas to the pan .
column2: add potatoes , carrots , green beans , and peas one at a time to the pan . stir together .

column1: add flour salt baking powder and oil to a bowl and mix with water .
column2: in a large bowl start with adding 3/4 cup of flour . then add a pinch of salt and a pinch of baking powder . fill a spoon with oil and add it to the bowl . do this 2 more times . ( 3 spoonfuls total ) . add water as you mix all the ingredients together in the bowl with your fingers . keep adding water and mixing until there is nothing dry left in the bowl and you feel the dough start to stiffen in your hands .

column1: add flour salt baking powder and oil to a bowl and mix with water .
column2: put the flour into the bowl . add salt into the bowl . add baking powder into the bowl . put oil into the bowl . with your hands mix it all together .

column1: add flour salt baking powder and oil to a bowl and mix with water .
column2: pour about 3/4 cup of flour into a large mixing bowl . put in a tiny amount of salt and baking powder . add in a few teaspoons of oil . mix it up with your hand as you add in a little bit of water . continue mixing it up until it is well combined and consistent .

column1: place the filling into the middle of the dough and fold it shut .
column2: use a spoon to scoop the filling and place it onto the dough . place the filling in the center of the dough . fold the dough over . seal the ends of the dough . fold the dough over again and seal all the edges .

column1: place the filling into the middle of the dough and fold it shut .
column2: open the dough up into a circle . using a spoon , scoop a spoonful of masala filling . place the filling on one corner of the dough . picking up the opposite corner of the dough , fold the dough in half over the filling and press the ends down with your fingers to seal the filling in . fold the dough once more with the remaining ends and seal the dough once again .

column1: place the filling into the middle of the dough and fold it shut .
column2: we now want to take the filling and put it in the corner of your dough . now take the dough and fold it over and seal the ends . now we want to turn the dough and fold it again . now just seal the edges once again .

column1: chop 2 garlic cloves grate ginger about 2 tsp and green onions finely .
column2: using a knife chop two garlic cloves and a handful of green onions into very small pieces . using a small cheese grater and grate about two teaspoons worth of ginger .

column1: chop 2 garlic cloves grate ginger about 2 tsp and green onions finely .
column2: cut up 2 garlic cloves with your knife . use a cheese grater and grate 2 tsp ginger . measure the ginger after grating with a teaspoon measurement . cut up lots of thin green onion into small pieces .

column1: chop 2 garlic cloves grate ginger about 2 tsp and green onions finely .
column2: get a knife and a cutting board . chop two gloves of garlic and four green onions into small pieces . get a cheese grater . rub the ginger against the grater to make it into about 2 teaspoons of mush .

column1: cut yu choy into diagonally medium pieces .
column2: take the knife and hold sideways . cut the pieces not too small , not too big .

column1: cut yu choy into diagonally medium pieces .
column2: get a large knife and a cutting board . you may need grown - up to help with the next part . place the yu choy on the cutting board . cut the yu choy in 2 inch pieces at an angle like these lines : / / / / .

column1: cut yu choy into diagonally medium pieces .
column2: take a knife and slant it across the yu choy . cut the yu choy with the knife slanted into pieces . you want the pieces to be about the size of your pointer and middle finger put together .

column1: chop beef slices into cubes .
column2: stack beef on top of one another . cut downwards into squares or cubes .

column1: chop beef slices into cubes .
column2: take a cutting board and a knife . take a long beef slice on the cutting board . cut the thick slice in to two halves horizontally . cut each half in to cube slices vertically . repeat with other half .

column1: chop beef slices into cubes .
column2: get a medium to large sized knife . cut the beef into long strips . stack the strips on top of each other . cut the strips from top to bottom into squares .

column1: cut pork belly into pieces .
column2: take any piece of pork and cut it into small pieces . take your pork and make smaller pieces the size of your thumb .

column1: cut pork belly into pieces .
column2: place pork belly on cutting board . slice pork belly into thick palm - sized slices .

column1: cut pork belly into pieces .
column2: lay the pork belly on a cutting board . take a knife and carefully slice pieces of pork belly off the larger piece . slide the cut off pieces to the side until you have completely cut up all the pork belly .

column1: crack 2 eggs in a bowl .
column2: take your egg and very carefully crack it against the bowl . make sure that you only put the inside of the egg into the bowl and not any part of the hard shell . do this with two eggs .

column1: crack 2 eggs in a bowl .
column2: grab one of the eggs and softly tap one of the sides using a spoon . using the fingernails of your thumbs , open the egg and put it in a bowl . repeat the same process with the second egg .

column1: add 2 tsp of sriracha small pinch of salt and pepper and beat them all .
column2: break two eggs into a measuring cup . add to teaspoons of sriracha sauce . grab some salt between two fingers , add it to the eggs . add pepper until it covers about half of the eggs .

column1: add 2 tsp of sriracha small pinch of salt and pepper and beat them all .
column2: to a glass measuring cup add two eggs and two teaspoons of sriracha sauce . add salt and peppers to the eggs and mix it up with a whisk .

column1: add 2 tsp of sriracha small pinch of salt and pepper and beat them all .
column2: fill a tbsp with sriracha and pour into eggs . pour a small amount of sale into hand and add to mixture . pour a small amount of pepper onto hand and add to mixture . stir everything together .

column1: mix soy sauce chili garlic sauce and chili oil with flakes .
column2: put soy sauce into the bowl . put the chili oil into the bowl . put the garlic sauce into the bowl . take a spoon and mix it all together .

column1: mix soy sauce chili garlic sauce and chili oil with flakes .
column2: add 4 teaspoons soy sauce to bow . add 4 teaspoons of chili garlic to bowl . add 4 teaspoons of chili oil to bowl . this makes it taste spicy . mix everything together .

column1: mix soy sauce chili garlic sauce and chili oil with flakes .
column2: pour soy sauce into a measuring tablespoon and dump into a bowl four times . pour chili garlic sauce into a measuring tablespoon and dump into bowl four times . pour chili oil with flakes into a measuring tablespoon and dump into bowl four times . stir it all together with a spoon .

column1: pour the mixed sauce over the cold rice .
column2: pick up smaller bowl containing sauce mix . pour sauce over rice .

column1: pour the mixed sauce over the cold rice .
column2: take the bowl of mixed sauce . pour the sauce evenly over the cold rice .

column1: pour the mixed sauce over the cold rice .
column2: have a bowl of sauce and a bowl of cold rice . pour the sauce over the rice , using the spatula to help you get it over the rice . use the spatula to scrape any remaining sauce out .

column1: turn on the heat at the highest and keep a pan add 2 tbsp of cooking oil .
column2: turn the stove knob all the way until you ca n't anymore . add two tbsp of cooking oil to the pan .

column1: turn on the heat at the highest and keep a pan add 2 tbsp of cooking oil .
column2: turn the heat to the highest . keep a pan on the stove . heat the pan . take about 2 tablespoon of oil . add oil in to the pan .

column1: turn on the heat at the highest and keep a pan add 2 tbsp of cooking oil .
column2: place the wok onto one stove burner . turn the stove burner onto high . once the wok is hot add 2 tablespoons cooking oik .

column1: add chopped garlic ginger and onions to the heated oil and salt and cook for 40 secs .
column2: take your garlic and green onions and use a large spoon to push them until the hot pan . let them get hot for 30 or 40 seconds until you can really smell them .

column1: add chopped garlic ginger and onions to the heated oil and salt and cook for 40 secs .
column2: heat the oil in a pan . add the chopped garlic , ginger , and onion . then add salt . cook for 30 to 40 seconds .

column1: add chopped garlic ginger and onions to the heated oil and salt and cook for 40 secs .
column2: add all the small pieces of garlic and ginger onion inside of the pan with the oil . let it cook for 30 - 45 seconds , or until you can smell all the garlic and onion .

column1: add all the cut meat to the salted veggies and cook .
column2: add chopped meat to pan with the salted veggies . stir occasionally until fully cooked .

column1: add all the cut meat to the salted veggies and cook .
column2: add the cut veggies in to the pan . add salt in to the veggies . cut the meat in to thin slices . add the meat in to the veggies . cook the meat till it is brown .

column1: add all the cut meat to the salted veggies and cook .
column2: carefully add all of the meat to the vegetables using tongs . stir the meat and vegetables . let the meat cook until it is a little brown on all sides .

column1: when the meat is cooked add the beaten egg and fry .
column2: push the meat aside and pour the egg mixture to the empty side of the pan . make sure you do n't mix the eggs and the meat until the eggs are cooked . cook the eggs until they are fluffy . once the eggs are cooked , mix the meat and eggs together .

column1: when the meat is cooked add the beaten egg and fry .
column2: when the meat has turned completely brown and the shrimp is completely orange and white , push everything in the pan to one side . add the egg mixture that you made to the empty side of the pan . then you need to use the spatula to mix the egg , do not mix it with the other items in the pan until the egg looks solid and scrambled . then you can mix all the ingredients in the pan together .

column1: when the meat is cooked add the beaten egg and fry .
column2: when the meat is cooked , slowly pour in the beaten egg mixture . gently stir the eggs until the egg is fully cooked . then mix the cooked eggs and the cooked meat together gently .

column1: add the rice sauce and choy mix and cook .
column2: add rice , sauce and the yu choi to the pan . use a spoon to stir for about one minute .

column1: add the rice sauce and choy mix and cook .
column2: add the rice , sauce , and yucho to the pan . mix well and cook . continue stirring to prevent burning .

column1: add the rice sauce and choy mix and cook .
column2: take a pan on the stove . add the rice in the pan . add the sauce in to the rice . cut the choy in to small pieces . add the choy in to rice and mix everything .

column1: cover and pot .
column2: take your lid and set it on top of your pan . make sure you get a good seal of the lid on the pan so you can let your food cook evenly .

column1: cover and pot .
column2: put lid on pot . let the pot cook and stir in between .

column1: cover and pot .
column2: put the lid on saucepan to let cook over the burner . stir occasionally and replace lid .

column1: chop up oleander .
column2: place the coriander on to your cutting board . use your knife to chop it finely . make sure to tuck in your fingers and chop carefully .

column1: chop up oleander .
column2: chop the coriander with a knife . coriander has a nice taste and smells good .

column1: chop up oleander .
column2: using a knife carefully shop up the oleander . cut into small pieces .

column1: cover up and cook for 6 to 8 minutes .
column2: cover and cook for 6 to 8 minutes . add water if you need to .

column1: cover up and cook for 6 to 8 minutes .
column2: add 500 ml of water on top of the chicken , and then cover the pan . make sure the stove top dial is set to the middle notch , for medium - high heat . let the chicken cook in the spices for at least six minutes . after six minutes , add the amount of garam masala that we measured out at the beginning . nine minutes later , take the lid off the pan .

column1: cover up and cook for 6 to 8 minutes .
column2: cover up the pot . allow the pot to cook for 6 to 8 minutes .

column1: add more garam masala powder .
column2: put in more garam masala powder . garam masala was already added , but this will increase the fragrance of the dish .

column1: add more garam masala powder .
column2: put in more garam masala powder . then mix the pot together .

column1: add more garam masala powder .
column2: with chicken in a pot , add more masala powder for fragrance . add green chili into pot too .

column1: add black cardamom to a large pot .
column2: get a large pot and put onto the stove . next open up 4 to 5 cardamom . put the cardamom into the pot .

column1: add black cardamom to a large pot .
column2: pinch open the black cardamom or they will pop . drop them into the pot .

column1: add black cardamom to a large pot .
column2: open up the black cardamom . drop the black cardamom into a large pot .

column1: add cloves to the pot .
column2: add 1 teaspoon of cumin to the pot . break up 1 garlic clove and sprinkle it into the pot . ( make sure to peel skin off of garlic clove before breaking it up ! ) .

column1: add cloves to the pot .
column2: add 1 teaspoon of cumin to the pot . add some cloves to the pot .

column1: add cloves to the pot .
column2: put large sauce pan on the burner . add one teaspoon of cumin . add some cloves .

column1: saute the onions .
column2: put the onions in the pot , stir and let saute . add some ginger .

column1: saute the onions .
column2: put onions into hot pot . using a spoon stir the onions and other ingredients as they cook .

column1: saute the onions .
column2: take a large pot on the stove . pour some oil in to the pot . take an onion and cut it in to long thin slices . add the onion in to the pan . fry the onions till they are brown .

column1: chop up the tomatoes .
column2: chicken is in the bowl . cut the core out of the tomatoes . add saturated fat to the pot ,

column1: chop up the tomatoes .
column2: take whole tomatoes . carefully take a small knife . cut tomatoes into four equal size pieces .

column1: chop up the tomatoes .
column2: carefully using a knife cut up tomatoes . cut the tomatoes into small squares .

column1: add ginger and garlic paste and saute .
column2: over a heated pan , add ginger and garlic paste . let cook .

column1: add ginger and garlic paste and saute .
column2: add ginger to the pot . add 1 tablespoon of garlic paste . stir the pot while it cooks .

column1: add ginger and garlic paste and saute .
column2: add one table spoon of the ginger and garlic paste and stir it into your chicken curry . saute it or cook it over medium to high heat for about one minute . let it saute until you will smell the aroma .

column1: add the tomatoes into the pot .
column2: pick up the tomatoes which should be cut . put the cut tomatoes into the pot .

column1: add the tomatoes into the pot .
column2: get out a clean cutting board . get a sharp knife , and be very careful with it . carefully cut the tomato into small cubes . put the tomato cubes into the pot . turn on the burner , and then turn the dial to the middle notch for medium heat .

column1: slice up the ginger finely .
column2: take a cutting board and a knife . take a piece of ginger on the cutting board . remove the peel of the ginger . cut the ginger in to thin slices . repeat the same with entire piece of ginger .

column1: slice up the ginger finely .
column2: pour water into pot and turn nob onto high . next grab a knife and start to cut the ginger . cut multiple times until little pieces . grab the greens and start to cut longways . drop the chopped ginger and greens into pot .

column1: slice up the ginger finely .
column2: carefully hold the ginger . cut the ginger into small strips .

column1: chop the green chilies .
column2: slice green chilies down the middle . slice tops off . add to pan .

column1: chop the green chilies .
column2: use your knife to cut the chilies . cut the chilies down the middle . add 3 chilies to the pan .

column1: chop the green chilies .
column2: take the green chilies and put them on the cutting board . hold the chili at one end and slice it down the middle with a sharp knife . do n't touch the inside of the chili or you will get spice on your hands and it could wind up in your eyes . put the sliced chilies into the pot using your knife to pick them up .

column1: add chili powder .
column2: turn on stove , and put mixture on the stove in a saucepan . put in 1 1/2 tablespoons of coriander powder .

column1: add chili powder .
column2: spoon the chili pepper . put spooned pepper in the pan .

column1: add chili powder .
column2: add chili powder to the pot . add pureoader powder to the pot with a spoon .

column1: add masala powder .
column2: while the dish is cooking , add one teaspoon of masala powder . then , using your fingers , add a large pinch of salt .

column1: add masala powder .
column2: add 1 teaspoon of masala while the mix is being cooked . add salt .

column1: add masala powder .
column2: take a small spoon . scoop out masala powder and drop it in carefully .

column1: stir around the food in the pot .
column2: you will want to keep stirring your dish for 3 - 4 minutes after the dry spices have been added . just use your spoon to move the ingredients around in the pan and make sure you get your spices mixed in well .

column1: stir around the food in the pot .
column2: get a spoon or spatula . use the spatula to carefully mix the food around in the pot .

column1: stir around the food in the pot .
column2: after adding dried spices , mix well . continue cooking for 3 - 4 minutes , stirring occasionally .

column1: add the chick to the pot and mix .
column2: hold the chicken bowl over the pot . use a spoon and slowly scoop the chicken into the pot . mix everything with the spoon .

column1: add the chick to the pot and mix .
column2: take a pot and cook it with the other ingredients . take the chicken pieces in the bowl . add the chicken in to the pot . take a large spoon . mix the chicken with the ingredients in the bowl .

column1: add the chick to the pot and mix .
column2: the chicken goes in the pot . keep cooking the chicken without adding water . keep stirring the chicken into the vegetables .

column1: add garlic to a wok of hot oil .
column2: when the oil is ready , carefully dump in the garlic to the hot oil in the wok . make sure you add all the garlic from the container by carefully shaking it .

column1: add garlic to a wok of hot oil .
column2: find your wok . it is a deep and big black pan with a handle . it looks like a deep frying pan . make sure the oil is inside . make sure to carefully check if the oil inside the wok is hot . you can do this by putting a small piece of onion inside the wok . if the oil makes a sizzling sound , then the oil inside the wok is ready . grab the cup of garlic and carefully put all of the garlic into the hot oil .

column1: add garlic to a wok of hot oil .
column2: take a pan on the stove . add some oil in to the pan . heat the oil . cut the garlic in to small pieces . add the garlic in to the oil .

column1: add pork to the wok .
column2: place all the pork pieces into the pan with the oil . using a wooden spoon or plastic / silicon tongues , move the pork around so that all the pork is cooked on all sides .

column1: add pork to the wok .
column2: put the meat in the pan . place the pork in the pot .

column1: add pork to the wok .
column2: add the meat to the wok . use tongs to stir the pork .

column1: add wine to the wok .
column2: measure wine in a small glass bowl . add the measured amount of wine to the wok .

column1: add wine to the wok .
column2: take a small glass of red wine . pour the wine gently and directly into the pan .

column1: add wine to the wok .
column2: while the meat is frying , pour the wine into the wok . stir the wine and meat together .

column1: add a scrambled egg to the wok .
column2: crack an egg into a bowl , put the inside of the egg into the bowl and throw away the egg shell . stir the egg with a fork until it is all yellow and mixed well . pour the scrambled egg into the hot wok and stir with tongs .

column1: add a scrambled egg to the wok .
column2: crack an egg into a separate bowl and throw away the shell . mix the egg up with a fork , so the yellow and the egg white are well mixed ( scrambled ) . pour the scrambled egg into the wok .

column1: add a scrambled egg to the wok .
column2: take a pan . add wok in to the pan . break open an egg and mix it . add the scrambled egg in to the wok . mix with a spatula .

column1: add corn to the wok .
column2: put the corn into a cup or bowl . pour the cup into the wok .

column1: add corn to the wok .
column2: take the small bowl of corn from the counter . put all of the corn in the bowl into the wok .

column1: add corn to the wok .
column2: add the corn to the wok . stir slowly . place wok on simmer . cook until light brownish .

column1: add bamboo to the wok .
column2: add bamboo to hot wok . stir to incorporate into the dish .

column1: add bamboo to the wok .
column2: take the small bowl with the bamboo pieces . shake the pieces of the bamboo onto the pan .

column1: add bamboo to the wok .
column2: open jar of bamboo with an electric can opener . drain the liquid from the bamboo by pouring the contents of the can into a colander or noodle drainer . set the open can aside by placing opened top in the can for safety . chop contents of can of bamboo on a clean cutting board with a sharp knife , and be careful while slicing . place the chopped bamboo in a bowl . pour contents of bamboo bowl into the remainder of wok ingredients .

column1: add the maggi sauce to the wok and stir .
column2: add maggi sauce to the pan with the mixture . stir the maggi sauce into the mixture .

column1: add the maggi sauce to the wok and stir .
column2: pour the maggi sauce from the measuring cup into the pan . you can use soy sauce if you do n't have maggi . shake the pan to combine everything . use a pair of tongs to stir it some more .

column1: add the maggi sauce to the wok and stir .
column2: pick up the cup containing the sauce and put it over the pan . tilt the cup so the sauce pours out of the cup and into the pan . carefully lift the pan off the heat and shake it a few times so that the food moves in the pan but does n't fall out . use the tongs to stir the food in the pan around .

column1: add fish balls to the wok and stir .
column2: get a pair of tongs . carefully add the fish balls to the wok .

column1: add fish balls to the wok and stir .
column2: add fish balls to wok . stir into other ingredients to avoid sticking . food will cook evenly .

column1: add fish balls to the wok and stir .
column2: put fish balls in pan . shake the pan .

column1: add udon noodles to the wok and stir .
column2: pour cooked udon noodles into the wok . stir with tongs until mixed well .

column1: add udon noodles to the wok and stir .
column2: dump the noodles out of the yellow bowl into the hot pan . use the tongs to lift and stir the noodles while they cook . tap tongs on pan when done stirring .

column1: add udon noodles to the wok and stir .
column2: take your bowl of udon noodles and put them into the pan . take your tongs and mix the noodles with everything .

column1: add hoisin sauce to the wok .
column2: pour hoisin sauce in the wok . using tongs , take vegetables from the wok to empty the bottle . mix the hoisin sauce with the ingredients in the wok .

column1: add hoisin sauce to the wok .
column2: put the hoisin sauce in . careful , it might sizzle .

column1: add hoisin sauce to the wok .
column2: put hoisin sauce to your pan of noodles . use your tongs to make sure you get all of the sauce out of the bowl .

column1: add ground black pepper to the wok .
column2: twist the top of the pepper grinder over and over . hold the grinder over the pan and move it around to sprinkle pepper on the food .

column1: add ground black pepper to the wok .
column2: cook meat , veggies and noodles in wok . add desired sauce . finish with sprinkling ground black pepper over the top . turn off burner .

column1: add ground black pepper to the wok .
column2: add pepper to a pepper grinder . hold the pepper grinder over the food . twist the grinder 4 or 5 times . now you can put the pepper away .

column1: add sugar to the wok .
column2: use a very small spoon to scoop some sugar out of your sugar container . sprinkle the spoonful of sugar over the noodles in your wok .

column1: add sugar to the wok .
column2: add 1 teaspoon of sugar . mix until evenly in wok .

column1: add sugar to the wok .
column2: stir the food in the pan . sprinkle sugar over the food .

column1: add the noodles to a plate .
column2: take the pan handle and shake the pan . place the noodles onto the plate until it is all off .

column1: add the noodles to a plate .
column2: take the pan off of the stove . pour the noodles onto a serving plate .

column1: add the noodles to a plate .
column2: get a plate ready on the counter . pick up the pan and move it next to the plate . slide the food out of the pan and onto the plate .

column1: add cardamom seeds to a pan of hot oil and shake .
column2: put a few cardamom seeds into the pan with the hot oil . shake the pan to release the flavors of the seeds .

column1: add cardamom seeds to a pan of hot oil and shake .
column2: the pan consists of hot oil . add the cardamom seeds to a pan . after adding , shake the pan well .

column1: add cardamom seeds to a pan of hot oil and shake .
column2: place a few cardamom seeds into the pan of hot oil . about 7 seeds is plenty . shake the pan a little .

column1: add chili flakes to the pan and shake .
column2: add pumpkin seeds to pan . add chili flakes to pan . shake pan until you hear the flakes popping .

column1: add chili flakes to the pan and shake .
column2: place some oil into a pot . add some seeds and let it get hot for a few minutes . sprinkle in some chili flakes until you hear a sizzling sound .

column1: add chili flakes to the pan and shake .
column2: take a pan on a stove . add some oil in to the pan . take some chili flakes . add the chili flakes in to the hot oil . hold the handle of the pan and shake it for the flakes to get mixed .

column1: add turmeric cumin and coriander powder to the pan and shake .
column2: pour the turmeric , cumin and coriander into the pan . gently lift the pan and slowly stir the oil and spice . keep stirring until the spice is fully mixed .

column1: add turmeric cumin and coriander powder to the pan and shake .
column2: add turmeric , cumin , and coriander powder to the pan . shake the pan to mix everything . use a spoon if it will help .

column1: add turmeric cumin and coriander powder to the pan and shake .
column2: gather the spices turmeric , cumin , and coriander . measure all spices out and place in small bowl . pour measured spices into heated pan on stove and gently shake pan . using a spatula then stir spices till they are blended good .

column1: add garlic ginger paste and onion    to the pan and stir .
column2: put the garlic and ginger paste into the pan . put the chopped onion into the pan . use a spoon to mix everything together .

column1: add garlic ginger paste and onion    to the pan and stir .
column2: take some ginger and garlic . make the ginger and garlic in to a paste . take an onion and cut them in to small pieces . add ginger garlic paste and onions in to the pan . mix everything with a spatula .

column1: add garlic ginger paste and onion    to the pan and stir .
column2: combine finely shopped garlic and ginger together to make a garlic ginger paste . add to the pan . chop red onion into small pieces . add to the pan .

column1: add lamb to the pan and stir .
column2: using a spatula slowly add the chopped lamb to the pan . use the spatula to stir the lamb .

column1: add lamb to the pan and stir .
column2: cook the ingredients in a hot pan . then add lamb to the pan . stir the lamb into the pan and cook while stirring .

column1: add lamb to the pan and stir .
column2: take your bowl of lamb and pour it into the pan . then take your stirring stick and mix the lamb together with the rest of the pan .

column1: add chili powder to the pan and mix .
column2: wait until the chicken is cooked . add the chili powder to the pan . mix together with chicken with a spatula .

column1: add chili powder to the pan and mix .
column2: sprinkle chili powder into the pan . use your wooden spoon to stir it up really good .

column1: add chili powder to the pan and mix .
column2: take a pan on a stove . take a tea spoon of chili powder . add chili powder in to the pan . take a wooden spatula . mix the chili powder with the ingredients in the pan .

column1: add chopped tomato to the pan .
column2: you 're going to cut your tomatoes into small cubes if you do n't have any cut up yet . put your tomato cubes into a small bowl . pour your tomatoes into the hot pan carefully since the steam coming out of pot will be hot .

column1: add chopped tomato to the pan .
column2: chop your tomatoes into small pieces and place in a bowl . pour the tomatoes into the pan . be careful to lower the bowl of tomatoes close to the pan before your pour them in so as not to spatter yourself with hot liquid .

column1: add chopped tomato to the pan .
column2: grab your bowl of chopped tomato . dump it into the pan that is cooking on your stove .

column1: add green chilies and garam masala powder to the pan and stir .
column2: take a pan on the stove . cut the green chilies in to small pieces . add the green chilies in to the pan . add garam masala powder in to the pan . mix everything with the wooden spatula .

column1: add green chilies and garam masala powder to the pan and stir .
column2: using your fingers , add a couple handfuls of green chilies over top of the mixture . you can use as many as your prefer . add a handful of garam masala powder . stir both chilies and powder into your mixture using a wooden spoon . once mixed evenly , remove spoon and place lid on pot .

column1: add green chilies and garam masala powder to the pan and stir .
column2: add green chilies to the pan . add garam masala powder to the pan . stir everything well with a spoon . put the lid on top of the pan .

column1: add coriander leaves to the pan .
column2: you are going to add the green leaves called coriander . mince it in between your hand and add to the cooking pot . make sure you are careful . the pot will be hot and warm . steam will be coming up from the pot . now grab your wooden spoon and stir all ingredients in your pot . set your spoon aside and turn off the stove by twisting the knob .

column1: add coriander leaves to the pan .
column2: add fresh coriander leaves to the pan . stir with a spoon . turn off the heat while you stir in the coriander .

column1: add coriander leaves to the pan .
column2: take a handful of fresh coriander leaves and sprinkle them over the top of the sauce . use a spoon to stir the leaves into the mixture and turn the heat off .

column1: combine rinsed black beans and refried beans heat and mix .
column2: put black beans in bowl . add one can of re fried beans . heat up for one minute and a half in microwave . then mix it up .

column1: combine rinsed black beans and refried beans heat and mix .
column2: put the beans in a strainer and run water through the beans to rinse them . move the beans into a solid bowl . add the refried beans and heat the bowl in the microwave for about 1:30 . mix the beans all together with a spoon .

column1: combine rinsed black beans and refried beans heat and mix .
column2: get you a big bowl . open the black beans and the refried beans ( ask an adult to help can openers can be sharp ) . then pour the black beans in the bowl and turn on the water and wash beans then pour the water out . be sure not to pour out the beans . then use a spoon to take the refried beans from the can and put them in the same bowl and mix it together with the spoon . then put it in the microwave and heat it for 1 minute and 30 seconds . then take spoonfuls and put it on to the shells .

column1: put beans onions chicken and cheese on the tortilla and fold it up .
column2: place your tortilla down on the table . with a spoon take your beans and put them onto the tortilla . take diced onions onto your beans . put chicken onto your onions . put cheese on top of your chicken .

column1: put beans onions chicken and cheese on the tortilla and fold it up .
column2: put beans on flour tortilla using a spoon . next , add onion , chicken and cheese using your fingers . fold the tortilla , bring in each side , fold over and tuck in the sides .

column1: put beans onions chicken and cheese on the tortilla and fold it up .
column2: take the tortilla on a flat surface . add the bean mixture in to the middle of tortilla . add cut pieces of onions in to the tortilla . cut the chicken in to small pieces and add it in to the tortilla . add the cheese on top of chicken and fold the tortilla .

column1: heat butter in a pan and fry the burrito .
column2: heat butter in a pan until melted . place 2 burritos in the pan to cook for a little while . turn the burritos over using tongs . cook until each side of of the burritos are lightly browned .

column1: heat butter in a pan and fry the burrito .
column2: turn on the stove burner to medium heat . put the butter in the pan and let it melt . place your burrito in the melted butter . when the burrito turns brown , flip them over carefully with some tongs . carefully use tongs to remove burrito from pan .

column1: heat butter in a pan and fry the burrito .
column2: put butter in pan a let it melt . put burrito in pan and let brown on one side . use tongs to flip the burrito and brown the other side . take burritos out of pan and put on a plate . keep repeating until all burritos are cooked .

column1: deep fry and flip the fish until golden brown .
column2: take a frying pan on the stove . add some oil in to the frying pan . heat the oil in the pan . add the fish in to the hot oil . fry the fish and flip till they are golden brown .

column1: deep fry and flip the fish until golden brown .
column2: use a spoon to spoon the oil onto the fish in the pan . let the fish cook for about two minutes on one side , then flip over . let the other side cook for two minutes and flip over again . cook for another two minutes .

column1: deep fry and flip the fish until golden brown .
column2: let the fish cook in the bubbling oil . use a spoon to scoop oil over the fish carefully . use a spatula to flip the fish .

column1: add flour salt pepper and fizzy water to a bowl and whisk .
column2: take a medium sized bowl . add some flour in to the bowl . add some pepper powder in to the bowl . add some fizzy water in to the bowl . whisk everything in the bowl .

column1: add flour salt pepper and fizzy water to a bowl and whisk .
column2: pour in flour salt pepper and fizzy water into a bowl . use a whisk to mix it all up carefully .

column1: add flour salt pepper and fizzy water to a bowl and whisk .
