column2: put plain flour into a large bowl . add some salt and pepper to the flour . pour some fizzy water into the flour , use a wire whisk to mix . mix until all of the lumps are gone . add a little bit more flour and whisk again .

column1: cut the white fish into pieces and season both the sides with little salt and freshly ground pepper .
column2: cut white fish into 1 inch cubes . season both sides of fish with some salt and ground pepper .

column1: cut the white fish into pieces and season both the sides with little salt and freshly ground pepper .
column2: season the fish pieces with salt and pepper . turn the fish pieces over and put salt and pepper on the other side .

column1: cut the white fish into pieces and season both the sides with little salt and freshly ground pepper .
column2: put cod on cutting board . cut cod into squares . season cod with salt and black pepper on both sides .

column1: add flour salt and pepper to a bowl and stir .
column2: take a bowl put some flour into it . put a bit of salt and pepper to the flour in the bowl . mix the ingredients in bowl with your fingers or fork .

column1: add flour salt and pepper to a bowl and stir .
column2: put your flour in a bowl . add quite a bit of salt and pepper to the flour . stir the ingredients together using your fingers , until they are mixed well .

column1: add flour salt and pepper to a bowl and stir .
column2: take a small bowl . add some flour in to the bowl . add some pepper powder in to the bowl . add some salt in to the bowl . mix everything in the bowl properly .

column1: heat some oil in a pan .
column2: pick up the bottle of sunflower oil and pour some into the pan . make sure the pan is about a quarter full . make sure the stove is on so the oil in the pan gets hot .

column1: heat some oil in a pan .
column2: using a whisk stir the mixture . put some oil into the pan . dip the shrimp into the flour .

column1: heat some oil in a pan .
column2: take a pan on the stove . heat the pan . take some oil in a jar . add the oil in to the pan . heat the oil in the pan .

column1: coat the fish pieces with flour and batter and place in oil .
column2: dip the fish into flour being sure to get it on both sides . then dip the fish into the batter . after it is covered in batter , place the fish into the frying pan .

column1: coat the fish pieces with flour and batter and place in oil .
column2: heat up the skillet with oil in it on the stove top . take a piece of fish and dip it in flour so that both sides of the fish are coated . then take the flour coated fish and dip it in the batter so that both sides are coated in batter as well . then slowly and carefully place the fish in the hot oil to cook . repeat steps with the other pieces of fish .

column1: coat the fish pieces with flour and batter and place in oil .
column2: dip fish pieces into flour , then into the batter . put the battered fish into the hot oil . repeat until all fish pieces are coated .

column1: remove the fish and drain the oil .
column2: use a spoon and scoop out the fish one piece at a time . put the fish on a paper towel .

column1: remove the fish and drain the oil .
column2: get a slotted spoon . spoon out a piece of fish and put it on a plate that has a paper towel on it . spoon out all the fish onto the paper towel and let the oil drain off the fish .

column1: remove the fish and drain the oil .
column2: use a spoon to scoop the fish out of the pan . set onto a paper towel on a plate and drain the oil out .

column1: plate the fish with fries .
column2: remove the fish from the paper towels . set them on the plate in an attractive way next to the fries .

column1: plate the fish with fries .
column2: use your hands to grab the fish and fries . lay the fries on one side and the fish on the other side not touching .

column1: plate the fish with fries .
column2: put the cooked fish and french fries onto a plate . put them on the plate neatly .

column1: add paneer cubes to a pan with hot oil and saute till golden brown .
column2: add paneer cubes to the pain with hot oil . use a spoon to stir the cubes until they are a golden brown . remove from the pan and drain off all the extra oil .

column1: add paneer cubes to a pan with hot oil and saute till golden brown .
column2: grab the bowl with the paneer cubes and gently pour them into the pan with the oil . take your large spoon and stir them around until they look golden brown . carefully remove the paneer cubes with your large spoon and put them back in the bowl .

column1: add paneer cubes to a pan with hot oil and saute till golden brown .
column2: add the paneer cubes to the oil in the pan . stir the paneer cubes until they are golden brown . drain all extra oil from the pan .

column1: add black cumin seeds to the same pan and let it sizzle .
column2: add the black cumin seeds to the hot pan . stir with the spoon and let them sizzle .

column1: add black cumin seeds to the same pan and let it sizzle .
column2: add black cumin seeds to the pan . let the seeds sizzle in the pan and mix them around the pan .

column1: add black cumin seeds to the same pan and let it sizzle .
column2: pour a small amount of oil into a pan on the stove . turn the heat on . use a spoon to add cumin seeds to the pan . use the spoon to stir the cumin seeds in the oil . let the cumin seeds sizzle there for a little while .

column1: now add cinnamon stick whole cloves bay leaf and black cardamom stir it .
column2: to your hot pan , add cinnamon stick , whole cloves , a bay leaf and black cardamom . stir to be sure all the ingredients are heated .

column1: now add cinnamon stick whole cloves bay leaf and black cardamom stir it .
column2: add whole cloves and bay leaves to the hot pan . then add black cardamom . using a plastic spoon , stir the ingredients in the oil .

column1: now add cinnamon stick whole cloves bay leaf and black cardamom stir it .
column2: put the cinnamon stick , whole cloves , bay leaf and black cardamom in the pan . use a spoon to stir the spices .

column1: add sliced onions and saute add turmeric powder and 1 tbsp of garam masala little salt and stir .
column2: hold the container of onions over the pan and slowly pour them into the pan . mix them around with a spatula while they cook . add turmeric powder and 1bsp garam masala and salt . mix everything together with spatula .

column1: add sliced onions and saute add turmeric powder and 1 tbsp of garam masala little salt and stir .
column2: put the sliced onions into the frying pan and stir them with a spatula until they turn a light brown color . be careful not to cook the onions to long . add a small spoons worth of turmeric powder and 1 tablespoon of biryana masala powder with a measuring spoon . continue to mix the onions with your spatula and pour a small amount of salt onto the onions .

column1: add sliced onions and saute add turmeric powder and 1 tbsp of garam masala little salt and stir .
column2: add sliced onions and saute them until browned in oil in the hot pan . use a spoon to stir them . add turmeric powder , 1 tbsp of garam masala , and a little salt . stir everything with the spoon .

column1: add the marinated vegetables into the pan and mix evenly to cover the veggies .
column2: add marinated vegetables to the wok with the grilled onions . mix the vegetables with a spatula . add more salt to the wok . continue to mix the ingredients with the spatula .

column1: add the marinated vegetables into the pan and mix evenly to cover the veggies .
column2: put vegetables in pan with meat . mix with spatula so veggies and meat are mixed . add a little bit of salt . stir . leave on heat until ready .

column1: add the marinated vegetables into the pan and mix evenly to cover the veggies .
column2: add the vegetables into the pan . use your stirring spoon to evenly cook the vegetables . add a pinch or two of salt if needed .

column1: cover it with lid and let it cook until the veggies are the done .
column2: cover up the mixture . cook it on the stove until you feel like it is almost , but not quite done cooking . ( the reason for this is because later it will go into the oven ) .

column1: cover it with lid and let it cook until the veggies are the done .
column2: fill the hot pan with vegetables . cover the pan . cook until vegetables are 3/4 of the way done .

column1: cover it with lid and let it cook until the veggies are the done .
column2: cover the pan with a lid . let the vegetables continue to cook . leave the lid on until the vegetables are about 3/4 of the way finished .

column1: add paneer cashews walnuts tomatoes and little yogurt    and mix it evenly .
column2: add cashews , add paneer . add tomatoes , fresh . add some fresh yogurt . mix it evenly and gently .

column1: add paneer cashews walnuts tomatoes and little yogurt    and mix it evenly .
column2: take your bowl of paneer and pour it into the pan . add cashews . then add walnuts . add the cut tomatoes to the pan . finally , add a little yogurt and stir the pan so everything is even .

column1: add paneer cashews walnuts tomatoes and little yogurt    and mix it evenly .
column2: hold the container of ingredients over the pan . carefully pour in the paneer cashews walnuts tomatoes . scoop out a little yogurt with a spoon and put it in the pan . mix everything with a spatula .

column1: spray cooking oil on the bottom and side of the baking dish .
column2: take some oil in a spray can . take a large baking dish . spray oil on bottom of baking dish . spray oil on one side of baking dish . spray oil on other sides of baking dish .

column1: spray cooking oil on the bottom and side of the baking dish .
column2: grab a baking dish and cooking spray . spray the bottom and sides evenly with cooking spray .

column1: spray cooking oil on the bottom and side of the baking dish .
column2: take a pan that can be put in oven out of the cupboard . get the spray can of oil . press the nozzle on top . make sure that you spray all sides and bottom of pan .

column1: put a layer of    rice to the bottom of the dish and sprinkle little garam masala over it .
column2: take a small bowl . put a layer of rice to the bottom of the dish . take some garam masala powder in to a bowl . sprinkle the garam masala powder on the rice . cover the rice with the garam masala .

column1: put a layer of    rice to the bottom of the dish and sprinkle little garam masala over it .
column2: pour three large spoonfuls of rice to your glass bowl , covering the bottom of the dish . take a small spoonful of garam masala and sprinkle it over the rice .

column1: put a layer of    rice to the bottom of the dish and sprinkle little garam masala over it .
column2: there will be 3 layers of rice . split it into even layers before your start . put the first layer down . then sprinkle a little garam masala . it 's spicy so be careful if you do n't want it too spicy .

column1: put a layer of veggies on top of it and sprinkle fried onions over the veggie layer .
column2: you want to scoop your vegetables out of the pan and place it into your dish . add a layer of vegetables using half of your cooked vegetables . now take some of your fried onions and carefully sprinkle and spread them across your layer of vegetables .

column1: put a layer of veggies on top of it and sprinkle fried onions over the veggie layer .
column2: take your spoon and take vegetables and put them on top . make two layers of vegetables on top . take some fried onions from your bowl and lightly sprinkle them over the top of the vegetables .

column1: put a layer of veggies on top of it and sprinkle fried onions over the veggie layer .
column2: add half of your vegetable mixture into the pot with the rice on the bottom . generously add the vegetables using a big spoon gently to the rice . now sprinkle the fried onions using your fingers . add just a few pinches of the fried onions on top of the vegetables .

column1: repeat the same layers again .
column2: repeat the same layers . press in the layers the same way .

column1: repeat the same layers again .
column2: turn on the oven and set the dial to 400 . wait for the oven to beep to know that it 's ready . evenly spread a thin layer of rice and pat it gently with a spoon or spatula . evenly sprinkle 1 teaspoon of ground masala . evenly spread a layer of veggies , and then a layer of onion . evenly spread a final layer of rice over the top .

column1: repeat the same layers again .
column2: add rice over vegetables . add masala over rice . add vegetable layer over rice . add rice layer over vegetables .

column1: sprinkle saffron oil over it and finally top it with fried onions and cilantro .
column2: drizzle saffron oil over dish . top with friend onions and cilantro .

column1: sprinkle saffron oil over it and finally top it with fried onions and cilantro .
column2: drop oil over it . put white onion on top . put fresh cilantro on top .

column1: sprinkle saffron oil over it and finally top it with fried onions and cilantro .
column2: slowly drizzle or sprinkle the saffron oil across the top of your dish . it does n't have to cover every spot , just spread it around leaving some areas white and untouched . now take your fried onions and spread them around the top of the dish as well . last , you will spread cilantro across the top of your dish also .

column1: cover the dish and put it into a 400deg preheated oven for 40 min .
column2: turn oven on to 400 degrees f and allow to preheat . put pan in preheated over and bake for about 40 minutes . keep an eye on it , so it does n't burn .

column1: cover the dish and put it into a 400deg preheated oven for 40 min .
column2: turn the dial of the oven to 400 and wait until it beeps . put the cover on the dish . put carefully put the dish in the oven .

column1: cover the dish and put it into a 400deg preheated oven for 40 min .
column2: take the lid for your dish and set it on top of your dish . make sure it gets on there straight and has a good seal . now remember , you are going to want to have your oven preheated to 400 degrees and once it is preheated , we will bake our dish for 40 minutes .

column1: mix some chili powder salt turmeric powder and tomato paste on a plate .
column2: mix everything together . roll them in the mixture . ready to cook . cook turmeric .

column1: mix some chili powder salt turmeric powder and tomato paste on a plate .
column2: put a spoonful of tomato paste on the plate . add a spoonful of chili powder to the plate . add a spoonful of salt to the plate . add a spoonful of turmeric powder to the plate . mix all of the ingredients together on the plate .

column1: mix some chili powder salt turmeric powder and tomato paste on a plate .
column2: have the plate in front of you . add a teaspoon of chili powder . then put a little bit of salt , turmeric powder with the chili powder . then add some tomato paste to the plate . mix the dry ingredients with the tomato paste .

column1: coat the halal hotdogs with the mixture on the plate .
column2: roll in mixture . dab on plate . ready to cook .

column1: coat the halal hotdogs with the mixture on the plate .
column2: take hotdogs and mixture on a plate . apply the mixture to the hotdogs by rolling them . coat the hotdogs properly . repeat the same with all of the hotdogs . the coating is done .

column1: coat the halal hotdogs with the mixture on the plate .
column2: roll the hotdogs into the mixture on the plate . coat them all evenly .

column1: put the hotdogs in the pan and let them grill on the pan .
column2: place the pan on the stove . turn the dial so the heat is turned on and wait a few minutes for the pan to become hot . place the hot dogs one at a time into the heated pan . let the hot dogs cook in the hot pan .

column1: put the hotdogs in the pan and let them grill on the pan .
column2: put a fry pan on the stove top . heat the pan to medium - high . place the hotdogs in the hot pan . move them around so they cook evenly . they are done , when all sides are brown .

column1: put the hotdogs in the pan and let them grill on the pan .
column2: take each hot dog of the plate individually . place each one in hot pan . move around the hot dogs to make sure you cook all sides . use spatula to turn them . remove when golden brown .

column1: cut the hotdogs .
column2: remove the hotdogs from the pan . place them onto a plate . cut one of the hotdogs in half lengthwise . cut another hotdog in half diagonally , making logs . cut another hotdog into pieces , cutting it in half horizontally .

column1: cut the hotdogs .
column2: take the hotdogs from the hot skillet . cut each hotdog up . one hot dog will be cut the length of the hot dog . the next one will be cut 6 times at an angle . the 3rd one will be cut 7 times evenly .

column1: cut the hotdogs .
column2: turn off the stove . take one hot dog out of the pan at a time . hold the hot dog horizontally in front of you . using the knife , cut up and down until the hot dog is in several little pieces .

column1: cut tomatoes and place them in a bowl .
column2: use a knife to carefully slice cherry tomatoes in half . cut 3 pints of tomatoes . put them in a bowl .

column1: cut tomatoes and place them in a bowl .
column2: chop up 3 pts of cherry tomatoes with a knife . you can use either grape or cherry tomatoes . slice in half . roast in oven .

column1: cut tomatoes and place them in a bowl .
column2: put tomatoes on a cutting board . use a sharp knife to cut each tomato in half . after the tomatoes are sliced , then place them in a bowl .

column1: combine bulgur chickpeas tomatoes parsley oil salt lemon in bowl .
column2: take a large glass bowl . add some bulgur chick peas in to the bowl . add cut tomatoes and parsley in to the bowl . add some oil and salt in to the bowl . add lemon juice in to the bowl .

column1: combine bulgur chickpeas tomatoes parsley oil salt lemon in bowl .
column2: hold the plate of vegetables over the bowl . add all the bulgur chickpeas tomatoes . scoop some parsley with your hands . add the oil salt lemon to bowl .

column1: combine bulgur chickpeas tomatoes parsley oil salt lemon in bowl .
column2: use a spoon and scoop the tomatoes , onions and chickpea mixture . then add some parsley into the bowl . add salt and oil . then add some lemon juice to the bowl . use the stirring spoon to mix everything together in the bowl .

column1: transfer the ingredients to a plate .
column2: scoop the food onto a platter with a wooden spoon . taste it to see if there 's enough salt and pepper . add more salt or pepper til it tastes good to you .

column1: transfer the ingredients to a plate .
column2: mix the ingredients in a mixing bowl . take a large plate . take a large wooden spoon . transfer the ingredients in the bowl in to the plate . spread the contents in the plate evenly .

column1: transfer the ingredients to a plate .
column2: using a spoon scoop the ingredients into the plate . smooth out the ingredients onto the plate .

column1: spread the tomatoes on a baking sheet and add oil and salt .
column2: cut cherry tomatoes in half . place on a big baking sheet . drizzle olive oil over the tomatoes . add a big pinch of salt . shake the pan to move the tomatoes all around .

column1: spread the tomatoes on a baking sheet and add oil and salt .
column2: use a rimmed baking sheet . pour your tomatoes onto your baking sheet and give it a shake to spread them out . add about 5 tablespoons oil or more if you like . use your fingers to sprinkle some salt on the tomatoes . give it a good shake to make sure all the flavors come together .

column1: spread the tomatoes on a baking sheet and add oil and salt .
column2: spread the tomatoes on a baking sheet . pour about 5 teaspoons of olive oil all over the tomatoes . sprinkle the tomatoes with some salt . shake the baking sheet back and forth a little bit so the tomatoes get coated in the oil .

column1: slice a red onion .
column2: now take your red onion and cut the two end off of it with your knife . once the ends are removed , cut the onion in half . using the end of the knife , cut out the core of your onion . now we can dice the tomato into large strips of thing slices .

column1: slice a red onion .
column2: use a knife to slice a red onion . cut off the core at the bottom of the onion . roast the onion in the oven for about 15 minutes .

column1: slice a red onion .
column2: take a cutting board and a sharp knife . take a red onion and cut it in to two halves vertically . remove the peel from each half of onion . take one half of onion and cut it in to thin vertical slices . repeat the same with the other half of onion .

column1: cook the bulgur in a pot of boiling water .
column2: bring a pot of 2 cup of water to boiling on the stove . carefully , add your bulgur to the boiling water . get your pot lid and pot holder . using the pot holder , carefully put the pot lid onto the pot . simmer for 15 minutes .

column1: cook the bulgur in a pot of boiling water .
column2: get the pot to boiling by heating until the water is bubbling a lot . add the bulgur to the pot slowly and cook .

column1: cook the bulgur in a pot of boiling water .
column2: you carefully close the oven by pushing the handle with your hand . pour 2 cups of water into a pot and put the pot onto the stove with the heat turned up to high . once the water is boiling you very carefully pour the bulgur wheat into the water . cover the pot with a lid and boil the bulgur for about 15 minutes .

column1: add bulgur to a separate baking sheet .
column2: take a baking sheet . take a cup of bulgur . add the bulgur in to the baking sheet . gently move the baking sheet with the hand . spread the bulgur on to the baking sheet .

column1: add bulgur to a separate baking sheet .
column2: pour 1 cup of bulgur onto a baking sheet . spread the bulgur around the baking sheet evenly .

column1: add bulgur to a separate baking sheet .
column2: measure one cup of bulgur . pour the measured bulgur on a small metal baking pan . spread bulgur evenly on pan .

column1: roast both baking sheets in the oven .
column2: place the baking sheets into the over . close the over and let the sheets bake .

column1: roast both baking sheets in the oven .
column2: make sure your oven is preheated to the right temperature . get your pot holders . open the oven and put both backing sheets into the oven , one on each rack . be careful not to touch the oven . close the oven and let it roast .

column1: roast both baking sheets in the oven .
column2: place both baking sheets in the oven . roast the tomatoes and bulgur in the oven until it gets a very nice depth .

column1: add the sliced onions to the tomatoes in the oven .
column2: pull the cookie sheet with tomatoes out of the oven . add the sliced onions to the tomatoes on the sheet . stir the onions and tomatoes together . place back in the oven for 15 minutes .

column1: add the sliced onions to the tomatoes in the oven .
column2: take the cut up onion and put them with the little tomatoes on the same tray in the oven . you are going to leave them in the oven for 15 minutes .

column1: add the sliced onions to the tomatoes in the oven .
column2: take the tray of tomatoes from the oven . take an onion and cut the onion in to thin slices . add the onions in to the tray . take the tray and open the door of the oven . place the tray inside the oven .

column1: remove the bulgur from the oven .
column2: open the oven door carefully . using a pot holder or kitchen towel to protect your hand , take the pan of bulgur out of the oven .

column1: remove the bulgur from the oven .
column2: open the oven . holding an oven mitt , carefully remove the hot bulgur from the oven . close the oven door .

column1: remove the bulgur from the oven .
column2: grab a towel and put it over your hand . use the towel to grab the pan out of the oven .

column1: remove tomatoes from the oven .
column2: grab an oven mitten . carefully grab the tray with the tomatoes and onions .

column1: remove tomatoes from the oven .
column2: put on an oven mitt . take the tomatoes and onions out of the oven . set on the table top .

column1: remove tomatoes from the oven .
column2: using a hot pad remove the tomatoes from the oven . make sure they are cooked all the way .

column1: chop parsley .
column2: use a knife to carefully chop the parsley . continue to chop the parsley until it gets diced fairly small .

column1: chop parsley .
column2: put the parsley on a large cutting board . with a large knife , chop the parsley . continue chopping until the parsley is in small pieces , but is not crushed .

column1: chop parsley .
column2: find a large kitchen knife and a large cutting board . pile the parsley onto the cutting board . chop up the parsley into small pieces .

column1: put some olive oil in a pan and brown the ground beef .
column2: take a pan and keep it on the stove . add some oil in to the pan . heat the pan for few seconds . add the ground beef to the pan . cook the beef till it becomes brown .

column1: put some olive oil in a pan and brown the ground beef .
column2: put the pan in the stove . put the olive oil into the pan . add the ground beef into the oil . spread the beef evenly into the pan . cover the pan until the beef becomes brown .

column1: put some olive oil in a pan and brown the ground beef .
column2: pour some olive oil into a pan over high heat . place the ground beef into the pan . stir beef until it 's all completely brown .

column1: drain off the fat and transfer the meat into a bowl .
column2: use a slotted spoon and scoop up a spoonful of meat . hold the spoon over the pan for one second to let it drain , and then put the meat into a bowl .

column1: drain off the fat and transfer the meat into a bowl .
column2: wait for the meat to turn brown . with a large slotted spoon , scoop some meat out of the pan , and let the fat in the spoon drip into the pot . scoop the meat into a large bowl . repeat until all the meat has been scooped into the bowl , and the oil is left in the pan .

column1: drain off the fat and transfer the meat into a bowl .
column2: pick up the meat with a slotted spoon . shake lightly to drain the fat from the meat . put the meat into the bowl .

column1: add the chopped vegetables onions paseo pepper and salt .
column2: chop 1 onion and 1 pepper into small pieces . put in pan and add a little salt . put pan on burner . turn dial to 5 . cook , stirring with a wooden spoon , until onions are soft and see through .

column1: add the chopped vegetables onions paseo pepper and salt .
column2: place cut vegetables in your taco . put onions . paseo pepper . now salt to taste .

column1: add the chopped vegetables onions paseo pepper and salt .
column2: use a wooden spoon to scrape in the chopped onion , and the chopped pasillo pepper . add two pinches of salt to the pan . over the pan , turn the top of your pepper grinder about 10 times . stir the mixture with a wooden spoon . wait until the onions start to look more see - through .

column1: add cumin powder chili powder oregano cayenne pepper mix and cook .
column2: get a bowl . get cumin powder . get chili powder . get oregano . get cayenne pepper put all ingredients into the bowl stir the ingredients with a spoon put the bowl on the stove and turn the stove on .

column1: add cumin powder chili powder oregano cayenne pepper mix and cook .
column2: add 2 table spoon of cumin powder . a table spoon of chili powder . half a spoon of oregano . a small amount of cayenne pepper . stir together nicely and allow it to cook .

column1: add cumin powder chili powder oregano cayenne pepper mix and cook .
column2: add one tablespoon of cumin powder in to the pan . add one tablespoon of chili powder in to the pan . add half tea spoon of oregano in to the pan . add little cayenne pepper in to the pan . mix everything with a spoon .

column1: add tomato paste stir and cook .
column2: put the tomato paste in . mix it with a wooden spoon . let it cook longer but keep mixing it while it cooks more .

column1: add tomato paste stir and cook .
column2: add tomato paste to the pan . stir the mixture and the tomato paste together . let the ingredients heat up and cook in the pan .

column1: add tomato paste stir and cook .
column2: squeeze some tomato paste out of a tube . stir it in and cook for 3 - 4 minutes . stir every once in a while .

column1: add the browned beef to the spice mixture and stir everything together .
column2: the beef will be brown , put it in the pot . take the wooden spoon and mix everything really good .

column1: add the browned beef to the spice mixture and stir everything together .
column2: pour the browned meat into the spice mixture . stir it all together taking care not to spill .

column1: add the browned beef to the spice mixture and stir everything together .
column2: add the browned beef to the mixture in the pan . use your spoon to stir it together .

column1: add ketchup honey and sauce and water stir and simmer .
column2: add ketchup to the meat in the pan . then add a tablespoon of honey . add two tablespoons of salsa . next add some water to the skillet . mix together , cover and simmer for 20 minutes .

column1: add ketchup honey and sauce and water stir and simmer .
column2: add 1/2 cup of ketchup to the hamburger . add 1 tablespoon of honey . add 2 tablespoons of salsa . slowly add 1 and a 1/2 cups of water . stir to mix up the ingredients , turn the heat to low and cover and let cook for 20 minutes .

column1: add ketchup honey and sauce and water stir and simmer .
column2: add ketchup into the mixture . add honey also into the mixture . again add sauce into it . add water also into the mixture . stir all the ingredients to blend well and put the stove in simmer .

column1: open the lid stir and season .
column2: after 20 minutes , take off the lid . stir with the spoon . now take a small taste . add salt and pepper . stir it again with the spoon .

column1: open the lid stir and season .
column2: cook the meat covered for 20 minutes . take the lid off . add a little more salt . then add some more pepper .

column1: open the lid stir and season .
column2: remove the lid . be careful because some hot steam will rise out of the pan . add seasoning and stir .

column1: fill the taco shells and top with sour cream grated cheddar cheese and chopped lettuce .
column2: first get some shells . then fill it with a spoon full of ground beef . put sour cream on top . add just a sprinkle of cheese . put your cut up lettuce on top .

column1: fill the taco shells and top with sour cream grated cheddar cheese and chopped lettuce .
column2: put some meat into the shells . put some sour cream , cheese , and lettuce on top .

column1: fill the taco shells and top with sour cream grated cheddar cheese and chopped lettuce .
column2: first you want to set the taco shells on the plate . you 'll carefully add the meat into the shells . you can then pick any topping you would like . lets try adding some sour cream to each taco shell and then some grated cheddar cheese . last , lets put a little lettuce in the tacos .

column1: add pork and scallions to the wok .
column2: put the roast pork and scallions into the hot wok . use a spatula to mix together for two minutes .

column1: add pork and scallions to the wok .
column2: hold the cutting board over the wok . use the cleaver to scrape the pork into the wok . stir the pork into the rice with a spatula . use the cleaver to scrape the scallions into the wok . stir the scallions into the rice mixture with a spatula .

column1: add pork and scallions to the wok .
column2: use a spatula to scrape the roast pork off the board into the wok . mix a little with the spatula . scrape the scallions into the wok . stir it all together in the wok for 2 minutes .

column1: chop the scallions into small pieces .
column2: take a cutting board and a sharp knife . take some scallions on the board . cut the scallions in to small pieces . cut the scallions along the length . place the scallions aside .

column1: chop the scallions into small pieces .
column2: get a cutting board . grab scallions . grab a knife . chop into small pieces . put scallions aside .

column1: chop the scallions into small pieces .
column2: use a cleaver to cut the scallions into small pieces . be careful not to cut your fingers ! set the scallions aside .

column1: chop the pork into small pieces .
column2: take a cutting board and a sharp knife . take the pork on the board . cut the pork in to long strips . take each strip and cut it in to small pieces . repeat the same till the entire pork is cut in to small pieces .

column1: chop the pork into small pieces .
column2: use a knife to cut the pork . chop the pork into small pieces . set the pork pieces aside .

column1: chop the pork into small pieces .
column2: now chop the pork into small pieces , be careful and watch your fingers ! put them aside once you have them chopped into small pieces .

column1: pour peanut oil into the wok .
column2: get a soup spoon out of the drawer . put the spoon into the peanut oil . spoon the peanut oil into the wok . do this three times .

column1: pour peanut oil into the wok .
column2: hold the cup of peanut oil over the wok . use a scoop to scoop some oil out and pour it onto the wok .

column1: pour peanut oil into the wok .
column2: first , put the meat on a cutting board . take a sharp knife and cut the knife into small pieces . the add oil into the wok and add heat . then add the meat mixture into the wok . finally allow to cook and heat .

column1: pour soy sauce on the rice .
column2: pour soy sauce into the rice in the pan . use the spatula to the mix the soy sauce together with the rice .

column1: pour soy sauce on the rice .
column2: stir the rice in the wok with a large metal spatula . pour a few teaspoons of soy sauce onto the rice in the wok . stir the rice with the spatula to mix it in .

column1: pour soy sauce on the rice .
column2: pour some soy sauce onto the rice . mix it into the rice - this will make it more salty .

column1: add the eggs to the rice and stir .
column2: tap eggs to crack and break them into the pan with rice . stir it all together with a spatula .

column1: add the eggs to the rice and stir .
column2: crack two eggs into the rice in the wok . use a spoon to stir the egg into the rice . cook until the egg is well done .

column1: add the eggs to the rice and stir .
column2: gently tap an egg on the side of a pan until its shell cracks . hold the egg over the rice and use your thumbs to carefully pull the eggshells apart . throw the eggshell into the trashcan . do this again with another egg . use the spatula to gently stir the egg into the rice until the egg is fully cooked and all the liquid is gone .

column1: add rice and salt to the wok .
column2: hold the container of rice over the wok . use a spoon to scoop the rice out into the wok . pour some salt on the rice .

column1: add rice and salt to the wok .
column2: add the rice to the wok . using a stirring utensil , spread out the rice evenly in the pot . take salt and shake some out on top of the rice . using the stirring utensil , stir the rice .

column1: add rice and salt to the wok .
column2: put the rice in the pan with the large spoon . next , stir the rice .

column1: sift some flour and baking powder and salt in a large bowl .
column2: put a strainer over a large bowl . add the flour , baking powder and salt to the strainer . gently shake the strainer to strain the dry ingredients into the bowl . this is done so that the ingredients are well mixed together for the batter .

column1: sift some flour and baking powder and salt in a large bowl .
column2: place the sifter on top of a large bowl . pour flour , baking powder , salt and sugar in the sifter . lift the sifter and shake it over the bowl so flour , baking powder , salt and sugar falls into the large bowl .

column1: sift some flour and baking powder and salt in a large bowl .
column2: grab a large bowl and a wire fine mesh noodle strainer . place strainer on top the of the bowl . add the following ingredients to the strainer flour , baking powder , salt and sugar . shake strainer over the bowl so all of the ingredients drop into the bowl . once all of the ingredients have been shaken into the bowl , add milk .

column1: add an egg and some milk and whisk everything quickly .
column2: add an egg to the dry ingredients and butter . then add milk to the ingredients in the bowl . mix the ingredients immediately and quickly so the butter does not have time to solidify .

column1: add an egg and some milk and whisk everything quickly .
column2: crack an egg in a cup and look for shells to take out . take your milk and put it in the cup with your egg . grab a spoon to stir it all together really fast . try not to spill !

column1: add an egg and some milk and whisk everything quickly .
column2: take an egg and then ready to break . add the egg into the flour . then add the milk into the egg and the flour . then mix them together for 5 minutes .

column1: pour small portions of the mixture to a medium heated pan .
column2: find a 1/4 cup measuring cup . put a skillet on a burner on top of the stove , put a tablespoon of margarine in it , and turn the burner on medium heat . let the margarine melt in the pan . fill the 1/4 cup measuring cup with the mixture . gently pour the mixture from the measuring cup into the skillet .

column1: pour small portions of the mixture to a medium heated pan .
column2: grab a 1/4 cup measuring cup . fill it with pancake mixture . slowly poor the mixture into one corner of the skillet and continue doing that 3 times . make sure to leave room to flip . watch until all bubbles are gone then they are ok to flip .

column1: pour small portions of the mixture to a medium heated pan .
column2: make sure the pan is heated on medium heat . take a small measuring cup and fill it with the pancake mix . pour the small mixture into the pan to make mini pancakes .

column1: flip the pancakes over when the bottom is ready .
column2: make sure your oven is on medium to high heat . when you see little air bubbles all over your pancake , use your spatula to flip your pancakes to the other side . this side will go a little quicker .

column1: flip the pancakes over when the bottom is ready .
column2: put heat on medium to medium high heat . put pancake batter in pan . let pancakes cook on this side . flip the pancakes . once flipped , the other side cooks faster .

column1: flip the pancakes over when the bottom is ready .
column2: put your pancake batter into pan . put heat on medium to medium high . cook until you see bubbles form in the batter . flip the batter . second side cooks faster then first side .

column1: spread butter and drizzle syrup on the pancakes .
column2: spread 1 tablespoon of butter on top of the hot pancake . spread it until it is all melted . drizzle a little syrup from the container onto the pancakes .

column1: spread butter and drizzle syrup on the pancakes .
column2: put pancakes onto plate . spread butter on each pancake . put butter on top . grab the maple syrup . pour maple syrup over pancakes .

column1: spread butter and drizzle syrup on the pancakes .
column2: take a little scoop of butter on a fork and start spreading on the first pancake using the wrong end of the fork . repeat on all your pancakes to get good butter coverage . take your syrup bottle and slowly poor onto the top of pancakes . a little goes a long way .

column1: finely chop small head of cabbage and put it in a bowl .
column2: get a cutting board , a large mixing bowl , and a large chopping knife . put the cabbage on the cutting board and chop it up into small pieces , as small as you can get it . put the cabbage in the large mixing bowl .

column1: finely chop small head of cabbage and put it in a bowl .
column2: chop the head of cabbage into small pieces . take the pieces of cabbage and place them in a bowl .

column1: finely chop small head of cabbage and put it in a bowl .
column2: get a small head of cabbage and a knife . chop the cabbage into thin slices , as thin as you can . put the cabbage into a bowl .

column1: grate 2 medium to large carrots .
column2: take a plate . take a grater on the plate . take two carrots and remove the peel . grate a carrot on to the plate . repeat the same with another carrot .

column1: grate 2 medium to large carrots .
column2: grab a grater and a plate . grate 1 large or 2 medium carrot over the plate .

column1: grate 2 medium to large carrots .
column2: put a grater over a plate . carefully hold one end of the carrot to grate . grate two medium carrots completely .

column1: add grated carrots to the cabbage and 1 tbsp of himalayan pink salt .
column2: now take your bowl of shredded carrots and pour them into your bowl of cabbage . take 1 tablespoon of himalayan pink salt and lightly sprinkle it into your mixture of cabbage and carrots . if you only have kosher salt , use 2 tablespoons .

column1: add grated carrots to the cabbage and 1 tbsp of himalayan pink salt .
column2: put grated carrots and one tablespoon of himalayan pink salt to the cabbage . if you use kosher salt , use two tablespoons .

column1: add grated carrots to the cabbage and 1 tbsp of himalayan pink salt .
column2: add grated carrots to the cabbage . next add 1 tablespoon of himalayan pink salt to the cabbage and carrots .

column1: add 1 tsp of fennel or kummel seeds and 1 tbsp of organic coconut sugar .
column2: pour in a tea spoon of fennel in a bowl . pour in a table spoon of organic coconut sugar in the bowl .

column1: add 1 tsp of fennel or kummel seeds and 1 tbsp of organic coconut sugar .
column2: add 1 teaspoon of fennel . add 1 tablespoon of organic sugar .

column1: add 1 tsp of fennel or kummel seeds and 1 tbsp of organic coconut sugar .
column2: get a spoon that says 1 tsp . add 1 spoon of fennel or kummel seeds into the bowl . get a spoon that says 1 tbsp . add one spoon of coconut sugar into the bowl .

column1: massage all the ingredients together and mix .
column2: using your hands , squeeze and mix all of the ingredients together . juices will come out of the ingredients .

column1: massage all the ingredients together and mix .
column2: make sure your hands are clean . put your hands into your ingredients and mix together .

column1: massage all the ingredients together and mix .
column2: wash your hands very well with warm water and soap . reach into the bowl and squeeze the ingredients together . squeeze hard enough so the juices get squeezed out into the bowl . then let the bowl of ingredients sit on the counter for a couple of hours .

column1: transfer the mixture to another bowl press it to the bottom and stick it .
column2: take the bowl and put the mix into a bigger bowl . use your hands to press the mixture together . push it until it sticks together .

column1: transfer the mixture to another bowl press it to the bottom and stick it .
column2: now slowly pour the mixture from your bowl into a larger mixing bowl . you can just slowly pour out your mixture using your hand to help and pieces stuck . then just slowly pack the mixture into the new bowl by using your hand to push down on top of it . this will help make it stick together in the new bowl .

column1: transfer the mixture to another bowl press it to the bottom and stick it .
column2: move the mixture to a new bowl . smush it on the bottom and make it stick .

column1: take a plate and put it on top of the mixture and place something heavy on top .
column2: take a plate and cover the sauerkraut with the plate . put something heavy on top of the plate .

column1: take a plate and put it on top of the mixture and place something heavy on top .
column2: take a plate and cover the ingredients in the bowl . place something , anything that is heavy on top of the plate to hold it down .

column1: take a plate and put it on top of the mixture and place something heavy on top .
column2: grab your smaller plate and slowly set it on top of your mixture in the mixing bowl . it may be easier to flip your plate over . now push down on the plate and find a heavy object to set on top of the plate . several jars in your kitchen may be just the right size and weight for this . a mason jar of water is a great example .

column1: cover it up with cling film and let ferment .
column2: cover your jars with plastic wrap . allow them to sit outside for 1 to 2 days or until sour to taste .

column1: cover it up with cling film and let ferment .
column2: put all ingredients in a large bowl and cover them with plastic wrap ( two layers of plastic wrap will help ) . this will have to sit outside for 24 - 48 hours or until it is sour .

column1: cover it up with cling film and let ferment .
column2: cover everything up with plastic wrap . make sure it is covered with the liquid . let it sit outside for 1 to 2 days .

column1: clean shrimps by peeling off tail and skin and devein the shrimp .
column2: pull the shell of the shrimp off including its legs , tail , and outer shell . make a small cut in the middle of the back of the shrimp using a knife . use your fingers to open the cut wider and pull out the black vein completely out .

column1: clean shrimps by peeling off tail and skin and devein the shrimp .
column2: clean shrimp by peeling the tail and skin off . devein the shrimp by cutting the back and taking out it 's guts .

column1: clean shrimps by peeling off tail and skin and devein the shrimp .
column2: peel tail and skin off shrimp . devein the shrimp by running your knife along the edge of the shrimp . use your clean fingers to open up the shrimp and pull the shrimp 's digestive tract out , which will look like a long , grayish tube .

column1: boil water and add shiitake mushroom and steep till rehydrated .
column2: heat up the water until it bubbles up . carefully drop the mushrooms in the bubbling water until they get soft .

column1: boil water and add shiitake mushroom and steep till rehydrated .
column2: fill a pot half full of water . heat the water on a burner set to medium - high ( 7 ) . when the water starts to bubble , add the mushrooms . turn the burner down to medium - low ( 4 ) . remove the mushrooms with a slotted spoon when they are soft and puffy .

column1: boil water and add shiitake mushroom and steep till rehydrated .
column2: bring water to a boil . add your shiitake mushrooms to the boiling water . let the mushrooms soak until they are rehydrated .

column1: finely chop green onions .
column2: place the onions on a flat surface so you can cut them . use a sharp knife and cut the onions into very small pieces . make sure there are no chunks of onion when you are finished .

column1: finely chop green onions .
column2: put green onions on a cutting board . use a sharp knife to cut the green onions into very small pieces .

column1: finely chop green onions .
column2: carefully hold the onion . cut the onion slowly and carefully without getting too close to your hand .

column1: take off the skin of shallots and finely mince .
column2: pick up a sharp knife . put a cutting board on the kitchen counter . make a cut in the shallot using the knife . peel the skin off of shallot . cut the shallot in very tiny cubes .

column1: take off the skin of shallots and finely mince .
column2: peel the skin off of the shallots . cut up the shallots into very small pieces so that there are no big chunks .

column1: take off the skin of shallots and finely mince .
column2: cut the ends off the shallots with your knife . take the knife to the skin and slice the skin . with your hands take the skin off the shallots . with a knife cut the shallots lengthwise . again with a knife cut the shallots lengthwise .

column1: drain out the water chestnuts and finely mince them .
column2: drain the water out of your chestnuts . put them on a cutting board . with a large , sharp knife , slice them . once they are sliced , chop them in the other direction . chop them again until they are very small pieces .

column1: drain out the water chestnuts and finely mince them .
column2: take your water chestnuts can and use a can opener to open them . push down on the water chestnuts lid and drain the water out . cut your water chestnuts with a knife lengthwise . cut your water chestnuts with a knife by going up and down with your knife .

column1: drain out the water chestnuts and finely mince them .
column2: after you open a can of water chestnuts , drain the water off of them . get out a cutting board and a sharp knife . chop up the water chestnuts very small and keep cutting it with your knife until it 's in tiny pieces .

column1: grate garlic and ginger drain the water from rehydrated shiitake mushroom and finely chop them .
column2: have an adult grate your garlic for you or show you how . get 1 teaspoon of the ' tiny cut ' or grated garlic , dried out mushrooms , and water . put 2 dried mushrooms in water until they feel like a squishy piece of play dough . use a plastic knife to cut the mushrooms or have an adult cut for you . add the garlic , ginger , and mushrooms to a bowl .

column1: grate garlic and ginger drain the water from rehydrated shiitake mushroom and finely chop them .
column2: grate the ginger in to small pieces . grate the garlic in to small pieces . take a shiitake mushrooms and soak it in water . drain the water and take a knife . cut the mushrooms in to small pieces .

column1: grate garlic and ginger drain the water from rehydrated shiitake mushroom and finely chop them .
column2: get a grater , a cutting board , and chopping knife . grate the garlic and ginger . ( ginger is easier to grate when it is frozen ) . drain the water from the shiitake mushrooms once they are rehydrated . squeeze the water out of the mushrooms . using the chopping knife and cutting board , chop up the shiitake mushrooms into very small pieces .

column1: rinse the shrimp with water and finely chop .
column2: rinse the shrimp off the platter with water . use a knife and carefully cut up the shrimp into small pieces .

column1: rinse the shrimp with water and finely chop .
column2: rinse the shrimp off with water . using a sharp knife , finely chop the shrimp .

column1: rinse the shrimp with water and finely chop .
column2: put the shrimp in a strainer and hold it under the faucet with cold water . drain the shrimp . cut all the pieces of shrimp into tiny pieces .

column1: in a bowl combine ground pork shrimps green onions shallots ginger and garlic shiitake mushrooms and water chestnuts .
column2: take a bowl and add ground pork in it . add shrimps in to the bowl . cut the green onions in to small pieces and add it in to the bowl . add small pieces of shallots , ginger and garlic pieces in to the bowl . add shiitake mushroom pieces and chest nut pieces in to the bowl .

column1: in a bowl combine ground pork shrimps green onions shallots ginger and garlic shiitake mushrooms and water chestnuts .
column2: add the ground pork into a bowl . cut the shrimp into small pieces and add to the pork . use a kitchen shear or herb scissors to cut small strips of green onions . add to the meats . cut the shallot in half and peel the outer layer off . next , cut the shallot into small cubes . add to the bowl with the other ingredients . peel the ginger by scraping off its outer layer with a spoon . place the garlic on the cutting board . hold the knife in one hand while the knife rests sideways on the garlic . be careful and hit the knife to peel the garlic . chop the garlic and ginger into small pieces . keep chopping until it seems like the pieces are n't getting smaller . slice the shiitake mushrooms into thin strips . now , turn the strips and cut them the opposite way to make small cubes . cut the water chestnuts into the same size pieces .

column1: add shaoxing wine sesame oil soy sauce salt sugar white pepper and an egg and mix .
column2: add water chestnuts , the shaoxing wine , sesame oil , soy sauce , salt , sugar , white pepper and 1 egg . mix it all up with your hands . when it 's all mixed ... .

column1: add shaoxing wine sesame oil soy sauce salt sugar white pepper and an egg and mix .
column2: add shaoxing wine to the bowl . next add sesame oil and soy sauce . then add salt , sugar and white pepper . finally , add an egg to the bowl . using your hands mix all of the ingredients in the bowl together .

column1: add shaoxing wine sesame oil soy sauce salt sugar white pepper and an egg and mix .
column2: in the large bowl add the shaoxing wine . add the sesame oil and soy sauce . add the salt and pepper . add the sugar . crack an egg open and add to the ingredients . mix it all up with your hands .

column1: add cornstarch to the mixture and mix .
column2: add cornstarch into your bowl . mix contents of bowl with your hand .

column1: add cornstarch to the mixture and mix .
column2: use a scoop and put some cornstarch in the mix . use your hands and rub everything together so it blends together .

column1: add cornstarch to the mixture and mix .
column2: take a medium sized bowl . take the mixture in the bowl . take two tablespoons of cornstarch . add corn starch in to the mixture . mix the corn starch and the mixture with the hand .

column1: place a tsp of the filling in the center of the dough and add water to the edge .
column2: make sure you have a teaspoon , not a tablespoon . scoop up one teaspoon of filling . put the filling exactly in the middle of the dough . dip your fingers in water . dab some water on the dough , around the filling .

column1: place a tsp of the filling in the center of the dough and add water to the edge .
column2: put the filling into the dough using a spoon . take water with your fingers and put the water around the edge .

column1: place a tsp of the filling in the center of the dough and add water to the edge .
column2: take a small flat piece of dough . take a filling in a bowl . place the filling in the center of the dough . take some water in a bowl . water the edges of the dough .

column1: fold the pot sticker and pleat the edges .
column2: fold the pot sticker in half and then take with your fingers , make 6 to 8 small folds evenly around the edge . flatten the bottom of the pot sticker with your hand .

column1: fold the pot sticker and pleat the edges .
column2: while your wonton is open on the cooking board , make sure there is n't too much stuffing . then fold in half so that the edges meet . then , press the edges so they seal and begin to carefully pleat . then inspect your wonton to make sure it is secure by tapping the bottom .

column1: fold the pot sticker and pleat the edges .
column2: fold the wrapper of the pot sticker in half . press the edges together while leaving small areas overlapping .

column1: place pot stickers in a pan pour chicken broth and cover .
column2: add pot stickers to hot pan . pour chicken broth into pan until it reaches halfway up the pot stickers . cover the pan with lid . cook for around 3 minutes .

column1: place pot stickers in a pan pour chicken broth and cover .
column2: take your pot stickers and gently set them into the heated pan . now pour chicken broth into the pan , so that it covers half way up the pan or the pot stickers . now take the cover we have on over the pan and let the stickers steam for about 3 minutes .

column1: place pot stickers in a pan pour chicken broth and cover .
column2: place pot stickers evenly over the pan . slowly pour the chicken brother until it 's halfway up the pan . cover with a lid .

column1: take the cover off add oil and fry .
column2: add pot stickers to pan with broth , cover and cook about 3 minutes . remove cover and cook until broth disappears . add oil to pan . cook until golden on one side , flip with tongs and cook again til golden brown on one side .

column1: take the cover off add oil and fry .
column2: take cover off with oven mitt . cover will be hot . how much oil to add .

column1: take the cover off add oil and fry .
column2: slowly pull off the lid . let the pan bubble up and it will fry .

column1: cut up the vegetables into thin strips .
column2: take the veggies and hold them carefully . cut them into thin strips or lines .

column1: cut up the vegetables into thin strips .
column2: take your knife . cut up each vegetable into very thin strips .

column1: cut up the vegetables into thin strips .
column2: take some garlic and carrot . take a cutting board and a knife . cut the garlic in to very thin long strip pieces . cut the carrot in to four halves . cut the each half of carrot in to very thin strips pieces .

column1: cook the spinach in hot water and then place in cold water .
column2: take some ice water in a bowl . cook spinach in a bowl . place the cooked spinach in to the cold water . place them for one min . remove spinach from ice water in to a plate .

column1: cook the spinach in hot water and then place in cold water .
column2: cook the spinach in a pan with hot water . move the spinach with tongs into a bowl of ice water .

column1: cook the spinach in hot water and then place in cold water .
column2: clean the spinach first . put the cleaned spinach in hot water and make it blench for 1 minute . take the spinach and put it in the cold water . it will become little crunchy .

column1: add the garlic to a pan .
column2: take a flat pan and place it on the stove . set the stove dial to the desired temperature . grab a garlic . carefully slice the garlic into tiny pieces with a knife . throw the pieces into the pan .

column1: add the garlic to a pan .
column2: using three fingers , grab a pinch of garlic . sprinkle the garlic into a pan .

column1: add the garlic to a pan .
column2: get a small amount of garlic . put it into the pan .

column1: cook the vegetables in the pan .
column2: cut different types of vegetables into small pieces . put all the vegetables into the pan . add some water in order to cook the vegetables . cover the pan with lid and wait for almost 10 minutes . check whether the vegetables become soft , then its cooked .

column1: cook the vegetables in the pan .
column2: put all the vegetables into the pan . heat them until they are cooked .

column1: cook the vegetables in the pan .
column2: add a bit of oil to the pan . add a little bit of salt to the pan . add vegetables to the pan . stir the vegetables using tongs .

column1: cook the meat in the pan .
column2: put meat into a separate pan . cook the meat until done .

column1: cook the meat in the pan .
column2: be sure to cook the meat and the eggs separately . this prevents cross contamination of your food .

column1: cook the meat in the pan .
column2: clean the meat and make it ready to cook . add oil in a pan . add meat into the oil to cook . cover the pan using lid and allow chicken to cook .

column1: fry an egg in the pan .
column2: take a pan and place it on stove . heat the pan . take an egg and break open the egg . pour the egg on the pan . fry the egg on the pan .

column1: fry an egg in the pan .
column2: break an egg and put it on the pan . let it cook and it will get white instead of clear .

column1: fry an egg in the pan .
column2: heat a separate pan . fry and egg in the hot pan .

column1: put the ingredients in the bowl .
column2: cut the carrot in to thin strips . cut the cucumber in to thin slices . boil the spinach . take a medium sized bowl . add all the ingredients in to the bowl .

column1: put the ingredients in the bowl .
column2: put your ingredients into a bowl using your hands . you can arrange them however you want .

column1: cut carrot and cabbage roughly .
column2: use your knife to cut carrots into thin sticks . use your knife to cut the cabbage into big pieces .

column1: cut carrot and cabbage roughly .
column2: cut carrot into slices . then cut carrot slices into thin sticks . cut cabbage in big sections . turn cabbage . cut again in big sections .

column1: cut carrot and cabbage roughly .
column2: cut carrots into sticks or circles . cut cabbage into big chunks .

column1: take the seeds of a bell pepper and cut it to pieces .
column2: scoop the seeds of the pepper out . cut the seeds into small pieces .

column1: take the seeds of a bell pepper and cut it to pieces .
column2: using a spoon , push out the white center piece holding all the seed inside of the pepper out . using a knife , slice the pepper into strips .

column1: take the seeds of a bell pepper and cut it to pieces .
column2: use a knife to cut the bell pepper in half . tear out the seeds and white inner part of the pepper , and set them aside . use the knife to slice the rest of the pepper into thin slices .

column1: chop a white onion to pieces .
column2: put an onion on a cutting board . peel off all of the outer papery skin . ask an adult to help with using the knife . cut the ends off of the onion and put them in the trash . chop the onion into small pieces .

column1: chop a white onion to pieces .
column2: chop the white onion thinly . be sure to use a knife when slicing the onion .

column1: chop a white onion to pieces .
column2: take a peeled onion and place it on a chopping board . carefully take a sharp knife and cut the onion into small slices .

column1: heat some oil in a pan .
column2: put the pan on top of the stove , and turn the burner to medium . then , add the vegetable oil . turn the pan in different sides so the oil runs and covers most of the surface .

column1: heat some oil in a pan .
column2: take a pan and keep it on stove . take some oil in a bowl . add oil in to the pan . on the stove . heat the oil on the pan .

column1: heat some oil in a pan .
column2: carefully place the pan on the stove . turn the stove top dial to medium . add vegetable oil to the pan .

column1: cook the meat in it .
column2: slice the meat into thin strips , we like to use pork but you can use chicken or beef as well . warm up a spoon of butter into a pan . add the meat to the butter and cook until slightly brown .

column1: cook the meat in it .
column2: carefully cut the meat into thin slices , about 2 inches in length by 1/4 inch wide . pour 1s tablespoon of oil in non - stick skillet and heat until slightly smoking . add meat strips , using tongs , and keep turning them until brown .

column1: cook the meat in it .
column2: heat oil in a pan . next add meat to the hot pan . cook the meat until done .

column1: add the chopped vegetables .
column2: put your onions into your pan . put your carrots into your pan . put your peppers into the pan . with your tongs mix the vegetable together . put cabbage into the pan .

column1: add the chopped vegetables .
column2: first cook your meat in a skillet . next add your hard vegetables , like pepper and carrot , to the skillet . use tongs to move the meat and vegetables around the skillet . next add your soft vegetables like cabbage to the skillet .

column1: add the chopped vegetables .
column2: after the meat is fully cooked in the pan , add your chopped vegetables . be careful , the oil may cause the water in the vegetables to spit  " and steam . use tongs and wear an apron to protect from the spitting oil . " " . " cook the vegetables in the pan with the meat . stir the vegetables around the pan so they will be cooked all the way through without burning .

column1: add the boiled udon noodles .
column2: cook vegetables until they are soft . once the vegetables begin to soften add in your udon noddles . continue to cook , stirring constantly .

column1: add the boiled udon noodles .
column2: wash your hands and kitchen counter . find all ingredients and chop necessary vegetables . heat the fryer with a small amount of oil . ( make sure adult is supervising ) . add vegetables slowly in the hot fryer ! ( be careful ) . when the vegetables are a little bit soft , add the udon noodles until hot , remove from heat ! enjoy !

column1: add the boiled udon noodles .
column2: when the vegetables are just soft , add the udon noodles . stir carefully with tongues .

column1: cook everything well and season with bonito flakes and ginger to serve .
column2: mix everything together . place it on a plate by using tongs . you can if you want to put bonito flakes on top of your dish . you can also put ginger on top of your dish .

column1: cook everything well and season with bonito flakes and ginger to serve .
column2: stir the noodles and vegetables in the pan to finish cooking them . get a serving plate and serving tongs . take a serving from the pan and place it in the middle of the plate . get a spoonful of bonito flakes and place them on top of the plated serving . get a small of clump of pickled ginger and place it on top of the plated serving .

column1: cook everything well and season with bonito flakes and ginger to serve .
column2: use tongs to remove the noodles from the pan and place on a serving plate . top the noodles with bonito flakes and pickled ginger .

column1: remove the shrimp from the pan .
column2: use a scoop to remove the shrimp from the pan . place the shrimp onto a plate .

column1: remove the shrimp from the pan .
column2: use a spatula to lift the fried shrimp out of the oil . put the fried shrimp on a plate .

column1: remove the shrimp from the pan .
column2: using a slotted spoon to scoop . scoop up the shrimp and let the oil drain out .

column1: add flour eggs baking soda salt and pepper to the bowl and stir .
column2: pour in flour into a large bowl . then add 2 eggs to the bowl . add baking soda , salt and pepper . use a whisk to stir the mixture together .

column1: add flour eggs baking soda salt and pepper to the bowl and stir .
column2: add flour , eggs , baking soda , salt and pepper to the bowl . use your whisk to stir them up good .

column1: add flour eggs baking soda salt and pepper to the bowl and stir .
column2: now take out your flour and add it into the bowl . next we will add the eggs . the next step is to add the baking powder , salt , and black pepper . now stir all of the ingredients together with a whisk .

column1: place the shrimp into a pan of hot oil .
column2: pour oil into a pan , put pan on stove , turn stove on , heat oil until oil has bubbles . put shrimp into hot oil , let shrimp sit in oil for 3 minutes . turn the shrimp over with a spatula . let shrimp fry another 3 minutes . take shrimp out of the oil .

column1: place the shrimp into a pan of hot oil .
column2: take the shrimp and place it into the hot oil . fry 4 pieces of shrimp at a time .

column1: place the shrimp into a pan of hot oil .
column2: mix flour , baking soda , salt , black pepper . add ice cold water to the mixture . immerse shrimp in the mixture . remove shrimp and dip into the bread crumb , make sure shrimp is completely covered . fry in oil that is already on medium heat .

column1: add cold water to the bowl and stir .
column2: add ice cold water to the bowl and stir with a large whisk . once the water in mixed in , add more ice cold water and continue to mix with the whisk . ice cold water is used to make a crisp batter . continue to add ice cold water and mix until the batter is smooth and as thin as you want it . if you want spicy tempura batter , you may add chili powder .

column1: add cold water to the bowl and stir .
column2: add some cold water to the bowl . use the whisk to stir the bowl mixing all of the ingredients . add more water as needed as you stir .

column1: add cold water to the bowl and stir .
column2: hold a cup of cold water over the bowl . pour the water in slowly . stir everything with a whisk .

column1: cover the shrimp in the batter and breadcrumbs .
column2: dip the shrimp into the batter so it is coated completely . take the covered shrimp and dip it in the breadcrumbs until it is fully coated .

column1: cover the shrimp in the batter and breadcrumbs .
column2: hold the shrimp by the tail . dip the shrimp in the batter first . dip the shrimp in the breadcrumbs after .

column1: cover the shrimp in the batter and breadcrumbs .
column2: place a bowl with the batter and a bowl with bread crumbs on the work counter . place the shrimp on the counter near the bowls . dip the first shrimp completely in the batter . place the dipped shrimp in the crumbs and coat it completely . repeat with the remaining shrimp .

column1: cut the salmon fish meat into thin slices .
column2: cut the large piece of salmon in half . next cut the salmon into thin slices .

column1: cut the salmon fish meat into thin slices .
column2: take your knife . cut the salmon into thin slices with the knife .

column1: cut the salmon fish meat into thin slices .
column2: take a cutting board and a knife . take a salmon piece on the board . cut the salmon in to rectangle shaped piece . cut the salmon in to very small thin slices . repeat the same till the entire salmon is cut in to thin slices .

column1: stuff the sushi rice inside the meat slice and place them on a baking sheet in a row .
column2: cut the meat in to a thick slice . take the sushi rice . place the rice in the meat slice and stuff it . close the meat slice and stick the sides . repeat the same with 4 other meats and place them in a row on a baking sheet .

column1: stuff the sushi rice inside the meat slice and place them on a baking sheet in a row .
column2: put the sushi rice inside of the salmon . put the slices onto a baking sheet in straight rows .

column1: using blow torch cook outer layer of the meat .
column2: ignite the blow torch . keep torch 4 -6 inches from meat . gently fan the flame across the meat evenly .

column1: using blow torch cook outer layer of the meat .
column2: place the salmon onto a heat proof dish such as a baking sheet . turn your blow torch on . carefully move the flame from the torch around the top of the salmon until it starts to brown slightly .

column1: using blow torch cook outer layer of the meat .
column2: with your parent 's supervision , find a cooking torch . lay out the meat . carefully turn on the cooking torch , facing away from you . turn the torch to the meat . cook the outside layer of the meat until no longer raw .

column1: brush some soy sauce on top and plate them .
column2: grab a brush . dip the brush into the soy sauce . paint the salmon until it 's covered with the sauce . once they 're covered . place them on a plate to serve .

column1: brush some soy sauce on top and plate them .
column2: put the soy sauce in a small bowl . get a pastry brush and dip it into the soy sauce . brush the tops of the fish with the soy sauce . make sure each piece has been brushed . pick them up and put them on a serving plate .

column1: brush some soy sauce on top and plate them .
column2: after cooking , use a brush to add soy sauce to each piece . put each piece carefully on a plate with your hand .

column1: garnish the salmon with a little sushi rice fish roe and thick soy sauce .
column2: take the salmon on a plate . with the help of chop sticks , add sushi rice on top of salmon . add fish roe on sushi . take some thick soy sauce in a bottle . add soy sauce on to the salmon .

column1: garnish the salmon with a little sushi rice fish roe and thick soy sauce .
column2: take a tiny bit of the sticky rice and place it in the center of each piece of salmon . add one fish egg to the top of the rice . then squeeze the thick soy sauce in a zig zap pattern over the whole plate .

column1: set it aside on a plate lined with a paper towel .
column2: line a serving plate with a paper towel . use tongs to take the bacon out of the pan . put the bacon on the paper towel lined plate to drain .

column1: set it aside on a plate lined with a paper towel .
column2: fry the meat in the pan . fry on both sides till they are golden brown . take a plate and line it up with paper towel . remove the meat from the pan . place it aside on the paper towel .

column1: set it aside on a plate lined with a paper towel .
column2: place a plate down with a clean paper towel on top . grab a pair of tongs . use the tongs to pick up the bacon . gently shake the extra grease from the bacon . move over to paper towel lined plate .

column1: spread a generous layer of mayonnaise over the second piece of toast .
column2: use a butter knife to get some mayonnaise on it . spread the mayonnaise around the bread .

column1: spread a generous layer of mayonnaise over the second piece of toast .
column2: set the second piece of toast on a plate . take a knife and apply a layer of mayo to the toast .

column1: spread a generous layer of mayonnaise over the second piece of toast .
column2: take a butter knife and scoop up lots of mayo with it . spread the mayo evenly over the bread covering it nicely .

column1: slice it in half and serve .
column2: place the top of the bread on the sandwich . use your knife to cut the sandwich in two pieces . place the sandwich on a tray and serve it .

column1: slice it in half and serve .
column2: place the top half of the bread on top of the sandwich . slice the sandwich in half with knife . ready to serve .

column1: slice it in half and serve .
column2: prepare the sandwich . take the sandwich on a plate . take a knife . cut the sandwich in to two halves . transfer it to serving plate .

column1: place the bacon on 1 piece of toast followed by the tomato and iceberg lettuce .
column2: take 2 pieces of white bread and lightly toast them . take 2 pieces of cooked bacon and lay it on one piece of bread . then , take 2 tomato slices and place it on top of the bacon . take 2 pieces of iceberg lettuce and place it on top of the tomato .

column1: place the bacon on 1 piece of toast followed by the tomato and iceberg lettuce .
column2: toast your favorite kind of bread . on one piece of bread place bacon strips to cover the piece . on top of the bacon strips , add sliced tomatoes . add pieces of your favorite lettuce on top of the tomato slices .

column1: place the bacon on 1 piece of toast followed by the tomato and iceberg lettuce .
column2: take one piece of toast on a plate . add some pieces of fried bacon on to the bread . cut the tomato and iceberg lettuce in to thin slices . add thin slices of tomato on to the bacon . add some leaves of iceberg lettuce on top of tomatoes .

column1: fry the bacon in a preheated pan over medium high heat .
column2: put the bacon into the pan using tongs . flip the bacon over using the tongs .

column1: fry the bacon in a preheated pan over medium high heat .
column2: turn the stove up to medium or halfway up on the knob . let the pan get hot for a bit . use tongs to grab and place the bacon in the hot pan .

column1: fry the bacon in a preheated pan over medium high heat .
column2: put a pan on the stove top and preheat the pan . add some bacon to the preheated pan . fry the bacon for about 4 - 5 minutes until it is crispy . use tongs to flip the bacon over and cook the other side .

column1: season the diced beef pieces with salt and pepper .
column2: sprinkle salt and pepper on both sides of the meat pieces . you will want to put salt and pepper on both sides of the meat .

column1: season the diced beef pieces with salt and pepper .
column2: take your salt and pepper and put it all around the cut up pieces of meat . make sure to spread it all around so it gets on all the meat .

column1: put the seasoned meat in a zip lock bag with flour and shake .
column2: place 1/3 cup of flower to a ziplock bag . put a handful of the meat into the bag with the flour and shake them around so they get coated in flower .

column1: put the seasoned meat in a zip lock bag with flour and shake .
column2: add 1/3 a cup of flower to bag . add chopped meat into bag with flour . close and shake bag to cover all the meat in flour .

column1: put the seasoned meat in a zip lock bag with flour and shake .
column2: place several cubes of beef into a bag of a third of a cup of flour . shake it around . cook well .

column1: cook some bacon in a pot once they brown take them out and put them into a bowl .
column2: put some bacon into a pan . once they become a brown color take them out of the pan into a bowl .

column1: cook some bacon in a pot once they brown take them out and put them into a bowl .
column2: put a pot on the stove . turn it on medium . add some bacon to the pan . let it cook down until there is some bacon oil in the bottom . take the bacon out of the pot and then add the meat to the bacon grease . let the meat cook until it turns brown on all sides . stir it around to get all the sides brown . use a spoon to get the meat out but leave the juice in the bottom of the pot . get the brandy and add a little bit to the bottom of the pot .

column1: cook some bacon in a pot once they brown take them out and put them into a bowl .
column2: place a pot on the stove and turn the heat to medium . keep a large bowl nearby . wait for the pot to get fully heated then add the bacon . once the bacon changes from red to fully brown on all sides use a large spoon to carefully move the bacon to the bowl .

column1: pour a mug of brandy to the pot and deglaze the pot later add some butter and olive oil .
column2: lift the pitcher of brandy and slowly pour into the pan . use wooden spoon to scrape the bottom of the pan to loosen . add butter and olive oil to the pan and keep stirring with wooden spoon .

column1: pour a mug of brandy to the pot and deglaze the pot later add some butter and olive oil .
column2: slowly pour a mug of brandy into the pan . stir the brandy around the pan try scrapping up the bits from the bottom . after your done stirring up the bits and brandy add butter and olive oil . slowly mix all the ingredient 's in the pot . now add the vegetables into the mixture .

column1: pour a mug of brandy to the pot and deglaze the pot later add some butter and olive oil .
column2: get an adult to help you with this step . slowly pour the measuring cup of brandy to the pot , stirring the whole time with a wooden spoon . the alcohol in the brandy will produce a strong smelling steam . you will want an adult to do this part . make sure to scrape the brown bits from the bottom of the pan and keep mixing for a few more minutes . it should start turning into a creamy looking sauce . add some butter and olive oil to loosen up the rest of the brown bits and pieces while stirring . make sure to add the oil and butter slowly and carefully .

column1: add some diced carrots leeks onions and garlic to it and cook until they become soft .
column2: cut up carrots , leeks , onion and garlic . add to hot pot . stir every few minutes with a wooden spoon until the veggies are soft .

column1: add some diced carrots leeks onions and garlic to it and cook until they become soft .
column2: pick up the plate containing the carrots , leeks , onions , and garlic . move it above the pot . tilt the plate down and with your hand , push the carrots , leeks , onions , and garlic off the plate and into the pot . mix the contents of the pot with a wooden spoon until all the vegetables are soft .

column1: add some diced carrots leeks onions and garlic to it and cook until they become soft .
column2: add cut up carrots , leeks , onion and garlic to the pot . cook until the vegetables are soft .

column1: add some tomato paste seasoned beef meat the cooked bacon and beef stock .
column2: put the bacon back in the pot . add a number of different herbs and spices . ground cloves is one of the spices used .

column1: add some tomato paste seasoned beef meat the cooked bacon and beef stock .
