column2: after the sauce is done , add the veggies and cook them for a few minutes . add the tomato paste to the vegetable mixture . cook the mixture long enough to where all the vegetables are very soft . after the vegetables are cooked down to where they are soft , add the meat and the bacon back into the pot , mix all together . you will need an adult to help add the wine . add beef stock , mix together and cook on the stove for 20 minutes . after 20 minutes . put on oven mitts and put the lid on the pot and place whole pot in the oven . cook in the oven for an hour .

column1: add some tomato paste seasoned beef meat the cooked bacon and beef stock .
column2: put the bacon into the pot again . add some tomato paste . add the meat . pour in some beef broth .

column1: add cloves bay leaves thyme parsley and wine to it and cook .
column2: put your ground cloves , bay leaves , thyme , and parsley to your pot of meat and vegetables . pour in a bottle of wine and your beef stock on top . put on the lip to your pot . let sit and cook .

column1: add cloves bay leaves thyme parsley and wine to it and cook .
column2: take the cloves and put them in the pot with the stew . take the bay leaves and put them in the pot with the stew . take the thyme and parsley and put them in the pot with the stew . pour wine from the bottle into a measuring cup and then pour the wine from the measuring cup into the stew . heat up the mixture on the stove and stir with the wooden spoon .

column1: add cloves bay leaves thyme parsley and wine to it and cook .
column2: first add ground cloves , and bay leaves to the pot . next add a lot of thyme and a lot of parsley . then add a bottle of wine to the pot . cook on low heat .

column1: add some fried onions and mushrooms and mix .
column2: add fried onions and mushrooms to pot . mix everything together .

column1: add some fried onions and mushrooms and mix .
column2: fry onions in the oil . cut the mushrooms in to small pieces . fry the mushrooms in the oil . add the fried onions and mushrooms in to the pot . mix them with the contents in the pot .

column1: add cream of chicken soup margarine and colby cheese and mix the ingredients .
column2: get a baking pan and large wooden spoon . open a can of cream of chicken soup and put it in the baking pan . melt 1/4 cup of butter or margarine in a small bowl . ( a 1/4 cup butter is equal to half a stick of butter ) . add the melted butter to the baking pan . add 2 cups of grated colby cheese .

column1: add cream of chicken soup margarine and colby cheese and mix the ingredients .
column2: add 1 can of cream of chicken soup to the bottom of the pan . add 1/2 of melted margarine . add 2 cups of chopped colby cheese . use a spatula and mix the ingredients together .

column1: add cream of chicken soup margarine and colby cheese and mix the ingredients .
column2: add one can of cream of chicken . add half stick of melted margarine or butter . add two cups of grated colby cheese .

column1: add diced onion salt and black pepper and mix .
column2: chop half an onion . add half a teaspoon of salt . add half a teaspoon of ground pepper . mix until its all mixed up .

column1: add diced onion salt and black pepper and mix .
column2: use and small spoon that says tsp . add spoons of the diced onion salt and black pepper . mix everything up .

column1: add diced onion salt and black pepper and mix .
column2: cut an onion in half with a knife . cut one of the halves of onion into slices , then cutting the onion slices into little pieces . add the cut up onion to the mixture . take a teaspoon measuring spoon and fill to the rim with salt . add salt to mixture . take a half teaspoon measuring spoon and fill to the rim with pepper . add pepper to mixture . take a big spoon and stir the mixture for a minute or two , mixing everything up .

column1: add shredded hash brown and mix the ingredients .
column2: put shredded hash brown into the pan . use your hands to mix the hash browns with the sauce .

column1: add shredded hash brown and mix the ingredients .
column2: thaw out 26 oz of frozen hash browns . pour into casserole dish . mix well with clean hands .

column1: add shredded hash brown and mix the ingredients .
column2: add two pounds of thawed hash browns to your mixture . open a second bag of hash browns and measure if there are not two pounds in one bag . take your hands or a stirring spoon and mix the hash browns with the sauce until the hash browns are covered in sauce .

column1: put the hash brown mixture in the oven .
column2: grab the pan with the has browns . put it in the oven .

column1: put the hash brown mixture in the oven .
column2: carefully place the casserole in a pre - heated oven . it may be easier for you to put it in and take it out if you put the casserole dish on a cookie sheet first . set the timer for the time it will take the casserole to bake . when the timer rings , using oven mitts or potholders on both hands , carefully remove the casserole from the oven and turn the oven off . do n't touch the casserole as it will be very , very hot !

column1: put the hash brown mixture in the oven .
column2: put the hash brown mixture into the oven . after it comes out of the oven , the hash brown mixture should look golden .

column1: crush some garlic into small pieces .
column2: get out a knife or chopper tool . use the knife or chopper and cut the garlic into little pieces .

column1: crush some garlic into small pieces .
column2: put the garlic on a chopping bored . chop the garlic into tiny pieces with a knife or a food chopper .

column1: crush some garlic into small pieces .
column2: take 3 - 4 cloves of garlic . remove the skin of the garlic . crush the cleaned garlic using a chopper or a knife .

column1: cut soft tofu into small cubes .
column2: get your knife . cut up the tofu into small cubes .

column1: cut soft tofu into small cubes .
column2: place tofu on cutting board . cut it into big slices . rotate the knife and cut it into a checker board . then cut along the side of the block of tofu so it 's in cubes .

column1: cut soft tofu into small cubes .
column2: take some soft tofu . use a sharp knife to first cut the block of tofu into long stripes . think about how a tic tack toe board is lined up . make the long lines first . then cut the short lines . the final step would be to then cut those sections once in the middle .

column1: heat some oil in a pan .
column2: place a wok on your stove top . pour 2 tablespoons of oil into the wok , lift the wok and turn it to get the oil to spread around the wok .

column1: heat some oil in a pan .
column2: pour some oil in the pan . heat up the pan .

column1: heat some oil in a pan .
column2: pour the oil into the pan . turn on the stove top burner on and heat the oil . spread the oil around the bottom of the pan .

column1: add the minced garlic and some chili paste .
column2: take a pan and add some oil and heat it . cut the garlic in to very small pieces . add the garlic in to the pan . fry the garlic for a minute . add a tablespoon of chili bean sauce in to the pan .

column1: add the minced garlic and some chili paste .
column2: add some finely chopped garlic to the oiled pan . add some chili paste to the frying garlic . mix the ingredients well .

column1: add the minced garlic and some chili paste .
column2: cut up the garlic into tiny pieces and add to the hot oil . fill one tablespoon just to the top of the spoon with chili paste . add the chili paste to the hot oil .

column1: add some minced pork and stir fry .
column2: fry the onions with a little bit of oil and soy sauce . take the pork out of the bag . add the pork to the pan where the sauce is . use a spoon or spatula to stir the pork . turn the stove off when the pork does n't look pink anymore .

column1: add some minced pork and stir fry .
column2: pour the minced pork into the hot pan . use a spatula to stir the pork and try to break it into pieces while it cooks .

column1: add some minced pork and stir fry .
column2: make sure that your pan is nice and hot and the oil is bubbling a little . add the pork and stir carefully with a plastic spoon . keep stirring until the meat starts to turn brown .

column1: add the cut tofu in and add some water and stir .
column2: take your tofu and add it all to the pan with the meat . use a spoon to gently mix the tofu and meat together . measure out 1 cup of water with a measuring cup . add the water to the tofu and meat . gently stir the water , tofu , and meat together .

column1: add the cut tofu in and add some water and stir .
column2: once the meat is just about brown all the way through , add your tofu that has been cut into cubes . use a kitchen spoon to stir the mixture . measure 1 cup of water and add to the pan as well and stir again .

column1: add the cut tofu in and add some water and stir .
column2: take the tofu on a cutting board . cut the tofu in to cube pieces . add the tofu to the cooking pan . add some water in to the cooking pan and mix . keep the lid and cook .

column1: season with some salt green leek and sesame oil .
column2: to thicken the sauce add the thickener ( cornstarch and water ) . stir the mixture to get it all mixed . add small pieces of onions which are just like onions . add some drops of sesame oil .

column1: season with some salt green leek and sesame oil .
column2: with your meat cooking add a little pinch of salt . add some green onions . add some sesame oil . then stir all together .

column1: season with some salt green leek and sesame oil .
column2: sprinkle salt on the food . add green leaks to the food . add sesame oil to the food .

column1: make round burger patties with ground beef using rolling pin and baking paper .
column2: put the baking paper over the top of the beef . use a rolling pin to roll the beef . use your hands to round the edges of the burger patty into the shape you want .

column1: make round burger patties with ground beef using rolling pin and baking paper .
column2: put a piece of parchment paper over the meat . take the rolling pin and gently roll it over to make it round . remove the paper and make it smooth with your finger tips . keep doing this until you have all of the burger patties you want to make .

column1: make round burger patties with ground beef using rolling pin and baking paper .
column2: take a hand full of hamburger meat and roll it in your hands until you get a ball . put a piece of wax paper , parchment paper , or plastic wrap put it on a counter , put the hamburger ball on top of the paper or plastic . take another sheet of the paper or plastic and put it on top of the meat . take your rolling pin and roll it over the meat ball until it is squished flat but do n't squish it to thin . take off the top paper and push the sides of the meat until you have a round circle of meat . place the meat you rolled out somewhere safe and clean and do what you just did again and again until you have as many as you want to make .

column1: grill the patties .
column2: take the uncooked patties and place them on the grill . grill the meat for 3 minutes . after 3 minutes , turn it over and grill the other side .

column1: grill the patties .
column2: lay the meat pieces flat on the grill . space them out a little . flip them and look for the black lines .

column1: grill the patties .
column2: slowly lay your patties onto the grill . just lower them on with your hands . be careful thought , as you do n't want to burn your hands . let the patties cook on each side for about 3 minutes on each side . you 'll want to flip them after 3 minutes as you will get nice char marks on them from the grills surface .

column1: place the patty pickles tomato ketchup and onions on the bun .
column2: place the hot patty onto the end of the bun . add pickles . add ketchup . a few sliced onion rings .

column1: place the patty pickles tomato ketchup and onions on the bun .
column2: use your spatula to gently place the meat patty to the bun . now you can add the thinly sliced pickles . then you can add some tomato ketchup . now you can place the rings of onions on top . the onions are sliced into rings and you can separate the rings and add it just like that .

column1: place the patty pickles tomato ketchup and onions on the bun .
column2: place the beef patty onto the bun . add some pickles to the patty . add ketchup over the pickles . then add two chopped onion rings .

column1: add mayo lettuce and tomato on the bun and put the buns together .
column2: add a spoon of mayonnaise into the bun . add a small amount of lettuce on top of the , mayo . cut small thin pieces of tomato on the bun . then place one piece of bun on top of the other bun .

column1: add mayo lettuce and tomato on the bun and put the buns together .
column2: use a spoon and scoop mayo on the bun . spread the mayo around the bun with the spoon . lay the lettuce and tomato on the bun neatly .

column1: add mayo lettuce and tomato on the bun and put the buns together .
column2: grab bun . get a tablespoon of mayo . spread mayo on bun . ad lettuce and tomato . put it all together .

column1: shred cabbage finely .
column2: hold the cabbage safely . take a knife and cut thin strips from the short end of the cabbage . keep cutting until the cabbage is in tiny shreds .

column1: shred cabbage finely .
column2: put napa cabbage on a cutting board . use a sharp knife to cut the cabbage into fine strips .

column1: shred cabbage finely .
column2: take a knife from the knife block . cut the cabbage in half lengthwise . using the knife make small ribbon - like cuts starting from the top of the cabbage working down to the base .

column1: drain the soaked shiitake mushroom discard the thick stem and chop the cap .
column2: buy dried chinese mushrooms or shiitake mushrooms . rehydrate the mushrooms by soaking them in water . cut off the tough stem . throw away the tough stem . cut the top , called a cap , into thin slices .

column1: drain the soaked shiitake mushroom discard the thick stem and chop the cap .
column2: now we are going to want to drain the shiitake mushrooms . take them out of the broth and let the juices fall back into the bowl . go ahead and give them a squeeze . now grab your knife and cut off the tough stem and then chop up the head / cap of the mushroom .

column1: drain the soaked shiitake mushroom discard the thick stem and chop the cap .
column2: take the shiitake mushrooms with the liquid in the bowl . squeeze the liquid from the mushrooms . take the mushrooms on a cutting board . remove the thick stem of the mushrooms . cut the cap of the mushrooms in to small pieces .

column1: mix cool water with cornstarch in a bowl .
column2: take a small mixing bowl . add some cold water in to the bowl . take a table spoon of corn starch in a bowl . add the cornstarch in the water . mix the water and corn starch .

column1: mix cool water with cornstarch in a bowl .
column2: to coat the rolls you will need to make a cornstarch glaze . you will need cool water . either refrigerate 1/2 cup water for 30 minutes or add ice to water to cool it then measure 1/2 cup of water . measure out 2/3 cup of cornstarch into a small bowl . place your cooled water into a larger bowl . using a whisk to stir , slowly add the cornstarch to the water . keep stirring the entire time so that there are no lumps . the mixture is ready all the cornstarch is added to the water in a smooth mixture .

column1: mix cool water with cornstarch in a bowl .
column2: fill a small bowl with cool water . slowly add cornstarch to the cool water . using a fork mix the cool water and cornstarch together . this will form a sort of glue .

column1: deep fry the egg rolls in a pan with hot oil until golden brown .
column2: slide in the egg rolls make sure they do not splash the oil everywhere . once the egg rolls sides are brown they are ready .

column1: deep fry the egg rolls in a pan with hot oil until golden brown .
column2: slide the egg rolls carefully into the frying pan . wait until the outside is golden brown . use the tongs to take the egg rolls out when cooked .

column1: deep fry the egg rolls in a pan with hot oil until golden brown .
column2: slide the egg rolls into the hot oil very carefully . fry them until they are browned on the outside . take them out with your tongs .

column1: wrap up the filling .
column2: put the wrapper on a cutting board . put about one tablespoon of filling on the wrapper . fold and roll the wrapper around the filling . use the corn starch mixture to apply to the edge of the wrapper and seal .

column1: wrap up the filling .
column2: place the mixture onto the wrap . roll up the wrap halfway . fold in both sides of the wrap . put liquid on the edges of the wrap to help it stick together .

column1: wrap up the filling .
column2: now we want to lay down the wrapper and turn it so it is a diamond shape . then take a teaspoon full of fillings and place it in your wrapper . now roll the wrapper halfway and then fold the edges inward . now roll it to just about the end . once there you can put some corn starch on the edges and seal the wrap .

column1: add all the vegetables except the bean sprouts and stir fry .
column2: carefully put all of the vegetables except the bean sprouts into the wok , the sprouts will be added later . stir the vegetables cooking in the wok often using tongs .

column1: add all the vegetables except the bean sprouts and stir fry .
column2: add vegetables into the frying pan . do not add the bean sprouts yet . stir the vegetable into the pan .

column1: add all the vegetables except the bean sprouts and stir fry .
column2: put all of the vegetables into the hot pan , except the bean sprouts . use tongs to toss the vegetables in the pan .

column1: cut bamboo shoots to similar shape and size of carrots .
column2: take a cutting board and a knife . add the thin strips of carrot in to a glass bowl . take some bamboo shoots . cut the bamboo shoots in to thin long strips . the carrot and bamboo in to similar pieces .

column1: cut bamboo shoots to similar shape and size of carrots .
column2: pour out the bamboo shoots . use a knife to carefully slice the shoots .

column1: cut bamboo shoots to similar shape and size of carrots .
column2: buy canned bamboo shoots which can be found in the asian aisle . drain the canned bamboo shoots . cut the bamboo shoots into thin strips about two inches long .

column1: cut the carrots to julienne .
column2: you will need to julienne the carrots . this means it needs to be cut into about a matchstick size . you can do this several ways , buying them pre - cut , you can use a knife and cut them by hand or you can buy a utensil that will julienne the carrot for you . there are also some food processors that will cut this way too .

column1: cut the carrots to julienne .
column2: use a knife to carefully chop the carrots . cut both ends off of the carrots and discard . cut into thin slices .

column1: cut the carrots to julienne .
column2: grab your carrots and put on a cutting board . cut the ends off of the carrots . next julienne the carrots which is nice thin slices . use a knife to cut into match stick like carrots . using a oxo julienne tool , anchor carrot with fork and pull tool away from fork will make nice thin slices .

column1: add bean sprouts to the same bowl with rest of the vegetables .
column2: grab the bean sprouts with your hand . throw in the bean sprouts to the same bowl of vegetables .

column1: add bean sprouts to the same bowl with rest of the vegetables .
column2: pinch off the bean sprout tails and discard them . add the bean sprouts to the bowl with the mixture .

column1: add bean sprouts to the same bowl with rest of the vegetables .
column2: use a sharp knife to cut the mushrooms . put the bean sprouts into the bowl .

column1: heat up a wok pan with little oil add ginger garlic paste green onion on low heat .
column2: heat up the frying pan . add oil to the pan . spread the oil around so it covers the pan . set to low heat . add ginger , garlic paste and green onions and stir together in the pan .

column1: heat up a wok pan with little oil add ginger garlic paste green onion on low heat .
column2: heat up a wok . add oil to the wok and let the oil get hot . add the chopped ginger , garlic paste and green onion to the wok , cooking them on low heat so they do n't burn . stir while cooking .

column1: heat up a wok pan with little oil add ginger garlic paste green onion on low heat .
column2: take a wok pan and heat the pan . add little oil in to the pan . add some ginger garlic paste in to the pan . add some cut green onion in the pan . cook them on a low heat .

column1: put the rolls on a baking plate and cover it with a plastic wrap and freeze them .
column2: pick up the rolls . put the rolls on the sheet with spaces in between them . rip off a piece of plastic wrap to cover the entire tray . press down the plastic wrap around all edges . pick them up and put them in the freezer .

column1: put the rolls on a baking plate and cover it with a plastic wrap and freeze them .
column2: place the rolls flat on a baking sheet . cover the sheet with plastic wrap .

column1: put the rolls on a baking plate and cover it with a plastic wrap and freeze them .
column2: grab a baking sheet . put the rolls inside the baking sheet . grab some plastic wrap . put the plastic wrap over the baking sheet . fold the plastic wrap down on the baking sheet .

column1: add the bean sprouts season with soya sauce and transfer everything on a baking sheet and spread them .
column2: put the bean sprouts into the pan and season with soy sauce . use tongs to mix . use the tongs to remove the vegetables from the pan and put on a baking sheet . spread the vegetables on the baking sheet and let cool . you can also prop up the baking sheet to drain extra oil .

column1: add the bean sprouts season with soya sauce and transfer everything on a baking sheet and spread them .
column2: take a pan on the stove . cook the vegetables in the pan . add bean sprouts in to the pan . add some soya sauce on to the pan . transfer everything on to the baking sheet and spread .

column1: add the bean sprouts season with soya sauce and transfer everything on a baking sheet and spread them .
column2: add in bean sprouts to the stir fry pan . add soy sauce . use the tongs to move the stir fry from the pan to the baking sheet . lift up the baking sheet at an angle so any unwanted liquid drains out .

column1: place the wings into the pot of hot oil and cook until fried .
column2: place the wings into the hot oil , but not all at once . a rack at the bottom of the oil pan keeps the chicken off the bottom of the pot . do small batches at a time , so you do n't lower the cooking temperature of the oil . do the drumettes separately from the wingettes , because the cooking time is a little different for each . continue until all the wings are cooked .

column1: place the wings into the pot of hot oil and cook until fried .
column2: set the wings a few at a time . gently set the wings into the pot . separate the wings by type of wing because they have different cooking times .

column1: place the wings into the pot of hot oil and cook until fried .
column2: now we are going to place the wings into the pot . the oil is very hot , so do n't touch it with your hands . we will try and fit all our drumettes in at once and let them fry . then we will fry our wingettes . total we will fry about 4 lbs of wings and they will cook for about 15 - 20 minutes in total .

column1: dry the chicken with paper towel .
column2: take a paper towel . using the paper towel and gently dab the extra moisture from the chicken wings . be sure that the chicken wings have been dried off .

column1: dry the chicken with paper towel .
column2: you will need a paper towel for the next part . take the paper towel and gently push on each of the chicken wings on both sides to dry them . you do n't have to pick up the wings . just do it while they are on the plan .

column1: dry the chicken with paper towel .
column2: fold up a paper towel . use the paper towel to pat all the chicken pieces dry .

column1: when the sauce starts to simmer gradually stir in the butter .
column2: wait for the water in the pot to begin to simmer . add 4 tablespoons of butter and whisk so it combines with the hot sauce .

column1: when the sauce starts to simmer gradually stir in the butter .
column2: wait until the sauce begins to bubble a little bit . drop in the butter into the sauce . use a whisk and mix everything with the whisk .

column1: when the sauce starts to simmer gradually stir in the butter .
column2: bring the sauce to a bare simmer - that means as soon as you see bubbles forming , we 're ready for the next step . from the fridge , grab the unsalted butter we measured out at the beginning . it should still be cold . add the butter into the sauce one slice at a time , and whisk it until it has melted completely . if you want a milder sauce , use twice as much butter . when all of the butter has been melted and stirred in , turn off the heat and let the sauce cool before we start putting it on the chicken wings .

column1: add the wings and sauce to a bowl and shake the bowl to coat the wings .
column2: add wings to a bowl . add sauce to a bowl . shake the bowl in order to evenly coat the wings .

column1: add the wings and sauce to a bowl and shake the bowl to coat the wings .
column2: get a big bowl and add the cooked chicken wings inside the bowl . pour the sauce in the bowl . shake and swirl / turn the bowl around to get the wings covered in the sauce .

column1: add the wings and sauce to a bowl and shake the bowl to coat the wings .
column2: take the tongs and use them to move the wings into a bowl . put the sauce into the bowl with the wins . shake the bowl . evenly spread the sauce over all the wings .

column1: separate and cut the chicken wing at the two joints .
column2: take the chicken wings in a plate . take a cutting board and a knife . now take one chicken wing piece , locate one joint and cut near the joint . separate the joint from the wing .

column1: separate and cut the chicken wing at the two joints .
column2: pull the chicken at the joint and it will pop . cut in between the bend . cut the other bend .

column1: separate and cut the chicken wing at the two joints .
column2: get a long kitchen knife . with the knife cut the skin over the two joints on the wing . bend the wing at the two joints to break the joints . use the knife to cut between the two joints . the wing will now be in three pieces . take the tiniest piece of each cut wing and put them in a bag and freeze them for later use .

column1: add red sauce to a sauce pan and heat to a simmer .
column2: get a small pan . add 1 cup of red sauce to the pan . turn the heat to medium low and heat the sauce until it bubbles just a little bit .

column1: add red sauce to a sauce pan and heat to a simmer .
column2: take a small sauce pan on to the stove . heat the sauce pan on a simmer . take a cup of red sauce to the sauce pan . add the red sauce in to the pan . heat the sauce in the pan .

column1: add red sauce to a sauce pan and heat to a simmer .
column2: pour one cup of the red sauce into a small pot called a saucepan . heat the pot on the stove so that the sauce bubbles just a little bit , which is called a simmer .

column1: cook bacon in a pot with oil and pepper .
column2: put chopped bacon into the pot . add a small amount of oil to the pot . sprinkle black pepper onto the bacon . use a wooden spoon to stir the bacon in the pot . cook the bacon until it starts to get crispy .

column1: cook bacon in a pot with oil and pepper .
column2: add pepper to the cured bacon or pork product . cook till done but not crisp .

column1: cook bacon in a pot with oil and pepper .
column2: put bacon into a pan . put oil on top of the bacon . put pepper on top of the bacon . use a spoon and mix together .

column1: mix eggs black pepper and cheese together .
column2: put 2 eggs , some black pepper , and fresh grated parmesan cheese into a small bowl . stir everything together and set the bowl aside . our bacon should already cooked .

column1: mix eggs black pepper and cheese together .
column2: crack two eggs into a bowl . add a little black pepper . put the cheese in the bowl as well . using a fork , mix it to break the egg yolks ( the yellow bits in the middle ! ) . add the rest of the cheese and mix it all together until it 's really thoroughly mixed up .

column1: mix eggs black pepper and cheese together .
column2: in a small bowl place two eggs , black pepper , and fresh parmesan cheese . whisk the ingredients well .

column1: cook the pasta in boiling water .
column2: while the pasta is boiling in the hot water , take your dipping spoon and take some of the hot water . add the hot pasta water to the pasta sauce mix you are making .

column1: cook the pasta in boiling water .
column2: get 6 ounces of pasta and put it in a pan of boiling hot water . let the pasta cook .

column1: cook the pasta in boiling water .
column2: wait until the water is hot and bubbling . put pasta in water to cook .

column1: add water from the pasta to the pan with bacon .
column2: take 2 ladles full of the water that the pasta is boiling in . add the ladles of water to the pan the bacon is in . gently mix the bacon and water in the pan .

column1: add water from the pasta to the pan with bacon .
column2: using a large ladle or measuring cup get about a cup of pasta water . add pasta water to pot .

column1: add water from the pasta to the pan with bacon .
column2: use a ladle to scoop a cup of water from the pasta , and add it to the pan with bacon . make sure that the heat is as low as it goes .

column1: add the pasta to the pan .
column2: cook small pieces of bacon in a pot . add black pepper . add cooked spaghetti .

column1: add the pasta to the pan .
column2: drain all the water from the pasta . add all the pasta to the pan with the bacon . mix the pasta gently so the sauce gets on all the pasta .

column1: add the pasta to the pan .
column2: take cooked spaghetti and add to pot . stir spaghetti with sauce in pan .

column1: mix in the egg mixture .
column2: mix . pour egg mix in bowl . keep stirring until creamy .

column1: mix in the egg mixture .
column2: get a wooden spoon . with the pasta in a bowl , move the pasta around in a circular motion . slowly pour the egg cheese mixture , while you stir the pasta in a circular motion with the wooden spoon . keep moving the pasta until the pasta becomes creamy .

column1: mix in the egg mixture .
column2: stir hot pasta mixture . once mixed add in the egg and cheese mixture . stir together the pasta and egg mixture . will form a creamy rich sauce for the pasta . make sure to keep stirring .

column1: mix in cheese .
column2: sprinkle your cheese on top of the noodles , use a spoon to stir it together . once it 's mixed in you 're ready to eat .

column1: mix in cheese .
column2: add half the cheese to your noodles . stir . add other half then stir again .

column1: mix in cheese .
column2: turn off your heat . put your cheese into your pan . take your spoon and mix your cheese in your noodles .

column1: pour some boiling water over the black fungus mushrooms .
column2: boil water in a teapot . carefully pour the boiled water over the mushrooms until they are covered .

column1: pour some boiling water over the black fungus mushrooms .
column2: pour water in a pot or kettle . place on stove and turn on , wait to boil . while waiting for water to boil , pour mushroom in a bowl . when water boils , pour the boiled water in the bowl . be sure hot water covers mushroom completely .

column1: pour some boiling water over the black fungus mushrooms .
column2: place dish with black fungus mushrooms on open area of counter . take tea kettle or small pot of boiling water off stove top . carefully pour boiling water onto the mushrooms . pour enough water into mushrooms dish so that they float .

column1: cut the chicken breast into thin slices and shred them into small pieces .
column2: use a knife to cut the chicken into thin slices . hold a slice with a fork and use another fork to tear the slice into small pieces . repeat with the remaining slices .

column1: cut the chicken breast into thin slices and shred them into small pieces .
column2: take a cutting board and a knife . take the chicken breast on the cutting board . cut the chicken breast in to thin slices by passing the knife horizontally . take each slice of chicken breast and cut it in to small pieces . repeat the same with all the slices .

column1: cut the chicken breast into thin slices and shred them into small pieces .
column2: take your 2 chicken breasts and place them on a cutting board . take your sharp knife and carefully slice the chicken breast into slices by pressing your hand on top of the chicken and sliding the knife underneath . then , cut the chicken at an angle until the chicken is in thin strips .

column1: add soy sauce corn starch and sesame oil and mix .
column2: add 3 tablespoons soy sauce to the chicken , mix by hand . add 3 table spoons corn starch to the chicken , mix by hand . add 1 teaspoon sesame oil and mix by hand . let marinade .

column1: add soy sauce corn starch and sesame oil and mix .
column2: add three tablespoons of soy to the chicken . afterward mix in three tablespoons of corn starch and add a drizzle toasted sesame oil .

column1: add soy sauce corn starch and sesame oil and mix .
column2: add the soy sauce to the bowl of chicken slices . mix in corn starch as well . add the sesame oil and mix it again . make sure you wash your hands after touching raw chicken - it can make you very sick if you do n't !

column1: cut the mushroom into little thin strips .
column2: stack mushrooms onto of one another . pinch them below where you will begin cutting . use back and forth motions with the knife to cut into strips .

column1: cut the mushroom into little thin strips .
column2: use a knife to carefully slice the mushrooms into thin strips . cut all of the mushrooms .

column1: cut the mushroom into little thin strips .
column2: take a small section of your mushrooms and stack them on top of each other . next , very carefully cut them into thin strips . do the same thing with the rest of the mushrooms in small sections .

column1: chop the tofu into small strips .
column2: take a cutting board and a knife . take a big brick of tofu . pass the knife vertically and cut the tofu . cut the tofu in to small strips . cut the entire tofu block .

column1: chop the tofu into small strips .
column2: place a cutting board and cheese knife on counter . place the block of tofu on the cutting board , wide side down . cut four strips of tofu keeping your fingers away from the knife blade . stack all four slices up . cut through all of the slices to make small strips of all the sliced tofu .

column1: chop the tofu into small strips .
column2: chop the tofu carefully with a knife into even slices . then turn the slices onto the side and chop them again . place them into the bowl afterward .

column1: slice the bamboo shoots into strips .
column2: drain an 8 oz can of bamboo shoots . cut the shoots into small strips .

column1: slice the bamboo shoots into strips .
column2: take a cutting board and a knife . take some bamboo shoots in a bowl . now cut the bamboo shoot in to thin strips . repeat the same with other bamboo shoots . take them in a bowl .

column1: slice the bamboo shoots into strips .
column2: open 8 oz . can of bamboo shoots . drain liquid from can using lid to keep pieces in can . empty bamboo shoots onto a cutting board . using a knife , slice all of bamboo shoots into small strips .

column1: boil the chicken stock and add the chicken mushroom tofu and the bamboo shoots .
column2: cook the chicken stock until it is boiling ( bubbles coming to the top ) . once it is boiling , carefully add in the chicken , mushrooms , tofu , and bamboo shoots . keep cooking until the chicken cooks .

column1: boil the chicken stock and add the chicken mushroom tofu and the bamboo shoots .
column2: put the chicken stock in a pan . wait until the stock is bubbling really fast . add the chicken mushroom tofu and the bamboo shoots .

column1: boil the chicken stock and add the chicken mushroom tofu and the bamboo shoots .
column2: get eight or nine cups of chicken stock . put all the cups of chicken stock into the cooking pot and turn the heat knob on the stove until the stove has a nice flame . wait until the chicken stock starts boiling . next , add four ingredients . chicken , mushroom , bamboo shoots , and tofu . cook everything together until the chicken is nice and soft . you must then test it with a fork or a knife and see if it is soft .

column1: add soy sauce rice vinegar sugar and white pepper .
column2: once the chicken is cooked add 1/4 cup of soy sauce to the pan . add 1/4 cup rice vinegar . add 3 teaspoons of sugar . mix together . taste the soup to see if it needs salt . add 2 teaspoons of salt if it needs the salt .

column1: add soy sauce rice vinegar sugar and white pepper .
column2: place 1/4 cup of soy sauce into a small bowl . place 1/4 cup of rice vinegar into a small bowl . place 2 teaspoons of salt and 3 teaspoons of sugar in a small bowl . place the amount of white pepper instructed by the recipe inside of a bowl . place all the ingredients in each bowl into the soup , one by one .

column1: add soy sauce rice vinegar sugar and white pepper .
column2: add soy sauce . add vinegar . add sugar . add white pepper as needed .

column1: add corn starch .
column2: open the corn starch . fill up a measuring cup to 1 and a half with cold water . put some corn starch into the water . mix it all together . pour the corn starch water into the soup .

column1: add corn starch .
column2: put 2 tablespoons of cornstarch in 1/2 cup of water . stir the cornstarch until it is mixed completely with the water . pour the cornstarch mixture into the soup , while stirring .

column1: add corn starch .
column2: add 2 tablespoons of corn starch . add 1/2 cup of cold water .

column1: add eggs and stir .
column2: stand over the pot and slowly pour your egg into the hot soup . use a fork or spoon to slowly stir the egg as you pour .

column1: add eggs and stir .
column2: slowly pour the egg into the soup . use a fork to stir egg into soup .

column1: add eggs and stir .
column2: place a small mixing bowl on the counter . crack your eggs into the bowl . with a fork , beat the eggs until all yellow . when your soup comes to a gentle boil , slowly pour eggs into pan while stirring gently .

column1: add the chopped scallions .
column2: take the pot on the stove . take a bunch of scallions . cut the scallions in to very small pieces . put the scallions in a small bowl . now add the scallions in to the pot .

column1: add the chopped scallions .
column2: put the chopped scallions ( green onions ) into the pot . be careful placing scallions into the hot liquid .

column1: add the chopped scallions .
column2: take the bowl of scallions . add the scallions to the soup .

column1: sprinkle the lamb with pepper salt worcestershire sauce garlic and cinnamon .
column2: put cracked black pepper onto the lamb in a bowl . next put 1 1/2 teaspoons of salt . then add a little bit of worcestershire sauce and garlic into the bowl . finally add cinnamon to the bowl . mix all ingredients into the lamb .

column1: sprinkle the lamb with pepper salt worcestershire sauce garlic and cinnamon .
column2: sprinkle pepper over the lamb . add 1 1/2 teaspoons of sea salt . a small dash of worcestershire sauce . add garlic and cinnamon . mix together with a spoon , put in refrigerator for an hour .

column1: sprinkle the lamb with pepper salt worcestershire sauce garlic and cinnamon .
column2: use pepper grinder and twist the cap around 10 times into bowl of lamb chunks . add a teaspoon and a half of salt . add a dash ( a few drops ) of worcestershire sauce . then add your chopped garlic and measured amount of cinnamon .

column1: stack pieces of lamb lemon green pepper onion and tomato on the skewer .
column2: pick up a bamboo skewer . add lamb to the skewer followed by the lemon . next add green pepper and onion to the skewer . then add a tomato to the skewer . repeat steps until skewer is full .

column1: stack pieces of lamb lemon green pepper onion and tomato on the skewer .
column2: place plates with cubed lamb , onion , lemon , green pepper and tomato together . place a stack of wood skewers on the same counter as the plates . skewer a chunk of lamb on the first skewer and then add a lemon chunk . add chunks of green pepper , onion , tomato , lamb , lemon and lamb . repeat skewering the ingredients in that order on separate skewers .

column1: stack pieces of lamb lemon green pepper onion and tomato on the skewer .
column2: grab a wooden stick . stab your lamb , lemon , green pepper , onion and tomato onto the stick in that order .

column1: place the shish kebabs on the grill and drizzle olive oil on top .
column2: preheat the grill to medium . then place all 6 shish kebabs on the grill . cook them for 4 minutes per side . drizzle olive oil on the shish kebabs .

column1: place the shish kebabs on the grill and drizzle olive oil on top .
column2: preheat the grill to medium . place the shish kebabs on the grill . cook for about 4 minutes for each side . drizzle some olive oil on top .

column1: place the shish kebabs on the grill and drizzle olive oil on top .
column2: preheat the grill to medium . put the shish kebabs on the grill . drizzle some olive oil over the top of each kebab . grill for about 4 minutes per side .

column1: add sesame oil egg yolk salt black pepper paprika all purpose flour and corn starch to a bowl .
column2: grab a big bowl to mix all of your ingredients in . first add your sesame oil . then add your egg yolk . salt , black pepper , and paprika are all to be added next . then add all purpose flour . finally , add your corn starch to a bowl .

column1: add pieces of chicken to the bowl and mix .
column2: get a mixing bowl , add the wet and dry seasonings together . add the cut chicken into the bowl . mix the chicken and seasonings together with your hands . when mixed , let the chicken sit in the bowl for 15 minutes . after 15 minutes , we will fry the chicken .

column1: add pieces of chicken to the bowl and mix .
column2: cut chicken in to strips . add strips of chicken to flour mixture .

column1: add pieces of chicken to the bowl and mix .
column2: add the pieces of chicken to the bowl . use your hand to mix the chicken within the ingredients you already have in your bowl . after mixing well , let it sit for fifteen minutes .

column1: add olive oil to a heated pan add the chicken to the pan and stir .
column2: start by placing oil into pan and heat the oil . add chicken to the oil and cook the chicken thoroughly . mix the chicken with the oil .

column1: add olive oil to a heated pan add the chicken to the pan and stir .
column2: turn on a burner on top of the stove to medium . put a large skillet on the burner and pour enough olive oil in it to coat the bottom of the skillet . let the olive oil get hot then put the chicken in a single layer in the skillet . use a spatula or spoon to stir the chicken while it is cooking .

column1: add olive oil to a heated pan add the chicken to the pan and stir .
column2: accompanied by an adult , take a frying pan and start the gas or electric burner to medium . add olive oil . once it is hot add the chicken . slowly cook it on medium until the chicken is white . there should be no pink in your chicken and it is done .

column1: pour the chicken into a bowl .
column2: take the pot of cooked chicken carefully . pour the chicken into a bowl and set aside .

column1: pour the chicken into a bowl .
column2: lift the pan off of the stove . pour the chicken into a empty bowl next to the stove .

column1: pour the chicken into a bowl .
column2: pick up the hot pan with the chicken in it . use a spatula to help move the chicken from the pan into a bowl .

column1: pour chicken stock oyster sauce sesame oil and olive oil to a pan .
column2: use same skillet you used before . pour chicken stock into a hot pan . then at the same time , add the oyster sauce , sesame oil and olive oil into the pan .

column1: pour chicken stock oyster sauce sesame oil and olive oil to a pan .
column2: use the same skillet you were already using . pour chicken stock , oyster sauce , sesame oil , and olive oil to your pan . these do not have to be in any specific order .

column1: pour chicken stock oyster sauce sesame oil and olive oil to a pan .
column2: put the skillet that you used earlier onto the stove with the heat on . put your hand over the skillet without touching it to see if it feels warm to your hand . one at a time pour the oyster sauce , sesame and olive oil into the hot skillet .

column1: add soy sauce fish sauce hoisin sauce ginger - garlic paste sriracha chili sauce and barbecue sauce to the pan .
column2: heat oil . add soy sauce . add rest of stuff . cook it forever .

column1: add soy sauce fish sauce hoisin sauce ginger - garlic paste sriracha chili sauce and barbecue sauce to the pan .
column2: add soy sauce to the hot pan . then add fish sauce and hoisin sauce to the pan with the soy sauce . next add the ginger - garlic paste to the pan . then add the sriracha chili sauce and barbecue sauce to the pan .

column1: add soy sauce fish sauce hoisin sauce ginger - garlic paste sriracha chili sauce and barbecue sauce to the pan .
column2: slowly pour all of the sauces and paste into the pan . the pan is hot , so be careful not to splash .

column1: add rice vinegar and lemon juice to the pan and stir .
column2: add rice vinegar into the sauce . add the lemon juice into the sauce . stir the sauce until it is well mixed and boiling .

column1: add rice vinegar and lemon juice to the pan and stir .
column2: add the rice vinegar which is white in color . add lemon juice also to the sauce . stir the sauce and cook it . then mix everything together with the help of a spatula . cook the sauce for 5 minutes until it becomes tasty .

column1: add rice vinegar and lemon juice to the pan and stir .
column2: add a cap full of rice vinegar to the sauce . add some lemon juice to the pan . stir all the ingredients in and cook it until it starts to boil . cook and stir for 5 minutes .

column1: add the chicken to the pan and mix .
column2: pour the cut up chicken into the hot sauce in the pan . using a spoon carefully mix the chicken and sauce together .

column1: add the chicken to the pan and mix .
column2: when the sauce is simmering , bring the bowl of chicken over to the pan and dump it in . using a spatula , stir and flip the chicken into the sauce so that the sauce covers the chicken .

column1: add the chicken to the pan and mix .
column2: get a pan and make your sauce . sauce should be hot and thick . grab cooked chicken . add chicken to sauce . mix sauce and chicken together .

column1: add chopped celery and half an onion into the pan and mix .
column2: cut one stalk of celery into small pieces . cut one half onion into small pieces . mix it together into the mix to make sure it 's all covered in sauce .

column1: add chopped celery and half an onion into the pan and mix .
column2: chop up one stalk of celery . add chopped celery to pan . chop up half of an onion . add the chopped onion to the pan . mix up the ingredients well .

column1: add chopped celery and half an onion into the pan and mix .
column2: first cut celery into small pieces . add the celery in to the mix . cut the onion into big thin slices . add this also into the mix and stir it .

column1: cut a green onion into two inch wide pieces finely chop garlic and thinly slice ginger .
column2: place two trimmed green onions onto the cutting board . cut the green onion into two inch long pieces . place three cloves of garlic on the cutting board . mash and then chop cloves into small pieces . place two small pieces of ginger onto board and slice into small slivers .

column1: cut a green onion into two inch wide pieces finely chop garlic and thinly slice ginger .
column2: get some green onion . cut them into two inch wide pieces . get some garlic and finely chop it up to small pieces . with a ginger slice it to thin pieces .

column1: cut a green onion into two inch wide pieces finely chop garlic and thinly slice ginger .
column2: take a cutting board and a knife . take some green onions on the board . cut the green onions in to inch wide pieces . take some cloves of garlic and cut them in to small pieces . take a piece of ginger and cut them in to thin slices .

column1: place the chicken into a pot of hot oil .
column2: set the heat to medium high 350 - 400 degrees . then use tongs to put the chicken into the pot of oil . continue to cook until the chicken is golden brown .

column1: place the chicken into a pot of hot oil .
column2: when the oil is very hot ( 375 - 400 degrees ) put the chicken in the pan . be careful - hot oil can spit which can be painful ! when the chicken is golden brown you can take it out .

column1: place the chicken into a pot of hot oil .
column2: dip the chicken in the watered flour . pour the oil in the bowl . boil the oil . put the chicken in the boiling oil . fry it until golden brown .

column1: crack an egg into a bowl of diced chicken and mix .
column2: tap an egg to crack it and open it into the bowl of chicken . mix everything together with chopsticks .

column1: crack an egg into a bowl of diced chicken and mix .
column2: crack one egg into the bowl of chicken pieces . use chopsticks to mix the egg and chicken together .

column1: crack an egg into a bowl of diced chicken and mix .
column2: add cut up diced chicken to a bowl . tap an egg on a corner to crack it and empty the egg into your bowl of chicken . mix it up well so the egg is incorporated into the chicken coating every piece .

column1: add chicken stock sugar vinegar hoisin sauce sesame oil cornstarch and mix .
column2: add 1/4 cup of chicken stock into a bowl . put 2 tablespoons of sugar and 2 tablespoons of vinegar . add 2 tablespoon of hoisin sauce . put in 1 tablespoon of cornstarch . use a fork to mix all of the ingredients in a bowl .

column1: add chicken stock sugar vinegar hoisin sauce sesame oil cornstarch and mix .
column2: take a mixing bowl . add 1/4 th cup of chicken stock in to the bowl . add 2 tablespoons of sugar and vinegar in the bowl . add 1 tablespoon of hoisin sauce and sesame oil in to the bowl . add 1 tablespoon of corn starch and mix .

column1: add chicken stock sugar vinegar hoisin sauce sesame oil cornstarch and mix .
column2: get a mixing bowl . using a measuring cup add 1/4 cup of chicken stock to the bowl . next using a measuring spoon add 2 tablespoons of sugar , 2 tablespoons of vinegar , 1 tablespoon of hoisin sauce , 1 tablespoon of sesame oil , 1 tablespoon of dark soy sauce and one teaspoon of corn starch . using a whisk or a fork mix until all the ingredients are blended and all the sugar has dissolved .

column1: add the sauce to the wok and stir .
column2: add the sauce to the middle of the wok . using a stirring utensil , stir the sauce and other ingredients together until the sauce begins to boil .

column1: add the sauce to the wok and stir .
column2: pour the sauce into the frying pan . use a stirring spoon to mix the sauce in while it cooks .

column1: add the sauce to the wok and stir .
column2: pour the bowl with your sauce into the wok . use a spatula or spoon to stir the sauce around . let it start to bubble .

column1: add the chicken to the wok and stir .
column2: very carefully put the chicken into the wok . stir the ingredients in the wok with a large wooden cooking spatula . keep stirring and make sure each piece of chicken gets coated with sauce .

column1: add the chicken to the wok and stir .
column2: pour the chicken into the hot wok . use a spoon to stir the chicken in the wok . turn up the heat and add sesame seeds if desired .

column1: add the chicken to the wok and stir .
column2: take the breaded chicken and add to the vegetable mix . stir constantly to cover the chicken with the sauce and vegetables until thoroughly hot and blended . add sesame seeds for flavor at the end if you wish .

column1: add oil into a hot wok and add the green onion garlic and ginger .
column2: let the wok heat up on high heat on the stove . add 2 tablespoons ( tbs ) of oil . cut green onions , garlic and ginger . add it all to the oil and pan .

column1: add oil into a hot wok and add the green onion garlic and ginger .

column1: add oil into a hot wok and add the green onion garlic and ginger .

column1: cover the chicken in flour .

column1: cover the chicken in flour .

column1: cover the chicken in flour .

column1: add sesame seeds to the wok and stir .

column1: remove the chicken from the pot and place onto a plate .

column1: remove the chicken from the pot and place onto a plate .

column1: remove the chicken from the pot and place onto a plate .

column1: slice and toast the bread in the pan .

column1: slice and toast the bread in the pan .

column1: season with some sea salt cracked pepper and dried oregano add some extra virgin olive oil around the pan .

column1: season with some sea salt cracked pepper and dried oregano add some extra virgin olive oil around the pan .

column1: squash about 7 - 8 cloves of garlic and distribute it around the onions and tomatoes .
column2: squash 7 or 8 cloves of garlic with your hands . sprinkle it over the onions and tomatoes evenly .

column1: squash about 7 - 8 cloves of garlic and distribute it around the onions and tomatoes .

column1: slice 2 kilos of tomatoes in half and place it flesh side up on a baking tray .
column2: 2 kilos equal to 4 1/2 lbs , let your mom know how many tomatoes you need for this recipe . wash tomatoes well because there have been many hands touching them to get them to your home . get a sharp knife , be careful now and with the stem side up , slice down the middle of each tomatoes . set the cut side up of each half tomato into an oblong cake pan . continue cutting the rest of tomatoes the sane way and place every one into the pan .

column1: slice 2 kilos of tomatoes in half and place it flesh side up on a baking tray .

column1: slice 2 kilos of tomatoes in half and place it flesh side up on a baking tray .

column1: cook it in the oven .
column2: now , we will want to place it in the oven for 50 minutes , maybe up to an hour . be careful when putting the pan in the oven , or you may burn yourself .

column1: cook it in the oven .
column2: chop up some tomato , onions , garlic . add olive oil . place in a pan and roast for about 2 hours . place a pot on the stove and add water . slice some italian bread and add to the pot . now pour the roasted tomato mix into the pot . mash everything together in the pot . soup is ready .

column1: cook it in the oven .
column2: turn your oven on at 200 degrees . when the oven is preheated , put the dish in the oven . let it cook for 50 min to 1 hour , until the tomatoes and garlic are soft .

column1: add some chopped basil leaves into it .
column2: use a knife to careful cut the basil leaves up . add the basil leaves to the pot .

column1: add some chopped basil leaves into it .
column2: on a cutting board cut up some bail leaves with a knife . take your chopped up basil leaves and add to your pot .

column1: blend the soup and add olive oil .

column1: blend the soup and add olive oil .
column2: use a blender and blend the soup . add some bail to the top of the soup . add some olive oil .

column1: blend the soup and add olive oil .
column2: use your immersion blender to place into the soup , and turn it on as to blend the soup into a more smooth soup . remove the immersion blender , and scoop the soup into a bowl with a large spoon or ladle . add a single basil leaf and lightly drizzle a bit of olive oil on top of the soup by plugging the olive oil bottle top with your finger as to not let too much come out on the top of the soup .

column1: pour all the ingredients into a soup pot pour the stock into the pot and put it on medium heat .
column2: take a pot on the stove and heat the pot . take a baking pan with all the ingredients . take the pan and transfer all the ingredients in to the pot . add a can of stock in to the pot . mix the contents of the pot .

column2: pour the contents of the pan into the pot . add the stock into the pot . turn the temperature to medium heat .

column1: cut two spanish onions into quarter pieces and scatter them on the tomatoes .

column1: season the sauce with a splash of red wine vinegar .

column1: season the sauce with a splash of red wine vinegar .

column2: add some red wine vinegar to the soup pot . keep an eye on the bread pan to make sure it does n't burn .

column1: tear half ciabatta bread pieces into the pot and stir .

column1: pop all the garlic flesh out and discard the skin .

column1: pop all the garlic flesh out and discard the skin .
column2: using your fingers , gently squeeze the garlic on the edge over the pan . the garlic should just pop out easily into the pan . you can throw away the garlic skin .

column1: add the noodles and stir .

column1: add the noodles and stir .

column1: cook the egg in the wok .

column1: cook the egg in the wok .

column1: cook the egg in the wok .

column1: add the sauce to the wok and stir .
column2: add the sauce to the food mixture in the pan . think about how much sauce you will want , and add that to the mixture . stir together to make sure you have added enough sauce .

column1: add the sauce to the wok and stir .
column2: use a wooden spoon to stir the noodles . add the sauce to the noodles and stir .

column1: add the sauce to the wok and stir .

column1: add the carrots green onion and chicken to the wok .

column1: add the carrots green onion and chicken to the wok .

column1: add the carrots green onion and chicken to the wok .

column1: add ginger and garlic to the wok and stir .
column2: use a spoon and put the ginger and garlic in the wok . stir everything with a wooden spoon .

column1: add ginger and garlic to the wok and stir .
column2: take a pan and place it on the stove . cook the ingredients in the pan . add some ginger in to the pan . add some garlic pieces in to the pan . mix the contents of the pan with the spatula .

column2: add some ginger to the pan . put in some garlic . use a spoon to stir the ingredients around as they cook .

column1: heat oil in the wok .

column1: heat oil in the wok .
column2: put oil in a hot wok . allow the oil to get hot .

column1: heat oil in the wok .
column2: put the pan on the stove , and turn the stove on to medium - high heat . double check that the dial for the burner is set to the middle notch . the middle notch is medium - high heat . let the pan heat up for about 2 minutes . set your timer so that you do n't let it heat for too long . while the pan is heating up , measure out the right amount of cooking oil . after two minutes , pour the oil into the middle of the pan .

column1: mix apple cider vinegar and sugar together .
column2: carefully pour the apple cider vinegar and sugar in the bowl . use a spoon to mix it up very well .

column1: mix apple cider vinegar and sugar together .
column2: put apple cider vinegar and sugar in a bowl . put in the microwave for a few seconds . take bowl out of microwave and use a spoon to mix the sugar into the vinegar .

column1: mix apple cider vinegar and sugar together .
column2: add 3 tablespoons of apple cider vinegar to a small bowl . then add 2 tablespoons of sugar . microwave for a few seconds to help dissolve the sugar . then stir well until the sugar is dissolved .

column1: mix in tamarind paste .

column1: mix in tamarind paste .
column2: take a small glass bowl . add some water in to the bowl . add some tamarind paste in to the bowl . take a spoon . mix the paste and water with a spoon .

column1: mix in tamarind paste .
column2: use a spoon to scoop in some tamarind paste . use the spoon to mix everything up really good .

column1: mix in fish sauce chili sauce chili flake and sriracha sauce .
column2: add 1 teaspoon of fish sauce . put in 1 tablespoon of hot chili sauce . add some chili flakes . put in some sriracha sauce . add some tamarind and mix together the ingredients with a spoon .

column1: mix in fish sauce chili sauce chili flake and sriracha sauce .
column2: to the bowl , add in 1 tsp . of fish sauce . pour in about 1 tablespoon of the thai hot chili sauce . you can also add hot chili flake if you like your sauce more spicy . add in sriracha sauce and some tamarind sauce . mix well .

column1: then start cutting along till the other end holding the strips .
column2: take a cutting board and a knife .. . take the meat on the cutting knife . place the knife in a slant angle . place the knife on one side of meat . pass the knife horizontally to the other side .

column1: then start cutting along till the other end holding the strips .
column2: use a knife to carefully cut along the bottom of the fish . hold the top end in place as you slice .

column1: then start cutting along till the other end holding the strips .
column2: hold the fish on one end . start cutting along the fish diagonally in thin strips with a knife .

column1: spread out the pieces .
column2: lay the fish out in rows with your hands . spread them out a little bit .

column1: spread out the pieces .
column2: after cutting the fish separate it into pieces . place the pieces side by side on a serving platter . garnish the fish with daikon radish slices .

column1: spread out the pieces .

column1: carefully cut the salmon flesh into long strips without cutting the outer skin of the fish .
column2: use the knife to cut long strips into the salmon . do not cut all the way through to the outer skin .

column1: carefully cut the salmon flesh into long strips without cutting the outer skin of the fish .
column2: use a knife to carefully cut the salmon . cut the salmon into long strips . be careful not to cut the outer skin on the bottom of the fish .

column1: carefully cut the salmon flesh into long strips without cutting the outer skin of the fish .

column1: make a cut in the center and take along till the one end of the meat holding the strips .
column2: use a knife to cut the fish . cut along the bottom not slicing all the way through the skin .

column1: make a cut in the center and take along till the one end of the meat holding the strips .
column2: cut into the middle of the salmon at a 45 degree in the dark part of the meat . once you have cut down , do n't cut through the skin but instead cut along the skin to remove the meat from the skin . this is a lot easier if you use a well sharpened knife and hold the meat firmly .

column1: make a cut in the center and take along till the one end of the meat holding the strips .
column2: you may need help from an adult for this part . get a cutting board and a sharp knife . you will be removing the skin from the salmon . put the piece of salmon on the cutting board with the pink side up . put the knife in the middle of the salmon and angle the blade like this : / . slowly cut down until you almost touch the skin then turn the knife blade so it is flat against the cutting board , firmly hold the other side of the salmon and cut across the bottom of the salmon piece . repeat it for the next side of the salmon piece .

column1: boil the peas in a pot of water .

column1: beat eggs and crush crackers .

column1: place two cheese slices on one patty .

column1: spread mayonnaise and add lettuce 5 pickles and 2 slices of onions on the top bun .

column1: spread mayonnaise and add lettuce 5 pickles and 2 slices of onions on the top bun .

column1: simultaneously add some oil and grill onions along with the patties .

column1: simultaneously add some oil and grill onions along with the patties .

column1: place the grilled patties on bottom burger and place the top bun .

column1: place the grilled patties on bottom burger and place the top bun .
column2: place the grilled patty on top of the cheese on the bottom bun . put the top bun on top of the patty to complete the burger .

column1: place the grilled patties on bottom burger and place the top bun .
column2: place both patties on the bottom bun . put the top bun and vegetables on top of the meat , being sure to hold the vegetables in place so they do n't fall .

column1: put the grilled onions on top of the ketchup and mustard sauce .
column2: use a spoon to scoop the onions out onto the sauce . lay the onions evenly over the bun .

column1: put the grilled onions on top of the ketchup and mustard sauce .
column2: use a spoon to scoop up grilled onions . add the onions on the bun on top of the ketchup and mustard .

column1: put the grilled onions on top of the ketchup and mustard sauce .
column2: add ketchup and mustard to the bun . use a spoon to scoop some of the grilled onions on top .

column1: remove onions from the grill pan .

column1: remove onions from the grill pan .
column2: scoop up all of the onions . take the onions off of the grill .

column1: remove onions from the grill pan .
column2: place the onions onto the spatula . place the onions onto a plate .

column1: place the other patty on the cheese slices and remove them from the grill pan .
column2: place hamburger patty on skillet . then add cheese to first burger . allow cheese to melt . then place on bun . add other desired toppings and serve .

column1: place the other patty on the cheese slices and remove them from the grill pan .

column1: place the other patty on the cheese slices and remove them from the grill pan .
column2: use the spatula to pick up the beef patty . place the patty on top of the cheese slices . scoop up the patties and remove from the grill .

column1: wrap the burger in an aluminum foil .
column2: push down on the top of the burger . place the aluminum foil sides over the top of the burger . wrap the rest of the foil around the rest of the burger .

column1: wrap the burger in an aluminum foil .
column2: set burger on a large piece of aluminum foil , in the center . start with one corner and fold it in . do the opposite corner and repeat the process for the other two . bunch up the wrapping to make it seal .

column1: wrap the burger in an aluminum foil .
column2: place the burger in the center of a piece of aluminum foil . bring the corners up to the top center of the bun . press the foil together at the top and squeeze the sides so the burger does n't come unwrapped .

column1: grill the patties .
column2: take a pan on the stove . heat the pan . take some patties . fry the patties on the pan . fry on both sides of the patties .

column1: grill the patties .
column2: put the meat patties on a grill . allow them to cook .

column1: grill the patties .

column1: place the patties on a parchment paper and stack them smash it using a burger hammer .
column2: take a parchment paper . place a patty on the parchment paper . place another parchment paper . place another patty on the parchment paper . press the burgers with the burger hammer .

column1: place the patties on a parchment paper and stack them smash it using a burger hammer .

column1: place the patties on a parchment paper and stack them smash it using a burger hammer .

" using a burger hammer , smash the balls of meat with good force until they are flattened to about 3/4 thick . " " . "

column1: put three rings of ketchup and two rings of mustard on the bottom bun .

column1: place the sesame seed buns on the grill pan .

column1: place the sesame seed buns on the grill pan .
column2: put the sesame seed buns onto the grill . place the inside of the bun face down on the grill .

column1: add soy sauce sugar rice wine chopped white onion honey and fish sauce in a blender .
column2: add soy sauce , sugar , rice , wine , chopped white onion , honey , and fish sauce to the blender . blend .

column1: add soy sauce sugar rice wine chopped white onion honey and fish sauce in a blender .
column2: get a blender an set it on the counter . add 1 cup of soy sauce to the blender . add 1/2 cup sugar and 1/2 cup rice wine to the blender . get a chopping board and a large knife . peel a medium size white onion and cut in half . cut up 1 half of the onion into small pieces . add the chopped onion to the blender . add 1/2 cup of honey to the blender . add 2 tablespoons of fish sauce to the blender .

column1: add minced ginger korean chili paste and fresh asian pear dices to the blender too .
column2: add 2 tablespoons of small cubes of ginger , 1 tablespoon of korean chili paste to the blender . cut 2 asian pears into small cubes and add them to the blender .

column1: add minced ginger korean chili paste and fresh asian pear dices to the blender too .
column2: put all of the following into a blender , 2 tablespoons of smashed & chopped ginger . then add 1 tablespoon of korean chili paste , then add fresh chopped asian pear .

column1: add minced ginger korean chili paste and fresh asian pear dices to the blender too .
column2: slice ginger into a circular shape , like a penny ( you 'll need about 4 - 5 ) . place something flat on the ginger and push hard to crush it . then scoop it up and add it to the blender . add 1 tablespoon of chili paste to the blender . cut pieces of pear small and add them to the blender .

column1: blend everything in the blender to form a sauce .
column2: take a blender . put all the ingredients into a blender . switch it on the blender . gradually increase the speed . blend everything to form a sauce .

column1: blend everything in the blender to form a sauce .
column2: start the blender at a lower setting . slowly increase the speed to mix all of the ingredients .

column1: blend everything in the blender to form a sauce .
column2: use a blender to mix everything up . make sure the lid is on and hold your hand over the top . start the blender on the lowest speed . that way there is not a big mess . after about 20 seconds push the higher speed button .

column1: marinate the ribs well with the prepared sauce in a bucket overnight .
column2: take your beef short ribs use a knife and lightly rub the knife on the top of the ribs . take the ribs and put them into a bucket . take your marinate you have and pour it over the ribs . cover the ribs in your bucket . put the bucket of ribs in your fridge .

column1: marinate the ribs well with the prepared sauce in a bucket overnight .
column2: take knife and scrape each piece of meat . put ribs in bucket . pour sauce on the bucket . then put the lid on the bucket . put bucket in frig .

column1: marinate the ribs well with the prepared sauce in a bucket overnight .
column2: take about 3 pounds of beef ribs . cut the ribs in to long thin pieces . take a long bucket and add the ribs in to the bucket . add the sauce in to the bucket . soak the ribs overnight in the bucket .

column1: grill the marinated ribs well and serve with chopped leeks and red onions .
column2: after your ribs are marinated , shake them over the sink to get rid of any extra juice or marinade . place the ribs on a preheated grill . be careful , the grill is very hot . you need to place them on an area of the grill where the coals are not right under the meat . this will keep the marinade and drippings from the meat from dripping into the hot coals and catching fire . that can be dangerous and can also burn your meat . " if the coals need to be moved , ask an adult or a responsible person to assist you . you 'll need to use tongs to move the coals away from your cooking area . this is called indirect heat " " " " . " after the ribs are cooked ( this wo n't take long ) remove the ribs with tongs , making sure to keep your face away from the grill in case juices drip and flare up fire . put the ribs on a plate . add chopped red onions and chopped leeks to the platter . if you can not find leeks , chives or green onion can be used . enjoy !

column1: grill the marinated ribs well and serve with chopped leeks and red onions .
column2: place the meat on the grill . wait until the top of the meat turns dark brown . using a tong flip each of the meats to the other side . wait a few minutes and flip the meat again . after meat is cooked place the meat on a plate .

column1: grill the marinated ribs well and serve with chopped leeks and red onions .
column2: shake off the marinade that may be in excess on your ribs . place your marinated ribs onto the grill . do not place over the coals , place on the side of the grill where the coals are absent . keep an eye on your meat as to make sure it does n't burn . be sure to flip the ribs onto the other side . you should see grill marks on your ribs and the ribs should not be pink . you can now place the ribs onto the direct heat to caramelize the marinade on the ribs . be careful of flare ups from the fire . serve the ribs with jasmine rice , chopped leeks , and red onions .

column1: add oil to a hot pan .

column1: add a piece of pork in a ziplock bag and pound it .
column2: place the meat inside of the ziplock bag . taking the hammer . beat the meat as hard as possible . feel the meat to see if its thin . if thin then you ready for the next step .

column1: coat the pork in flour egg and breadcrumbs .

column1: coat the pork in flour egg and breadcrumbs .

column1: add bacon to the hot pan .

column1: add salt plain yogurt and water and mix to form a dough .

column1: add carrots onions bell peppers and cabbage to the pot and stir .

column1: when the soup boils add arrow root powder and stir .

column1: take the shrimp and cut it into two halves .

column1: repeat the process for all the other rolls and serve .

column1: add rice noodles on top and roll it without breaking and fold the spring roll .

column1: soften the rice paper by soaking it in warm water for 30 minutes .
